description: Ordered out a pizza and was not impressed at all.  They say they serve up Neapolitan-style pizza, but I have to disagreed.  The dough/crust is nowhere close to Neapolitan-style pizza.  The crust was thin, but not soft or bubbly as I would have expected.
author: Mark K.

description:
The hype is real!

Came here on a Wednesday night around 5:30pm with a friend to catch-up. We got seated right away and started off with the tricolore salad and an Arnold Palmer. Love that the Arnold Palmer is not too sweet or too sour - just perfect. As for the salad - we devoured it! Super refreshing with the greens and slices of parmesan cheese on top - the dressing was sour but a good combination for a nice start to a dinner. We both shared the Prosciutto pizza which comes with arugula and cheesy goodness! The arugula was a great topping with the prosciutto since that is usually salty - and we finished it! Thin crust, but not bad and not too heavy. We left full but enough room for ice cream next door at Smittens. The total was about $34 including tips and tax - not too bad for this neighborhood. Definitely will return :)
author: Amanda C.

description: Great Pizza options!! Boyfriend and I first time here, if you are a fan of prosciutto and arrúgala you should of try prosciutto pie, we ordered meatballs and prosciutto pie which is my all time favorite, pizza was so delicious  crispy, and tasty!!  meatball was just on point  the waitress was so friendly and nice!
author: Marychuy T.

description: So so pizza. There wasnt a pizza place close to me so I walked aways to Delfina after ordering a Margherita pizza with prosciutto(sp?) to go. Tasted just ok. Thin crust was nice, red sauce mediocre, 1 1/2 pieces of arugula woohoo! There was a good amount of prosciutto though but come on put some arugula on the damn pizza people. Two stars are fair and it was pricey for a medium size pizza. Try somewhere else.
author: Gary E.

description: Great pizza options! The Pana is really good and different since it has cream and tomato sauce. On the other hand, the service isn't good there and the waiters are definitely not friendly. Also, there was a $2.75 per person extra charge for ordering plates for a birthday cake! Too bad the pizza was actually pretty good!
author: Haya D.

description: This place is amazing!!! Literally the best margarita in the world! Not exaggerating. We always get this delivered to our house for lazy movie nights in via various apps so I'm not sure what their restaurants are like inside etc but we are obsessed with ordering pizza delfina! They never mess up the orders (like everywhere else) & All the appetizers are good too - my favorite is the asparagus one :)
author: Kate J.

description: Loved their burrata appi and margherita pizza!! So light and so far the best I've tasted to similar pizza I've had in Rome! Can't wait to come back!
author: R P.

description:
Came here last week with a friend. We were pretty excited to try this place since there are rave reviews. But we weren't let down, just one of the pizzas we chose was somewhat disappointing.

Fungi pie:4/5: definitely tasty! I love the mushroom variety mixed with the cheese. It had a nice crispy crust. I think it would have been even better if I had added sausage. But overall a pretty tasty pie.

Clam pie: 3/5: I read rave reviews about this pie. First bite it kinda surprised me by how clammy it was. The sauce and the clams had an overwhelming clamminess that I didn't really like. Don't get me wrong, I love clams but I wasn't the biggest fan of this clam pizza. Would not get it again.

Overall a decent pizza place. Would definitely come back here again for more pizza and to try the appetizers.

Total for 2: $45
author: Stella J.

description: This review is strictly for their take out service.  These guys lie, lie, lie -- you order online for a specific time...say 7:15 pm...and it still isn't ready at 7:45 pm tonight.  I even built in a cushion of 15 minutes by arriving at 7:30 pm to pick it up but nothing.  No apologies, no offer of a free dessert.  Your service here sucks and the short surly brown haired girl is the WORST human on earth -- when there is a line 20 people deep for pick ups please stop checking your Instagram feed!  Your pizza isn't even that great, just go to Dino's for a quick pizza fix because Delfina Pizza is resting on their laurels of the main restaurant and Locanda.  This place is Papa Murphy's with a bad attitude.  Avoid at all costs.  Craig and Annie Stoll should be ashamed of the level of service at this location -- the staff has done a fantastic job of making them look like a joke.
author: Hannah H.

description:
Let me begin by saying... I'm still trying to figure out how I can at this place every day. Not joking! 

A small, family oriented, homey, and welcoming restaurant with big flavors! We visited the restaurant today for lunch, and when we arrived around noon, it wasn't too busy which was very nice! We ordered a number of places to share: the Citrus & Walnuts Salad, the mussels, meatballs, the Panna Pizza with sausage and the Salsiccia Pizza. All ingredients were very fresh and flavorful. Everything was amazing! I honestly have no complaints about any part of our visit to this fine establishment! The only thing I will say is that it is slightly more on the expensive side, but I believe this just comes with the territory. The customer service was friendly, warm, inviting, and prompt. The food was delicious, yummy, fresh and amazing. Like I said, I'm still trying to figure out how I can eat at this place every day! We will be back - you can guarantee that!
author: Erica P.

description:
I had always wanted to see if Defina was deserving of all the hype, but the Mission location is always beset by a gaggle of gourmands - yep, I don't do lines. So it was with some delight that I spotted this Pac Heights satellite. I dipped inside for an early dinner recently and was happy to snag a couple of spots at the counter overlooking the small, bustling kitchen.

My companion and I ordered the STUFFED SHELLS / 13.00
w/ tomato, anchovy, ricotta & escarole. It was divine! It was drizzled with some incredibly delicious lemon oil. It was the highlight of the meal and will keep us coming back for more.

I enjoyed the special pizza of the day - cheese and chicory topped with a soft farm fresh egg. My dinner guest was not thrilled with it - more for me!

Can't wait to return and try more dishes.
author: Carole B.

description:
One of my favorite regular places in San Francisco. Low key, super friendly staff. Smaller menu but they are always changing up the vegetables with what's in season. The pizzas and vegetables are always cooked to perfection. Claudio, one of my Italian friends who came to the states in his 20's, took his aunt from Rome here (a bold move!) who commented that this is just like the pizza in Italy.

Salsaccia pizza, yummy sausages cooked just right. Thin crusted pizza.

Chard.- I don't love chard but want to eat more of it.  Delfina's chard is never bitter. Never overcooked. As delicious as chard gets.

Peas and peas - one of the newer things on the menu and just love it. The burrata is soft and more American style (vs their Italian counterparts). Sweet peas justapositioned with the crunchy texture of the snow peas. Definitely a winner and a must try.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Typifies the stereotyped "SF Smug" attitude that I'm not a fan of. The food is tasty, but I come from the East Coast where good pizza abounds. And I've spent less than half the price at zillions of East Coast pizza places for pizza that is twice as good. For me, it wasn't worth the hype and I won't be going back unless someone else is paying for me and I don't have to talk to the rude servers!
author: Kimberly L.

description:
Last weekend, Delfina accommodated our HUGE party (even though there wasn't enough space).  The service was PERFECT, and the food is without doubt, always great.

Thanks, Delfina, for making it so easy for all of us (from different parts of the US) catch up over a nice dinner.  The neopolitana (remove anchovy and add mozzarella) is my favorite pizza in the whole world.  Their saffron arrancini and spicy cauliflower are delicious appetizers you should try out.

Lindsay (sorry if this spelling is wrong) is awesome!!!!!!!
author: Nira P.

description:
I had an early dinner with a friend here on a Thursday around 4:15pm and they weren't that busy...

Our waitress came by and asked us what we wanted to drink. She also mentioned that they didn't have the artichokes, which we didn't want anyway. But, I thought it was good that we were informed. 

We decided on the "Clam Pie: cherrystones, tomato, oregano, pecorino, hot peppers" and the "Funghi: Hen o' the woods mushrooms, panna, fontina, nepitella." Our pizzas came out in about 20 mins...

The clam pie was alright. It wasn't as flavorful as I thought it would be. At first bite, you don't really taste the heat from the hot peppers, but it does creep up on you slightly. I prefer the clam and garlic from Golden Boy because the garlic adds so much flavor. 

I had a slice of the mushroom pie and I liked it a lot better than the clam. The mushrooms were tasty and the fontina was nice and gooey. The crust wasn't overcooked. 

Overall, I had a good first-time experience here and don't feel the need to try their other locations. The only thing that I didn't like was that after our waitress took our plates, she wiped off our table while we were still seated.
author: Fallon P.

description: Relaxing environment with lots of natural light and friendly staff. Quick service. The pizza crust was ultra thin and crispy, the sauce very flavorful. The meatballs were moist inside and tasty. The sauce was a bit too salty.
author: Braylon H.

description: Overall bad experience. The waitress was very rude and it took nearly 1hr to get our pizza. Pizza was plain and there were 2 hairs in it.
author: Eforio S.

description:
A very decent place to grab a pizza. 
They don't take reservations so depending on the time be prepared to wait. 
Service is decent as we were checked on regularly. My friend ordered a salad and Margherita and I went for the Lamb Sausage pizza. 
The salad had a very healthy serving of cheese and my friend enjoyed it.
Now for the main good crust, good toppings and nothing overwhelming the balance IMO. Baked just right as the crust was not soggy and had a nice crisp finish. Sauce IMO was neutral.
Priced well I would recommend one coming here.
author: Elvis A.

description:
If I could, I would have given a 2.5 rating. Have heard how good this place is for pizza but didn't find the pizza anything special -- ordered the margherita.

The dessert -- panna cotta w/pistachios and strawberries was DELICIOUS and I'd go back just for that. Have had panna cotta only a handful of times but this was one of the instances where I found it delicious.
author: D L.

description: This place was the bomb, no question. We arrived around 8 pm on a Friday night and only had to wait about 15 minutes. The server / hostess was very helpful and brought us each a glass of wine while we waited. Once seated, the service was lightning fast and the food came even faster. We split a Tri-colore salad and roasted olives, and then a pizza between the two of us. Everything was outstanding from start to finish. We are both Italians from near NYC and take our pizza very seriously, and we both give Delfina two thumbs up.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Very disappointing given the reviews. First the burrata antipasti. The burrata itself was delicious and the accompanying toast was perfectly done. But the arugula salad was unnecessarily drenched in oil and was so salty that it was virtually inedible. Next up was the DOP margarita pizza. While the tomato sauce was great, the pizza was overcooked and was hard and crusty to the centre. Also it was way too salty.
author: David S.

description: We heard about this place from a local friend and loved everything about it! Fabulous pizza, great service and nice ambience. We ordered the prosciutto pie and the citrus and walnuts salad and they were both fantastic!
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Definitely one of the highlights of my trip! This place was jam-packed on a Sunday evening at 5:30pm. I was part of a party of 9, so we waited about an hour for a table. The food was delicious and didn't weigh you down like other pizzas do. I didn't feel lethargic after eating it or feel the need to take a nap. The service was good and pretty fast, especially for how busy it was. It is reallllllllly tight in there but not as bad as other places in the area. 

FOOD: 5 stars.
For 9 of us we ordered 5 salads to start and then 8 pizzas. We probably ordered way too much food, but after a day of traveling and waiting an hour for a table, it was perfect. The Margherita pizza with arugula on top was delicious. Thin crust and everything tasted very fresh. We also ordered the Prosciutto pizza with arugula and prosciutto on top and that was also excellent. I think we ordered each of the 3 salads they had on be menu and each of those were delicious. A little heavy on the salad dressing, but I'm someone who doesn't like dressing on my salad haha. 

SERVICE: 4 stars.
Kind of slow, but expected with how busy it was. They were all very friendly and down to Earth. 

LOCATION: 4.5 stars.
The space is very tight but it works. It's right next to Smitten's, so it definitely attracts a lot of people. I would recommend getting here early because we waited a loooonnngggg time when we arrived 20 minutes after they opened. 

I'm not a big fan of pizza and having lived in NY, I feel like I am a very tough critic. This pizza was well-crafted and not too heavy. The toppings were very different and unique so I feel like it is very customized to this place. I would recommend making it a point to come here if you're in SF and looking for amazing pizza!
author: Zoe Y.

description:
There's something about chomping on primo 'za while listening to B.I.G, Dr.Dre, and the likes. Didn't think it would be that spectacular, but oh, how  it was. Made me feel young again, which doesn't happen very often. 

As far as food goes, Delfina makes a very good Neapolitan-style pie. Have I had better? I'd probably say yes, but only slightly better. I'm splitting hairs at this point. The salsiccia turned out to be the perfect choice. Really good toppings and the crust was on point. 

Oh, and their meatballs are quite savory and delicate. A great menu option if you really want to cut back on carbohydrate overload.

Service and ambiance at Delfina? Warm and inviting. Were it not for that pesky closing time, I'm sure the Missus and I could have stayed for at least another hour. A few drinks and maybe an extra appetizer. 

I think we'll be heading back if we ever have a hankerin' for pizza and some ghetto beats.
author: Aren A.

description:
One of the worst pizzas I've ever had. 

This happened on a late Wednesday afternoon. It wasn't busy. 

So, I walked in to this place because apparently this pizza place serves one of the best pizzas in town, so I decided to give it a try. I ultimately was here just to try out Smitten Ice Cream, and I was so pleased, I was wanting to hit the next best spot down the block, which was Delfina Pizzeria! 

Walked right in. Ordered a Salsicchia to go, since I was stuffed with ice cream already, and headed out to walk on Fillmore and window shop, since the pizza would be ready in 20 minutes. Came back. Waited in total, about 30 minutes. Pizza was done, smelled great, looked amazing, and headed back to my car. 

My boyfriend and I had to get a taste before we drove off bc the car was filled with this amazing aroma of tomato and sausage, bell peppers and more, so we dug in for a slice. Thank GOD all my toppings fell off because, low and behold, THERE WAS A SMALL CURLY HAIR UNDERNEATH THE TOPPINGS!!!! I almost hacked and threw the pizza back into the box. My boyfriend ran back in and told them about it, with the hair still there, and they just said, oh sorry about that. You'll have to wait another 20 minutes for another one. REALLY?! I was so upset. They couldn't even offer to give it for free or offer some sort of courtesy discount or even a free dessert to make up for that? To make matters worse, the replacement pizza had a lot less meat on it. So I get less of a pizza for the same price and had to wait even longer for this 2nd pizza? Wow. 

Whenever I find hair in my food, especially on a 1st visit, and there was no remorse for it, that is unacceptable. Sorry Delfina. You just lost a possible repeat customer. But I will come back to the neighboring ice cream spot! Smitten gets an A+!
author: Leah G.

description:
On Saturday, 7/25/15, my girlfriend and I ate at Pizzeria Delfina for dinner. A few of my friends said Pizzeria Delfina is the best pizza place ever and a lot of the reviews on here say the same thing. I had very high expectations for Pizzeria Delfina. 

Atmosphere/Decor:

The restaurant is very small and cluttered. Everything is way too close to one another. You fill totally boxed in. I didn't like the set up of the restaurant. When you enter the restaurant you'll see a chalk board on the left which is basically the menu and the waiting list. I waited in line for about 10 minutes before one of the employees told me I had to write my name on the chalk board. I didn't like the chalk board waiting list concept at all. I saw a lot of people that were unaware of writing their name down on the chalk board.  

Food:

My girlfriend and I ordered our own pizzas. I went with the Salsiccia (house made fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions, mozzarella). The Salsiccia pizza was mediocre at best. There was nothing spectacular about it. It barely had any mozzarella cheese on it. The bell peppers weren't even cooked. They still had a hard texture and tasted like a raw vegetable. The only good tasting thing was the house made fennel sausage. Everything else was pretty weak.

My girlfriend felt the same way about her Margherita Pizza. She didn't really like it. The dough was really soggy and the tomato sauce tasted kind of weird. We weren't a fan of the pizza crust as well because it was so burnt.

Service:

I thought the service was pretty bad from start to finish. Like I said previously when we got there I had to wait in line for about 10 minutes until an employee told me I had to write my name up on the chalk board in order to be seated. It seemed like everyone working there was too busy to acknowledge people waiting in line. I thought our waitress did an okay job. She took our order and that was really it. We didn't see her or hear from her until she dropped off the check. She didn't even check up on us throughout our dinner or ask if we liked the pizzas. 

Overall:

I don't understand how people on here can say that the pizza crust and ingredients at Pizzeria Delfina are the best they've ever had. They must not know what really good pizza tastes like. Tony's on Stockton Street is way better and blows Pizza Delfina out of the water. Don't waste your time at this place. Hit up Tony's instead. The wait is actually worth it there.
author: David R.

description: What can I say about this place to do it justice?! I've tried nearly everything and I've loved it all.  The staff is always friendly, but the food is the superstar. The crust is exceptional and toppings are always fresh and seasonal. The sides are  fresh and interesting as well.
author: Robbie C.

description: If you are a fan of California thin slice pizza this is the place to go. Their prosciutto pizza is my all time favorite. Life the ambiance and food!
author: Leslie K.

description: These guys really know how to do pizza. The dough is crispy and doesn't flop down after being loaded up with the goodies. We had the fresh baby tomato pizza. The tomatoes were absolutely fresh and sweet and not overwhelmed by the cheese or tomato sauce. The crust was just the right color of char to make it tasty, but not burnt. We had a baby lettuce salad with green goddess dressing that we shared as well. My mother came with us and also had a salad that she thought was fantastic. It was beets, goat cheese and farro. We arrived at about 1:15 and there was no wait. Service was present but not intrusive. Everybody was very friendly and accommodating. My mother uses a walker and they were very helpful getting her seated and then put in the Walker aside so would not be in the way but where she could still see it. All good.
author: Tom B.

description:
Horrible online ordering and pickup experience. Do not use their online ordering!!! The receptionist said he wasn't going to go back and check until it was 642 pm because that was the time on the order. And he didn't go until I asked him again. He went at 644. The stuff was waiting there. He was on a power trip to make me wait.  

I will not be returning after this experience. They have reasonable pizza but still.  This time the pizza was definitely cold even though we live close and has it right away.
author: Renu A.

description: I loved the pizza here! It was really a whole new experience for me to eat here cause I've never tried anything like it! the pizza was delicious, as were the other stuff that my family had such as the chicken salad! I definitely give this a 5 stars and you should really check it out if you haven't done so already!
author: Asher D.

description: The queue on a Friday night was pretty insane. But once seated the waiters are really nice and let you order/eat/chat at your own pace without giving you an evil eye. We had 2 pizzas, the arugula and mozarella, as well as mussels to share between 3 people. We walloped the food. Arugula pizza was better than the mozarella. Mussels were ok but the portion was a bit small. Breadsticks were yummy.
author: Lindt C.

description: Good food, good service and good location. I've been here over a dozen times and it never disappoints. Sausage pizza has to be one of if not the best in the city. The salads are super fresh and well balanced. The staff is always friendly, accommodating and very knowledgeable of the wine selection.
author: Maria R.

description:
Waiting time :Well a very busy place on weekend so around 30-45 min of wait
Service : full 5 star on service, waitress was very helpful and nice 
Food: well the pizza we choose was the one with broccoli and spinach and it was not that great. A little watery. Will give a 2 star on the pizza. Grilled Chicken was amazing and so the ice-cream ( one scoop is very small do do order two) 
Ambience: nice 

Overall it was a nice experience. Definitely a one time visit place.
author: Ekta B.

description:
This was my 2nd time around coming to Pizzeria Delfina. Just like the 1st time I came here 3 years ago, the food was great, as was the service. 

I paid extra for the DPO margherita, it was good but I don't know that it was worth the extra cost. 

In the end, my only complaint(and it's not a complaint) is that I wish the pizza was wood fired like it is back in Naples. Either way, I'll be back.
author: Jason P.

description: Great pizza - friendly service. Ordered the vegetarian lasagna special, which was outstanding and the clam pizza, which was surprisingly delicious. Would definitely return!!
author: Denise N.

description: I had the margherita pizza which was really good. The service was OK. The waitress was very helpful but the waiter who served me first and the other guy who was the manager or hostess was not hospitable at all. If I wasn't visiting the city and knew of somewhere else to go I would've definitely left. But the food was really good!
author: Krystyna P.

description: Quality pizza for a really reasonable price. I got the panna pizza and it was amazing. My husband and I went on a Saturday night & only had to wait 15 minutes for a table. My only knock on this place is how tiny and crammed it is. We were awkwardly close to the tables surrounding us and it made it difficult to have a conversation because we were having to talk over the tables next to us.
author: Kayla S.

description:
Go early! Skip the wait time. 

Ordered: fried brussel sprouts (so freakin' good. They put parm on them when they are piping hot - tastes like the top burnt part of a bomb mac and cheese.)
Marinated beets: goat cheese. Wish they had a more vinegar-y taste but still good.
Margherita pizza: Very yummy. Crust was good and chewy, tomatoes were tasty, cheese was solid - just wish they had some fresh basil on top. 

For those minor things I would set it at a high 4 stars. 

Service was fast too - even when they started to get busy. Always a plus.
author: Jessica D.

description: From the minute we arrived in San Francisco, people told us to go to Pizzeria Delfina. Just a few blocks from our hotel, we made the short walk and waited maybe 15 minutes for a table on a busy night. The fried okra was tasty with a good remoulade, and we built our own pizza with spicy salami. My only complaints were that they don't have jalapeños as a topping or ranch dressing (what's better than pizza crust and ranch?). Overall really enjoyed it, and it was convenient to where we were staying.
author: Christin Y.

description:
Yes, the pizza was tastey and looked good.

Starting around $12.95 for a twelve inch thin crust pizza done right is a treat.

We started with a salcissia pizza and cheese pizza with chopped olives and anchovy.

Kinda spendy, but when you want quality over quantity, their pizza is very good.

Decor: ok.

Customer service: very good.
author: Bert K.

description: Hit or miss.  The heirloom tomato salad was great.  Amazing tomatoes.  Meatballs were over salted and somehow not meaty.  The pizza crust was great.  We ordered the margherita pizza.  It came sparsely peppered with two basil leaves, just like da Michelle, the Eat Pray Love place in Naples, Italy,  The crust was great --hot, yeasty, thin and chewy.  However, the mozzarella was gummy and bland.  It slid off the pizza in blobs.  Given the extra calories and unappealing texture, I'd actually opt for a cheeseless pizza next time if I have to go back to Delfina.
author: Amy J.

description: Not sure what the fuss is about. Ok pizza and other eats. Nothing about it screams let's wait for  45 mins for a table. Try Pizzetta 201 for better crust and creative pizza.
author: Roger B.

description:
It's embarrassing to admit that I've lived in SF for almost five years and hadn't been to Delfina until very recently. Well the joke is on me be since I've been missing out.

We went on a Saturday night prepared to wait for hours, but with two people it really wasn't bad. Maybe 45 minutes with offers to buy alcohol and plenty of seating outside. 

Once we were seated, service was quick and friendly. This place is legit. We ordered two pizzas (for two of us) so we could try different kinds and "have leftovers". There were no leftovers. We got the classic margherita, which is right of entry for any solid pizza place. We also got one with onions, red peppers, and ground beef (can't recall the name). Both were lick-the-plate phenomenal. 

We even got talked into gelato dessert. We did the sampler with three flavors. All were good but I would trade a pinky toe to eat the coconut flavor all day, everyday, forever. 

I can't believe I've been missing out on this spot and I can't wait to go back. A zillion times.
author: Aggie N.

description: First time since I have left Atlanta.    Yeah. Eclectic food. Yummy. Made in front of me. Great service.  So happy.
author: Shana E.

description:
If you are looking for a nice pizza spot, this is it. They have fresh, unique personal sized pizzas.
I recommend getting it to-go; I didn't give it the full 5 stars because I am not crazy about the atmosphere of the restaurant. There is also always a bit of a wait which makes taking it to-go an even better option.
author: Caroline L.

description: Order it to go if you can, it's much easier since you'll wait a long time at the restaurant otherwise. I love the pizza with creme on top, and the crust here is just perfect.
author: Christa K.

description: The pizza was honestly just okay. It was very watery and greasy from the sauce (although the sauce was good) and the excessive amount of guanciale they put on top. It was my bad for ordering their guanciale special, but I also just didn't expect it to have giant chunks all over the pizza. The mozzarella was also not very good. Aaaaand the pizza also could have used another minute in the oven, although it still burned the roof of my mouth! My sweet server warned me, but it still did it! No food for me today as it's still singed off. $27 for a personal pizza after tax and tip. No thank you!
author: Jen B.

description:
Consider me a fan!  The margherita pizza is legit. The crust is thin and crispy.  The sauce taste super fresh and tangy.  And the cheese brings it all together.  Highly recommended!

The fried mozzarella was probably my favorite dish though.  Perfectly battered and fried.  The sauce is absolutely delicious.  Cheese lovers will not be disappointed.

And as everyone says, the meatballs are super good.  Full of flavor, moist and the tomato sauce is a perfect complement.  The asparagus is also a great choice.  Love the lemon brown butter pairing with the parmesan cheese.

Well done, Delfina.  Well done.  Now we just gotta figure out those crazy long lines!

4.5 stars rounded up!
author: Peter P.

description: Hello. Best pizza in SF. Love love love. All of them are fab but you can't beat the marg pizza and a nice bottle of Italian red wine. Yes.
author: Molly H.

description: So fresh and delicious but pricy too. For just 2 pizzas and 2 appetizer we paid 70$. They also charge extra for sitting inside which is odd. Anyhow, it was a delicious classic itallian
author: Maryam T.

description:
5 years ago my friend brought me here to try the meatballs and ever since I have wanted them on a weekly basis. I wish I was joking. 

My husband and I have also made this place a goto for date nights and even had it delivered-for valentines day 

The pizza, meatballs, burrata, its all delicious. I always end up overeating their crunchy olive oil brushed bread with leftover sauce from the meatballs. I wish i could live on those two alone. bread and sauce..heaven.  

Arrive with patience. They dont take reservations at this location. You will write your name on a chock board they will call you once the seat is ready. You can order a drink to pass the time, but there will not be anywhere to put it down and you could be standing outside until your name is called too.. Daunting as it sounds, its not too long and its totally worth it.  Other Delfinas take reservations, but expect to make it for 3 weeks out. Personally, I cant wait that long for pizza. The anticipation would kill me.  

Beautiful food and the prices somehow are even more attractive. Hands down my favorite pizza in the city.
author: Denniz S.

description:
I was around the downtown area and after shopping, decided to grab lunch.  I was craving pizza and Pizzeria Delfina came to mind.  What?!  They have one on Californa street?  Sweet, we're going.  

Walked in, scribbled my name on the chalkboard, and waited for about 20 minutes.  We were seated inside, thank God.  As lovely as it was outside, I'd rather enjoy a nice meal indoors.  Ordered the classic margherita pizza and the argula and prosciutto pizza.  Complimentary bread sticks kept us busy while waiting for our pizza.

Margherita-  Now I know why this is a classic.  Tomato, mozzarella, and basil.  The simplicty of this pizza reminds me of comfort food.  

Prosciutto Pie-  Of course we had to get one pizza with meat- I'm not really a fan of sausage so prosciutto it is!  Wow.  That's all I could say.  If you hate veggies, your first impression might be " Wow, that's a lot of arugula.  But after the first bite, it all makes sense.  The arugula and mozzarella helps balance out the saltiness from the prosciutto.  

Root Beer Float-  I'm not a fan of soda, but if you're gonna go all out on the food, you might as well go all out on the beverage as well.  

Each pizza includes 6 slices.  Between 2 people, you could easily finish 9 slices.  These pizzas were thin, not on the heavy side, and the freshness of the ingredients really brought out all the flavors of each component.  It's a little on the pricey side- $50 including tip but it was worth it.  Excellent service btw.
author: Linda N.

description:
I'm giving this place 3.5 stars. My friend and I arrived at around 7 on a busy Saturday evening. We initially saw a long list of names on the chalk board, but within a matter of 10 minutes we were seated. 

We got the Salsiccia Pizza (one of the few pizzas with MEAT on the menu) which had six slices total. It was around a 10 inch pizza so not small but not really large either. We also got an arugula salad as well to stay on the healthy side. The salad was not worth it but the pizza was pretty good. It was overall an above average thin crust pizza.
author: Andrew C.

description: Our server Anthony was amazing! Thank you for the great service and food! We are outside at night which was nice. We had a view of the street and it wasn't cold. Thank God for the heaters above us. The music they were playing was great too.
author: Chelsea C.

description: GREAT MARGARITA PIZZA, but I received the worst attitude from Jenna when she was cashing me out, maybe she has had a bad day but I was really disappointed because I walked in there with a great attitude and I was happy that I'm about to eat somewhere with high reviews that has great pizza. I ordered a margarita pizza and a prosciutto pie. The margarita was excellent but the prosciutto was awful because the actual prosciutto smelled really bad and not a fresh sense to it, to the point that my car started stinking and I end up giving it to a hungry homeless man that was looking for food. But once again, GREAT MARGARITA PIZZA!
author: Sean T.

description: Although pizzerias are a dime a dozen, pizzerias with typical "italian" options like anchovies or fresh prosciutto on an authentic Neapolitan crust are not as common.  Delfina has them all.  I came in wanting to test their arugula and prosciutto pizza and ended up trying the "Nepoletana" which has tomato, anchovies, capers, hot peppers, olives, oregano.  Bursting with flavor, a perfect pairing with a glass of bold red.  I thought the service was attentive and the food came out quick and well executed.  The dough was perfectly cooked and slightly crispy, slightly chewy, and flavorful.  The tomato sauce had that San Marazano taste to them (though I did not verify that is what they use).  Everything was spot on.  I look forward to coming back to try their prosciutto and arugula.
author: Edward P.

description:
Write your name on the chalkboard as you enter the restaurant. The wait to eat here is really long. 

Complimentary bread sticks at your table. Prosciutto pie was good, but I liked the sausage pizza the best! The meatballs were okay...
author: April Y.

description: Getting the right menu items, as always, is key to the experience.  The Little Gems salad was beyond delicious....but you've come for the pizza and I loved the Salsiccia (housemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions, mozzarella).  Great crust, too.  Friendly service and great food.  Downsides:  Way Too F@%$*#G noisy!  Wait times are DMV-like.
author: David S.

description: I was a little disappointed. There are so many positive reviews. I found the pizza to be just OK. I got a margarita pizza. The cheese was very rubbery. The crust was good, not great.
author: Jen G.

description:
3.5 stars.

NaCl...yep that is pretty much what I tasted( and tons of it) in every dish I had: From the warm olives, Insalata Tricolore, and the pizzas ordered.

Don't get me wrong Pizzeria Delfina is a cute little Pizzeria...but it is just okay. 

The Warm olives were just a plate of salted warm olives with a bit of lemon zest....totally meh.

The Tricolore Salad was another mediocre experience composed of a type of shaved cheese, arugula , and radicchio...another salty presentation which lacked depth, texture, or flavor.

The pizzas were pretty good although I prefer Little star, beretta, or pauline's.

The margherita  was nice (good crust, cheese and sauce).

The Salssicia was good with nice sausage ...although it again was really salty..

The  clam pie was pretty disappointing....just not very flavorful. Should have had a white sauce on it.

Wait at 5 was no problem. Service was fast and efficient. Prices are on the high side.

Chalk it up to been there done that.
author: David G.

description:
One word : YUMMMM!!! 

I went to Delfina for the first time with one of my coworker. She ordered me Salsiccia which basically contain meat and sausage with tomato sauce. For the veggie, we ordered the spicy cauliflower. I don't usually like pizza but this place is an exception.

I was so excited to know that it has other location which is few blocks away from where I live. Went there three times with family and friends and I can say that you cant go wrong with this restaurant. Every thing I ordered is good, it is only a matter of preferences. 

I am not good with italian cooking term so sometimes I ordered the stuffs i dont like because i dont know what they are and I also don't bother to ask. But, they are all good. I just don't like that particular ingredients for example green onion on top of pizza. Stuffs like that.

Some of their menu changing sometimes, but be sure to order pork ear with sea salt and chili oil and when it is available.
author: Ulrica J.

description: Pizza was delicious. Nice casual atmosphere. Had the clam pizza and anchovy pizza, both of which were cooked with a crispy yet not burnt crust.
author: ronak g.

description:
I've been going here for years and I love the food here. I also like this place better than the Mission District location because it's larger and since they don't take reservations, I presume it's easier to find seating here. 

I really like the salsiccia pizza. Sometimes I'm able to get a couple of eggs over easy layered on top and it really takes it to another level. 

I like the ambiance, which is cozy and upscale. Sitting at the counter is fun if you like watching the staff make the food. Sooo much good food porn here. On nicer days, there's a 'parklet' outside where you can sit and lounge. Also, some restaurant outdoor seating is available as well. 

The bathrooms are clean and there are two unisex ones, including one near the back that people sometimes miss. They are clean, well-decorated, and reasonably spacious.
author: Jimmy H.

description: This place is always a treat to go to.  The food is consistent, flavorful and fresh.  Its a popular place so it gets crowded, but enjoy the food very much.
author: Samantha S.

description: Love love love Panna pizza, meatballs and panna cotta. I've been there many times before and I actually went there twice this week. I just cant get enough of Delfina.
author: Moe T.

description: Swanky pizza place that we visited with family on our trip to SF. Had their fresh stretched mozzarella, chicken legs & 2 veggie pizzas (one was margherita & don't remember the second one!). Their wine was good as well. Overall a good place for ur pizza craving.
author: Aakruti M.

description: I love this place just as much as the Mission flagship. I love the small interior, quick delivery of pizza to table, and of course, the delicious fresh ingredients that make this pizza so special. The crust is thin but remains chewy and soft, and I'm a sucker for the prosciutto pizza. Pro-tip: eat it all and don't bring it home, doesn't reheat well. You can use that as your excuse to the table for polishing off this delicious, delicious pie.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Got there minutes before closing and they were incredibly accommodating. 

Service was extremely fast & cordial. 

Proceeded to enjoy a phenomenal pizza... they even made sure it was extra crispy, as requested. 

Wonderful experience!
author: Mitch S.

description:
Let me start by saying Delfina's is my good friend's favvvvorite pizza place.  Maybe I had high hopes, but I wasn't all that impressed (God, I hope she doesn't see this review).  

The dude and I split the Salsiccia pizza ($15.75), which is made with homemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions, and mozzarella.  The crust was a little burnt, but it was a good size for sharing and we still had a couple of extra slices.  We also ordered the fried risotto balls.  It was an interesting concept, but I could've done without them.  

The decor was cool, servers were all really friendly and patient, and the food came out within 30 minutes.  Still, Delfina's food is disappointing and, well, have fun finding parking.
author: Kristen H.

description:
Short and sweet for the LA crowd...

If you like Pizzeria Mozza then you will like Pizzeria Delfina.  Go get a pizza, some red wine, and enjoy. 

Tip:  Write your name on the chalkboard when you come in to get a table.
author: Jim G.

description:
I came here once for lunch with a group of friends. It's not spacious but has a decent amount of seats. They also have outdoor seating which is nice on a sunny day. It's also located on Fillmore Street which is a great area with cute boutiques and cafes. Also dog friendly!

If you're not familiar with Fillmore street, it's all street parking, which can be difficult to find sometimes.

They make delicious pizza here. It's thin crust gourmet pizza. If you're looking for a thick doughy crust, wrong place. It's nice crispy, airy, and light. Their sauce is very flavorful and I like that they use freshly grated/sliced cheese. Not the typical shredded cheese at your typical pizza place. They have a good variety of pizzas, not too overwhelming, perfect for me cause they all sound so good and I can never choose. Of course you can always add additional toppings/create your own pie. We got the Margherita, which you can never go wrong with and the Prosciutto Pie, very good too. The prosciutto added a perfect amount of saltiness to the pizza and the arugula added some texture to it too. It all came together perfectly.

They also give these super addicting breadsticks too. They also have quite an extensive wine selection to go with your meal.

The service was excellent. 

On a busy night there can definitely be a wait. They do take reservations!

This place definitely has a nice authentic Italian touch to it.

I will definitely return, I really want to try their gelato.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I went here on the strength of a previous vegan review, even though they don't really have a vegan menu. 

The place was very busy - the waitress was trying to do way too many things at once. I ordered a pizza with all the veges and no cheese - it turned out pretty good, although was really a bit too oily. The problem? Looking at the bill later, they had loaded up on the bill too! An $11 pizza with $12 in extras! And all vegetables - very disappointing, and no response to a message to the business before this review. 

Other complaints - getting served after others who sat after us and having the table sort of cleared instead of waiting a little until we left - sure, it happens, but not really cool. 

Finally, in their defense, the beer menu was pretty good. If you go here, check your bill. No one likes being overcharged.
author: Peter N.

description: The Margherita pizza. Perfectly zesty tomato sauce, chewy but crispy thin crust. Soooo good. Pancetta arugula pizza was also delicious and well balanced in texture and flavors. Also very attentive service and cute atmosphere.
author: Lisa K.

description: mmmmm perfect pizza, beautifully dressed salad.  kind of noisy--but not the place you would choose for a quiet conversation anyway.  Go get it!
author: Annie W.

description:
Now this is PIZZA!

The boyfriend and I were deciding between Troya and Delfina for lunch, and in the end we couldn't resist the allure of some hot, fresh pizza =) Unfortunately we arrived early (they open at 11:30) and we mistakenly walked in because the door was open. The owners kindly told us that they weren't open yet, so we wandered around the area for a bit before coming back to sit on the seats outside, counting down the minutes until 11:30. 

We were seated promptly and now I understand why there can be such a long wait for dinner, this place is TINY! The tables are pretty close together but thankfully there was no one next to us. I liked how they gave us paper menus but they also have a big chalkboard menu near the door. I really wanted to try the meatballs, but the special lamb sausage pizza caught my eye, so in the end we went with that as well as a special fried cod appetizer. 

The free breadsticks on the table are so-so but I was wondering what the plate of cheese, spicy dried chili and oregano was doing on the table. Once the pizza arrived I thought "Duh, it's to sprinkle on top!". Anyway, our cod appetizer was delicious! Four pieces of lightly breaded and fried cod with a side of lemony aioli and what appeared to be flash fried parsley. Even though this was $10 it was some super tasty fish, I would definitely order it again. AND THE PIZZA! They brought out the lamb sausage pizza with mozzarella and basil and I was not ashamed when I whipped out my phone to take a picture. Even our waitress commented on how beautiful it looked. And it was DELICIOUS! The crust was nice and soft and thin, the lamb had good flavor, and the sauce was made from real tomatoes. Perfection, we ate the entire thing. 

Service was good but since it's such a small space I would think about ordering take out next time, as that would be pretty convenient. Be aware that they tack on $1.50 per person for some fee, and people seem to like to bring their children to eat here so it can get a bit loud.
author: Sam F.

description: Delfina pizzas are super fresh but at times too healthy for me or too tomato-y so I tend to sprinkle all the house dried spice, cheese and pepper all over it, and get the thin crusted pizza spicier and saltier with their premium aged pepperoni slices
author: Dilys S.

description: Food and service is always amazing at Delfina. The burrata, fungi, and salsiccia are amazing dishes. I would however recommend having the servers read up on some of their wines if they want to try and embarrass their customers. I asked for their Barbaresco (clearly printed on the menu), the server had a confused look on her face, looked at their menu and condescendingly said "oh it's not Barbaresco it's Nebiollo that's the grape". Knowing that this the appellation in the Langhe region of Piedmont, it's also a style of wine such as a Bordeaux or and red Burgundy. To be clear, the Nebiollo grape is famously made in Barolo and in Barbaresco, Barbaresco being the lighter style of the 2 powerful, high tannin wines from Piedmont. I'm not saying I know everything about wine, but I also don't want to look like a fool in front of my date!!! Haha
author: Thomas R.

description: Although not the best pizza I've ever had in my life, I did really enjoy the proscuitto pie I ordered! Proscuitto and arugula is one of my favorite combinations and the crust of their pizza is also quite good! It's good pizza done simply - you can't go wrong coming here for a casual lunch or dinner with friends! Service is fast and the staff is really nice, and best of all, you get free breadsticks! Can't get better than that.
author: Trisha V.

description:
I want to be one of those people who will say "I don't wait in line for anything" but I would be lying to your face, because I waited forty minutes out in the cold with a glass of wine in my hand to be seated at Pizzaria Delfina and damn, yo it was worth it.

The burrata was awesome and honestly, when is it ever not awesome? They gave us two slices of toasted baguette but CHARGED US $2 for more, plus didn't tell us, which I thought was pretty dick, so that's why they only get four stars.

The Pizza... damn, just chewy delictible goodness. We went for the Panna with tomato sauce, cream, basil, shaved parmigiano and it totally made the next day's lunch. Also split the Beets, which were great but seriously just save room for pizza. Rounded it all out with an affogato - espresso and gelato- which is totally the way to go.

I loved that you could order wine while you waited staring at the chalkboard waiting list and praying the people in front of you would casually walk into a black hole so your turn could come sooner. Super packed and a little elbowey, squished, but overall a winner.
author: Claire F.

description: Really wonderful, the fennel sausage one rocked as did the cherry tomato and feta, a seasonal special. Less loved was the clam, a red version was big on heat and low on clam. Meatballs delightful and a must. Wonderful service. The kids loved it. Thursday night 6:30 we were filling the last open tables,
author: Rob B.

description:
I came here with big expectations thanks to Yelp. 

We ordered 1 pizza, a side of carrots, a glass of wine and a beer. Our bill was 60 dollars. The pizza must have been freakin' good you think? Meeeeh. 
It was a margarita with pepperoni ($17). They use quality ingredients but there was hardly cheese on the pizza. I also had to use my magnifying glass to find basil. The pepperoni wasn't evenly spread and.. Well it was a pizza.

Once again this spot is what I call 'San Francisco Yelping', meaning: overestimating places because other people write good reviews. 

Bottom line: the food is okay, people are friendly, but for 60 bucks I expect more from a pizza and carrots.
author: Judith S.

description:
Great food, good service, lovely place .
Pizza is awesome so tasty and juice.
Neapolitan meatballs is so match with the bread.
Can't stop eating!
author: Sarah W.

description:
Came here randomly on a Monday afternoon and there were plenty of tables open.  Service was fine and with a smile. 

Ordered the clam pie to share and it was very tasty.  I would have preferred a little thinner crust, but this was fine.  I can't stand those thick crust and feeling way to heavy type of pizza.  The sauce was minimal and you get to dress it with the oregano, chili flakes, and cheese that is fresh at your table.  

We also ordered dessert seeing that the gelato was made in-house.  I mean $5 for an affogato and I believe it was $3 for a single scoop was like really?  I get it, it's an artisan ice cream.  Sure, everyone is talking about artisan this or that...fine.  It was creamy but the pistachio gelato had barely any pistachio taste to it.  The color was on point, but not so much the taste.  

Without drinks, our lunch for 2 was just below $30.  It's a nice lunch spot.  I would go back for some of those meatballs!
author: Meshell C.

description:
Swung by here around 3pm for late lunch with a friend. I'm a self-proclaimed pizza snob and I definitely don't just eat any pizza. The calories need to be OH SO worth it, and given how many times I had heard about Delfina, I decided today would be judgment day. Yes, this is how dramatic I get when my friends let me pick the restaurant. 

Ambiance/Decor: My initial reaction was "oh wow, this is more casual than I thought". No I wasn't expecting fine dining, but I was expecting something more like the ambiance at Little Star - dim lighting & obviously trendy. This spot definitely appears more chill and underrated. Lots of natural lighting and super casual CPK-like atmosphere. Not a bad thing whatsoever - it made for a great environment for a friend and I to catch up.. but I def would not want to be brought on a first, second or even third date here. 

Food: Okay, so here's where things get good. I was debating over the arugula and proscuitto pizza and the salsiccia and ended up going with the latter. I don't know what I don't know, but I do know that the salsiccia was amazing! I really enjoyed the fennel sausage and the chewy consistency of the crust. It wasn't crispy at all, but deliciously chewy without being soggy. Subtle but important difference! My friend ordered the margherita pizza and there were little three shriveled sad looking pieces of basil on the entire pie. Say what?! That was absurd to me. 

Service: Decent. Nothing stands out here, but there was no shade thrown either. 

Tl;dr: very solid thin crust pizza. basil looking a lil sparse on the margherita but the salsiccia is golden.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Our first choice for a beautiful Saturday morning lunch was actually somewhere in Cow Hollow, but parking on Chestnut was a pain, so we opted for a nice lunch in Pac Heights instead. I remembered that Pizzeria Delfina had been on my bookmarks forever, so we headed there.  And yes, we lucked out with free parking up the block and around the corner.  The wait time was about 15 minutes after we placed our names on the chalkboard.  What was weird though was that there was some empty seating at the bar and some empty tables too, not sure why they took their time seating people.

We were finally seated at the bar, which was fine by us, so we could see everything in their open kitchen being prepped and cooked.  Though the meatballs were so tempting; I had a feeling we'd be so full because they were huge and filling, so we went with the squash arancini ($10) for our appetizer and the Prosciutto pie ($17) for our main.  The squash arancini came out quickly and were perfectly golden brown.  You can't go wrong with cheese and fried balls, right?  I love squash, but the cheese did overpower the squash.  Onto the Proscuitto Pie next!  Lots of fresh arugula, yummy pieces of well balanced proscuitto,  with three cheeses: caciocavallo, mozzarella, panna.  It was a white pie.  Slightly burned in the crust, but nowhere else.   The crust is thicker here than most similar pizzas.  It was an excellent pizza though more porscuitto would have been an added bonus since we are pork  lovers.  I can see why it's their most popular pizza.  

We enjoyed the service from our waiter and the gentleman that brought us our food.  Front of house staff seemed a teeny bit hipster eliteish and not as attentive as the back of the house staff.  We'd come back for another appetizer and pie on a beautiful day in Pac Heights.
author: Cat C.

description: We loved this pizza joint. Had a very attentive server too.
author: Annie P.

description: Party of 3 seated at the bar. Ordered pizza, meatballs and salad to share. All of the food came out within 2 minutes of each other. Rushed. Our bill came to $100. The hostess or manager or whoever she was is extremely rude and tried to push us out of our seats after 1hr 15 min - coming back to our table (oops I mean bar seats) when we hadn't put our cards out yet and clearing away the salt and pepper shakers and the bread sticks (yes honey your point taken, we won't elongate our stay by eating a breadstick or sprinkling salt and pepper on your bar). If you spend $100 on pizza can't you let your clientele stay more than 1 hr 15 min so a glass of wine can be finished? Absurd. I realize this review won't prevent you from eating the mediocre food (quickly) here but I won't be back.
author: Robin P.

description: Good food, friendly service. Food wasn't good enough to warrant the price. We ordered various pizzas for our group of 5. I did enjoy the outdoor seating.
author: Chris H.

description:
Pros:
- prosciutto pie (2 of the best things in the world combined)
- broccoli raab pie (also tasty, but was outshone by the prosciutto)
- thin crust with the right amount of chewiness

Cons:
- prosciutto doesn't break easily when you take a bite
- easy to accidentally steal prosciutto from other slices on the pie (good for me, bad for the people I share with)

Bottom line: Super delicious pizza! Only reason I didn't rate as 5 stars is because I haven't had a full meal here yet. I would love to try some of the other pizzas.
author: Jiann M.

description:
Terrible service, food presentation and quality. Wasted 25 dollars and 30 minutes today.


I do not recommend
author: Aaron R.

description: My fav pizza place in the city! I eat there fairly regularly and have never been disappointed- I've tried almost everything on the menu. There is typically a wait because it's so popular but I recommend eating there versus take out. It's always better to eat it right out of the oven. My most recent visit, our waitress was Erika, and she was by far the friendliest (and genuine), most knowledgeable and most helpful waitress I've ever had. They were so BUSY that night but she still filled our water glasses the second they were close to empty and treated us as if we were her only Table.
author: Shilps S.

description: pretty delicious pizza.  i've been to the mission location once, but wasnt impressed that first time, so i waited a few years to try them out again.. ha :) came here last night with a gf and got the burrata appetizer (they only give two pieces of toast what?!) and the broccoli rabe pizza. delicious. i think the crust could be ever so slightly stronger in the middle, but all good.  would totallly come back again.
author: Christina L.

description: Came here based on a recommendation from a friend who lived on that block. I had the broccoli rabe pizza. This is a bit of a mixed review. Yes, the pizza was good. Thin, crispy. But was it worth $21 after taxes? Not for a small pizza. That's a little high, even for SF standards. But it was a cozy little place, I'll give them that.
author: Michelle P.

description:
Came here for lunch on a beautiful Sunday. Arrived and found street parking right in front of the pizzeria, which is rare for the area because parking around here sucks. We walk in and ask for a table for 2 people and they say they have seats at the bar, so we decide to sit there. They have breadsticks for everyone to grab and enjoy while perusing the menu which were tasty little bites. 

I ended up ordering a beer from the menu, we got a margarita pizza and one with fennel sausage. My beer came out and apparently the beer was one that came with sort of a champagne top and the guy opened it and it was literally all foam. When I poured it into my glass it pretty much exploded all over the table because of an air pocket or something from when the guy opened my beer. I was not happy with that. Then when the bill comes it's a fricken $16 beer! What gives? That was ridiculous. That's the only reason they are demoted from 5 stars. 

The pizza came out and it's on thin crust and it was warm and delicious looking. Took a bite of the margarita pizza and the fresh mozzarella and tomato sauce on that cracker thin crust was amazing. So tasty and the ingredients were all high quality. Same with the fennel sausage pizza, the crust was just heavy duty enough to hold up to the ingredients on top but also wasn't to the point of being a cracker that messes up the roof of your mouth. I appreciated that. We came to get the margarita pizza because 7x7 said it was on the top 100 things to eat and it was pretty tasty.

We ended our meal with two scoops of gelato, one scoop vanilla and one scoop of cardamon plum. Gelato is made in house and it was creamy and had great flavor. The cardamon left a pleasant aftertaste in my mouth that was a great way to end the meal. I would love to come back again and try their clam pizza. Will not be getting a fricken $16 beer, that cost more than one of my pizzas!
author: Jeromy G.

description:
I can't seem to understand what's the deal with this pizzeria because it's really not that great. 

I went there maybe three other times before because friends dragged me and went for the fourth time last week. I didn't care too much about it before but this last experience made me certain that I will never go back to Delphina's.

1/ the staff was rude to me and my friend from out of town. They barely looked at us when we came in and it was not that busy. When I decided to go to one of the girls and ask for a table (since there was one available right in front of us), she snapped at me that I had to go write it on the empty board with no names on it... I complied and waited. 
After maybe 5 other minutes of nobody looking at us, one of the hosts(/waitress?) looked up and asked if we had been helped. I told her that we hadn't and that we were 2 for lunch. She wanted to sit us at the bar but since it was pretty empty I asked if we could get the table instead. 
Irritated she answered "sure! Let me prep it!"
The table was already cleaned but apparently putting some silverware on top of it can be pretty annoying.
So we finally seated and then service became normal again. 

2/ the food was nothing but mediocre. We ordered fried okra that tasted more like oil than anything else and the prosciutto pizza which really wasn't tasty. The crust was thin and good but the toppings were bland and didn't make for a good pizza. 

3/ it is way overpriced for pizza. One pizza and one appetizer with no drinks should not cost over $40 I'm sorry. 

Delphina is a typical place suffering the SF fame fever. Arrivederci NOT!
author: Cemeldosce M.

description:
Stopped by for a late lunch around 3ish and the restaurant was still a bit busy. Sat at the bar for pizza and beer. Really good and attentive service but unfortunately the pizza is just so-so. 

Neapolitan style has overtaken NY as my favorite style, and while the ingredients seemed of high quality, the prep was poor. I ordered the margherita. Too much char left the crust overly stiff, and somehow the mozzarella was not well melted and tasted rubbery and congealed. Pizza was not terrible but I was expecting much better based on what I'd heard of Delfina.
author: Jason C.

description: Hands down the best PIZZA in SF! Fresh toppings,homemade sauce and the best crust ever!All together makes for the best pie in the Frisco Bay. Favorite margarita & fennel sausage is what brings me back every time! Btw they know what there doing with meatballs and appetizers.(corn & spicy cauliflower).
author: Sergio T.

description: Stopped for a quick bite with my 7-yo daughter. I'll have to come back to check the pizza out. Daughter had the lumachine pasta I had the grilled calamari and a glass of verdicchio. Friendly service and the food was great for the value. Wine glass prices range from $9-$14 and most plates are $11-$17. I'll come back
author: Massimo M.

description:
LOVE FOR THIN CRUST
(4.5 stars)

Taste Italy on a flat circle!!!

- FOOD, yum
- PRICES, decent
- SERVICE, ok
- AMBIANCE, small

Yup, it's my favorite pizza joint in the city. I just love simple fun. There's nothing more romantic then sharing thin crust pizza really late at night and laughing together until our eyes water. Lol. We waited about 45 minutes before we were seated. No biggy, it's expected. Munched on the long bread sticks until food arrived. They are edible and not table decor!!!! 

HEFER STATUS.

LONG BREAD STICKS - free, crunchy, and love them.

MARGARITA - tomato, fior de latte mozzarella, and basil. It's simple but it's the best. I LOVE margarita pizza and can seek out good pizza, this is BOMB! 

CLAM PIE - I enjoy clam pizza but I'm also very picky where and how it's prepared. It wasn't bad here, the clams were good and did not have that over clammy taste. It's not for everyone but it sure was for us tonight!!!

ROOTBEER FLOAT - I love shakes, malts, and ice cream. Settled on the float because I was craving a shake. It was good and creamy. 

Will I be back? It's my favorite pizza joint, of course!!!

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
THIN CRUST PIZZA FTW. #bougiepizza 

don't come here expecting some $5 pizza. This is fancy pizza and when I say fancy, I mean delicious pizza. The toppings include fennel sausage (my personal favorite) and fancy cheeses. (As you can tell I don't eat fancy pizza often.) 

The service is friendly. The wait is long so you have been officially forewarned. 

Oh! The tripe appitizer is bomb! Highly recommend! I'm normally not a fan of tripe but this was oh so tasty!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Not much to add to all the nice things already mentioned about this SF staple. Good food, good service, great location. My only two negatives are that this place gets really busy so there is often a wait. Put your name on the list when you get there. I also think the price is also a bit high.  (Thus the 4 star instead of 5) But you can count on solid food and service here.
author: Paul W.

description:
The best pizza in San Francisco! Amazing spot with great service and fast and effective service. 

The pizza's here are the best. Perfect crust and fresh ingredients. The combination of ingredients is always spot on, the flavors just go amazingly well together. 

Beside the best pizzas they also have the best meatballs in SF, tasty and just fantastically cooked. 

A must if you're in SF!
author: Angel J.

description:
Came here to eat with a few good friends to celebrate a birthday on a Friday night after work. Initially, we were going to be seated inside the restaurant which is part of the same establishment... but our goal was PIZZA and then main portion of the restaurant doesn't offer any pizza. Hence, why we ended up at Pizzeria Delfina. No regrets!

First, we started off with the meatballs.The presentation was very rustic, served to us in an iron type mini skillet with slices of bread to accompany it. It was delightfully juicy and incredibly tasty. There was so much flavor in that thing, I could have shamelessly licked the skillet. Next came the pizzas.. We ordered the MARGHERITA pizza. The ingredients are so obviously fresh that its mouthwatering. They're able to extract every last inch of sweetness from whatever lovely tomatoes they use in to the sauce and onto that piece of pizza. It's magical... and on top of that the fresh mozzarella just melts. Our second pizza was the SALSICCIA, and we didn't think it would get better but it did. Doesn't it always get better with meat? :) The sausage was perfect.. a bit spicy, a bit sweet, but overall very savory. We ended the night with the cannolis which came with a slight lemon zest and sprinkled pistachios. Very decadent, but not too sweet. The cappuccinos were amazing as well!! SUCH an amazing way to end the meal! 

I absolutely want to come here again just to pretty much order the entire menu.
author: Mariko M.

description: This pizza is awesome. Consistently delicious. I pulled up tonight to pick up two pies and there were four cars double parked in front on California Street. Double parking is a public nuisance so I pulled around and found two parking spots right in front of the people diverting traffic because they are special and everyone else should drive around them. Oh the entitlement. Some places such put up a sign asking patrons not to double park. Delfina might consider doing this to be a neighbor as good as its pizza.
author: Greg D.

description:
There was a slight wait on a Thursday night at 8pm but there is a decent amount of space and benches to wait outside.  We were able to have drinks while we waiting.

The services was quite good...once we sat down and ordered the food came rather quickly and customizable.  

Olives and stretched mozzarella were a very nice first dish.  

Entrees were a nice size and some of the people even ordered "off menu" and were easily accommodated.  

The ice cream at the end for dessert was to die for.

Worth the wait and will be coming back soon.
author: Robert G.

description:
Free breadsticks. Yup. Golden.

Started off with a Margherita Pizza ($13.00), which was excellent by traditional-Margherita-standards but, because I love ooey-gooey cheese, this was slightly disappointing in the drippy & stringy cheese department. The pizzas are big enough to share, even though I'm sure they would love you to buy one per person (the server acted hesitant when I asked if they were big enough for two).

For dessert, I had the Amarena Cherry Sundae ($7.50), which was definitely the highlight of the meal. It came with 2-3 scoops of delicious vanilla gelato and was topped with halved cherries, pistachios and whipped cream. They give you a side of chocolate sauce and, by the end of it, I was eating the chocolate straight-up with a spoon. Yeah, I'm not proud. But it's that good.

The atmosphere is perfect. The restaurant is bright and airy, which is definitely a fresh and modern take on your typical Italian establishment.

I would have appreciated a little more service. My table, which was comprised of all girls, was definitely not given as much attention as the table right next to us that was comprised of all guys. We had a female-server who enjoyed joking and flirting with the male-table, but never really paid attention to my table. Oh, well. The jokes on her, because the guys were more interested in our table than the hovering-waitress...

Hello, boys. Bye, Felicia (how good would that be if that was actually the server's name?)
author: Gabriela K.

description:
I can't say enough about their mozzarella in carozza. How can you not like fried bread and cheese? I also love their meatballs but it doesn't come with enough sauce or bread so we end up always asking for more sauce and bread. And yes, they do charge for it. $1.75 for the extra sauce and $1.75 for the extra bread which is fine but when they are already charging $14 bucks for 3 regular sized meatballs, it should at least come with enough sauce and bread.

Surprisingly, the pizza here is what I like the least. They are great but compared to the other dishes I've had here, I rather skip the pizza and get an extra dish of something else.

The wait is pretty bad but at least at this location, there's an area to sit outside unlike the mission location where you feel like you are in the way no matter where you stand to wait.
author: Andy W.

description:
I haven't been here in awhile but noticed something the other night when we dropped by - the pizzas have changed. Well, not entirely but crusts are noticeably different. It's thicker and perhaps a different flour is being used but to me this makes a world of a difference and tastes like a completely different pizza than the ones we used to love frequenting for a couple years back. We overheard the couple sitting next to us observe the same thing so I know it's not just us imagining things. 

Other things remain the same though; service is still great, there's always a crowd at the front waiting for a table. Although they still offer a solid pizza I'm sorry to say they've been demoted off my personal list of best pizzas in SF.
author: Esther A.

description: Way delicious pizza in a comfy place. everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. Great vibe. We tried the roasted corn per our waitress' suggestion. Yum! We had the broccoli rabb pizza. Totally unique and delish!  Can't wait to snack on the leftovers! Fabulous food, great music, fun customers and waitresses.
author: Ruth C.

description: It was a busy Saturday, but they promptly sat us early because we were outside and we had a baby.  Pizza was really good - a little salty..  But everything was great.  Our waitress was amazing and extremely attentive.   Will definitely come back to try more of the menu.   Next time will come earlier with our kid...
author: Edgar C.

description: Wow! The pizza was crave-worthy! We ordered the sausage pizza, and it was a little spicy, but really delicious! We also ordered the green goddess salad. The rich avocado and pistachio crunch made it special. My daughters got kids noodles and shared some meatballs. They ate more than they have in a long time. The Sugo sauce was rich and complex. The wine the waitress suggested after I couldn't make up my mind was perfect and the service was very friendly. I will be back!!
author: Katie D.

description: SOOOO good. This is real Italian style pizza for a very decent price. My friend and I came and each got a Margherita, classic, and were not disappointed.  Thin, bubbly, burnt crust, tomato sauce, hunks of mozzarella.... there could have been more basil on it but still amazing. I've also tried the Sausage one which was amazing and the Little Gem Salad. Everything is 5/5.
author: Jenna G.

description:
You don't have to ask me twice if I would want to eat pizza. Pizza is my favorite dish/meal. For breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
Delfina is one of my favorite places in SF. I am always excited to have their pizza. I think every pizza tastes delicious there. 
The only reason I took one star is because of customer service. When they are sort of busy, the service slows down, and you may need to ask for anything couple of times. Although, people are super sweet. And it's totally worth it. 
Other than that, I think this is the best place in SF if you crave for pizza or don't know what to have for dinner. You can never go wrong.
author: Jenna F.

description:
Toothsome is one of my fave words when I describe pizza.

Especially good pizza. 

Admittedly, I'm more of a deep dish type gal, but Pizzeria Delfina quite possibly serves THE best thin crust in the city. The Margherita Pizza is outstanding: stringy fior di latte mozzarella, tangy tomato sauce and fresh basil. I still have a gripe about not having enough basil on my pizza, but this is as good as thin crust gets. The dough is stretchy which I love and it's not paper thin like Cotogna or too floppy that it couldn't hold up toppings like Zero Zero. 

The braised octopus was a special of the day, cooked with potatoes and tomatoes. (that rhymes!) However, the octopus wasn't as tender as I'd like it to be and for a place like Pizzeria Delfina, I expect it to be perfect. The insalata tricolore with a lemon vinaigrette and grana padano was a fresh, light starter to the meal. 

Service was warm and efficient, striking a nice balance to the busy atmosphere of this pizzeria. Be prepared to spend some serious cash, this place isn't cheap.
author: Janice C.

description:
We called for a take out order and I was impressed that they said we could pick it up in just 10 minutes, on a busy Saturday night. Sure enough, it was hot and ready on time, and there was crowd outside, so take out was definitely the way to go.  

There were 3 of us and we shared the 4 cheese pizza and we added mushrooms to it. Heads up! The mushroom pizza we read about on yelp apparently is not on the menu anymore. We also ordered the hot clam pie and the crispy pig ears which were fried when we got there and hot and ready in 2 minutes. 

The four cheese pizza was pretty basic and ordinary. I wouldn't get that again as I like a more interesting pie, but we got it for one of our more choosy dinner guests. The clam pie was good, but the star of the meal was the crispy pig ears!! They are served with lime and nice dipping sauce, which gave them such an amazing citrus zest. They were phenomenal!
The pies aren't that big, but the 2 pies and the appetizers was a good amount for the 3 of us.
author: Rebecca G.

description: Would keep on the list of top pizza spots based on a combination of the neighborhood location and tasty pizza! Hostest was accommodating in letting us saddle up to the bar while we waited for awhile for our table. Very enjoyable
author: J K.

description:
5 stars for the essentials: crust, cheese, sauce. 3/5 for interestingness of toppings. 

Probably the best crust I've had in SF. The crust was light, flaky. 80/20 cheese to tomato sauce ratio, and the sauce was really fresh and tomato-y rather than pasty. Had the Amatriciana pizza, which was nice and peppery, but a lighter amount of topping than I was expecting. 

Come early and put your name down to beat the rush, and come back when you're ready to eat to get seated right away!
author: Amanda A.

description: Ordered a Salsiccia pizza and tripe. My friend wasn't too keen on the tripe, but I'm glad they had something unique on the menu. It's good for fancy pizza. My only bias is that I'm from NYC, so I have a bias against fancy pizza. Give me pizza by the slice any day!
author: Annie L.

description:
I went here with my brothers and sister, and we all walked out extremely happy with our first meal at Pizzeria Delfina.  We tried a mix of different dishes from the menu, including the burrata, warm olives, a brussel sprouts with chili/mint dish, and two pizzas and everything was done perfectly.  The pizzas were all out of this world. There is something amazing about a proper thin crust pizza when it comes out of the oven and is served up piping hot; the crust is just chewy enough but not crispy; the toppings are melted right, and the whole combo feels like a "party in your mouth".  At least that's the best way we could describe it after we had finished off both of them.  Dessert was an excellent vanilla gelato sundae with cherries and a rich chocolate syrup to pour on top.  

The food was great - all of it. The service was excellent; the waitstaff was patient, answered all of our questions with a smile and brought every dish out promptly.  IMHO, great service does make a huge difference when it all comes together because it takes any meal and pushes it to a higher level. In the case of Delfina, the food was already stellar, but the waitstaff made it even that much better.  Best. Pizza. in SF.
author: David Z.

description: This place is overrated. Pizza was just ok plus you have to pay ($1.50 per person "health care tax") on top of tips, that was definitely first for us. The tables are very close to each so it's really hard to enjoy your meal.
author: Andrew B.

description: This did not disappoint! Went in excited for the clam pizza- which was delicious. But we were pleasantly surprised about the corn soup- if on the menu it is a must!
author: Brooke K.

description: Can you guys please come up with an equally excellent gluten free pie??? PLEASE! I think eating all that regular pizza finally caught up to me. gahhh!
author: Reena T.

description: Meatballs are a must try! Really busy so everything seems to be in a hurry. Our waiter wasn't the typical I'll explain everything. You had to ask him a question to get something from him. Had the Margherita with pepperoni. The mozzarella is fresh & delicious.
author: Brenda C.

description: Service was slow and at times rude.  Mussels were overpriced.  I asked for a small side of tomato sauce, and without telling me, they brought me a large bowl and later charged me for it (if I had known I was going to be charged I wouldn't have ordered it...).  Pizza was okay, nothing to write home about. Overall I doubt I'd be back.
author: Gieselle A.

description: Dude! Pizza heaven! We ended up taking two boxes of the Panna pizza on the plane with us. Hands down the best pizza I have ever had, let alone the marinara sauce. Definitely order a side of marinara, your tastebuds will worship you. There are all kinds of great San Francisco joints, but this place takes the cake in my opinion. Soo amazing!
author: Kyan S.

description:
My friends and I waited over an hour to eat here. I didn't think it was worth the hour wait.

I noticed that most people order take out and I would suggest getting take out too. This place is too small for how many people come here and there are so many take out orders that the people who eat in have to wait a while.

When our table was finally ready, we sat down and ordered as soon as we could. I didn't think the service was all that good.
