While our waitress was pouring our waters, we ordered a Prosciutto Pie and Salsiccia pizza but she insisted we wait until after she was done with the waters to take down the order. I get that servers have an order for things, but we had just waited over an hour and it was only two items, not an extensive order... I admit, their workers work hard because they are so busy but even considering that, I didn't really like the service throughout the night. Also, just a heads up, they add an additional fee in the meal. It has to do with providing health care for workers in SF. I don't know if it's a flat rate but ours was $6.

My friends and I thought the pizza wasn't anything special. It was good but it wasn't great. Of the two, I think we all liked the Salsiccia better. We are all from Berkeley and we agreed that there were plenty of better pizza places there. So all in all, our trip to SF for the pizza here was not worth it.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
My cousin and his wife took us out to dinner and I had no idea where we were going. It's rare that I get down like that, but I was game. Apparently I am supposed to love this place and drop a 5 star review and be excited that I waited nearly 2 hours b/c this place is so amazing. Please! Let's get real. It's glorified pizza. Check it out. If I told you there was this place that was spinning Mexican food into something it isn't, charged you more than you should pay and you would wait on line for 2 hours to eat it, would you be interested? Well, some of my Yelper peeps would be, but generally the answer is no. 

Prosciutto Parma pizza sounds SOOOOOO good. However, when you slap thick slices of it on a pizza, top that with a salad of arugula it makes it nearly impossible to eat together!!! The first bite I took, all of the aforementioned items were falling from my face faster than a tandem skydive! I mean, it was ridiculous! The fish and chips spin off appetizer was pretty good. The roasted beets were ok, but overall I am just not feeling this place. 

Clearly, based on countless reviews, I am in the minority here. I just think pizza should be pizza and not something that barely resembles pizza.
author: Hector G.

description: Really nothing special. I always hear such amazing things about pizzeria Delfina- I've tried to like it on 3 visits but each time was super disappointing. The starters were better than the pizza. I'm giving up, and I don't think it's worth the wait or the money. Overrated big time.
author: Allie S.

description:
I wanted to see what one of San Francisco's top five pizzas was like. I ordered their clam pizza and added sausage. I had a great clam pizza in Europe and wanted to see what kind of pizza San Franciscans love. 

Crust was a little soggy, pizza was soggy overall. sausage tasted good. kind of cold. Clams were chewy and overall not a great taste.

Not my favorite, kind of a fusion.

Thanks.
author: Dean N.

description:
I used to come here a LOT when I lived in the area, so I wanted to stop by on a recent visit to SF to relive the awesome food and nice people. While the food was still good, I was really surprised at the sass my friends and I received from the staff. Most of it was sort of "you had to be there" moments because their tone/eye rolling was painful, so keep that image in your mind. First, we walked in and my friends were finishing up ice cream (like... one bite left) and the person at the counter says we aren't allowed to sit because they have food. So they finish their food in about 5 seconds, and we are instructed to put our name on the list (just for context, it's about 4pm saturday and about half the restaurant is empty, AND the outside heated area is deserted). We are told it would be about a 20 min wait, which I'm confused by. I ask if I can just place an order to go, which I do. I tip like I would for any normal sit down order. 

When the pizza is ready, after a bit of back and forth, I ask if it's ok to sit on the heated patio because it was about to rain and was very chilly, so we didn't want to sit in the "public" area. In the waitresses words: "ohh.... no, sorry, those are reserved for people who, like... TIP." 

Eh? You saw my receipt, you saw I tipped... if it's because you want to keep it open for people dining in (even though people were avoiding the patio because it was FREEZING outside) then fine, but why phrase it that way?

All in all, the snark and condescension from the entire staff was really shocking because I only have had great experiences here. Why did things have to change?!
author: Naomi P.

description:
For pizza & a glass of wine in a hip setting, pizzeria Delfina is tough to beat -- & They know it! So much so that they have increased their prices to an all-time high. 

We've been loyal (weekly, sometimes 2-3 times a week) customers since their opening on California & Fillmore (previously frequenting the mission location). 
We love the atmosphere, progressive vibe, salty bites, free-flowing wine and friendly attitude. It's casual but hip.

However, I had a *moment* tonight when I was in with my young daughter. One adult, one child this time and a whopping $75. tab! We order the same things practically every time, but a few price hikes here and there equated to a roughly $10-$15. increase on our bill. Despite how much I love the joint, this new reality will no doubt decrease our frequency of visits. 

Still love the food & familiar faces, but like the rest of the Bay Area -- they've gone too far. It might not stop us, but it will slow us down.
author: Claire G.

description: We waited for a table for such a long time this Saturday but with a nice glass of wine in your hand it went by smoothly. Seriously good pizza. Especially the Salsiccia. And dont forget the ice cream sandwich. It's so refreshing. The service too is so kind even though it's a pretty hectic place!
author: Cathrine N.

description: Burrata, meatballs, margherita and salsiccia pizza, AMAZING. About a 30 minute wait for 2 on a Thursday evening but worth the wait.
author: Elaine G.

description:
Delfina has been an iconic pizza joint for many years and I've been eager to try.  I was just as excited when they opened the joint in Pac Heights, a neighborhood that I frequent more often, but put off the experience until recently because pizza is the last thing that I think of when I visit the most vanilla neighborhood in San Francisco.

Fortunately, we didn't have long to wait and were seated immediately when I arrived.

Our waitress was literally a hot mess.  Her outfit wasn't really appropriate for food service on a Saturday afternoon, and she was sweating profusely.  A little off putting when she is serving you food.  And we've all been there and done that, but it was the typical "first to be seated, but everyone after was was served drinks, appetizers, and pizza" long before we were.

I guess the thing that was the most off putting was that my boyfriend ordered a vegan pizza and was basically charged for 2 pizzas.  I could understand charging an extra $5 or so making it comparable to one of the pricier pizzas on the menu to compensate  for the labor of prep.  $23 for a veggie pizza is beyond ridiculous even for SF standards.

He tried doing the honorable thing by bringing it to the management's attention and received no response.

Lame duck tactics and if they keep up the shoddy service, they will be eaten alive by other restaurants.
author: Amy Z.

description:
Love it! Def coming back!Had the 4 cheese and a salad and It was just enough for two.
Great wine and beer selection as well.
author: Maria O.

description: This is a local favorite very expensive. They have a very small salads $10 soup which was all broth nine dollars had a tiny bit of egg inside a loser for sure -pizzas one size it was OK we have had so much better.pompous servers$$$
author: Martine C.

description:
Easy street parking and 20 minute wait for two on Sunday night. I love the Mission Street location, but this location is double the size. 

I loved my dinner, everything was so fresh and tasty. 
* Belfiore Burrata $10.25 (5 of 5) Burrata and two piece of good toast and arugula. Olive oil and fresh cracked pepper never tasted so fresh on a dish. I loved the simplicity of the components but the complexity of the taste. I loved the burrata texture and loved the olive oil and fresh cracked pepper on it. I promise to always order this dish when I am at Delfina's. 
* "Salsiccia" housemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions, mozzarella $15.75 (5 of 5) Tasty and freshness. I could taste the juicy bell peppers and tomato juice. Lovely sausage pizza!
* "Purgatorio" spicy tomato sauce, 2 farm eggs, pecorino romano $15 (5 of 5) Astonishing pizza with a spicy tomato with just enough kick. And the eggs were perfectly cooked on the egg.

Again, the pizza crust was perfectly cooked on both pizzas. Delfina is supremely consistent regarding their pizza dough. I loved seeing how thin the crusts are. And never having a soggy middle. It is always amazing I am able to lift the one slice of pizza with one hand. With that slice of pizza, no toppings fall off and neither to they drag off the end of the slice. I love their pizza dough recipe. They have perfected the pizza dough recipe and cooking temperature. Perfect!

I am kinda liking this location. It was easy to get too. Larger seating than the other location. And if I go earlier for lunch, I can walk around Fillmore. Pizza and shopping=score!
author: Janice T.

description:
Great pizza, service and wine selection.
Using a better mozzarella cheese would have earned them the fifth star.
author: Martin J.

description:
Easily one of my favorite pizza spots ever!

At times when you arrive, you may have to wait a bit (longest I've waited was 45 min), but the wait is definitely worth while. As you wait, you are able to order beer & wine as long as you stay within their patio area. 

Inside is usually loud and busy. The food usually comes quick, but if you're starving after the wait outside, there are breadsticks to munch on. I always order my favorite, the Salsiccia (pronounced "SAL-SEE-CHA"), this has perfectly cooked italian sausage, sweet peppers, and onions. The taste is phenomenal, and bursts with flavor. If you're looking for more of a kick, there are crushed peppers and oregano at the table. 

Some other items I would recommend off the menu: Meatballs (delicious), the Broccolli Rabe Pizza (if you're not in the mood for meat),  and their Clam Pie. They also do offer a Vegan Pizza, which is even pretty great!

The deserts are good, but I would recommend stopping by Smitten Ice Cream next door if you're in the neighborhood!
author: S F.

description: Best pizza in the city and arguably elsewhere, if you are okay letting go to deep dish or NY pie. The margarita as well as the salsiccia are always a must (yes both). The bottom crust is charred perfectly so you have the original and authentic Neapolitan pizza with out it being flimsy.
author: Amy V.

description:
I always love coming to delfina. The food is really tasty and it's a great environment for something casual or a date night. It's a huge plus that they're open during the day as well, that 3-5p time slot is tough to find quality places. I'd definitely recommend sitting at the bar as well, or in the outdoor space. 
My favorite is the sausage pizza, thin crust and not too much sauce.
author: Kaego R.

description: Oh man, totally disappointed in this pizza.  Nice atmosphere, and okay service, but the pizza here was mediocre at best. The pizza with broccoli rabe was comically bad, I can't imagine how this made the cut to make it on the menu.  The beets were decent, but I can't say I'd recommend this place if you're a vegetarian.
author: K H.

description:
This is my first visit to this location. Excellent pizza with refined flavors and exceptional service. We got here on a Sunday at about 6:15 PM. Even at that early time, the wait was about a half hour. But the staff was very efficient at clearing tables and seating guests.
I opted for the Napoletana Pizza w/ Mozzarella cheese added. With anchovies, capers hot peppers, it might not be a flavor that suits everyone. But it was definitely right in my wheelhouse. The flavor was complex yet not too challenging. The saltiness of the anchovies and spicy peppers complemented the sweetness of the sauce perfectly. The crust is thin but held up nicely. 
This restaurant was actually a choice of my friend, who did not enjoy her selection of pizza, the Margarita, as much as I did mine. She felt the sweet sauce was a bit overpowering, and on a Margarita pizza with less ingredients, I can see that being possible.
Our waiter knew we were in a hurry and his service was fast friendly and efficient.
Overall a terrific meal.
author: Gary B.

description:
Delfina is by far my favorite pizza place in the country.  When I lived in SF, I'm embarrassed to admit, I visited Delfina almost once a week (it was close, I was studying, that's my excuse!).  I moved from SF a few  years ago but my husband and I were recently back and decided to make a stop at Delfina.  It continues to impress me!

We started with the burrata, served with crostini and arugula.  The crostini was pretty oily but, other than that, it was a delicious starter.  We used to always get the marinated olives that never disappointed.  It doesn't sound that inventive but they are marinated in orange rind that imparts the most amazing flavors.  

We followed with the broccoli raab pizza.  The pizza was, as always, perfect.  The crust is thin, fluffy and crispy all at once - very Naples like.  There isn't really any sauce on the pizza but the broccoli raab is flavorful enough that it would take over any sauce that was there.  The hubby generally prefers any of their pizzas with red sauce as the sauce is fantastic but I won this one.

If you live in SF or are visiting, Delfina is not to be missed!
author: Zena B.

description: My absolute favorite pizza spot in the city! I have yet to taste anything bad at this restaurant, and have been a long time customer because of that fact! Keep doin' what you're doin' Delfina, cause I'm one satisfied customer.
author: Mona M.

description:
Arrived around 5.30pm on a Saturday evening. To our luck there was only one party with a name before us on the chalk board. I love this. So green and you can put in/out or at a table next to your name. While you wait you get bread sticks which taste like a pretzel in my opinion or you can order a drink. 

We were given a table by the window. I sat next to the window. In one angle I was cold from the breeze outside and in another I was warm from the heating lamps they had for those sitting outside. 

We ordered 

Pizza Margherita (Tomato, fior di latte mozzarella, basil) 12.50 - #21 on the 2010 7x7 list. I love thin crust pizza and this was right up my alley. I didn't like the crust as much but I can deal with that. The pizza was very tasty. It is a bit oily though. 

P.E.I. Mussels (w/chilies and garlic) 11.50 - Came with a toast. Buttery and crunchy but it is great when dipped in the sauce on the bottom. The mussels were cooked perfectly and was so savory. I could have eaten another order. I loved it. The bowl they gave us for the shells weren't big enough for all the mussels so we left half of the empty shells in the hot plate it came in. 

The place is a bit small and the tables were really close to one another. We were able to listen in on the couple who were on their first date who sat next to us. It was tough getting to my seat without brushing one of them. Doesn't seem to be any spark during their date. 

Two bathrooms. 

I love the music they played!!!!
author: Sarah C.

description: Mozzarella in Carozza *a must have* but they don't have it daily so make sure to check the website before you go and they usually update it early in the morning. I love their pizza too and meatballs and Burrata. So yum
author: Christy K.

description:
This place may be one of the most over-hyped restaurants in the City, which is saying a lot.  The pizzas were bone dry.  Seriously, I saw the margherita pizza another table ordered, and it looked like a tablespoon of tomato paste was smeared on and baked to oblivion.  We ordered two pizzas - one with speck and the other with broccali rabe - neither of which you could actually see sauce on.  Both pizzas were rather underwhelming in flavor, and the speck one had speck lazily tossed on top (which made eating it difficult).  We considered getting an appetizer, but the menu was really small and not that inspiring.  Some people say this pizza is as close to pizza in Italy as you can get in SF, or even the States.  I'm not sure where the hell they ate in Italy, because that couldn't be further from the truth.  I say this as someone who has lived in Italy twice, and visits fairly frequently.

As for service, we called ahead to check the wait, and were told it was half an hour if we just showed up.  So we took the five minutes to get there, and ended up waiting for almost an hour and a half to get seated.  Once we did, we were seated outside, where people who were still waiting for a table kept crowding ours.  The waitress didn't show up to give us menus or take our order for another half hour.  From that point forward her service was sporadic, at best.  Maybe the service is what people mean when they liken this place to pizza restaurants in Italy?
author: Scott E.

description: Easy walk from our hotel. We wanted good take out. We ordered 3 pizzas. They were meh. The best one was the mushroom. The budino was soup-y. Really expensive for meh.
author: Karena H.

description: Went here for dinner. I was alone and was able to sit at the bar (about 10 spaces) but larger parties had to wait. You write your name and party size on a chalkboard just inside the board. I started with a glass of Sangiovese that would pair well with my prosciutto pizza and it was delicious. Amazing crust, great pizza and the wine selection is very good. My waitress was great and always made sure I had everything I needed. It's a small, intimate place with amazing food and drinks. Highly recommended!
author: Phillip B.

description: We were excited to go there for lunch, and they opened at 11:30 there is no Custmer yet but one of waitress said us to put waiting list because still one of my friends did not show up...... This is very snobby . And our table waitress was very bad mode. When we asked a menu , she throw it! She did for plate, too. We were scared to ask her any more and asked other waiters . I do not know why this restaurant has this bad bad Sarvice ! Food were good but Sarvice was terrible. I  don't want to there any more.
author: Yuki K.

description:
This is one of my go-to places. All the pizzas that I've had here are great. I always order the Salcicca and one of the specials. They sometimes have one with an egg, which is yum. 

I also always order the Burrata, which is super creamy and soft and the Meatballs are fantastic!

Definitely come here! omg so yummy.
author: Monica H.

description:
This may sound a little serious, but I feel like I've had my best pizza at Delfinas. There will be a wait so be prepared or order in advance to-go. 

I like to think that I'm simple so more often than not, I will order the margherita. There is just something about their tomato sauce that make you go "ummm..." with every single bite. My bf ordered the lasagna which is also delicious because they use the same tomato sauce, but he was sad about the portion he received for the price. 

Service was also very good, I like the idea of having bread sticks at each table
author: Serena L.

description: We were here for pizza, but it was a tough choice - everything looks amazing and the pizzas were everything people say they are. Next time meat balls I think.
author: Nathan M.

description:
We're foodies from NJ - yes, near the pizza capitals of Trenton, Manhattan and Brooklyn. Needless to say, we are very picky about our pizza...and we generally expect west coast pizza to be "different." Therefore, when a friend/Philly chef/restauranteur recommended Pizzeria Delfina as "his neighborhood favorite," we immediately put it on our hit list.

This ended up being one of favorite meals of our week in San Fran - we ate there on Monday evening, August 3, 2015. The kids had a Panna pizza and thought it was delicious, rivaling the best of Brooklyn pies. My wife and I had the special - grape tomato pie, which was fabulous. Thin crust, charred but not crumbly - just how I like it.

But the highlight for me was the chilled Tomato soup. The base was grated tomatoes - mostly smooth, but still had some tomato texture. Then there were lumps of Burrata cheese placed throughout...basil and a few other spices sprinkled in too. This was one of the best tasting foods I ate all week. My son described it as a "pizza soup."

The service was spot-on, as well. We highly recommend Pizzeria Delfina!

*PS - right next door is Smitten Ice Cream, which ended up being the perfect dessert cap-off to a memorable meal.
author: Darren L.

description:
True Napolitano style pizza. There is a reason the place is jam packed at all times - it is reliably, consistently good. I go in for take out every month or so, our favorites are the Margherita, the Napolitano, and the Proscuitto with fresh arugula and olive oil.  

If I had one critique, it is this, and a quibble, I'd prefer the crust to be a tiny bit firmer, however, it is still the best thin crust around.
author: Sandra M.

description:
We had the margarita and the prosciutto pie. Both amazing. Perfect dough, nice and thin. 

Great service, perfect actually. Would love to come back.
author: Matt C.

description: A lot of people complained about the wait but when my friend and I came in at 6PM on a Friday, there was no wait at all. The food is really great! I really loved the Funghi pizza. It was creamy and savory with a crispy crust. In fact, my friend hates crust normally but finished all of his. We shared one pizza and it was enough for both of us. Definitely recommend!
author: Amanda N.

description: Amazing pizza, and the service is just as great! Will definitely visit this place again!!!
author: Google U.

description:
The best pie in the city? That is a possibility. Calling themselves "Neapolitan inspired" is just technicality. Their pizzas might not be certified strictly Neapolitan but the taste and style are every bit authentic with only minor New York style influence. 

Their Napoletana pizza was fabulous. The pie was thin and crisp with a hint of New York-style chewiness, beautifully hand-tossed and baked to perfection. Ingredients were high quality and sparkling fresh. The rich savory sensation from the anchovies and capers were well balanced by sweet and tangy tomato sauce. 

On a good day Zero Zero could still beat Delfina in terms of flavor but the pies are more nicely crafted here. Which one do I like more? The jury is still out.
author: Mona W.

description: My sons fav pizza restaurant ever! We have visited SFO twice in the last two years from TX and we will always mark this place on our calendar when returning!  Love the wait staff, pizzas of course are amazing and the ambiance  makes this a wonderful, total experience.
author: Jon N.

description:
Within seconds of walking into Delfina, my friend and I were greeted by a cheery little woman behind the counter, who seated us right away in a bright, just as cheery spot. The decor is definitely not that of your average pizza place - it's chic and well...Nice. Thumbs up for the breadstick centerpieces.

We decided to split the four cheese pizza and were somewhat overwhelmed after the first slice. The first bite was delicious - perfect crust, perfect oil-cheese ratio. Amazing. 

And then time rolled by and we were still finishing our one pizza (which isn't that big, really) and the taste just died and the excitement dulled down. Perhaps we should have ordered something else, but I l definitely left a satisfied customer. The waitress we had definitely knew what she was doing and gave us time to slowly enjoy our pizza (or lull through the process of eating it all). The water pitcher on our table was pretty convenient too.

Two thumbs up for no wait (we went at lunch time on a weekday) and personable service.
author: Colleen M.

description: Deflina's is amazing!!! Every single time I come with a friend, we spit the Margarita pizza, burrata, and meatballs! It's just that good, I can't stray from my regular order!!!!!
author: Melissa G.

description: Some of the best foods and drinks in SF! This location is far more calm, cozy and clean than the Dolores park one, even though I love both of them! I had a 4-cheese pizza with extra prosciutto, it was very satisfying!!
author: Maryna C.

description:
The pizza here was absolutely delicious. 

After traveling on a plane with no food-service for over five hours, we were starving. Luckily, this pizzeria was up the street from our hotel in the Fillmore district. We were able to be seated immediately at the bar and set to ordering. 

While waiting for the pizza, which was only a few moments, we were able to get a great view of fresh mozzarella being pulled and formed into perfect balls at the counter. We struck up a conversation with the mozz-er and turns out he was from Philly originally! We bonded over east coast memories, he recommended some places to go, and even gave us some gratis mozzarella. The mozzarella was chewy with a great texture and fresh, clean flavor. Eating it plain allowed us to enjoy it even more when it arrived on our pie shortly after. 

The pizza had interesting bubbles formed around the edges. They were charred so much that they disintegrated when you touched them, but they didn't hold the bitter taste that burnt pizza dough usually has. 

While the delectable ingredients piled on the Salsiccia lent moisture to the dough, it wasn't soupy in the center as other Neopolitan pies we've tried have been. The dough held its own and supported the toppings, but easily tore and had a great chew to it. My favorite thing on the pizza were the peppers, which had a great hot sweetness to them. 

The decor is nice and airy. They have plates of oregano (dried there), chili flakes, and cheese at the table and the layout is open. At this location there is a chalkboard for a waitlist and specials as well as a mirror that holds that day's special gelato flavors. They also use their natural/golden pizza boxes as artwork by stacking them up from the ceiling in a location visible to diners.

I was definitely glad that this was our first stop in San Francisco. It was a great way to start our vacation out on the right foot!
author: Nicole O.

description:
Tonight was our first and last time at Delfina. The hostess was unfriendly and rude. As if we were supposed to know how their reservation system works. Next to great food I expect great service and friendly people. For my taste their pizza has too much dough, it's too filling.
I am still looking for a pizza restaurant that is better than Delarosa, Delfina is definitely not.
author: Guido W.

description: Everybody raves about this place and on a busy Friday or Saturday night, there is always a line.  I found the pizza to just be OK.  If you are looking for brick oven, slightly gourmet pizza, then this is the place for you.
author: GoldBlooded J.

description: The burrata crostini is very good and the salsiccia pizza is my favorite.  The wait for a table is about 20 minutes, but the servers are fast, so you get the food very quickly after being seated.
author: L W.

description:
Been wanting to try the pizza here for awhile and I was not disappointed. We started off with fries with eyes, which we actually thought were fries and anchovies but it was actually just anchovies. I bit disappointed. The fried anchovies itself was a bit bland but the aioli made up for it. We also had the tricolore salad which, was simple and light but portioned on the smaller side.

The pizza here is different. It was thin and very flavorful. The prisciutto pie was amazing. I loved the creaminess of the cheese and the arugula to top it off with the prisciutto. The salsicca was also very tasty with sausage. 

I will definitely come back to try the other pizzas!
author: Mich L.

description:
This is definitely one of those restaurants that everyone must try!!  We came here probably a year ago; not sure how I failed to review... 

The pizza was / is nothing short of AMAZING!!  And service was great too.  

The place is small, the wait can be long, and it gets loud when they're full... BUT TOTALLY WORTH ALL OF IT!  

We just so happened to meet the owners recently at a friend's wedding, and they were the sweetest, friendliest folks ever, which is a plus for a small business.  To have caring owners def translates into happier employees, and therefore better service as well as consistent food quality. 

Luv it & looking forward to our next visit.
author: Kai R.

description:
Visits: 1st
Rating: 4*
Service: Excellent
Dishes: Margarita Pizza

Pretty good. Loved the crispy, airy crust. The sauce is light & perfect for a Margarita style pizza. We added Italian sausage which was a great idea because it was delicious & went very well with the Margarita Pizza. Wish there was a tad more mozzarella & at least some basil like other Margarita Pizzas we've had (no basil). But still good.
author: Daniel T.

description:
Judging by the sheer amount of reviews at Delfina, I know no one is going to read this so....

IT'S THE BEST PIZZA IN SF, HANDS DOWN.

Nothing further.
author: Liz G.

description:
Forget Golden Boy. Delfina is the BEST pizza in town and if I ever leave San Francisco, it'll be one of the top things I miss. 

So yes, the restaurant is almost always packed but if you can muster the courage to wait, it's worth it. My favorite pizza is the Panna w/ sausage. The tomato sauce is perfectly creamy and savory and the fennel sausage really gives it the kick of flavor it needs to make it a complete pizza. Imagine your favorite sausage pizza-- well THIS IS TEN TIMES BETTER. Their pizza is thin but not cracker thin which is an important detail to note. It's crunchy where it needs to be but still soft in all the right places. It's the type of pizza that turns you into a loyal customer and the type that refers friends in town to Delfina when they ask for recommendations. 

Don't leave w/o trying the sorbet trio. The TCHO chocolate mixed with the vanilla bean is to die for.
author: Angeline V.

description:
I finally tried the meatballs and carbonara!!

I got all four wisdom teeth out. And that ish was SUPER painful. The bottom two were impossibly impacted and growing sideways, mind you. The first meal I had was from Pizza Delfina, at my request, of course. The meatballs? DIVINE. Second best I've ever had. I let the crostini soak in tomato sauce until it was soggy enough to eat. I managed to slowly, but surely, get one whole meatball down. 

The carbonara pizza wasn't as good as I thought it was going to be, but still very yummy! Panna and chicories are still my reigning champs.
author: Bianca W.

description:
Perhaps I'm biased by too many travels in Italy, and I ate too much amazing pizza in Naples - but I was pretty disappointed with Pizzeria Delfina.  

I found that the flour used for the crust was really lacking in any kind of flavor.  It was obvious that there was no attention to the quality of the flour - the crust was sort of fluffy and empty, with none of the good fermentation or chew that one would expect in an excellent pizza.  

This place felt like a franchise with less attention to quality of ingredients than I would expect for such a famous institution.  They seem to spend more money on service than the food served (when we went there were practically more servers than people there...).
author: Hannah N.

description: Tried Pizzeria Delfina in the Burlingame and it was great. Fabulous food, freshest ingredients and cool servers. I have eaten here about twenty times since they opened. My favorites are the meatballs, the burrata, the sausage pizza with the addition of mushrooms, the seasonal vegetable dishes, the pasta specials.  The pizzas are all delicious, also drinks and some appetizers. The staff was exceptional. Service was great and they constantly gave you attention. All ingredients are natural. It was a great dining experience and the check was also a pleasant surprise. My recommendation would be to arrive early because they do not take reservations. Not surprised to see that they are busy most of the times, the place is totally worth it.
author: Carlos R.

description: The pizza was amazing! We had the prosciutto pie and added fennel sausage. the fennel in the sausage added so much flavor, yum! I loved the crust, slightly crispy on the outside, super soft on the inside, and not greasy at all.. The hubby and I shared a pizza and it was more than enough. I will definitely be back, when I am visiting. The staff was super friendly and helpful. I also loved the guy taking the online orders, he was hilarious!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
People need to readjust their expectations of what defines a proper 4 star restaurant because this definitely does not qualify.

We called ahead of time and were told the wait would be a half hour. We live up the street so we decided to walk on over with the hopes of being seated rather quickly. We show up, put our name on the board, sit on a chair on the sidewalk, and wait. It wasn't until an hour later we finally got seated (outside) and then another 15 minutes before we ordered our food. We finally ordered the broccoli rabe pizza along with the speciality speck pizza. 

The food was dry. I mean, desert thirsty for some sauce and some flavor. The broccoli rabe pizza had nothing other than the pungent sting of rabe. The speck pizza was lazily tossed together with an overwhelming amount of garlic and the most bland mozzarella I've ever tasted. What more, the speck was just tossed on top. Cool, a long slab of speck slaps my chin with the first bite of each slice until I rip it off and have none left to enjoy. 

The atmosphere is a bit much. Almost every party there was enjoying a bottle of wine to themselves and having a grand time; I don't have a problem with that. What I have problems with are people were shouting, slurring, stumbling, and being straight up obnoxious while I'm trying to enjoy my meal. What more? The music was booming and I couldn't hear my dinner companion from across the table. I felt like I was at a frat party (only there were no hot men, just gaggles of women). 

I was astonished that people could eat this pizza and rave about it so freely. People compare this pizza to the pies they've eaten in Italy; I'm not sure what part of Italy they've been to, but I can tell you the pizza there is infinitely more flavorful and delicious than this.   

I could go on about the lack of menu items but instead I'll end my rant here. I would honestly love if people took a step back next time they visit Pizzeria Delfina and really think "is what I'm eating great pizza?". This restaurant doesn't have to be delicious just because everyone says so. People of San Francisco, beat the hype and think for yourselves.
author: Tommy C.

description:
SHHHHHH, don't tell anyone about the secret menu item: the deep-fried meatball calzone!!!! - delish.

we also split the grilled lettuce salad that was amazing, and the green beans (okay full disclosure the green beans were also deep fried, and delicious!)

Not very Weight Watcher friendly - but two us SPLIT everything - further proof that I can justify anything!

I will say it was pricey though, we only had water to drink and spent about $50
author: Amy W.

description:
I know I am going to be an anomaly here but I'm ok with that.

I came here with my aunt and my two kids. They wanted pizza and my aunt thought this would fit the bill. Oh wow, were we wrong! This is definitely not a place for kids. The environment is loud and aggressive. Music is thumping on the speakers. People are nearly screaming at each other to be heard. Service was poor - part of our order was missed and never delivered. To their credit they gave us desert for free. When we asked for a tweak to their standard offering they refused. All we wanted was for them to go easy on the sauce. Nope. It had to become a battle with the chef. We won, which was nice.

The food is fine otherwise. My kids ate their pizza. The salad my aunt and I had was tasty. It's just not a family friendly place.
author: Boris S.

description:
Dear Delfina,

I'm sorry I only gave 4 stars when I reviewed your Margherita pizza 4 years ago. 
I was so wrong. Your Margherita pizza deserves 5 stars or even more. It really is as good as it gets. I have yet to find a better Margherita pizza from anywhere else. 

When I first had a Margherita pizza in Italy in 2010, my comment to my husband after my first bite was "OMG, Delfina's is so much better...". It wasn't in Napoli but still it was in Italy recommended by a local... Since then, we've tried Margherita pizza in Italy or in the US whenever we could, and we haven't found a one that is better than yours or even close to be as good as yours.

So, dear Delfina, your Margherita is really as good as it gets, and it's heavenly.
author: Wakaknee J.

description:
I love Pizzeria Delfina!

This was my first time checking out the location in Pacific Heights, I usually go to the one in the Mission but I loved the atmosphere of this location. 

It was definitely a shorter wait, they had a cute parklet outside the restaurant, and some tables you can have a drink at while you wait.

Ordered two beers, a mushroom pizza, olive appetizer and the meatballs. Everything was delicious!!
author: Heather J.

description:
Yes, the wait may be long.

Yes, you might secretly want to erase someone's name off the chalkboard..............

Yes, you will have an amazing dinner.

And Yes, I come here with my mom, my boyfriend, my clients and even my husky. (we sit outside with the heated lamps and such.  If Simba is a good boy and lets all the girls ooh and ahh over him, I give him a complimentary bread stick)

Not the cheapest of pizza spots, but you get what you pay for and although you feel like you may explode, you know you're exploding with amazing food & local ingredients :P

** I don't like veggies, but when I get the seasonal veggie dishes here...i CRAVE them immediately after I leave. wowza
author: Selina W.

description: We ordered margarita pizza and sausage pizza. Both were so good. We asked the waiter to make the pizza extra crispy and they did it right. The only thing we got a little disappointed was the restaurant charged for the extra tomato sauce I asked for. This is the first restaurant which charged us $2 for it. Otherwise I really liked the foods.
author: Erika L.

description: Great pizza at a great location. Staff is friendly and gives good recommendation - our sever recommended two wines for my friend and me - both were excellent.
author: Suparna J.

description: Oh my yum! This has been the best pizza place I've been to in San Francisco.The Margherita pizza is to die for. One, when you pick up your pizza it is nice and hot, so fresh. Two, the crust has good flavoring (I love pizza's with a crust on it). Three,  although I'm not much of a red sauce kinda gal or cheese lover, the toppings were soooo good. I will definitely come back here!
author: Jenna N.

description: Really loved this pizza place! Attentive and efficient service, cosy yet effervescent atmosphere, and most importantly, delicious, flavorful thin crust pizzas. What more can I say? I really recommend this venue - clearly popular, it gets busy so be prepared to wait! NB: we sat at the counter and loved it.
author: Helene D.

description:
Yuuuuuuuuuum.

You honestly just can't go wrong. I've had many different pies, and goddamn, but they've all been great. 

I think my favorite is the Spicy Clam Pie, and not just because I'm a lesbian. It really is delicious and hits all the right notes, balancing fire and shellfish nicely. The Margherita is also a can't-go-wrong classic. 

We also usually started the Tricolore salad, sometimes rounded off with the burrata... 

Service is always nicely balanced. Relaxed but not slow, and I've never been rushed through a meal, even though this is obviously a hopping joint. 

In any event, you should go.
author: Allison S.

description: Delfina pizza is solid... the ingredients don't sounds that amazing on paper but the food quality and taste are def always top of the line. I usually add a couple of toppings to whatever pizza I get as well just to make it extra delicious.  Additionally, the staff is super cool!
author: Nolan M.

description:
Very good thin crust pizza, but not the best I've had in SF (that goes to Una Pizza Napoletana, by a long shot). 

On the service: our server was friendly enough, but we had to flag her down and get her attention to ask for everything (more water, the bill, the extra sauce we ordered).

On the crust: a good crisp, but it doesn't taste completely fresh and is a bit rubbery on some bites.

On the sauce: great, tangy, fresh. Could use some more herbs. The dried oregano we got on the table was an amazing addition to every bite of the pizzas we got.

* Margherita (Tomato, fior di latte mozzarella, basil) - very good.. like I said above, the crust could be better but the sauce is great. Not quite enough basil. I would also say the cheese squares they add are a little too thick and not very fresh, as when you take a bite from the middle of them they stretch out way wayyy too much. They should be much more fresh and melted and break off more easily.

* Broccoli Raab (Star Route Farms broccoli raab, caciocavallo, mozzarella, olives, hot peppers) - we were forewarned that this was going to be bitter, but in a good way. We got mushrooms as an extra topping which went really well. And we'd ordered extra sauce on the side which really enhanced the flavor in my opinion. 

* Meatballs - wow. For me, this was the star of the meal. The meatballs were so succulent and soft, slightly pink in the middle, piping hot, juicy. And my complaints about the pizza sauce - it's like they made ALL those improvements in the meatball sauce. There was much more flavor and seasoning, the bread soaked in the sauce was amazing, and there was just enough until the very last bite of the 5th meatball. I'd definitely come back for this dish.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Soup! How rare to have soup that is good soup, rich soup, soup seasoned with flair ... its flavor, complex, yet balanced ... ingredients of the freshest ... soup not rushed but simmered to create a mind-bending marriage of flavors.

Rare outside of the home!

Had such at Pizzeria Delfina.

Wandered in on a whim, tried the corn soup, and ah! It was that rarest of treats, a great restaurant-made soup (see superlatives above).

They have pizza?

I'll try it some time ... maybe.

But for me ... it's the sooooop!
author: Duke E.

description: Absolutely LOVED this place!!! The pizza is amazingly good! BEST pizza I have had for it's style. Very traditional which I love! Great ambiance & service! The waiter was so friendly and engaging! I ordered the pizza with sausage, purple onions, and bell peppers asked if they could add basil and was surprised that they did not add an extra charge for that. Will be coming back every chance I get!!!!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Delicious gourmet pizza and gelato with an unpretentious feel. Hubby and I split the cherry pie and the carbonara pizzas and had about 1/3 of each left to take home. The carbonara was tasty but I really loved the cherry pie - like a margherita but with in season marinated cherry tomatoes and a sheep's milk cheese. Yum. Their crust is thin and crispy in the center but still doughy and fluffy on the edges. Perfect!

The Tahitian vanilla bean and Tcho chocolate gelato were so rich and flavorful. Left with a happy tummy. And no wait for lunch on a Monday!
author: Amy X.

description:
A cool little Italian restaurant in the Pacific Heights area.  The inside reminds me a of a hipster diner that serves really good Italian Food.  My friends and I stopped by about a half hour before closing, but the staff was really cool about it.  They sat us promptly and did not rush us at all.  

My friends and I split a couple of entrees:

-Panna (Creamy/Tomato-y goodness)
-Prosciutto Pie (Salty/Creamy... Not my favorite, but still good if you're into prosciutto/bacon)
-Ravioli (Special of the night... SO FREAKING GOOD... Creamy and perfectly made dough)
-TCHO Chocolate Gelato/Tahitian Vanilla Bean Gelato (SO MUCH YES. Creamy, Sweet, VERY RICH!)

The pizza here is thin crust and I would pretty much refrain from asking for ranch (definitely not that kind of establishment... LOL).  

Pros:
-Great Food
-REALLY Nice staff
-Food is up quick

Cons:
-Parking is a nightmare

Tips:
-There are some fees wrapped into the meal already (I believe to help employees keep up with cost of living in SF), so keep that in mind
-You still need to tip!
author: Michelle H.

description:
got takeout here

margherita and the sausage one were both good, thin crust

salad was ok
author: Jon K.

description:
Popped in for lunch today.  Had:  a glass of rose for me, a Peroni for Josh, and we split a Margherita pizza.  IT WAS SO GOOD.   It totally hit the spot.

Josh also gets the sausage pizza when he's out here for work and can vouch for it.  

The vibe is good, but it's a little small.  That said, they do a good job of moving people through and cranking through the wait, but I'm sure it can take longer for big groups.

  The brussels sprouts at the table next to us looked GREAT. The seating by the windows and outside and perfect for beautiful San Francisco days (65 degrees is beautiful . . . no north faces needed, San Francisco!)  

Would be here all the time if we lived here!
author: Kate W.

description: Love this place!!  It's a short walk from where I live in Lower Pacific Heights.  If you ask for spicy, you will get spicy.
author: Jason P.

description: We came in for a slice, got a free pizza. Pizza is bomb - the quality of the sauce is really what brings it together. Thanks to the kind gentleman who had a long day of meetings who generously (and secretly) purchased our pizza. Time for us to pass on the good deeds!
author: Anthony R.

description:
Great pizza and spot. It is up there with the likes of Zero Zero and Regazza. Can't go wrong here with the thin crust pizza options. We tried the Salsiccia pizza with
housemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions, mozzarella. It was very tasty...the sausage really has a lot of flavor. The bell peppers sweetness matches well with the sausage and cheeses' saltiness. 

We also started with the the Burrata and the Spicy Cauliflower which we are very tasty. I would go back and have the exact same order again ...but will try something new.
author: Derek S.

description: Came here on a Saturday night at 8 with two friends, without a reservation.  We waited about an hour for a table, but it was well worth it.  For appetizers we got the burrata, tripe, and meatballs.  All were pretty good, but not amazing.  The pizzas, however, were really great.  The salsiccia was topped with huge chunks of delicious fennel sausage.  And the 4 formaggi had the perfect combination of different cheeses.  Probably the best pizza I've had in San Francisco.
author: Simon L.

description:
Been here several times now, and have trusted the product enough to bring several out of town guests here.  Obviously the salsiccia pizza is a must... Which is always incredible and consistent; perfect ratio of fennel sausage, onion, and red pepper.  The crust is great and always comes with plenty of bubbles which I find most people enjoy.  Aside from the pizza, the meatballs are good and the chicken is good as told to me by guests... I always have to do the salsiccia.  

The inside gets a little hectic but the staff does a good job coordinating things.  If there are seats open, you can sit at the prep station and watch the chefs operate, which is always fun.  There is also outdoor seating, which we have done before, but remember you are at Cal and Fillmore so traffic is always busy.  

I hope they don't become a victim of their own success, as they have become popular and therefore each time I walk past there always seems to be a line.  Take out is an option but personally I prefer eating the pizza fresh from the oven!
author: Brad W.

description:
Always passed up this unassuming pizzeria on California Street until my sister told me about it so off we went to try it tonight for dinner...Thank you SISTER dear ;-)  

I am putting this place as one of my top choices of "GO TO" specialty pizzerias here in this AWESOME city of San Francisco, CA!!!

Spicy Cauliflower - YUMMY
Prosciutto Pie (Pizza Pie)- YUMMY
4 Formaggi (Plain Cheese Pizza, literaly)- YUMMY
Maiale Al Latte (Milk Braised Berkshire Pork Shoulder w/ Polenta) - YUMMY
Amarena Cherry Sundaie - YUMMY (with pure chocolate poured over)
Affogato - YUMMY (Expresso poured over Vanilla Gelato
And...
Even their lemonade - YUMMY

FRESH QUALITY ingredients.  And the fried/roasted sage leaves they use to accent the dishes are SUPER YUMMY - I would've just tossed it aside but my sister said to try it and DAMN!  It's good!!!

***I'm going to have to try their meatballs next time.  I hear it's SUPER DELISH***

So, do you see a pattern here? YUMMY?!

AND while service was a tad bit slow because it was really super busy (6PM dinner on Sunday) - it made it up for great smiles and super family friendly customer service atmosphere ;-)

The line does get long but worth the wait.  Don't forget to write your name down on the blackboard list for a table.  I did notice that they do clean up fast right after someone leaves and seems to go out of their way to accommodate everybody.
author: Grace D.

description:
I walked in and snagged a table at the bar immediately. The server brought out our food pretty quickly after we ordered, and this is essential when you're as hungry as I am! I could taste how fresh the ingredients were, and it was cool to see them making our pizza. I don't say this often, but I loved the cheese and the sauce.

Deflina's didn't serve the type of New York soft and chewy thin crust pizza like I expected. It's baked till the bottom is pretty crispy and in fact charred on the top - kind of like a cracker. One person can eat a full pizza, and each pizza is about $15. I'd recommend the pizza with egg on it; the cod pizza with potato was interesting but not the favorite.

Deflina is fresh and tasty, but not my type. The ambiance is fun and I don't regret going because I got to walk around Pac Heights a bit (this neighborhood is so cute). Go to Fraiche for dessert, it's around the corner! I'd come back to Delfina the restaurant in the Mission. But if I'm craving pizza, I'll probably head to Tomasso's.
author: Jess C.

description:
Excellent meal.  Two different pizzas were sampled, prosciutto and four-cheese, both excellent.   Superb toppings. Crust was very tasty with a nice chew, though I think a tad underdone.

Appetizers were fried onions (good, but pedestrian), fried sardines (enormous), and a three-color salad (fresh, beautiful and well dressed).

We finished the meal with gelato (very good).

Why not 5 stars?  Service was very good, but not outstanding.  The ambiance is casual.  I'm definitely a fan.  The pizzas were 4.5 stars.  If you're looking for an excellent pizza, you shouldn't hesitate to try Delfina.  The salad was 5 star.  The rest was all 4-star.  Our final bill for lunch approached $50 a person (with one drink each).
author: TennisBum P.

description:
Stopped into Delfina with some friends on a recent Sunday night after having heard so many good things about it. I might be a little biased here (being from NYC, dun, dun, dun...) but I just thought it was alright. I don't want to go off verbally bashing what effectively seems like a San Francisco institution, but my thoughts were more like "What's the big deal about this place?" 

Our group of four had to wait about 45 minutes for a table which was fine and we were seated a little faster than that anyway. For starters, Delfina is in a great space - Bright, interesting, and friendly - and the service and staff are diligent and remain pleasant in spite of how crazy this place can get. Our group shared a few things including two pizzas - the margherita and the broccoli raab , both of which were good but I didn't think they were earth-shattering in any way. Delfina gets points for their creative toppings and the inherent shareability of their pizzas, but I thought the crust was rather weak... Just kind of "blah." 

With that, Delfina is still an interesting spot for a casual meal but I don't think it's a culinary revelation. Still though, with friendly service and good, not-too-expensive menu offerings, still worth a stop if you're looking for some interesting pizzas to try.
author: Justin S.

description:
tasty sure, but $13 some odd bucks for 3 meatballs is a bit steep. I mean they were great balls, but over over $4/ball...really?

margherita pizza definitely fresh ingredients and nice crust, but after few mins just gets soggy.
tricolore salad was small, super simple and nothing special
gelato was good, but small portions. 

overall, still decent place, quick service, just over priced for its portions. no reservations so get there early and write your name on the chalkboard.
author: Angela L.

description: Went for lunch with friends.  Fried spring onions were great, as were the meat balls.  Pizza with fresh tomato flavor and incredible mozzarella.  Simple and excellent.   Good wine recommendations to go along.  Friendly competent staff and a nice atmosphere made it a perfect spot for a nice Saturday lunch.
author: Greg B.

description:
Greg and I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.  Neither one of us can ever say no to pizza, especially when it comes from Pizzeria Delfina.  We've had a number of dates here, so when it came time to leave Pac Heights and start our new life in a new neighborhood, we felt that it was necessary to have our last dinner here.  The wait wasn't very long, although being that it was a Sunday, there was still about a 20 minute wait for a table inside.  Feeling a little adventurous, we ordered the special appetizer of the night: Baked Lumachine with Sunday Supper Sauce.  The dish was basically a rendition of Mac n Cheese and it was oh so delicious!  Seeing the bubbly cheese in the red sauce made those calories worth every bite.  We've also had the meatballs in the past, but this definitely takes the cake on best appetizer!  For our pizza, we ordered the Margherita and added the Fennel Sausage and Fra'Mani Salami Piccante.   Both Greg and I like our pizza pretty straightforward so while I wanted to try the Carbonara, this was a safe bet for him.  We also had a bottle of the Piedirosso La Sibilla Campania to go with dinner.  I want to take off 1/2 a star for the service we had when the wine came; someone just dropped it off on the table without allowing us to try it.  It was a good (and reasonably priced) bottle, but that seemed a little rude.  Our waitress was really nice, and while she wasn't all that knowledgeable on the type of wine we should have with our meal, she was really attentive and made sure we had everything.  We passed on dessert to splurge on Yoppi across the street but the desserts there still sounded delicious.

There were no leftovers to take with us down to South Beach, and I'm totally OK with that.  Hope to see you soon Pizzeria Delfina!
author: Lisa I.

description:
Hands down my favorite pizza anywhere in NorCal.  I still can't get over the Napoletana.  What a perfectly balanced pizza.  The tomato sauce is spicy, but offset by the salt of the anchovies and olives, the creaminess of the cheese and the acidity of the capers.  Don't get me started on the crust.  Both crispy and chewy, as you've probably heard.

I was disappointed to come out on a Tuesday to find the restaurant closed, so be sure you don't make the same mistake I did.  If it's your first time coming in, be sure to put your name on the board.  If it gets really busy, there's a possibility the host might miss you.

A total plus that these guys take phone orders.  Although the pizza is best when served fresh, you can easily throw it in your oven to reheat.

I'll definitely be back...if not to eat in, definitely to go!

Buon appetito!
author: Anna V.

description:
Honestly I like this place a lot and the food was great but the waiter staff was inflexible, rude and the wait was unbearable.
we ended up eating outside by the bench.

maybe the management could raise the price a little or something because nobody likes to wait that long for pizza.
author: Toro O.

description: Might be in part due to the cool-down during the car ride back home from the restaurant, but the pizza was just a-okay.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
So, 
took my baby and drove over there as I was over the cheesy north beach pizzas.

I got a table in 3 seconds.
The waiter was nice and accommodating as I was standing and bouncing a baby while ordering.
The beer was nice but expensive. Peroni.
I ordered the Margharita pizza, which is plain.
The dough tasted nicely due to the nice thickness.
The tomato sauce was a little bland.
The cheese wasn't mozzarella of buffalo it was regular moz. 
So it was ok.
All in all, it was nice but the pizza was $15 or so and then the beer was $7.

So I guess if you are well off, want to dress up and go out and spend lots of money on pizza. It's nice.
If you are pizza savvy, I'd skip it.

So 3 star pizza, I would have added one for excellent service
but the price was so high I deducted it.
But then again, not everyone is as cost efficient as I am.
So 4 stars it will be.
author: Saar H.

description:
"BRILLIANT, UNPRETENTIOUS AND DELICIOUS !"
A great experience overall. The lemon vinaigrette !!! out of this world. I am making it and I am almost there... Our server Brittany was superb. my wife did not care for the glass of red wine I got for her, Brittany was on top of it no question asked and has her try something else with the most gracious attitude.( I wish I had more Brittany in my restaurant...)We had pizza in Italy, France, New York, LA and Delfina's pizzas sits in the top 5.Great Job you will see us again
author: Christophe D.

description:
Delfina Pac Heights is my GO-TO pizza place. Love their friendly service and clean big bathrooms! (There are two, one is by the kitchen corridor)

Favs:

Homemade carbonated lemonade.

Fried Sand dabs or fried anything. SO bomb.

Tricolor salad -- Good veggie fix and their endives are NEVER bitter! Love the lemon vinaigrette that they sell at the Mission branch.

Margherita pizza with all the toppings, baked oregano, chili flakes, parm, and DONT FORGET THE CHILI OIL!!!

Salciccia pizza --- when I feel like having some meat. SO Delicious!!

I am not a big fan of Meatballs but my friends LOVE the delfina meatballs.

All those dishes mentioned above are enough to keep me coming back for more!!
author: Amber S.

description: Pizza here is delicious!  Casual feeling restaurant with excellent food.  You can tell the ingredients are really high quality, and it's not cheap, but not expensive either (especially for the area).  Really good to call in for pick up also!
author: Franny N.

description: I am not joking. This is the best pizza I've ever had. The crust was thin and crispy. We had a fennel sausage pizza. It was the perfect balance of quality ingredients. It tasted so fresh and earthy. The wait staff is very attentive and friendly. I wish we had this place in L. A.   Oh, and gelato for dessert!
author: Glenn J.

description:
Definitely a cute place. Love the chalkboard and atmosphere the minute you walk in. Good service. Wish the tables were bigger though.

MOZZARELLA IN CAROZZA
Delicious. Very salty though, so I had smaller bits with my bread. We asked for another order of sliced toasted bread because the mozzarella was really big. Yummy dish, I would get this again.

PROSCIUTTO PIE
Prosciutto di Parma, caciocavallo, mozzarella, panna, arugula.
I was surprised how salty the prosciutto is here. The arugula helped with the saltiness and the pizza is very good. 

SARDINES
These were actually fried. We wouldn't have gotten them if we knew they were fried, but it was ok. Again, SALTY as hell!!!!!! I had one bite and was done. My cousin and our friend the majority of it.
author: Debby L.

description:
Love, love, LOVE Delfina! This is my typical Sunday night spot. Their pizzas are my favorite in the city, and you can simply never go wrong with this spot. The servers are awesome, and at this point they recognize us when we come in. They are all very friendly & give us great recommendations on wine. Plus, they're all super hipster trendy (but not the kind that are pretentious - haha).

My favorites on the menu:
Olives - they are warm - YUM
Proscuitto Pie - proscuitto, arugula, and mozarella
Tricolore Salad - three types of greens with a lemon olive oil dressing
Buratta - buratta, arugula

Also, they have different pizza specials, and those are always great too.  All of the ingredients are so fresh, and the pizza is thin, crispy and delicious. 

Plus, did I mention the ambiance? It's so cute inside. I've sat outside, inside, and at the counter, and you really can't go wrong in any of these spots. It's bright and just always has an awesome buzz about it.
author: Taylor L.

description: Very attentive staff, amazing food. I prefer Delarosa personally because the pizza crust isn't AS stiff but it's still very tasty. The meatballs are yummy.
author: Rebecca A.

description: My girlfriend and I just came back from an awesome anniversary night and are very happy of our experience. Though we had to wait, (so what!), the servers were taking drinks orders in line + were not frazzled by the line out the door (line out the door = this place has to be good). When we were seated, our kind, friendly, and personable server *Chloe* helped us including the over-the-phone-order server *Stephanie* who normally works in the back but swung by just to greet and welcome us (told ya these were friendly folk). Our food was amazing (tripe, tri-color salad, salsiccia pizza, meatballs...and I apologize, I'm unfortunately not the amazing food critic/writer capable of composing the quintessential blog Yelp review) b/c this Yelp review is dedicated more to *Chloe's* great customer service. There was a mishap in our bill but Chloe was super quick to correct going above and beyond in addition to just spending the extra few minutes to chat about topics other than what we ordered. (Note: this was *before* the mix up so we know her conversation was sincere vs trying to patch things up) We really enjoyed our dinner tonight and will come again hopefully on the nights with Chloe and Stephanie.
author: Stephen C.

description: I'm honestly not that impressed with this place, or maybe I just came in with higher expectations after reading all of the reviews. The place itself is in a convenient location, and I really like the strawberry lemonade soda. For main dish we got the 4-something pizza and meatballs. The meatballs were good and big. I was really unimpressed with the pizza though. The ingredients were very fresh, but the pizza itself was very simple and tasted like cheese with some pepperoni.  Also, all the toppings fall off when you pick it up. For dessert we got gelato, and it was good, but far from the best in San Francisco.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Lively weekend spot! 

Write your name on the chalkboard and grab a blood orange mimosa while you wait. 

Simple menu with great specials thrown in. We had the beets with ricotta, farro and seeds which was to die for. The panna pizza is my go to choice.
author: Maya C.

description:
Date & Time:  Sunday September 27, 2009 @ 1pm
Company:  Michael & Jack
Crowd:  Friends Catching-Up
Atmosphere:  Energetic
Music:  80's Music
Decor:  Rustic Contemporary 
Service:  Friendly Attentive 
Imbibe:  Vino & Limeade
Devour:  Special of The Day:  Pig's Ears w/ Lime + Chili Oil, Neopoletan Meatballs in Sugo, Salsiccia Pizza
Total:  $49.63
author: Genevieve Y.

description: Decent service ...nice wine suggestion...not impressed with the meatballs they werent bad just had an odd flavor. ..I didn't care for it.. the baked pasta dish was just ok..and no black pepper on any  table and it seemed like every dish needed it. However , the bread sticks and herbs plates sit on the tables all day??? Strange place... seemed like more hype than actual quality.
author: Orion D.

description:
I am not a pizza lover. With that said, I FREAKING LOVED DELFINA!
For someone that dislikes pizza, this place definitely knocked my socks off. First of all, it's thiiiiiin, crispy, crunchy dough w/ fresh local ingredients. ALL GOOD IN MY NEIGHBORHOOD. That's what i'm talking about. The taste is amazing and I didn't even mind eating the crust!

We had to order  3 pizzas (napoletana, clam pie, salsiccia)   but the clam pie was definitely my favorite! The tomato sauce was slightly tangy and had a small kick to it. My friend really enjoyed his pick of the napoletana because he could really taste the anchovy. Don't get me wrong, I loved all three pizzas but my fave is still the clam pie. 

The affettati was good. I wish I had more. The meatballs in sugo? Oh man. I was hoping they were some huge meatballs because they were $13 but they're small and you only get 5 of them. HOWEVER. They are the best, tenderest, juiciest most flavorful meatballs I have ever had in my whole entire life. GOOD BALLS. MMMHMMM go for it.

p.s. It gets really busy and crowded here. If you have small children who like to lick chalkboards, DO ME A FAVOR AND JUST ORDER TAKEOUT. GEEZ

and big thank you to our server who recommended the sparkling red wine, and DID NOT SING for my friend's bday. Much appreciated.
author: Susy C.

description:
I was honestly surprised by the quality of the food and drinks as well. The crew is friendly and there can be a little wait before having a sit..but that's pretty common in SF, right? 
I really enjoyed the prosciutto pie pizza and the prosciutto itself was authentic and very good. 
I didn't try the gelato, I just had a shot of espresso after the pizza and even the coffee was well done. 
Food price is relatively cheap, you should definitely give it a try if you are around.
author: Marco B.

description:
Not sure what all the hype was about.  It's a great little place, and has an unique atmosphere, but it's always overcrowded, there's hardly any space, it's noisy, and I could barely understand the menu.  

Next time, and that is if I ever go back, I'll be doing take out.  The wait was just ridiculous.  We were about the 5th party waiting, and we had a party of the three, something they're probably not use to.  Seems like you either have a party of two, or a party of 4+.  Now I understand that they want to serve all their customers, but if someone is called and they are not there, just cross them off, and move on.  People who have actually waited the entire time should be seated in a timely manner.  

Another thing that just ticked me off was the fact that they smashed three people onto a table made for two.  Now I get that this place is small and they try to save the booths for bigger parties, but shoving three people on a table the size of a desk is just bad customer service.

Now, the food, probably the only thing that saved them from a 1-star.  Had the roasted corn with lardo butter, absolutely amazing.  The butter was so creamy and rich, and the corn was so sweet.  If only Hawaii had good tasting corn the way the mainland does.  If I ever do come back that is the only thing I will be getting.  Next, I ordered the margarita pizza.  Maybe it was just me, but I thought the sauce to be very watery, and the cheese and toppings just fell off onto my plate.  A bummer there.  Definitely not worth $15.  

Maybe I just had a bad experience, but Pizzeria Delfina was not what I had expected.
author: Kylie O.

description:
My first time dining at this location. Didn't wow me quite as much as the original location, but still extremely enjoyable.

We braved the cold and sat outside, which I love--great people watching. Plus, the heaters made it bearable. We started with the Roasted Mariquita Farms Carrots, with cumin, ricotta, and wildflower honey. They were sweet and savory and cooked well. Next was the Neapolitan Meatballs in Sugo (red wine tomato sauce). The meatballs were flavorful and tender, and it's a generous serving (three sizeable meatballs served with two slices of crusty toasted bread). There were three of us, and I'm not sure we even finished them. For our pizzas, we went with the Salsiccia (housemade fennel sausage, tomato, red bell peppers, red onion, and mozzarella), and, at the server's suggestion, one of the specials, which had house-cured lardo, cippolini onion, tomato, arugula, and black pepper. The Salsiccia is a perennial favorite. It's hearty and flavorful, and the sausage is amazing. The special was surprisingly bland. How is something with cured pig fat bland, you ask? Beats me. Still had that killer Delfina crust, and wasn't unenjoyable when doctored with some red chili flakes and Parmesan.
author: Dara M.

description:
Yum! Didn't know there was a Pizzeria Delfina so close to my house. I used to just go to the Mission for my fix of Delfina pizza.

My roommate and I got the:
- Margherita Pizza
- Neapolitan Meatballs in Sugo 
- Insalata tricolore
- Montepulciano "Delfina" wine

Overall, great service and good food. The meatballs were my favorite part of the meal!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Pizza + Baked Egg = yummy in my tummy!!!! I think it's the BEST thing they offer. It's not always on the regular menu though, so be sure to ask (nicely) if they will make it for you on night's it's not.

Broccoli raab pizza is interesting, but not much more.  As a veggie, I really wanted to like it, but will probably never order it again.  I also do not care too much for the pizza margherita (a lot of sauce and little cheese) but may try it again, for good measure. The 4 cheese pizza with mushrooms added on, on the other hand, is  delicious!!! 

I also really loved the seasonal corn salad  they offered every once in a while as a special during teh summer.  Sweet corn and shaved parmesan makes for a simple yet tasty combination.  i shall be counting down the days...

5 stars because of the whole experience. I never seem to mind the wait, the staff is especially helpful and happy to be there - shock! - (especially this loud younger really thin girl who gets super excited about the pizza), they have really good wine options and nice deserts! Plus, did I mention the pizza with baked egg on top?
author: Gev M.

description:
The pizza is definitely good here. We had the margarita and prosciutto and were happy with both. But I'm not so sure it was worth the 45 minute wait, just to sit on the sidewalk (which was a little chilly despite the heat lamps) right next to the 50 people still waiting for a table and the hostess who kept yelling out names. Another half star off for the truly atrocious wine - the montepulciano in particular was terrible. A step up from red wine vinegar. I did manage to down it since I waited so long for a table it and it kept me warm...

In the future we'll stay home and make just as good pizza with way better wine for a much cheaper price tag.
author: Dassance R.

description:
Arrive, write your own name and number in your party on the chalkboard, and go for a walk. During peak times the wait can be up to an hour but there are plenty of distractions along Fillmore to keep you occupied (Goodwill, Athleta, Kiehl's, Marc Jacobs). If you miss your call time your name will be circled for later, but don't be that guy.

It's quite cozy inside and although seating is intimate, it's quite noisy, usually owing to the music being too loud. Don't bother asking anyone to turn it down. In a nutshell - might not be ideal for a first date. 

Start with the Insalata Tricolore ($8.50) - it doesn't sound very exciting but the taste is dynamite. One pizza can easily be shared between two people, and if there are even more of you I recommend getting a bunch of different ones to split. As a vegetarian I have sampled the 4 Formaggi, Margherita and Panna, which are all sort of similar and range in price from $10-15. It depends what kind of mood I'm in but I have always been satisfied with those three. The wine list is solid.

If you don't want to wait, call your order in ahead of time and take it out. I've had much success with this when I'm not in the mood to elbow my way in for a seat.
author: Kat F.

description:
Service was HORRIBLE! I don't mind waiting in line for good food, but the hostess was so rude to our entire party. We had a party of 9, so I know it's an odd number. So we already told the hostess 30 minutes into waiting that we can spilt up our group how many ever way just to get seated. So one by one, we watch this hostess give tables of 2-4 to people that got there after us. I really believe he gave tables away to other people just to be rude.

Then we sit down after waiting for 3 hours (no I'm not exaggerating)- we spilt up in groups of 2s and a group of 3, so was already upset that we didn't get seated way before...

Food wasn't good enough to make up for the wait and the horrible hostess.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
My friend and I got the proscuitto and the carbonara. Both are good, but damn, eggs on a pizza; who knew?

The gelato is very tasty- we ordered it in brioche, which gives you a lot less actual ice cream than I expected. The brioche is fluffy and lightly sweet.
author: Chibi K.

description:
After a long day at work on a Sunday, I went out to grab dinner here at about 8pm. We lucked out and found street parking around the block from the restaurant. There was a line out the door and I knew it would be quite a wait.

The restaurant is pretty small, especially since it has a huge following, but I guess that just adds to its popularity. Walking in, there's a giant chalk board that lists the menu and the day's specials. It's also where you write your own name on the waiting list. To the right there's a few chairs to grab a seat and you can even order a drink (beer/wine) while you're waiting. There's seating at tables and seating at the bar overlooking the kitchen. There's also a couple outdoor tables, which aside from being cold during the middle of winter, it can also be awkward because of all the people waiting for a table only 2 feet away from you. 

We ended up waiting about 45-60 minutes to finally get seated. The waitress was nice about it and assured us we would be seated as she write "CLOSED" underneath the wait list.

Since we were anxious to eat,we sat at the first place that opened up -- the bar. Right as we sat down, one of the cooks in the back was throwing a fit and arguing with a waitress... AWKWARD. At the bar, they had breadsticks and a plate of seasonings for our pizzas (hot peppers, cheese, and oregano?). I got the Salsiccia, as did one of my other roommates, and the other roommate got the Prosciutto Pie. Our pizzas came out about 10 minutes later and were perfectly cooked. The flavor combinations were quite tasty and I loved the thin crust. I even ate the ends because the dough was crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside, without it being too much. My roomies split their pies half an half and said the Salsiccia was better than the Proscuitto. 

For about $15+ per pie, it's pretty pricey, but the neighborhood is nice and trendy, so it should be expected. The clientele is the young, well-dressed, and successful 20-30 year old crowd, but there are some hipsters. I mostly saw couples or small groups of people. I don't know if I would return right away because I think I preferred Zero Zero's pizzas, but it's a different ambiance from Zero Zero (more casual then the mood-lit happy hour place).

Side Note: They serve bottled Coke!
author: Leana L.

description:
Pizzeria Delfina hits all the high notes - ambiance, service, menu, food - all outstanding. The restaurant itself is a hip and inviting spot which offers paper menus on the way in and a big board just inside so you can be prepared to order the second you sit down.* We arrived early on a weeknight and sat outside, where an overhead heater was activated for us right away, taking away any thought of being cold as evening approached.

Our server was completely friendly, helpful with recommendations, all while dancing every time he came to the table. With his help, we settled on the brussels sprouts as an appetizer and a special vegetable pie, with 2 farm eggs on top along with a garlic and anchovy aioli. There are few places I would even consider having a pizza with eggs on top, but it definitely was the best choice - an unusual textural combination bursting with flavor, laying a top a perfectly fired pizza. The brussels sprouts had some lime and chili in it, as well as some arugula and a lemon vinaigrette and altogether formed a just right combination of heat and flavor. Pizzeria Delfina obviously pays attention to the measurements for their concoctions because they were all perfectly balanced.

Finishing off the meal with homemade mint chip and coconut gelato were the cherry on the sundae. This is California pizza at its best - creative, local and fresh and full of flavor. I can't imagine there is much better pizza around.
_______________
*After seeing pizza on a stranger's plate on the way in, you will be more than ready to order.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Officially the best pizza we've ever tried in SFO. The tomato sauce in unbeatable; mozzarella tastes like is fresh out of Italy; and the crust is just perfectly crunchy. Oh, and order the corns as starters!! You wont regret it!
author: Carol P.

description:
Pizzeria Delfina, I think you're my new favorite pizza place! Margherita pizza, marinated olives, a tall glass of lemonciatta & good company makes for a good night out! 

PS. The marinated olives were pretty amazing! 
PSS. The service was very attentive too! Great food, great service makes for a happy Jeanette!
author: Jeanette Y.

description: Let me start off by saying the pizza here is amazing. Food not the problem. Service was excruciatingly slow. I think we saw our waitress twice the whole meal. Maybe it was an off day but poor service makes me not want to come back.
author: Priya P.

description:
Wow, this place is nothing compared to Tony's. it's overhyped with boojie decor is all.  Prepare for  $16-17, small dinner plate sized pieces of cracker with some toppings on it basically. I tried the salciccia which wasn't terrible but at almost $20 it was tiny and definitely not worth it. I also had the broccoli raab that everyone raves about, which was oversalted and dry. 

Service was subpar, they wouldn't seat our party of three unless everyone was there. Three, really?! There wasn't even a wait at the time, half the restaurant was empty! Our server forgot twice when I asked her for a toothpick, but she was prompt about refilling our water, which I badly need for the oversalted broccoli mess I ate.

Back to Tony's I go!
author: Emily H.

description:
