Delfina is a good pizza restaurant, and the finest such establishment in the immediate area- this is evidenced by the fact that it is ALWAYS busy, and you usually have to chalk your name on the board and wait for a short while.  But in the city-wide perspective of pizza- there are several more elite options which blow Delfina's product away.  

I do enjoy their pizzas, but really I enjoy their non-pizza items more- great 'tricolor' salad and meatballs.  I think the crust at Delfina just doesn't cut it for me.  It has a rather pedestrian taste, and my most recent margarita pizza there was rather 'crackerishly' crisp, and simply not to my tastes.  This stated, the pizzas are good, and I can easily engulf them.  But once you have tasted the wood-fired creations from A-16, Tony's, Flour+Water or Una Pizza Napoletana (my favorite), there is no comparison whatsoever.  I'll be back, but more for a 'stop when in the area' kind of visit than a 'pizza night' kind of visit.
author: Andy S.

description:
last night's dine-in experience was the worst we had this month. while our pizza was good, it wasn't as great as the pizza we had the night before from Gioia. meatballs of course were delicious. not here to bash on the food at all - it's obviously decent and attracts a crowd. the crowd, the service, and the system at which this restaurant is run however, is completely terrifying. 

you will be overwhelmed by the amount of people standing around in no specific order - all confused. no hostess to greet you at the door, no one to answer questions, no order of peace whatsoever. questions were thrown out randomly to the first person you figured was a server. "excuse me, how long is the wait?" - said every new customer who walked in last night. "i'm not sure yet. i can't help you right now." why? because she's busy running drinks or food out the door. 

not only was the chalkboard waitlist hard to find because people were hovered in front of it, but i also witnessed a number of customers adding their names to the wrong list - only to cut in front of 15 other people. no one else is watching, no one notices but me. these poor people will have to wait EVEN LONGER. kids are screaming, as are the workers behind the register. a huge catastrophe i will say, in addition to a fucking fire hazard. literally.
author: Thao T.

description:
Really great pizza. Loved the sausage pie. 
It's all about the crust and they get it right. 
Thanks.
author: Kev M.

description:
Love ordering their pizza to go and just walking down the street to pick it up since Fillmore Street is usually packed and it can be hard to find parking.  Plus, they are always crowded and I hate waiting for a table.  

I usually get the Napoletana and Broccoli Raab pizzas (for two people) which are just delish.  Their pizza's are small and simple but I like the thin, crisp crust and the sauce they use.  I've also had their Burrata appetizer which is pretty good.

Make sure you check your pizza before you head out the door when it's crazy busy - once we were sent home with a different pizza!  Usually the servers are on top of checking but with the large crowd it must have been overlooked.  They were very sweet about it and we were able to return the pizza and get the one we actually ordered, and they threw in a salad to make up for the mix-up.
author: Sumeena B.

description: Bay Area Pizza standout. Solid variety of apps and the thin crust pizza made me wonder if I had better pizza this year. I have, but Delfina made me wonder and that's all that counts. What really makes this one standout is the quaint dining room and staff - hip enough to be interesting but not overwhelming.
author: Gonzalo S.

description: It's in the heart of the Filmore near Filmore and California and it's amazing. The best part of the food is the flavors. I've had my share of pizza's and this pizza has such a unique take on spices that you keep on coming back for more. It's like there is a fireworks show in your mouth.
author: Devika B.

description:
My sister and her colleague joined us for lunch here last Friday after an appointment we had in the city. We came at peak lunch time and waited for about 30 minutes to be seated. It was packed!

There were a few incidents with our service at the beginning of our meal that rubbed me the wrong way but I just brushed it off to them being quite busy and needing to serve a packed room. However, towards the end of our meal when the restaurant had mostly cleared out, we still were not attended to and the servers were downright rude.  2 stars for service.....and that may be a bit generous.

As for the food....it lived up to all of the hype. The bf and I shared the Insalata Tricolore and their Salsiccia pizza. And although I ordered the Insalata Tricolore thinking it was something else, I enjoyed the light salad with endives and arugula.  However, it was the Salsiccia that was the show stopper---and to me, it was all about the crust! Thin but slightly chewy in the inside and crisp on the outside. Granted, I have never been fortunate enough to visit Italy but I can only imagine that this is what authentic pizza tastes like. Delish! 4.5 stars for food. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wPJjpOZ0mnsajJLBkWUnwA?select=JxuDiXnWMRWCWiFmPbZm-g

Overall, I give Pizzeria Delfina 3.5 stars. It's unfortunate that the service really took down my overall rating because the food was stellar. Perhaps I'll go back again to see if my experience was just an anomaly since other Yelpers seemed to have had a different quality of service that we received.
author: Nam N.

description:
I feel utterly spoilt that I live just a stones throw from this place. A bit dangerous also as its so tempting to pop in there quite regularly. The pizzas are consistently perfect! Not only is the base thin, crusty and tasty, you can also tell the toppings are of really high quality!
Don't be afraid to deviate from pizza menu too, tonight I tried the chicken brodo and boy did it pack a punch with flavor! They used to have a problem with estimating wait times, but lately they've nailed it down to the second - very impressive!
author: Julia B.

description:
A friend told me about this place and on a trip to the city we run into it. It's worth the visit! High quality ingredients is their signature. You can tell they care about that overall. 

The napolitana pizza was superb -- perfect crust, sauce juicy and great tomato and spices flavour, and at a perfect temperature. We were warned that it didn't come with cheese... good catch! We added that key ingredient of course. 

The salad and its dressing were close to perfection. Ruccola, radiccio and endives with olive oil and lemon zest vinagrette. So good! 

Yes, the place is crowded and short in space but the food is plain fab!!!
author: Florencia G.

description: Amazing service, great atmosphere and delicious food. The speck pizza is perfection :)
author: Kelly K.

description:
A bit on the pricey side. Great service. I like the open kitchen.

We ordered the Prosciutto Pie and Salsiccia. I thought the Salsiccia was settled in flavor. It could be because I'm not a big fan of Salsiccia. I enjoyed the Prosciutto pie more. The flavor was more intense.

We ordered this mozzarella cheese mixed with something else with some greens. I can't remember the name, but I really loved it. 

The employees are nice and attentive, they seem so energetic. It's cute that they kept calling us kiddies.

Also, I love the music that they were playing that day. Very old school, 60's, soul, and R&B-ish. Very pleasant to my ears.
author: Mandy D.

description: Update: ordered a carbonara pizza I wasn't crazy about, sheepishly mentioned it to the staff, they then brought me another pizza--- on the house. Class acts!
author: Dan B.

description: Waited forever to try this place but it was A-OK. I don't know what people love about it.
author: Tania S.

description:
It seems we can never get in to the one on Mission...with no line, we decided to give it a try and rest a bit from the fair.

The breadsticks were thin and crispy.  The plate of cheese, herb and pepper were quickly depleted.

Napoletana - tomato caper olive anchovies hit peppers and oregano - $11 - nice thin crisp crust.

Chilled tripe triperia style - $8.5 - crunchy, the chili oil has a nice kick

Pitcher of Anchor Steam - $18? - bigger than other places but a great deal.
author: Gloria H.

description:
I said I would give this place another try.. and so I did! 

Turns out I'm glad I tried it again because I did think the pies were much better. However, again I'd have to say they're just not worth the wait and price.

+Cute spot if you want to spend a LONG time with a date, grab a drink while you wait and get to know each other..

Came here with a party of 6 and it took almost a good 2HRS to be seated. 
When we're finally seated we were told it takes about 20 mins to make a pizza, okay. that's cool we decided to order a Calamari appetizer....NOT. it should be called the 'hummus+garbanzo bean dip, with 2 pieces of squid" because thats the misconception that was set down on our table haha.

BEST: Part of the SPECIALS is the pizza with 2 farm eggs and spicy tomato sauce - $15. The spicy sauce is a just a hint but if you tend to add red peppers, beware because it will get HOT haha. Who thought.. egg on a pizza? GENIUS.

Margherita pizza - a classic, good but not extraordinary. Skimpy on the basil - We had to call dibs on who gets one of the slices consisting of the 3 pieces of basil. 

+homemade gelato! I wish I got to try it but with the portions that were continually letting us down, I didn't want to pay about $5-6 on a potential measly scoop.

- NO RESERVATIONS
+ AVAILABLE TO ORDER PICK-UP
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Soggy overpriced pizza with way too much attitude. 

Pick any of a dozen pizza places and have a better meal.
author: Mr J.

description:
I've never encountered a pizza place that refused to put meatballs on a pizza, or make a pepperoni and mushroom pizza. until i called for a take out order from pizzeria delfina, that is.  

Called on a saturday night around 8pm to get a couple of pies for my friends and i.  i asked for pepperoni and mushroom, and was quickly made to feel like a fool by the gentleman on the phone... "Have you ever seen our menu?"

actually no i haven't.  i recently moved to this neighborhood (from nob hill) and found a 4 star pizza joint on yelp and wanted to get some pizza.  well i finally settled on the salcissa pizza and margherita, solely based on the images from this page.  

the margherita had something i have never seen before on a margherita pizza, cooked basil (which looked black and rotten).  maybe its just me, but every other margherita i've ever had (including in rome itself) had fresh basil on it.  but who knows, i'm sure this neighborhood pizza joint knows something the rest of the pizza world doesn't.  and if that wasn't bad enough, on our 12" pizza, i counted 4 blackened, whole basil leaves.  on the entire pizza.  not great distribution.  might as well called it a cheese pizza with some cooked greens on it.  

the salcissa was better flavor, but the crust was tough.  thin as i like it, but boy did i have quite the time chewing down the last few bites of this tough and hard crust.  



oh there was more to the phone call to order as well! i asked what types of cheese they had (i wanted to try and replicate one of my favorites at Tony's pizza in north beach...if you haven't been...you're missing THE BEST PIZZA IN THE CITY....no really they've won plenty of awards and are one of the few wood fire burning pizza spots in the bay area)....so i asked to get a ricotta and meatball.  well we settled on mozzarella, but then i was told "we have meatballs, but we can't put meatballs on your pizza...we can give it to you on the side."  

i'm just utterly confused on how the kitchen at this place has all these ingredients that all make delicious pizza's, but are told they cannot  use it on a pizza? are there robots back there putting these pies together? where's the creativity? 

at $16 a pie......there are plenty better options...heck i'd get a larger tastier pie from tony's next time despite this spot being so much closer.
author: omid a.

description: Had a delicious white pizza and a few glasses of dry Italian white wine. Food didn't make the experience, not in a bad way, but it was the service from the guy at the door that made this "first outing with newborn baby" memorable. He immediately made us at home and put our stroller in the back. Super accommodating, not that I'm saying this place is for kids, but hey they're nice people. Wine selection is a selling point too. Cheers.
author: Mike P.

description:
I love this place... The vibe feels like some European spot I could sit in for hours. 

The lighting is warm and inviting, the beer and wine list is well curated... The 4 formaggio, the salsiccia, and the prosciutto pie are consistently wonderful. Also, the tricolore salad is delicious. 

Overall very well done.
author: Nick S.

description: Loved the food and the service was good in an exceptionally hectic environment!  We waited 45 min for a table but no one seems deterred by the long waits. This was at 5PM on a Saturday. The food: Neapolitan meatballs, great; margarita pizza, perfection; mussels, garlicky with heat from spicy peppers- not my ideal preparation. Pepper kick detracts from those juicy morsels. The ambience is super loud and a family sized diner gone hipster. Fun place anyway!
author: Brian H.

description: Great experience here a couple weeks ago.  We tried the arugula salad, fresh mozz, and the sausage pizza.  So happy there is one of these in Palo Alto so I can get this pizza on the regular.  Hands down best za i've had on the west coast!!
author: Caroline C.

description:
Have to give credit where credit's due. This thick crust lovin girl just inhaled a thin crust pizza from Pizzeria Delfina & it was *awesome*

4-Cheese Pizza paired w/ their Spicy Cauliflower side dish  (To-Go)

Obviously I dumped the cauli on the pizza & yup, as expected, it was delectable
....I am genius like that

Pizza had tangy & flavorful, string-pulling cheeses & even though the crust was thin, it still stood up on its own & didn't necessarily fold over like other thin crusts tend to do

There was also a tasty charred, smoky, flavor in their outer crust that at 1st blush I thought would be too crunchy & tear my mouth up (as I am a delicate flower) but the dough was soft & mooshy on the inside & it provided the perfect ratio of crunch to squish....well done!

The Cauliflower was tender & just a bit spicy & had capers & red pepper bits to kick up the flavor - but I poured on all the chili flakes they gave me to take it up to my heat level & the rest is history

Not sure if their side dishes change / rotate but would def get the cauli again or try another side-dish-dumping combo next time

While I was waiting on my order, I overheard the waitstaff telling a table how to enhance the flavor of their pizza w/ an oil she gave them & I thought, that sounds pretty cool - would certainly be worth a dine-in experience to see what they gotta say!
author: Adrienne G.

description: Above-average pizza and fine service, but the restaurant is overcrowded and too loud.
author: Robert T.

description: There are very few bad choices you can make here, but be ready to wait a while to get seated. Put your name in a walk on Fillmore for about 30 minutes if you're trying to eat in the evening on weekends. Weeknights aren't a whole lot better for wait time. Still worth it though.
author: JP N.

description: Love this place. Fabulous atmosphere with amazing food. Most everything is made on sight, right down to your last gelato! The fresh ingredients and favor make it all delicious. We tried all the specials and weren't disappointed.
author: Denise R.

description:
Checking off the SF7x7 magazine 100 things to try before you die 2012 list.  Still a ways to go on the list, but we checked off the Margherita pizza last night by eating here.

We arrived around 5:30 p.m. and already the place was 98% occupied. Within the hour folks had to sign up on the blackboard wait list to your left as you enter the premises.

Ordered two draft Italian beers to go with our two thin crust pizzas -
*Margherita - came to the table piping hot.  The first slice was very crusty, but the sauce caused the crust on remaining pieces to become somewhat soggy as I continued eating. Also starting to coagulate because they keep the front door open due to so many folks coming in and out. But as far as Margherita pizzas go, this one was very good.
*Salsiccia - nice combo of spicy sausage to cheese ratio. Great with the beer.

We enjoyed both pizzas and had three leftover slices to take home.

Quick informal service.  Somewhat noisy and very busy pace.  A few outdoor tables with overhead heating lamps.  We were in and out within an hour.

Tab including tax & tip $51.00.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Once I visit Pizzeria Delfina again, I have a feeling this review will be bumped up to five-stars!  But for now, I will review based on my short to-go experience.  

Seeing Pizzeria Delfina on the 7x7 Big Eat, and not really wanting to cook on a Sunday night, my boyfriend and I called in an order for a margherita pizza around 6:00 p.m.  The restaurant said it'd be about 25 minutes, so we got in the car and headed over.  We quickly found free street parking about a block away and when we walked into the restaurant, the pizza had just been boxed.  The single pizza came up at just over $15 and the cashier was very friendly.  He gave us cheese, peppers, and some herb/garnish to put on our pizza.  We asked if they had any paper plates, they didn't, but the cashier offered us some flat to-go boxes to use as plates.  

As for the pizza, it's pretty much as good as I imagine a margherita pizza can be.  The tomato sauce is very fresh tasting (not overly heavy at all) and the mozzarella was great.  There are a few basil leaves and overall, the ingredients were perfectly complimentary.  The crust was also very good.  My boyfriend and I were impressed that it was thin crust, but still had a nice chewiness to it and was quite substantial.  The edge/upper crust area had a nice cooked, wood-fired look to it and the crust had a nice flavor overall.

I'll be back soon to dine-in.

Notes:
-The have some temporary tattoos by the cash register.  I grabbed a couple, just because. 
-The area is pretty busy, but on a Sunday evening, parking was very manageable.
author: Samantha L.

description: Perfection! Salsiccia pizza was perfectly charred and toppings were fresh. Also had bean and escarole soup and gelato to finish. Loved the thin breadsticks they have and the service was very kind and answered all our questions about the menu. Will definitely be back (they also do take out!)
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Possibly the best margherita pizza I've ever had (including my experience in North Beach and in New Haven). The sausage pizza was pretty good too but less impressive relative to other versions I've had at other places. 

Sanddabs were available the day we came and they tasted delicious, but they also were supposed to be appetizers and yet they arrived long after the pizza did. There was some issue with the deep fryer, but the staff made it up to us by taking the order off the final bill (without being asked). This level of service and consideration really impressed me.

Overall, I can see why there is such a long line and I'd happily wait in it again.
author: Victor W.

description:
Food: 5/5 - The thin crust pizza is authentic, arguably the best in SF (Tony's Pizza?), yet offers toppings like egg, clam, broccoli raabe, and others that make it unique. Fried pig ears are like fresh pork rinds, with lime and chili oil that give it some zest and spice.

Service: 3/5 - Since it gets busy during prime dinner hours, the service can be slow at times, but still remains friendly.  

Ambiance: 4/5 - Despite being a busy spot, the tables aren't too close/crowded in most cases, and the overall feel is clean and well kept.

Value: 5/5 - With full sized thin crust pizzas at $10-17, this is well worth it as long as you are either willing to wait, take out, or go during an off-peak time. Best shared of course, so that you can try a variety.
author: Kevin T.

description: This review is about the poor customer service of the hostess that worked the lunch time on December 15. I walked in as a single and spoke to the first person that greeted me. I asked if I would be able to order and finish my pizza in 45 minutes since I had a doctor appointment nearby. She said yes and I then asked where I could sit. I mistakenly thought she said anywhere including the booth since there were plenty of other tables or the counter. I placed my coat and umbrella in a booth and went to the restroom. When I returned another woman evidently the hostess said I couldn't sit in the booth which was meant for a larger party. Which makes sense and totally understand. I mentioned to her I thought the person who I spoke with (evidently a waitress) said  I could sit anywhere but I was fine in moving. What got me upset as she was walking away she muttered that the waitress never told me that.  Basically calling me a liar. I know she hadn't asked the waitress. I summoned the waitress and asked if I misheard her. She was courteous and said she didn't offer the booth and was just miscommunication. I told her even though I was in the wrong the hostess didn't need to have a condescending attitude and should learn some customer service skills and tact. I have been to this particular location many times and have always enjoyed their pizza and service.  She said she will mention my feelings to the hostess. Other than that the waitress who did serve me provided excellent service and the pizza was great as usual and served quickly. It's a shame that the first person a customer usually see first is the hostess and that greeting can help or ruin the entire dining experience. I'm writing this Yelp review so that management can read my experience and have a one on one with this particular hostess.
author: Patrick L.

description: Their pizza is SO good. I can't believe I waited this long to try it! I came here with a friend on a Tuesday night, and it was pretty packed, but fortunately didn't have to wait for a table. We decided to order two pizzas after we learned that we couldn't order half of one pizza and half of another so we got the margherita and the prosciutto pie. I personally liked the prosciutto pie a little more because it didn't have tomato sauce and I love arugula and prosciutto, but the margherita was also really good. I recommend both! I love how their crust is thin, but still soft at the same time. It seemed like a lot of food, but we actually probably could have finished it all in one sitting if we didn't stop ourselves. They also have other dishes to choose from and a dessert menu, mostly gelato I think, but we didn't try any. Definitely coming back here to try their other pizzas!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Waited an hour, ready to order.  Ordered 3 pizzas - Margarita, Salsiccia, and the special of the day (Prosciutto and Artichoke), with a side order of their meatballs.

Meatballs were soft and tasty, but a bit too salty for me, not sure if I'll ever order it again.  All the pizzas came hot crispy hot and Margarita was my favorite!  The mozzarella cheese tasted so fresh and definitely was one of the best part of the pizza.  I requested for more basils, but they forgot to put it on the pizza, so they gave us a side of some fresh basils, which I thought was better since I think it taste better with some fresh herbs.  

Salsiccia was tasty, but the third pizza was super bland and no one at the table wanted a second slice.   

Service was great and servers were attentive.  Got a complimentary dessert for our friend's birthday, which was exactly what we needed to end the night.  Can't wait to be back, except for the hour wait, but well worth it!
author: Nancy S.

description: i'll keep this short: wasn't blown away by any of our dishes (Margherita Pizza and Mozzarella to start) BUT our waitress and the rest of the staff were so incredibly sweet and welcoming. you could tell they were excited about sharing their pizzas, and that sort of genuine warmth is truthfully hard to come by. So for that, they got extra points! I'd probably come back here because I know I wouldn't get bad service (which can really break a night!)
author: Asmita J.

description: I continue to frequent this restaurant as I can rely on the excellent food and fantastic service. Most recently, I brought my cousin here during her visit, ordered the meatballs and a margarita pizza. Just fresh food that melts in your mouth. Wine list has unique affordable wines as well.
author: Lisa B.

description: Fantastic! Came all the way from NYC to experience San Francisco food and wine and heard great things about this place and it did not disappoint. Excellent pizza and great little wine selection. Also the hostess/waitress C'assandra was absolutely fabulous and super fun. My two friends and I had a few great laughs with her and she really made our experience great. Overall A+
author: Helena S.

description: Fancy and clean, I had never encountered a place that served the breadsticks like they do. Menu gave good variations and its own uniqueness. Tasted very fresh, I recommend the four cheese
author: Sara T.

description:
After hearing about this legendary pizza place couple of years ago, I have wanted to try this place out since. Well, I got the chance to do that today and although their pizza isn't bad, it certainly doesn't live up to the hype. I've had better pizza at Pizza My Heart for less. They only have one size that you can order here. It's about the size of a large plate. The crust is thin and chewy but the pizza isn't as savory as I expected it to be. I was expecting more fennel in the sausage. I didn't taste it at all. I got the salsiccia pizza for $16.75 plus an extra $6.00 added on to that just for adding speck (smoked prosciutto) on there. I wasn't aware of how much that cost until I saw the bill and one of the employees there pointed that out to me. Wow, even if it was imported, charging $6.00 just to add a few slices of fancy ham to my pizza is a rip off!

And it wasn't even as good as the speck that I've had in Italy! I also got the arancini balls. They're pricey at $1.00 each, and much smaller than they appear in the pics on here. It was just OK. My total came out to be $31.75 (that included a diet coke with free refills) just for me! I sat at the bar since all the booths were taken at that time.The guy who was my server was nice and attentive at first. He asked me if I wanted refills on my diet coke often. Well, I got annoyed near the end since he almost took away the pizza dish before I was done with my last few bites! He didn't even ask me if I was done or apologize for his mistake! I had to put my hand down and push the plate back towards me. Awkward!

Half way into my meal, the place became practically empty. I counted a total of SIX people there including a kid with her mom! So, why were they so eager to get me out of there so fast? It's not as if anyone is waiting for a table! Also, I overheard him talking to someone about leaving in 15 minutes. Apparently he was in a big rush to go home and was afraid that he'd also miss out on his tip if I didn't hurry the hell up! Well, I would've left a better rating for them, a 3.5 instead of a three if I wasn't so rushed! He undid all the good he did by rushing me! I still left him a tip, but it was slightly less than 15%. I guess that he was upset that I only left him $4.00 as I didn't get a thanks for coming or goodbye as I left.
author: Butterfly A.

description: I think that's fine for pizza. I had napoletana plus extra sausage. Did not want to complain, but would like to remind the management of using low sodium recipe for anything that is salt prepared. It is also my learning that not everybody realizes anchovies usually bring way more salt to a dish.
author: Lichen W.

description: Their food is good but is over priced. The prosciutto pizza, a Italian pizza places go to, took minimal effort. The cheese pizza was cooked first, with no sauce, was cooked and cut. Afterwards cold slices of persciutto and arugula were thrown on top. The service was sloppy. They wouldn't seat me because I was waiting on someone and they were "super busy", there was one couple in the restaurant, and general poor attitude. I argued for a seat and finished eating before it looked remotely full.
author: Parker J.

description:
FYI- A16 on Chestnut is better in every possible way,; ambulance service, food, sounds level and I know this, but today, I was an hour and 15 min early for my Doctor's appointment, and I hadn't eaten so I thought I'd try this place again.  After waiting 35 min for my order, and after seeing people who arrived 10 minutes after me receive their orders, I was approached and told that they marked my order "to go" and my pizza had been sitting in a box near the stove so they were remaking it. They said that the manager was coming by and she did, without me asking and said that it was on her because of the mix up. Okay, no worries, things happen, I wasn't mad...then the bill comes for my Brioche with ice cream. Well, I guess that is fair, but what is this? My bill was $8 for a $6 scoop of gelato. What? There was a fee on the bill named coperto. What's that??? I later googled it... It means "bread and cover". It is a fee just to sit in the restaurant. The thing is, there was no bread!!! If they count the skinny stale breadsticks that seems to have been there through who knows how many customers, then maybe there was"bread", but really? Secret surprise fees at the bottom of checks should not be legal, especially if they haven't been articulated ahead of time. Besides, if you comp a meal, comp a meal, don't charge me a service charge when you left me sitting waiting for my meal. 

Btw, I agree with the statements that other reviewers have written about the noise and the fact that suspiciously, 90+ one star reviews are hidden....
author: Robin K.

description:
I wish we didn't wait an hour and a half...

The food & service was great. The server was extremely friendly and upbeat. She recommended the fried asparagus and it was absolutely delicious - we ended up getting 2 orders.

The pizza here is good. My favorite was definitely the Carbonara - there was a fried egg in the middle...HmmmmMmM YUM. We ordered the Prosciutto and Margherita pizza as well and they're both good. The crust is alright, nothing outstanding.
author: Terry C.

description:
Kind of hyped. 

We waited for about an hour and 15 minutes starting at 9:00 PM on a saturday evening. Yes, we came at 9:00 PM and there was still over an hour wait!

I was excited to try with all of the good reviews... and it always seems busy with people standing outside. Figured it should be good.

And it was good, just not a spectacular, "wait-for-an-hour-and-15-minutes-for-an-already-late-dinner" type of good.

Admittedly, I just don't think I'm that into "fancy" pizza. It's just not satisfying in that pizza way. You want that pizza from childhood. The one that's greasy with both tomato sauce and mozzerella on that simple crust - possibly with good old fashion pepperoni. Not that it has to be simple, like I love the crust at Little Star. I guess I like a more down-to-earth pizza. Yeah, I think that's what I'm trying to say.

I'm glad I tried it because all of SF seems to be obsessed with this place. But I think I'll pass on the wait.
author: Bonnie H.

description:
I love this place! 
The best seats are at the chef bar- put your name on the board (they don't take reservations) but tell the hostess that you'll take a bar seat if one opens up. You generally get in much faster and the entertainment is well worth it!
I love watching them create the dishes I am about to enjoy- it adds an element to "going out to dinner".
The pizzas are so good- I've yet to meet a Delfina pie that I didn't like. I usually opt for the special which is always a home run.
The tuna salad is a great starter or you can go with the home made cheese sticks- super cheesy and super tasty.
I have yet to try the Root Beer float for dessert but have been told that its the bomb.
author: Janell D.

description: The service, whether you stay in or take out, is awesome. Great attitudes abound from the hard working staff. They obviously love what they do. The food is amazing and I've never had anything that is less than delicious.
author: Mark D.

description: Piping hot margarita pizza is the best! Fresh fresh fresh. Crust has the perfect chew. Great place to eat by yourself...has counter seating.
author: Pam C.

description:
Came here around 1 pm on a hot day and got table outside- they only have few, as well as public space area right in front of the restaurant where you can sit but of course no service there. 
This place has good unpretentious vibe, hipstery servers are very friendly and attentive. 
We split grilled asparagus for a starter and had tuna conserva salad with beans and arugula and Neapolitan meatballs as our entrees. Everything was pretty enjoyable but nothing over the top. Next time we are def going for pizzas.
author: Liza B.

description: My wife  I came for a late lunch ,the pizza is ok , there is way better Pizza places in the city. My problem with this place was the service , they never Brought my wife her drink and my drink they dropped it off at a different table, we did ask 3 times for my wife drink and the Server said I'll bring it right away but failed to do so. So I don't think we will eat here again because lousy service.
author: Pat C.

description: This place is "First class" their appetizers are "Superb"...Pizzas are probably the best in the city, and the service is Always both courteous and friendly...I'll be going more and more often
author: Tayseer A.

description:
I've been here so many times, mainly due to my friends "on the other side of town" requesting it. I even have a Chicago friend who needs her fix every time Google requests her presence in SF. It's finally time to give my thoughts...

I've never been impressed with the pizza. I just don't get the hype. Specifically because the middle of the pizzas have always seemed to be mushy and wet which makes for terrible leftover pizza. Whatever. I do quite like the side dishes, though! The vegetables and salads are great, though drenched heavily in sauce/oil/what-have-you. The meat balls are INTENSE and worth a try. 

Service is fantastic (service-with-a-smile) and they manage their consistent wait list VERY well.
author: Meredith R.

description:
A place where you can order drinks and enjoy them outside while you wait for your table? Yes please!

Beer - yum
Arancini - cheesy goodness
Pizza - delicious!
Gelato - great way to end the night
Service - excellent

Knocking one star off for the inaccurate estimate for wait time. We were told an hour, it took 2. They made up for it though, and it was a great meal.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Great food, ambiance, & service. Not much selection but it appears to be the style of the place. It's clear that the customers that were dining on the night we were there were regulars. It looks like it is a fun, neighborhood restaurant.

Sausage pizza great as well as the insalata tricolore. Unique flavors!
author: Hector M.

description: The food taste / quality / or anything else about food cannot be explained by the hype this place has going for it. The food was really mediocre for a 1 hour wait. May be its just me but there are so many other places in the city where you get the same kind of margarita pizza. why overpay , overwait here.
author: Y U.

description: When in season (late summer) the cherry tomato pizza is to-die-for. So refreshing and light, yet extremely satisfying. We're new to the neighborhood and this place has already become one of our favorites. Must try if you're ever in Pac Heights.
author: Kirk P.

description: This place never disappoints! I am a vegetarian and I always feel like I have a decent amount of options to choose from in terms of appetizers, salads and pizza. The service here is always courteous; and on very busy evenings, they still maintain quality service ! I highly recommend this place if you're into wood fired pizza and delicious toppings. My personal favorites are the corn, which comes with the most mouth watering butter that you must save for your pizza crust. I also enjoy the panna pizza and I add broccolini on top. Enjoy!
author: Michelle K.

description: The meatballs were fantastic, but I wasn't too impressed with the cherry tomato pizza. It was still a great experience.
author: Bonnie R.

description:
In search of the best pizza in San Francisco, I came to this place with high hopes and left with...well...I left pretty satisfied.

It's not the best pizza I've ever had, but it definitely is good. The location is convenient, clean and service is par. The food tastes good and is fresh out of the oven. I ordered a classic Neapolitan and yes, delish.

The only reason I am not ranking it 5 stars is because I've had better and I'm hoping there's an even better pizza place in SF (similar to Pizzaria Mozza in LA)...and if not, I wouldn't be disappointed because it was pretty good.
author: Julia P.

description:
MmmmmmMMm one of my favorite pizzas! 

I always order the sausage pizza sans onions/red peppers and add HEN OF THE WOODS MUSHROOMS (A MUST HAVE AND NEED FOR CAPITALIZATION) and an egg. The egg makes the pizza! The total comes out to be pretty pricey though for one pizza  because of the add-ons ($24-26), but worth it in my opinion. Feeds 2 people so you're only really spending $12-13 for your meal. :) Food tastes better when you look at the bright side.

And now I'm hungry.
author: Sophia L.

description:
This place had some really good Neapolitan style pizza. When we came, though, the line to get seated was pretty long so we got our pizza to go. If you have a place to sit around I definitely recommend this option instead of eating in the restaurant since the wait time for the pizza was around 15-20 minutes for an order of 4 pies. 

Anyway, my favorite was definitely the funghi! So yummy. If I came back and it was available, I would definitely order that one. The mushrooms were just the right level of funky and salty and the sauce was really light and nice. The classic margherita was also pretty good, with a nice amount of basil. The crust had the nice characteristic char and fluffiness of a Neapolitan pizza. Overall, a really good experience.
author: Becky L.

description: I went there on a Monday evening and it was the only packed place! The pizza is delicious and the ingredients very fresh. The corn on the comb very tasty and the cod bites delicious. I did not really liked the fried peppers. They can improve the customers' accommodation time and maybe the blackboard is not the perfect idea as a lot of people write down their names and do not show up. This causes unnecessary delay.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Warning: this is an incredibly lack-luster Yelp review. I'm just so exhausted lately that all I've been doing is slamming down carbs. 

This the best place in the city to slam down carbs. The dinner I had here with Ginger Broty and El Suz 3 nights ago was beyond amazing.

Every time I eat Deflina its like I remember just how good pizza can be- and I love that its light, fresh, and utterly delicious. 

I used to judge their desserts, but this time my bro ordered the cherry sundae. .... it was phenomenal. Truly amazing. Enough for 3 people.
author: Emily D.

description: Outstanding food. Small place, crowded, noisy - but the the food is worth it.
author: Mark S.

description:
All of the wait staff here is super nice! I love how modern, bright and clean this restaurant is. They offer table seating, booths and outdoor seating as well. As for the food...

Salsiccia: Great sausage pizza with bell peppers, onions and cheese. The crust here is thin where the toppings are, puffy on the edges, and very crunchy.  

Neapolitan Meatballs: 5 meatballs sitting in tomato sauce paired with two crunchy, toasted buttery bread slices. The sauce was delicious and the meatballs were very flavorful and moist. There is this floral note to the meatballs which I can't quite pinpoint but the essence makes the meatballs so unique!

Check out the herbs drying above the wine case too! What I thought was just oregano is actually oregono + thyme + nepitella (herb I've never heard of until my meal here but apparently is a cross between mint and oregano).

I definitely want to come back to try more of their pizzas and their homemade gelato too!
author: Maya S.

description: This place probably doesn't need any more reviews, but I just have to give it the full 5 stars. It's one of the best food values in the entire city. The slight sweetness in their crust makes this one solid pizza. New Yorkers can stop bitchin' about how it's different.. Delfina does pizza right in their own style.
author: Kazu O.

description:
Arrived at 5:45 on a Tuesday night and still a 30 minute wait!! With a small waiting area and heat lamps outside, the wait didn't end up being too bad. Alternatively, they offered to immediately seat anyone in line at the tables outside, but there were no takers. Compared to the Mission location, this one is more inviting and can hold almost twice as many people. 

The food is equally amazing.

Broccoli Di Ciccio 4/5 - I had a slight hesitation with the anchovies and capers, but I rather enjoyed this due to the subtlety of those flavors.

Neapolitan Meatballs In Sugo 5/5 - Amazing! Meatballs are making a comeback! Delicately made to order.

Salsiccia Pizza 5/5 - Possibly the best option for a meat-eater. Everything I want in my pizza (red sauce, sausage, onions, etc)

Funghi Pizza 4/5 - Good but I prefer traditional tomato sauce on my pizza. If this pizza had truffle oil added to it, that might take it over the top.

Unlike all other pizza places, I love how they pay attention to the details. Their parmesan cheese is freshly grated and presented with a sprig of oregano and some crushed red pepper flakes not bottled in a shaker, but on a plate to be shared liberally.
__
March '12 Health Score - 88
author: Dennis L.

description:
It's a great neighborhood gem that's guaranteed crowded almost every night of the week.  We decided to dine here on a Tuesday and there was no line since we came early ~ 6pm.  

It was the first time hubs dined here other then doing take out.  We shared a few things - 1) broccoli - no bueno.  It was served room temp/cold and just not that interesting.  2) Insalata Tricolore - lack of presentation and was just ok, basic greens.  3) Salsiccia pizza (housemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions, mozzarella) with an egg - this was the best dish however our egg came out funny.  The yolk was separated from the white and it was already broken.  What's up with that...Also adding the oregano, pepper flakes, and parma on the pizza make the flavor, and the crust is still good!    

Customer service is good but just disappointed with the food.
author: Meredith K.

description:
Delicious handmade, thin crust pizza with super fresh ingredients! We ordered the margherita  pizza (my favorite) and the proscuitto. both are perfect. not too salty or greasy. The cheese is fresh and not piled on into a thick, rubbery layer. 


There is also a great spicy cauliflower appetizer. I generally hate cauliflower, but this dish actually makes me love it! It's toasted, and I love the burnt edges and spicy bits. It's perfect!

Service is friendly. I appreciate the fact that even though it's super busy, the staff put on a happy face and do what they can to help you. It's a small place, so this isn't great for large parties. However, the ambiance is cute -- there's a great mural of SF on one of the walls that looks like Van Gogh street art. 

Be prepared to wait for your dinner. This place is very popular!
author: Evonne L.

description:
I always drive by this place and it is always crowded. It looks so fun inside from the outside. People look like they are really enjoying themselves So I've wanted to go here for a long long time.  

We were too early for some other eateries along Fillmore and hoped Pizzeria Delfina would be open. It was open and there was no wait at 4 pm. If you do have to wait, there are about five chairs lining the entrance smack dab across from the ever changing chalkboard menu.

Started with their homemade limeade which was refreshing and perked me up after a long day.  

Next, we ordered some appetizers from the chalkboard.  The duck conserva is shredded duck with some extras making it a duck salad and spread onto ovals of crisped bread.  It was different but VERY complex and delicious!  It is garnished with large caper berries with their stems giving some awesomeness to the dish.  The pickly capers were perfect with the duck. The next table all turned their heads to look at our duck appetizers and ordered it after finishing their appetizers.  It does make an impression.

We also ordered the meatballs which were excellent!  The dicey tomato sauce was very good and filling for an appetizer.

The pizza margherita was very good!

By this time, we had too much of the bready things and wished we had ordered a salad or vegetable to balance our choices.

We ended our dinner with a scoop of gelato which was excellent!  Dense cream and intense chocolate flavor. Next time I won't be sharing a scoop but maybe ordering two all for myself. The gelato was memorable for me.

The coffee was excellent.

If I lived in the City, I would be eating here every week.
author: Rebecca B.

description: Cozy space that has the quick service necessary to keep such a popular spot running smoothly!  You definitely come here for the tasty thin crust pizza - the menu isn't the largest but they have daily specials to change things up and plenty of vegetarian (and vegan) options.  They also have a good selection of beer and wine, and there's gelato in case you're in the mood for dessert (as I always am).
author: Jason X.

description:
All I have to say is this is my favorite pizza place of all time. I recommend coming for lunch because you will be standing in the cold for a long time if you try to come here for dinner. Yummy thin crust gourmet pizzas. 

My favorite is the pizza with the sausage. I've had the Margherita too and it's really good but if you like meat look for the sausage one. FYI: The meatballs are a MUST! I also really like the burrata. The last time I was there this couple ordered this fish salad thing.. I can't remember the name of the fish but it was a seasonal item. They ordered it twice so it mush be pretty damn good. I will definitely order that the next time. Delfina has been a new regular spot for me so see you soon!
author: Karen L.

description:
After almost two years of seeing this hot-spot parked near the top of my "must try" list, I seized an early Friday evening window of opportunity to duck in.  Going early, before 6pm, and visiting the California Street location (larger than Mission) proved a winning formula for scoring a table.  By the time our meal hit the table, alas, the blackboard had a long list of names and a crowd of eager, expectant loiterers had gathered on the front sidewalk.

Our pair of appetizers were a celebration of simplicity - a beautiful-to-behold insalata tricolore and a delightfully creamy hand-pulled burrata.  Together they likely had less than 10 ingredients, all phenomenally fresh, robust in flavor and paired to perfect synergy.  The grana padano atop the tricolore, itself mixed gently with lemon vinaigrette, was divine, and the burrata was among the best we've tasted, and we've had it our share of gastro-havens.  The grilled bread with the burrata, with a crisp, fresh-off-the-fire smokiness and a super-soft inside, could produce addiction.

Most of the pizzas sounded tempting, and choosing only one was an arduous process.  Luckily we landed on 4 Formaggi (four cheeses), and somehow every square inch of our pie had a magically-balanced blend of each of the four (mozzarella, fontal (fontina), pecorino, and provolone).   With this rich array of cheeses and the blissfully blistered Neapolitan crust, we had found a few little slices of heaven.
author: Derek W.

description:
So this place has been hot in my sights since I saw it on the 2009 and 2010 7x7 list and I'd been wanting to try it for awhile. My prayers were answered a few weeks ago.

The place opens at 11:30am most days. We were made very aware of this as at 11:15 we asked to sit at the tables in front and were told no, then they closed and locked the front door. Yeesh.

We came back at 11:30 and sat down and were greeted warmly.

We started with the tricolore salad (4/5) and ordered two drinks. The strawberry soda with basil was awesome (5/5). The Allesandro was good as well (4/5).

Despite my desire to order the margherita, we ordered one of the daily specials which was the Purgatorio. If you've never had egg on a pizza, you're basically ruining all future experiences by starting with this. Take Delfina's crispy crust and put a spicy tomato sauce similar to arrabbiata sauce on top. Now add a healthy dose of pecorino romano cheese. Now add two farm fresh eggs with slightly runny yolks.

There is something to be said about the creaminess of a yolk cut by the mild spice of the sauce on top of the crispy crust. I've never really experienced this before but you must try it.

I'd like to come again to try the things that are on the 7x7 list before I give up a 5-star rating. $40+ for pizza and salad is a bit steep, but it was good and pretty much worth it.
author: Dave K.

description: I want to come back to try all of the other options! Plus some of the starters looked delicious! My mom and I shared a pizza and it was definitely enough. The homemade ice cream was a great way to finish!
author: Sarah M.

description:
The price and customer service is worth the wait!!!

Came here on Saturday (8/13) around 6pm for an early dinner before a night out on the town. There were 7 of us, and they said the wait was approximately 45 minutes so we put our name down and went to grab a drink inside somewhere else. We probably ended up waiting a little over an hour, but we knew that there was going to be  wait so we were okay with it. And luckily everyone else you are waiting with is cool about it also, so the atmosphere is still nice.

Once we were seated, the attention given to us by our server and ALL the waitstaff, really, was just amazing. They give you those little thin breadstick things - I don't think we ran out of them once! One of the employees was always bringing more before we even finished what was on the table - definitely a win in ANY book.

We ordered a whole bunch of pizzas - the clam bake, some sausage one, the broccoli raabe, and the margherita. They were all superb. I think the definite winner at the table was the sausage one - everyone just couldn't stop raving about it! The broccoli raabe was definitely super interesting. Usually when they put greens on a pizza you dont get any taste from it, but this definitely tasted "green" - and was a nice break from the heavy toppings we are used to having on pizza. Definitely refreshing. We were talking about it and if you shared the broccoli raabe and the sausage pizzas you would be all set.

I also ordered the tricolore salad. It was nothing special. Not a salad you can really share, even if you are just using it as a small app or a side dish. I wasn't terribly impressed, but everything on the plate was fresh and very tasty.

All in all, I would definitely not hesitate to come back. The prices are fair for the quality of ingredients you are getting, and the serving size is very good.
author: Courtney S.

description:
I'm surprised this ended up on the 7x7 list.  Maybe I'm spoiled by all the good food in the bay area and my expectations for this place is too high.  I've definitely had better pizza than this place.  The way this place was set up was like a little dinner.  Limited seating so I recommend calling in or try to make a reservation. I came here early around 6pm and was able to get seated right away.  

Ordered:

-Tuna Salad ( which was nice and refreshing.  Very light and enough for two)
-Appetizer: fried sweet red peppers ( it was made in a tempura style.  Very sweet and comes with a nice aioli sauce)
-Margarita Pizza ( Thin crust, medium size with 6 slices.  Not bad but nothing super memorable.)

Overall, the experience was just ok.  I'm not dying to come back here anytime soon.
author: Ying F.

description: This was my second time here and I will come back for a third on my next visit to SF. Great pizza, great service, great people, and great beer! Get the salsiccia pizza, def the best on the menu! The cherry Sunday was just okay but I do t like cherries. Gelato is good. Prefer the one on California street.
author: Mike B.

description: As good as it gets for traditional thin crust Italian pizza. Great service too.  And great gelato and espresso for the win.
author: Dustin S.

description: Nice place and good pizza! I ordered a Margharita expecting to take half of it home and of course scarfed the whole thing.
author: Scott H.

description:
Leaning towards a 3.5.  I think Pizzeria Delfina is a solid place but I wouldn't wait in the long line for the pizza. 

Sure, the cheese is delicious but I think I'm more of the classic pepperoni kinda gal.  However when I feel like having a glamorous pizza experience, Delfina will be in the race if there isn't a wait.
author: Nho C.

description: Great meal in a fun neighborhood.
author: Morris R.

description: Long wait because the place is quite small. But the pizza is very good! Had the marguerita and the salsiccia. The gelatto was okay (chocolate and vanilla).
author: Bruna S.

description: Went here for lunch a couple days ago and had a delicious pizza with ricotta cheese and some kind of pulled pork (yes.) Tricolore salad was a little weird, but always good to eat something healthy with something unhealthy.
author: Jared M.

description:
I keep coming back here for the margherita. Best in the city (that I've tried). 

Everything else, meh. The date loved the Salsiccia though...
author: Evelyn C.

description: Some of the best Italian food I have had in a long time. We got a salad, stretched mozzarella to start and both were fabulous. We ordered a pizza with sausage on it and it was so delicious my mouth is watering for it now! This was one of my husband's favorite places when he lived in San Fran for dental school, and I can see why. Will return when I am back in SF!
author: Emily A.

description: The food and service are fantastic and unbelievable. Everything tastes amazing and the people are working there supper friendly. You have to go and experience by yourself
author: Ellie D.

description: We've been to Pizzeria Delphina quite a few times and although I with their daily menu had more pasta, I really can't complain about anything they serve. Their Margherita pizza is excellent, their meatballs are good, and the burrata is always a great addition
author: Matt R.

description:
I'm always intent on trying out the new restaurants that pop up near my workplace so I was pretty excited to have lunch here at Delfina. Now a couple of years ago, I heard this place was one of the top 5 in pizzas in the city. 

WRONG.

Atmosphere is typical of Pacific Heights. Modern swank with that brunch feel and white tables (I think, my memory lapses a lot) with older women who don't work because they don't have to. Oh lucky them. 

Anyways we were seated right away which was surprising because it was packed to the gills. Our server was a little slow and I couldn't decipher if it was because he just was or thought he was hot sh~~. Either way, it annoyed me.

My friend and I share a pie and we choose the proscuitto pie with arugula and some kinda cheese. It arrives and the crust is thin like I prefer but hella hard because they left it in the over too long. What a waste. they did'n't add enough proscuitto, which is, "HELLO?? The point??" so I found myself trying to divvy up the meat on my bites. How sad is that!

Ugh. I was totally turned off, but it didn't stop me from finishing my pizza. Well, how could I not? It had proscuitto on it!
author: Sharon B.

description: They have a nice thin crust and offer a vegan option with broccoli rabe. Would definitely recommend asking for other veggies too if you get a vegan pie. The house made strawberry soda was fairly meh.
author: Josh B.

description:
Must visit for Fillmore district, I go here regularly, as do many locals. 

There is a reason the line is out the door every night, filled with people happily and noisily waiting the full hour or more for a table.  though, time it right and you'll wait 10-15. Or order a glass of wine from the exceptionally friendly staff while you're waiting.

Besides the great Italian wines, I come here for the incredible Neapolitan pizzas - it's top 3 in city (second only to Tony's, IMO). Or, I go for the thoughtfully prepared pasta dinners with super high quality tomatoes, beef, wheat, arugula, cheeses, house-dried herbs.  The beef/pork/veal meatballs - OMG.  Even the crushed red pepper they serve you is homemade and carefully sourced.  The staff seem to work together really well, and are usually pretty up to speed on the menu too. 

I always have an amazing dining experience here, and would take family, friends or business visitors here in a heartbeat.
author: Nick L.

description:
Location/Ambiance: 2 locations - This location popped my brick-oven, thin-crust cherry and I'm pretty sure I had a spiritual awakening here. Open kitchen (I have a thing for open kitchens). Lots of natural lighting keeps the place feeling open although it is a bit small. Simple, modern decor.

Food/Prices: Pizzeria Delfina, you introduced and welcomed me into the world of brick-oven, thin-crust pizza. I vow to stay loyal and I will never forget our first date. Yeah, it just took one date but I'm not easy, cross my heart and hope to die. How lucky am I to have tried Pizzaria Delfina for my first brick-oven experience? Fresh ingredients. "Quality not quantity" is key.The pizza is simply and absolutely amazing. I get tingly inside just thinking about it. They also have other dishes to offer. The Mediterranean muscles with chilies and garlic are a must try! It is served in a cast-iron skillet. Need I say more? I'm going to anyway - perfectly seasoned and spiced. Average priced, worth every penny.

Service: Friendly and attentive.
author: Jessica L.

description: I am not a fan of flat bread pizza. Small portions take out was not enough to get us through watching the Warriors game back at the hotel. Otherwise the food was good, but pricey for the portions.
author: Christopher K.

description:
Best pizzas I've ever had! I enjoyed the Napoletana, Margherita, Clam Pie, and 4 Formaggi. I had anchovies for the first time at Delfina and I was amazed. The capers, olives and tomatoes complimented the fish very well and the peppers gave it a nice flavor; not too spicy but just right. I was so happy that the dairy-free pizza was so tasty; I didn't miss the cheese!

The Clam Pie, Margherita, and 4 Formaggi pizzas were equally as amazing as the Napoletana. The doughs were free, baked to perfection (not too hard, not too soft), and full of flavor. The staff was super nice and accommodating as well. I can't wait to go back once I'm in town!!
author: Tasaday L.

description:
By MILES the best pizza Ive had in the city and probably in the top two all time. This place is fantastic and has a great atmosphere. Its even good for a date because it has a sort of quaint italian feel without being dark or cheesy.

I'm tempted to cross half a star out because sometimes it can be crowded like crazy and you'll have to wait for a table. But I think if you're waiting for up to 20 minutes or so, its worth it.

The gelato is also excellent!
author: Ash S.

description:
If you like thin crispy crust pizza, this is the place for you! Actually, Delfina is the best I've had in the city so far. 

This location is on the casual side & seating is limited, so arrive early. During prime time it gets super crowded & if your whole party isn't there yet, they won't seat you. 

The burrata cheese app is really good. How could you go wrong there?! And the prosciutto pie pizza is to-die-for. I like how they use the raw prosciutto & put it on the pizza AFTER the pizza is cooked. 

I want to try the Mission location - heard it's nicer & the pizzas are even better??
author: Alysha K.

description:
Loved it Loved it! 
I was in town for the weekend and decided to have lunch at Pizzeria Delfina one day (mostly because I was walking around there the night before and had seen the crowd and their amazing-looking pizzas). The place was packed! I was able to get a table after about 10 minutes of waiting. The service was good and fast. Their tricolore  salad was to die for! They got my pizza order wrong, but they were very quick to fix it and bring me the right one and in order to make up for it, they treated me to their amazing chocolate gelato, which I thought was very sweet! They have a 5-STAR customer service. The pizza was delicious too!
author: Sonya M.

description:
I chose Delfina for my staycation lunch, or shall I say it chose me? A friend gave me a gift card, so it was the perfect reason to try it.

Right off the bat, the staff were lovely. Since the weather was nice (and my 2-hour street parking limit was winding down), I asked for my pizza to go. I was told it would take about 15 minutes for my pizza to be done. After about 25, I inquired and saw that it'd been sitting on a shelf. I guess they forgot to convey the message to the front. Without even asking, I was happily surprised when I was handed 3 containers - fresh grated parmesan, dried basil and chili flakes to accessorize my meal. A nice complement.

I drove out to the parking lot overlooking Ocean Beach, the Cliff House and Sutro Baths. I happily dined with pizza on the dash while enjoying the ocean view. It would've been even better if my Napoletana pizza was less salty and I had a giant glass of water. I should've known it might be thirst inducing with its anchovies, capers and olives. The crust was nice, chewy and medium thin. I look forward to choosing a different toppings on my next visit, and perhaps the Amarena Cherry sundae.
author: Cathy K.

description: We ended up waiting for two hours to be seated which is ridiculous. The pizza was good but certainly not worth the wait and they aren't cooked in fire ovens but the taste is great. The burrata appetizer is delicious and the risotto balls are really good but again, I would never wait two hours for this meal, it was nothing extraordinary.
author: Brett D.

description: My 5 star rating has zero to do with the 'hipster' scene. I eat here regularly and it never fails, ever. The salsiccia pizza is amazing with their home cured fennel sausage and the tricolore salad is the perfect addition to create a delicious meal (add red wine to drink!).
author: Melissa B.

description:
Pizzeria Delfina is definitely in my top 3 thin-crust pizza spots in the city.  Came here with a girlfriend on a busy Friday night - expect 2ish hours wait time.  You can put your name in on the chalkboard and come back, they seem to be really fair/honest about the list, which I really appreciate.

We kept it simple with the burrata pizza (it was the special that night, just my luck!) and a salad. We also each had wine (a fly found it's way into my glass, our server happily gave me a free refill).

Food and service was top notch, would happily go back over and over again!
author: Brianna M.

description:
Is it possible that I think I might be addicted to their pizza.  I actually typically not a big pizza fan, but theirs is an exception.   mmm.....Love their wonderful thin crust pizza...I love their pizza dough! So far I've had the Margherita and the clam pizza and they are both delicious.  I had another one that I didn't care for, however that is probably just personal preference.  I still am anxious to try their prosciutto pizza and the meatballs (they just look so good). =)

Although many people have commented on the wait, I never had an unreasonable wait time here.  But like any restaurant it just depends on what time you go, and how busy they are.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Long lines again! (seems to be standard SF feature). Pizza was OK, meatballs were amazing. Cramped space; would prob be better for takeout. They do have outside seating but they are usually taken.
author: Sanjay P.

description:
Came here for lunch the other day and while the food was good, I was a bit turned off by the brusque and haughty attitude I received from the lady manning the front desk.

Prosciutto and arugula pizza - Lots of arugula on this pie. It was almost like eating a separate salad!  But the best part was the crust. Nicely seasoned, crispy and thin. Very good. 

Fries with eyes - Fried smelt was tasty but it was a rather small plate (~10 smelt maybe)

All in all, good food but lost a star due to bad attitude. Don't hate just b/c I'm asian.
author: Stella L.

description: The best pizza in the city! Friendly staff, truly Italian pizza, housemade gelato. Favorites: fresh pulled mozzarella with arugula, margherita pizza, the oregano, and affogato.
author: Sarah V.

description:
Service was very annoying. Waited 45 minutes for my pizza--I think they forgot to put the order in or something, cuz I checked on my order and then it came out 10-15 min later. Also, they were paying more attention to the adjacent table, refilling their water while leaving us parched. Discrimination. 

Pizzas were not amazing. Tastes like CPK.

Going to go back and try the meatballs. But not going to get anything else. Actually the breadsticks are good. And free yay.
author: Juliette W.

description:
I LOVE YOU, Pizzeria Delfina!

They use fresh, high-quality ingredients with none of that greasiness that you often get at other pizza places. The pizzas come out not fully loaded but with enough ingredients that allows you to have an "intimate" party in your mouth, seriously. I love the melted cheese and the perfect combination of ingredients in each bite. I've tried many of their pizzas but I must say that my favorites are definitely the magherita and the prosciutto pie pizzas. Very heavenly! I've been told that it tastes like the real pizzas you get in Italy. 

I love the atmosphere at this place as well. Very clean and organic-looking. You get bread sticks and a plate of Parmesan cheese, chili flakes & herbs at your table.   

BEST thin crust, oven-baked pizzas ever!!!
author: linh d.

description:
I'm not into spicy food. My face turns red and my lips swell. So I was discouraged that the menu was full of items with chili oil and red peppers. Not just because I don't like heat, but it indicates one-dimensional cooking. I was even more discouraged by an exhausting 35 minute wait for two people arriving at 6:55P on a Monday.

The "roasted corn starter" was corn on the cob with a thick, slobberingly-succulent slathering in butter/pork fat. The corn also had chili oil which I didn't like and even worse, the chili oil was not mentioned on the menu. Had I known, I wouldn't have ordered it. The corn was high quality and perfectly cooked.

The thinly sliced eggplant parmesan had more breading than eggplant. The best part was the bright red and simple tomato sauce. The unflattering end result was breading getting soggy in sauce.

They also used the same sauce on the Margherita pizza. Unfortunately, the pizza had a burnt crust (I don't understand why it's become acceptable to burn food) and three small leaves of basil. I ended up using the table condiments to better flavor the pizza which I rarely do at any restaurant. The crust was thin and held up nicely, but lacked flavor.

The fried pig ears had a coating that was greasy and gummy. Thankfully, the chili oil was on the side, as was the lime.

The wines offered were a limited and lowly list of affordable Italian wines. I ordered a bottle of the Ciro rosso classico for $40.

My final point of frustration came with the bill which had a $3 "coperto" surcharge "to support SF employer mandates." Whether it is a valid charge or not, it's distasteful to itemize your employee costs (payroll tax, disability, insurance, health care, etc.) on the bill. I'm just going out to eat - not hiring a contractor to renovate my house and require a line item budget. So if the restaurant owners want to play these games, how about I play a game where I consider the coperto the tip? Let's see a restaurant keep any employees around when that starts to happen on a regular basis.
author: Brian U.

description: There's not much to say about Pizzeria Delfina that hasn't been already said.  The pizza is great, but is it worth waiting over an hour outside for it and then sitting in a loud, raucous, cafeteria-like setting for it?  I'm not sure anything is that good.  I would probably give it four or five stars if it were less popular (quieter and less crowded), but the crowd really turned me off.
author: Nadine F.

description:
I really enjoyed going to Pizzeria Delfina for lunch with my friends. They serve wonderful thin crust pizza. 

The staff is very nice and try to be as attentive as possible. It is a small pizzeria with a big following. 

My two friends and I shared a Margherita pizza which consists of tomato sauce, fior di latte mozzarella and basil. ($12.50) It was delicious. We each got two pieces. I would recommend getting two pizzas if you are hungry. It was just perfect for us because it was more of an afternoon snack. 

For dessert I had the root beer float. It was wonderful and hit the spot after working out in the morning.

I would definitely come back. They seem to have lots of interesting items on their menu
author: Joyce H.

description:
OMG!

This is the BEST Pizza I have ever had, and I am not joking!

I had the Broccoli-Raab Pizza, which is a cream style Broccoli sauce with small Brocoloini on top, and I devoured it!

The crust is PERFECT, the ingregients are SUPERIOR, and the portions just right!

You do have to wait a good 30 minutes or more on certain nights, but I would be willing to wait an hour to get back into this Pizzeria! You can have a beer on the sidewalk why you wait as well.

Their appetizers are insane, and they have many unique signature offerings.

Next time you are in the City, make this a MUST stop when hunger comes a knockin.......
author: Anthony R.

description:
We were the first ones there on Sunday since we had a big group.  Glad to say they open exactly at 11:30am, on the dot!

Since we had a large group, we decided to order a few things off the menu and just share everything.  We were able to try 4 types of their Neapolitan-style pizzas, as well as a few appetizers!

+ Margherita - tomato, fior di latte mozzarella & basil.  Delfina has definitely got margherita right!  Great tomato sauce with a great crust and fresh mozzarella is definitely the way to go!
+ Broccoli Raab - broccoli raab, caciocavallo, mozzarella, olives & hot peppers.  This is definitely a pie that's more for the grown ups.  Brccoli Raab has that distinctive bitter flavor, which I do like a lot.
+ Prosciutto Pie - prosciutto di parma, caciocavallo, mozzarella, panna & arugula.  I was afraid of prosciutto being skimped, like many places, but no worries about that here!  Arugula is loosely topped onto the pie once it is baked.
+ Salsiccia - housemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions & mozzarella.  The housemade sausage is definitely the star.  I can probably just eat the sausage by the spoonful.
+ Chilled Tripe "Tripperia Style" - chilled tripe served with salt & chili oil.  Some people will be turned off by this, but it is a really really refreshing dish.  Squirt some lemon over the tripe and drizzle a bit of the oil, with a dash of the salt, and it's a cool flavorful party going on in your mouth!
+ Mozzarella in Carrozza - super tasty but super oily.  They put a fun spin on a classic Italian dish.  Mozzarella is stuffed inside bread from the famous Acme Bakery, then deep fried in this light tempura batter.  Of course when cheese is friend, it is melted and turns into this orgasmic gooey mess.

Nothing wow-ed me but the pizzas are just solid at Delfina!  I'm a huge fan of margherita pizzas and Delfina has a great one.  I also like how they change the menu up with seasonal ingredients and the appetizers we tried were all tasty.

The restaurant itself is very comfortable too, with lots of day light coming into the restaurant.  It can feel a bit packed since it is a small restaurant!  Our server was great too.  She was very friendly and was very happy to answer any of our questions!  She definitely made the whole experience that much better!
author: Duke C.

description:
The dough used for the pizza is quite nice and seems freshly made, but the topping are rather lacking, both in quantity and in quality. Overall, not very good at all.

On top of it, the restaurant has taken over two or three very badly needed parking spots right in front of it and has converted them into a small park which in practice is used exclusively by customers waiting to get a table at the place. This is outright theft of public space.
author: Rascal M.

description: Very good pizza, and great gelato, what a "healthy" combo.  The 3 of us enjoyed sharing the margherita and the salsiccia pizza which was just the right amount to save room for dessert.  I liked that they had several beers on tap including Death and Taxes :)  The pizza is grand in the neopolitan style with just the right chewy/cruch to the crust and fresh toppings and not over the top cheesey (basically perfect balance).
author: Dan M.

description:
Worst service!
First restaurant in sf discriminate according to your race and color!
Shame
author: Monica B.

description: Love Delfina but wish they took reservations and kept the arancini on the menu permanently. It's my favorite thing ever! Also I'm not wild about their Italian wine selection but gotta love the salads and pizza.
author: Amanda T.

description: Fun! That is how I would describe the vibe here. The food is good - really good without all the bougie pretension that can accompany good food. The freshness of the ingredients is obvious: the tomatoes and the herbs tasted like came right from the garden. If there is one drawback: no cocktail bar and the beer/wine prices are not for the cheap drunk.
author: Robert A.

description:
Lets start by saying Yum!! The pizza here is truly delicious. They make it perfectly and make your taste buds dance for joy! I'm a veggie and went with two big meat eaters, they both went crazy over their eats as did I. Great to come hang out with friends and enjoy a meal. Also they have a really great wine list. 
The service was spectacular!
author: Mike F.

description:
TIP:  walk in and put your name immediately on the CHALK BOARD.  I thought were weren't going to be seated for at least an hour, but it only took 25 minutes!  They turn tables!  

Good points:
- Swiss Chard was not too healthy...but, surprisingly delicious- will order it again!
- WAIT- 25 minutes at 8p.m. on a Friday!  
- ordered two pies- tomato pie- house special and a broccoli rabe pie.  Both were yummo! The broccoli rabe pie was rich and creamy.  The tomato pie was Delicious but a bit water/soggy in the middle.
- good selection of italian wines and beers

not so good
- tables were so close together that the woman squeezing in whipped her muni but on our pizza, then the second time we moved the pizza in and I think her hair or something hit the pizza again!  But that's not Delfina's problem...that woman was a bit cra cra!

Will be back to try more wine and pies
author: Bridget H.

description:
I'm not sure what the hype is about this place...  They do have a unique pizza  menu compared to pizza hut.  

What you really can expect is a long wait to be seated, grouchy servers and mediocre pizza.
author: Moe D.

description:
Came in for lunch and sat at the bar. The staff were very friendly and I appreciated the patience as she answered a million questions. I ordered the tuna with butter beans dish. I loved that it wasn't dry, it wasn't bland and it was the perfect portion. 

Looking forward to trying out other dishes some time in the future. The whole menu was appealing and it was hard to decide.
author: Heather D.

description:
Seriously, there is nothing wrong with this place. Seriously.
Staff is awesome.
Meatballs will change.your.life.
Pizza is great, especially the broccoli rabe pizza; holy Moses on a pizza!
The Cherry/Vanilla/Pistachio sundae is pretty damn great.

My parents, whenever they visit, request Delfina Pizzeria at all times.
author: Matt L.

description:
Come early and grab a seat, because this place definitely gets more and more busy as the night goes on. Me and a couple friends decided to do a girls night, which consisted of shopping and then eating pizza here.

Anyways, the pizza is good, and crisp, and delicious, and everything you can imagine.
author: Jessica H.

description:
It was a beautiful night in the city, so we were able to sit outside (under very warm heat lamps) and enjoy our meal.  We beat the dinner crowd, but since so many people were waiting to eat, I felt like I was on display.  I could tell everyone was jealous of our delish looking dinner: 

Great quality thin crust pizza!  I am always on a quest to find perfect pizza and Delfina was great.  The waitress advised us on getting more than just a pizza to share for two, so we ordered the Saliccia pizza and lasagna.  Wrong choice! The pizza itself was enough, and the lasagna was not very impressive.  In hindsight, a salad would have been better.  There was also Sudwerks on the menu, which I had not seen since my Davis days, so bonus points for Aggie pride!
author: Lyn C.

description:
Holy hell this place is awesome!

Start to finish, Delfina delivers a gourmet pizza experience filled with kick-ass appetizers, hand crafted pies, and punch you in the taste buds-good desserts.  And to top it all off, the trendy / hipster vibe they're aiming for somehow actually works.

Here is my recommendation if you want to indulge in the ideal meal at Delfina:

For an appetizer, whatever their version of a mozzarella stick is, it's a gift from the gods.  They take some of the freshest motz I've ever had, fry the shit out of it, then douse it with some kind of wonder sauce.  For $7, it's perfect for 2, but if you're dining with 3 or 4, it's a perfect treat that everyone at the table can try.  In addition, their special artichoke appetizer was sensational, although I can't remember for the life of me what the hell it was called.

Pizza is obviously what the show is all about at Delfina, and you'd be well advised to try out a couple of their pies while you are there.  The Margarita is the biz, very olive oily taste and the tomato sauce is so fresh you'd think the server picked the tomatoes and made it for you personally.
