After you're done stuffing your face with delicious thin crust pizza, don't be that boner who passes on dessert because you have a pint of Ben and Jerry's sitting in your freezer at home, Delfina's post-meal treats are excellent.  The gelato is oh-so sumptuous, and when you mix it with their fried pizza dough (Zeppole di San Giuseppe), you feel like you won the food lottery as you sit fat and happy trying to figure out how you're going to find the will to stand up and exit the building.

Not the best pizza joint in the world by any means, but as wonderful a food experience as you will find in Pacific Heights.  A must-try!
author: Kyle S.

description:
We came here around 6:30 on a Thursday night and waited about 20 minutes for a table. No other restaurants on Filmore street had a wait, so we figured that this was the best place around, and we were right! We ordered glasses of wine while we waited, which made the time go by. The turnover is really fast and they try to seat people as soon as possible. 
Loved the hole-in-the-wall atmosphere and cozy feel of the restaurant. I wish that they served real bread instead of the breadsticks because we were starving, but I guess that doesn't coincide with authentic Italian cuisine. We ended up having to Google a bunch of words off the menu because we had no idea what the ingredients were. We finally decided on Pecorino Lucano for an appetizer and Salsiccia for our pizza. And YUM did we make great choices! I highly recommend both. The appetizer came with a lot of cheese and it was a great pairing with the fava beans. The pizza was cooked perfectly and had just enough spice. The sausage, bell peppers, and onions were a great flavor combination and I would definitely order it again. Perfect size for two people. The prices here are also reasonable. I didn't find anything to be overly expensive (for SF). 
Next time I want to sit at the chef's bar and try the meatballs, fresh mozzarella, and prosciutto pizza.
author: Alisha K.

description:
Pizza: crust vs. toppings.  While 211 and Forge focus hard on their crust, Delfina goes for toppings.  Not that their crust is bad, at all.  But what makes Delfina's pizza really shine are the interesting combinations of mostly-Italian ingredients with which they make up pizzas; brocolli rabe and quail eggs and truffles and caciocavallo and more.  These combinations vary not just seasonally but daily, so the whole menu is written on a big chalkboard.

Worth multiple visits.  Hard to get into though; expect a wait just about anytime, and a really long wait on weekends.  The California St. one is a bit less mobbed than the one in the Castro, though.
author: Josh B.

description:
My husband and I had a perfectly acceptable dinner last night at Pizzeria Delfina, at least until it came time to order dessert. As they had vanilla ice cream on the dessert menu ($4 per scoop), I asked if they would mind bringing it to me with a drizzle of olive oil and sprinkle of sea salt on top. Our server went to check, then came back to the table and said, "Sorry, the kitchen won't let me do that. We like to be different here, and they think the ice cream/olive oil/salt thing is overplayed." Um, seriously? Just give me the freakin' ice cream/olive oil/sea salt combo - it's not like I asked for something difficult or elaborate! I hate pretentious restaurants. There are plenty of other excellent artisan pizzerias in SF that won't give me this type of attitude.

Also, we prefer the pizza at Delarosa and Zero Zero. The crust on the pizza at Delfina had no chew to it - it was really brittle.

NEXT!
author: Heather T.

description: Fantastic thin crust pizza. Excellent service. We ordered meatballs for the table to share, fantastic!!  I ordered the tricolor salad, and it was very good.
author: Melissa P.

description: I am a frequent visitor to the city and always, always visit this wonderful pizzeria for the panna pizza.  Perfect crust, sauce and cheese. What more can I say? This location is made even better because there is parking close, a definite plus.
author: Shirley R.

description: First time been there, ordered Clam Pie which I never tried. It tasted good. My son suggested we should go there more often. While it's a little pricy to me. Will recommend it to friends.
author: June H.

description: Very solid pizza for SF. Chocolate gelato is really great too.
author: Rohan S.

description:
Amazing pizza! Amazing service! Long wait!

I think that sums it up.

I visited with two friends and showed up around 8pm for dinner on a Tuesday night. We waited about 30 minutes for a table for a party of 3. Luckily, we were able to order a bottle of wine while we were waiting, however, this place is pretty small and seats are only available for diners so there was no place for the bar for us to have our drinks. If you have drinks, you aren't permitted to sit on outdoor public sidewalk area either, so we were in a weird limbo standing in the waiting area drinking our bottle of wine...but whatevs, it was better than nothing.

Eventually, we were seated at the bar which was a great vantage point of the prep area for desserts and all other non-pizza related foods. Immediately, we saw some sundaes being prepared and they looked soooooo good. We knew we had to make room for dessert before even looking at the menus! 

We ordered the proscuitto pizza, sausage pizza and the broccoli rabe pizza. The proscuitto and the sausage were our favorites. I really liked the broccoli rabe pizza but they weren't the top pick for my friends. 

Being a self proclaimed pizza aficionado (like everyone else in NYC says they are!!!!), I was really impressed with this place!!!!! The crusts were cooked perfectly, and even though the sausage pizza was pretty wet, the bottom of the pizza was not overly soggy and did not fall apart. The toppings were really authentic and I'll recommend this place to my friends from NYC visiting SF.

Our server was really helpful and did a great job considering how incredibly busy this place was. He was wiping down the counter as he was clearing our plates and accidentally spilt my friend's glass of red wine over and was insanely apologetic, even though it wasn't a big deal. He offered multiple times to pay for her dry cleaning (she was wearing old jeans and a t-shirt so NDB) and comped us an extra sundae. Another employee, I'm assuming a shift supervisor or manager, came over and also apologized and offered to pay for dry cleaning. The staff were REALLY nice about this incident and I was impressed at how quickly and, above all, professionally they reacted. 

Next our cherry sundaes arrived with fresh whip, cherries and vanilla bean gelato. Awesome!!!! Very tasty...we were planning on sharing just one (and it would have been more than enough after 3 pizzas) but since we got an extra one on the house, we stuffed ourselves silly.

It was a great experience - I'll be back the next time I'm in town! Thanks!
author: M L.

description:
I was craving pizza for a while, and although I went to Mozzeria the week before, the pizza i had there didn't seem like real pizza to me without cheese. I've been wanting to try Pizzeria Delfina for a while but never had the chance.  Came here on a Saturday with a friend and was told the wait was going to be an hour. I just paid for parking too! So walked around the neighborhood but wasn't in the mood to try any other place. Came back and decided to order a pizza to go and eat in the car. 

I originally wanted to order the pigs ears but they were sold out. The lady suggested I order the fries with eyes. For some reason when she was explaining what they were, I kind of zoned out. I assumed it came with fries but I was wrong. It was just deep fried fish. It reminded me of deep fried fish you could find in chinese restaurants in hong kong during dim sum but with aioli sauce. I loved it but the portions were a little small and it was pricey. I also ordered the 4 formaggi pizza which was a little salty. I ended up not eating the crust because this was the chewiest pizza I've ever had. My friend and I both skipped out on eating the crusts because our jaws started hurting from just eating the pizza. 

The place was a little pricey and the food was not worth the hour wait. Luckily I ordered togo and waited 15 minutes. The workers were very friendly and the menu is pretty diverse for a pizzeria. Might come back and order the pigs ears to go next time but don't think I'll be coming back for the pizza.
author: Sean W.

description:
02.25.10

Pizzeria Delfina has been on my list for quite some time.  After dining at Delfina last year, I knew I had to venture over.  I finally got a chance to last night!

The wait in, as other Yelpers have mentioned, ridiculous.  But it moves quicker than you think.  Patience, little grasshoppers.  Unfortunately, my stomach and I did not study that virtue vigorously.  So I made my friend order to go instead.

On the order:
Margherita pizza [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wPJjpOZ0mnsajJLBkWUnwA?select=8PQ9NjsBxr-i7sTSHwoNwQ], $11.50.  Six slices of piping hot cheese, basil and tomato.  I'm not a huge pizza fan, and an even less enthused consumer of pizza crust, but I devoured my half of the pizza in less than 10 minutes, in the car.  That's how good it was.

O.C.T.O.P.U.S. [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wPJjpOZ0mnsajJLBkWUnwA?select=YicIVxriC0_FYBWiqqygOg], $16.  I really didn't think it was just going to be squid, bread and potatoes, but here we are.  Unless you're a giant squid fan, skip this dish.

Props to the servers for staying cool and collected through the dinner rush.  I would have been super frazzled, but that's why you guys are the pros and I'm just tipping you.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Pizza Margherita and Meatballs.

Pizza is great.  It's the thin, Italian kind which is just simple and delectable.  Who says pizza has to be heavy to taste good?  But, here you do have to eat it quite fast because it cools fast and ours got soggy in the middle from the sauce.  The fior di latte mozzarella was so fresh and I loved the fresh ingredients (parmesan, red chili peppers, etc.). on the table too.

Meatballs were a bit on the salty side.  BUT if you can just alternate between eating that and the crust of your pizza, it's quite good.  It comes out REALLY REALLY hot.  Believe me, they did not let it cool a second before they brought it out to us.  You get 5-6 hefty meatballs with a crostini that I'm assuming was baked with it because it was so crispy.  It's perfect for dipping into the sauce which we actually devoured.  

The wait is still ridiculous.  I finished eating and left at around 10 p.m. and there were STILL people waiting.  But it's totally worth it.  I recommend sitting at the bar; there's better lighting and you can get a glimpse of the action from the kitchen.

On a side note, they were playing a lot of Tupac (and similar music) the night I dined here.  They must be going for the urban cool thing with their hip hop music and plaid shirts.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Amazing crust, they have the best pizza crust in the Bay Area.. I tried many places but nothing is as good as Delfina; We love this place, we tried everything on their menu and liked everything.. It is amazing that they don't even have one dish that isn't goo.. Everything at Delfina is good and most dishes are beyond good.. I would have given them 5 stars but had to take few out for the service.. In general they are simply rude, I have been to Delfina at least 30 times and never seen a smiling face.. God forbid if you ask a question about a menu item; you get the "what are you stupid" look from most of them.. As if I am supposed to know everything on the menu..
Whatever service not so great but their pizza is so good that you don't even care ;) that's why we keep going back like crazy..
author: Seda M.

description: If you're going for dinner, on a weekend especially, get there early or expect a wait. The meatballs were...how shall I say it.....off the chain! Great beer choices and the pizza was excellent. But seriously, the meatballs are a must get. It's not to say that the pizza is not great, because it's very good. But I guarantee that if you had to wait a while to get seated, the enjoyment you and your stomach will get from the meatballs will make the wait all seem like a distant memory.
author: Osito S.

description: Usually I do my ratings based on the food, but I had to make an unpleasant exception for this place. I placed my order over the phone and the girl was so nice. When I got in however, this lady made me feel so unwelcomed. She was Caucasian and a lot on the chubby side. I asked if I could have more hot peppers, Parmesan and toppings and she just threw them on my box. How rude. Is this how you treat your first time customers? They fill those containers not even halfway. I ordered two pizzas and this place is really selfish and stingy. I'm definitely sticking to Baretta. Not coming back thanks to you. You ruined the experience for me.
author: Priscilla B.

description:
Experienced Delfina twice now with pleasant reviews. Very thought-out décor, service and pizza was excellent. I love pizza of all kinds, this one isn't my top five but one I will visit again!!.
There is outside seating with plenty to look at, California is a busy street!
author: Quinn S.

description: They will take in walk-ins but all diners must be there in order to be seated. Which I think Is legit given it's a busy restaurant. You need to write your name on the board including the no. of patrons. Waitresses are very friendly. I'd definitely go back as it's close to my place but I prefer the mission place.
author: Bomin K.

description:
The pizza is good, nothing special though. The last time I went there it was not even OK, something smelled weird and  that night my boyfriend and I (we have our own pizza, different toppings) got a very bad stomachache. 

I would say this place is a little bit over rated but I  know it's also the experience; the place itself is nice and the service is good but I don't think I will go back any soon.
author: Erika C.

description: ......Napoletana and Funghi pizzas ordered.....Napoletana was horrendous (think salty ocean water flavored).....Funghi just passable....Way over rated...will never go back....
author: Fred M.

description:
Just a perfect experience all around. I'm saying this after 4-5 visits, as a couple, as a family, and with guests from out of town.

First, the food is incredible. The pizza is just perfect, from the basic Margherita to the more exotic, spicy Napoletano. All of it is good. 

Second, this place is popular and gets crowded, but the staff manages it nicely. We've gone to many places with our two young kids and some popular, crowded SF destinations can treat that as an unwelcome development. Pizzeria Delfina has always risen to the occasion, and I appreciate that very much.
author: Farooq J.

description:
Horrible and painful waitlist "system" (chalk and blackboard): they estimated 20 minutes, and after 45 minutes they brought us 5 bread sticks to kill the wait. So nice of them... not!
The noise level is unacceptable. The food is ok, so if you take it to go, I guess you'll have a relatively good dinner. Relatively, because there are way better pizzerias in town.
author: Peppe R.

description: Nice, crowded, pricey, ok food....nice service. brutal parking often. I liked the Marguerite. good service. more accurate review=3.5 stars
author: Kevin F.

description:
I'm craving pizza right now... And the taste that comes to my mouth is the Margherita from Delfina. If only I wasn't miles away...

For first timers - the wait list is a chalkboard to the immediate left of the front door. CUTE, I love chalkboards. But it kinda feels like elementary school when the teacher puts your name on the board for being bad. Well, I'll be as bad as necessary to get to the top! But the wait was less than expected (~30 min) for a Sunday evening even though it looks like the only packed restaurant on the street.

Outside seating is not that bad - the heaters actually made me kinda hot. 

Margherita Pizza and the Pizza with home made sausage were excellent. Perfect combination of crust, sauce, and fresh ingredients; it was a nice balance, and nothing was overpowered by another flavor.

I guess you pay for what you get, because it came out to ~$20 with tip tax and a glass of wine. Much better spent here than other so called fancy pizza places (AHEM pizzaiolo)!
author: Jen L.

description:
This place blows. 

Don't get me wrong, I love pizza!  And thin crust in my favorite!  But their pizza is just overpriced crust with very minimal toppings.  And the vibe is more pretentious than it is cool.  But there's always at least 30 minute wait so they've got people fooled.  If you want pizza, and especially take out or delivery, do yourself a favor and order from Dino's down the street.
author: Nat H.

description: I'm a purist Neapolitan pizza lover.  This delivered on all levels...big blisters, fresh ingredients, balanced flavors.  The marriage of Amatriciana and pizza is brilliant.  You must have the clam pizza and the meatballs are perfectly executed.   Just wish crust had more flavor.
author: Ross W.

description:
I wish I could give this place 6 stars.

These people know what they are doing.  Great quality, great tasting food just pours out of the kitchen as the queue grows longer and longer of patrons waiting to eat.  

Service was great, pizza was great, wine was great...and it's the same each time I come.
author: Matt V.

description:
This place is good...not amazing. I don't think the long wait is worth it.
Here's my breakdown:
Food - 3.7 stars
Ambiance - 3.7 stars
Servers - 4 stars
Female hostess (on a Wednesday night): 1 star
Honestly my main complaint was the hostess...bad attitude, rude, uninformative.
Otherwise, this place is fine.
author: Adrea F.

description:
OH MY GOSH...SERIOUSLY???? I have waited forever to eat here because the place is always packed at both locations but I never have the patience to wait an hour for the hipsters to clear a table. 

What the heck is the hype for? Maybe I should have tried something other than the pizza.. but its a pizza place right? 

We ordered the Prosciutto Pie and the Broccoli Raab and I couldn't believe how boring and tasteless they were. Wait, I take that back, the Broccoli Raab was so bitter that it made me gag on the first bite. Could not touch that pizza again. The crust is usually one of my favorite things but this was dry, tasteless cardboard. 

The place is cute, ingredients are fresh and service is nice, but really?? $44 for 2 small pizzas? I surely could have made this at home on the cheap (and could have made the same tasteless dough with 3 ingredients tops.)
Maybe I'm just getting tired of paying steep prices for food that is nothing but hipster hype.  

I would say the Yelp reviews for this place are a total FAIL, but obviously my opinion is not the majority here so I guess I'm missing something..........

[????]

If you enjoy thin style pizza but actually want a GOOD pie, go to Caffé BaoNecci in North Beach. (still pricey too, but hey...at least you leave satisfied!)
author: S. M.

description: Ordered the tricolore salad, margarita pizza with Fra'Mani salami and anchovies, the mussels, broccoli raab, and gelato brioche (with vanilla and mint stracciatella). The salad and broccoli were perfectly seasoned. The pizza would have been perfect if we didn't order anchovies for one half. We were anticipating our mother eating more than one slice. Anchovies on pizza = no gracias! Mussels had great flavor; chiles were more on the sweet than spicy side. Ice cream sandwich was perfect; freshly made (no soggy brioche), homemade gelato was delicious (could see flecks of fresh mint leaf in the mint stracciatella). The only complaint I have is our waitress had a little 'tude while we were ordering. Meal gets an A-.
author: Lara H.

description:
Such delicious pizza and great atmosphere! This is our go to pizzeria. Great location friendly service, moderately quick to get into even if  it's packed. This is the place where we take  our pizza loving friends from out of town to give them the impression of "omg were moving to san francisco just  for the pizza". They never disappoint. One thing that wasn't so great was that they couldn't take a reservation.  VERY understandable as it's not a big place and it has so many constant customers ( there's never an empty seat!), the day we needed one we had a group of 12. Its such good pizza we decided to wait. About 25 minutes or so for a space for us all and  they let us order drinks  while we waited so it was a win. They're very accommodating to make you feel comfortable being there, even while you wait. Great friendly attractive staff.

We will and have returned often!
author: Jess H.

description: Gourmet pizza but not so pretentious you roll your eyes. Staff is super laid-back.
author: C. S.

description: Best meatballs, excelent salads, great pizzas ! Very nice place, kids friendly, waiters are super friendly. 100% recommended.
author: Maria P.

description:
pizza was great, but service was spotty 
tl;dr version: you may want to skip this spot if you're within 2 hours of them closing

longer version- I haven't been here in a while and was craving good pizza. and it was damn good. but the service was spotty. we had a trainee who was shadowing a FOH manager - and they were great. but everyone else on staff was just clock-watching and talking to their friends who were waiting up by the registers for them to get off their shifts. they were also most interested in just grabbing their end-of-shift free beer or wine and talking.  I get the free glass thing, but get a glass and sit down at an open table towards the back, stop walking around shouting to your friends. 

they should have been cut earlier and told to clear out or if staying, then perhaps help the manager and trainee who were actually still serving, clearing tables and re-stocking the fridge/stations midway back towards the cooks. 

also, what's up with the waitress with the lulu lemon pants, tank top and beanie? very professional looking attire. put some pants on. 

I'm sure I'll go back, but I'll be sure to go more than 2 hours before closing. Or I'll just get it to go.
author: El T.

description:
Came in on Saturday August 11th, 2012 around 6:30 PM and waited around 15 to 20 minutes for a table for two (2).

After being seated by the staff - we were greeted by a cute eastern European blonde server who immediately offered us a beverage and said she would come back to take our order. I did notice the entire staff was of above average attractiveness.

We ordered the veggies of the day which arrived first followed by the Broccoli Raab pizza at $14.75 with Star Route Farms broccoli raab, caciocavallo, mozzarella, olives, hot peppers and Margherita Pizza for $13 with tomato, fior di latte mozzarella, basil. The pizza's took a little longer than expected to come out, however, it was to be expected with the wait.

Overall the pizza why tasty - in my honest opinion were not worth the hour plus wait that many individuals were waiting by the time i left. Overall, I find the margherita pizza gold standard to be either http://www.viatribunali.net/ or http://www.tonyspizzanapoletana.com/ and I did not find Pizzeria Delfina to be even in the same ballpark.

After dinner we ordered an espresso - where the portion was so tiny when adding sugar the espresso did not sink and actually rose entirely. While I understand the portion sizes for espresso are rather small to start - would there have been a dilemma with filling the cup?

The entire dinner was $51 give or take - and I left a 20% tip to bring the total to nearly $60 for two pizzas, espresso, peroni, and a side of veggies. Personally, I found the service to be average compared to other SF restaurants -  and the food not justifying the wait.
author: Brian D.

description:
Extremely fresh. Kat F offers great advice, however I'm going to put a small twist on it: Arrive, write your name on the chalkboard with the # of people in your party and snag a glass of red at the bar. There are convenient places to sit and wait for your name to be called and you get to enjoy some vino.

Every time I've visited Delfina the appetizers and pizza have always been cooked to perfection. There is an excellent wine selection, and the wait staff is friendly. The only con is that the tables are quite close in the pac heights location. Totally fine if you don't mind hearing other conversations.
author: Jason M.

description: Nice place, great atmosphere and good service. The food is good, not excellent. Please make sure that you make your reservation on time since it's a popular spot!
author: Geert M.

description: Pizzeria Delfina is always busy, but the wait is never long. This is the second time we have been here. My partner had the 4 frommage pizza with anchovies and it was exactly what he was expecting. We started with the meatballs, which are great because they aren't overly seasoned, but definitely flavorful enough. I had the panna pizza, and ate the entire thing myself, except for the few bites from my one year old. The staff is extremely efficient, pleasant and will suggest the proper wine or beer pairing.
author: M Z.

description:
There's a lot of good pizza in this city, but Delfina definitely tops my list. At least in terms of thin crust pizza. Their thin crust pizzas are amazing. This place knows just the right amount of crust to sauce to toppings ratio. The end result: perfection. 

For appetizers, try the Meatballs. They're delicious. My favorite pizza is their famous Prosciutto Pie - it will leave you drooling all over yourself. Use napkins haha. Watch out for the stick-bread they have sitting on the table. Before you know it, you will have engorged yourself with stick bread after stick bread after stick bread. It's surprisingly really good so you continue to eat it while waiting for dishes to come out. With so much goodness on the menu, try to resist have more than 1 or 2 sticks.
author: Kristin H.

description:
Great Pizza, and great ambiance. The only real deal breaker was the music volume: they were blasting 90's throwbacks throughout dinner. We asked for them to turn it down a few times, but the volume just kept going back up. And no, we weren't being difficult, it was really damn loud! the two tables next to us asked them to do the same as well, but the music volume just kept going back up!

Other than that, the service was great, and the food even better. Our waitress was very friendly, and helpful when it came time to pick an appropriate wine pairing. Would go again, but please, keep that music down, you're not a club!
author: Basile S.

description: Yum yum yum yum yum. The food is awesome. Service is too. However, the atmosphere and crowd leave much to be desired. Too many suits for my taste! Why people think it's ok to sit at an 8-top table far beyond having paid the check and there is a line out the door is beyond me, but whatever. Also, not sure what's going on with their music choices but it seems like they are blasting dance music and hip hop to make their customers deliberately uncomfortable. Not cool, considering the high menu prices. I recommend take out for sure and enjoying dinner there during the week, but go early so you don't have to deal with the lines. Cherry pie (seasonal) and broccoli rabe are my favorite!
author: Lauren K.

description: Delfina is my favorite pizza in the city. I love there this location is just steps away from my apartment so I never really have to wait for a seat because I just call it in to-go. My two favorites are the margarita and panna with sausage. The crust is always super thin and perfectly cooked. The sauce on the panna is tomato with a bit of cream, and it is incredible. I generally reserve Delfina for dinner on nights where I had a completely horrible day at work, it is some seriously amazing comfort food. If you are a pizza lover you definitely need to give Delfina a try.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
The music leaves something to be desired, and the decor diner-like and uninspired. The food is damn skippy good and the service is great, so if you close your eyes (and ears!) to the Pac Heights crowd, you'll be fine here versus the Pizzeria Delfina in the Mission. For a more zen dining experience, I'd head for the Mission...

Crispy pig ears were light and NOT really crispy... Insalata tricolore delectable... speck pizza good to the last bite. Lime gelato was smashing -- much more complicated and tasty than the roasted strawberry gelato. Two scoops of gelato for dessert? Win.
author: Angie C.

description: Best to visit as soon as they open = I did not have to wait for a table.  I enjoyed the seasonal, grilled asparagus dish that I enjoyed before my simple yet lovely pizza arrived.  Nice enough wine list, featuring affordable vino.  Service is what it should be, familiar, casual, no fuss.
author: Richard M.

description:
The pizza crust and sauce were good but the broccoli in the pizza was salty. could be a one off mistake.

The dessert was awesome. Wouldn't rule this place out.
author: Jayasimhan M.

description:
Our evening at Delfina was one of the most memorable and enjoyable experiences we have had in San Francisco so far.  We stated with the Tricolor salad and Prosciutto pizza, both delicious. The space is great and unassuming just like the service. Hip, laid back, understated, but still exactly right. The flavors were bright and fresh. And now for the best part... (drum roll)

They serve Cheerwine. Yes NC natives THAT Cheerwine. Plus one million stars. We freaked out and demanded that the server reveal their distributor. 

In short Delfina is worth the hype. It is really truly great. The details are perfect right down to importing regional soda from 3000 miles away. It shows that Delfina cares and so should you. Go early.
author: Kim K.

description:
4.5 stars

Probably one of the best places I've visited for a great dinner with friends. Reasons: great portions for sharing, prices are affordable, and the atmosphere is relaxed and fun.

Well aware of the wait we might have to endure with the 6 people we had in our group, we [smartly] decided to head there a tad earlier (around 715). Surprisingly enough, we found two tables empty and sat ourselves down immediately. Had we waited just another half an hour, that probably wouldn't have been possible. And I'll explain why in a bit.

We started off with a bottle of wine (well priced and delicious!), calamari and marinated artichokes. Needless to say both the appetizers were great. I personally liked the artichokes more, but the grilled calamari had a lot of flavor. Just remember, it's not fried so the texture is chewy. 

We decided to split the following 3 pizzas and it worked out perfectly between 6 people with each getting 3 slices. 
1. Broccoli Raab - Star Route Farms Broccoli raab, caciocavallo, mozzarella, olives, hot peppers
2. Salsiccia - Housemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions, mozzarella
3. Panna - Tomato sauce, cream, basil, shaved parmigiano

My favorite was definitely the Salsiccia. The sausage had a ton of flavor and was cooked to perfection. The panna followed as the large shavings of parmigiano and basil added a ton of flavor. And the broccoli raab was good, though compared to the other two, it was definitely my least favorite.

The table also ended up getting the meatball calzone which for many turned out to be the best thing they had the entire night. Definitely give it a try!

Not yet ready to leave (at this point we'd been there for almost 2 hours...I understand the why the wait is so long now...), we looked at the dessert menu and ordered the fried pizza dough with mascarpone cream and gelato in 4 different flavors (favorites being the thai iced tea and the toasted almond)

And 3 hours later, we walked out as we literally shut down the restaurant. Not once was the wait staff curt with us for that (granted we kept ordering food, but we stuck around after we paid for a good 45 minutes) and was incredibly helpful in deciding what to get as well! I love this place and I hope I never have to wait in line so I can continue enjoying it the way I did. Some of the best pizza I've had in the city, hands down.
author: Aditi R.

description:
This place was slightly above average, at best.

We went with all the recommendations - the meatballs as an App, the panna pizza, prosciutto pie, and fungi special pizza. Everything was average and highly overrated except for maybe the prosciutto pie. It was pretty good, but that maybe bc of my love for proscuitto. 

I love pizza.. all pizza - thin, thick, chicago, new york, gourmet, meaty, veggie, cheese.. everything. I'm not picky. Unfortunately, this place does not live up to the hype. Maybe it's because there is way too much hype, but the bar is set too high and this place can't live up to it. At least in terms of the food. 

The staff DEFINITELY needs work. I live around the corner and it was my first time there. I wasn't sure how the "name on the board" system worked and I could barely get the waitstaff to explain how to put my name down for a table. Multiple waitstaff would walk by, make eye contact, and then look away and walk away. They aren't friendly until you are sitting at your table. Just because you have a line at your door doesn't mean you shouldn't care about customer service.
author: Mina E.

description:
Great pizza's. The Tricolore salad was Delicious, lightly seasoned, enhanced the freshness of the greens-the cheese was perfection. 

Worth the wait. 

Get there early to add your name to the chalk board. 

We ordered 3 pie's. The ingredients sent our taste bubs rolling...the prosciutto, the salsiccia and the special carobonara. 

The neighborhood, one of the best in The City.  SO.. walk around and feel the excitement and the culture, it will add to your night.
author: Nancy M.

description: Great menu, awesome service, and the food is good and inventive. Came on a Saturday afternoon, got a warm welcome, fast seating for my family, and the food just kept rolling in. Everything on the menu is great.
author: Evelyn G.

description: I am in love. The tri-color salad (and the dressing) is divine. The pizza is the best I've had in CA!  Exceptional.
author: Mel M.

description:
Ordered the pizza take-out, so this review is primarily for the Margherita pizza itself.

Came here with high expectations and mouth watering.  Was sorely looking forward to trying the famous Margherita pizza, having seen it on 7x7's top 100 list.  

Gotta say...big letdown.

The restaurant itself seemed a pleasant enough space, and I can see myself returning here to dine in.  The service was average, not exactly friendly, yet prompt.

Now on to the pizza!  I'm a big fan of a good margherita, and I've had some winners.  As mentioned, my engines were revved, looking forward to this one.  Got it to go in-box, with pepper, cheese, and dried basil.   

Opened the box, and...first impression....where the hell is the basil???  There were 2, count 'em, 2 measly pieces of basil cooked onto the pizza.  How would this happen?  Basic food prep tells you to spread the toppings in some semblance of evenness over the pie.  Strike one.

But it smelled so good, so I was looking forward to savoring the wonderful cheese and tomato sauce.  I grab a slice, take a big ole' bite, and....the cheese comes completely off the slice in a single bite, dragged off by my teeth.  This means the cheese is undercooked and hasn't melted enough.  Interesting, considering the outer edges of the crust were blackened.  So the pizza was cooked unevenly.  Strike two.

However, the pizza did still taste pretty darn good, and it was obvious that fresh, quality ingredients were used, saving this poor, deprived, malnourished, underserved pizza from the dreaded single star review.

Perhaps this was an off day, or the wrong location to get Delfina's best pizza, or...perhaps the cooks here are just inconsistent. 

Either way, I'll give the Pizzeria Delfina in the Mission a shot and see if they can serve a better pie.

For now, I walk away still hungry, disappointed, and wondering where my basil is!

Taste: 3.5
Preparation: 1.5
author: Ethan R.

description:
Do you LOVE fresh mozzarella, deliciously simple pizzas with edible soft crust, with indoor and outdoor seating areas? If so, then this is the place for you.

I definitely found a *new favorite* restaurant in my neighborhood. Lunch today was the *perfect* hangover cure. The food, the service...all very delightful.

The three of us started with the fresh mozzarella that came out with a frisee salad and toasted bread--divine. Then, we shared two pizzas--a bit ambitious-- but, we finished every bite. We had the salchiccha (sweet sausage and red bell pepper), and the broccoli rabe (creamier with yummy broccoli topping). 

Get here early or else your name will be chalked on the board and you will be waiting at least 20 mins for a table.

Delightful.
author: Misha F.

description:
I knew I was stepping inside my next best pizza restaurant as soon as the nice and attentive lady working there told me to write our party name and number on a chalkboard. I mean, how cool is that? 

I've been here multiple times now, but there was something so memorable about that first time  coming to Delfina. As I took a bite into my first slice of the Salsiccia pizza, I experienced one of those rare moments where you are 100% certain, that of all the pizzas or other food you have had in your life, this is the best you have ever had. I know that is a pretty big statement to make about a pizza, but I friggin' loved it. Upon second visit, I was afraid it wouldn't be as great or euphoric as the first time, and although it wasn't (you only go to heaven once), it  still remains my favorite pizza in San Francisco.

The service is also fantastic.  This hip and delicious pizza parlor in the Fillmore is one I will continue to frequent with my roommates and bring my friends to from out of town. Great root beer floats too!
author: Lee L.

description:
ohhhh, pizzeria delfina...you're just solid on all counts.

thin crust, wood-fired pizza...can't go wrong.
best meatballs on earth...check.

the only thing that's not the best is the long wait, but hey, it's a sign of success, right?
author: Mandy A.

description: Guiltiest pleasure ever...being vegan, the ONE thing I can't give up is Delfina. I've tried to give it up, and all that happened was I was without Delfina and sad. Once a month, I break vegan and come here and it's kind of like Disneyland magic meets a crack house, meets mother Teresa, all in my mouth. Not to mention the warm and hospitable embrace of Sasha!!! If you're not sure what to get, blindfold yourself, take a swig of beer, and point- cause it's all mouthwatering, delicious, perfect, and amazing !!!
author: Shelly P.

description:
Usually the crust of my pizza goes to my dog. But at Pizzaria Delfina, the chewy smokey, delicious crust is just too good to share. Sorry Simba, but dog biscuits for you today.

I've been out to the one in the Mission dozens of times, but just the thought of trying to find parking near 18th St makes me cringe. I was in the Richmond so I decided to give the Lower Pac Heights location a chance and drive by. 

Rockstar parking right in front of the restaurant? CHECK. A ten minute wait? CHECK. Honestly at this point I was wondering why I keep going to the Mission location (then I remembered that Bi-Rite ice cream and Dolores Park were located half block away).

This was a my first trip to this location and it was considerably bigger inside than the Mission spot. There was a small group of people outside waiting for tables, but nothing unreasonable. And so much less foot traffic than 18th St which makes Simba less nervous.

I decided to be adventurous and get the special on the board, the Baccla pizza: salt cod, potato, panna, tomato, and oregano. Like every thing I've ever had at Delfina or the Pizzaria, the taste was stupendous! I thought the salt cod at first was clam (which I LOVE on pizza). The potato was a fantastic compliment to the salty flavor of the cod. It just worked. A little drizzle of red pepper oil would've made it perfect.
author: Cristofer P.

description:
Very very Italian. Not Italian like from the immigrants of the past (which made delicious red sauce type of foods) but Italian like you'd find in Italy today. The pizza is fabulous, the Margherita of course, my all time favorite, even tough it's not my N1 favorite in SF - sorry Delfina, but your crust is still not "perfectly thin and tasty every time". In fact sometimes the crust is perfect, other times it's a little too thick.
Love the appetizers, the pastas, and the gelato panino: gelato served inside sweet bread, like I did when i was little.
They dry their own oregano and serve it on a little plate at the table as condimets, with some cheese and hot red pepper flakes - it's so nice!
The wine list is also very interesting.
Please go try this place, it's sooooo worth it :-)
I miss you, Pizzeria Delfina!
author: OcchiDiGatto S.

description: I am still "ooing" and "awwing" after my lunch here two hours ago. Wow. So amazingly fresh and great service. We started with the burrrata crostini with arugula app and the fried black eyed peas. The burrrata and arugula was drizzled with a delectable oil and dressing. The black eyed peas - DELISH. They were the perfect amount of crisp and spice combined. For our entree, we ordered the four cheese pizza and the tricolore salad. The salad dressing was a divine lemon vinaigrette. I could order 5 of those salads and eat them all...and I'm a very picky salad eater. It was also topped with fresh cheese. On to the pizza...incredible! It was so crispy and the sauce was so pure and sweet. For the first time, maybe ever, I could legitimately taste four different cheeses. We ate everything. I also must mention that when you order iced tea, they bring you a small personal pitcher. Love this idea. Although we didn't eat dessert this time, we plan to try one of their freshly made gelatos. And when it's not raining outside, we will surely return with our dog and sit outside on their heated patio. I'm ready looking forward to our next outing at Delfina. P.S. I couldn't say more about the entire waitstaff. Everyone was pleasant, friendly, and willing to make recommendations.
author: Kelsey K.

description:
I love the pizza here! A few words of wisdom though:

1. The wait can be long so prepare yourself. Don't show up on a completly empty stomach because you will starve in the meantime. Bring a snack in your purse or man satchel.

2. Parking absolutely sucks! You're lucky if you can find street parking but it is $3.75 per hour so bring lots of change. Parking a few doors down in the California Ave lot is ideal  but waiting around stalking people to see if they will leave their spot can be a pain. If you're meeting people for lunch or dinner I'd recommend carving out at least 15-20 minutes to find a parking spot.

3. Pay in cash! I used my credit card there once and was over-charged. We split the bill in half but I was charged the full amount and the person I was with was charged zero even though both cards were swiped and we both signed the bills. The manager was lovely though and remedied the situation when I called on the phone and was apologetic and profesional. I think they've had issues with staff not processing credit card transactions correctly.

4. Overall, I love Pizzeria Delfina, it's one of my favorite pizza places. I heard they are opening one on Burlingame Ave in the near future?? I'll be happy when and if they do!
author: Ashley F.

description:
Great food and wine line. Awesome pizzas. Wonderful service.

The wait can get long, but it's so worth it. On nice nights, grab a glass of wine or a beer and wait outside. Laid back atmosphere but a great meal. Our server was attentive and awesome. Wish I could remember her name. She brought us tastes of the two bottles of wine we were contemplating and told us to see for ourselves before committing. 

Reasonable prices for a date night too!
author: christine c.

description:
I absolutely love Delfina (both locations) and the food is definitely 5 stars in my book. I always crave their margherita pizza and ensalata tricolore! The margherita is amazingly fresh and I love the simplicity of their milky mozzarella atop the homemade tomato sauce. The ensalata tricolore is radicchio, endive, and arugula topped with a simple lemon dressing and parmigiana reggiano. My friends didn't enjoy the ensalata tricolore as much as I did but I personally loved the bitterness of endive mixed with the nuttiness of arugula. 

The only reason I took a star off is because of the service we received during our recent visit. We ordered the margherita, the ensalata, and meatballs. Usually the meatballs are one of the first things to come out but by the time we finished our pizza and salad, our meatballs still hadn't arrived. I asked our server to check on it and she said they usually take a long time (lies) and were being cooked. 15 minutes later, she came back to say the chefs had forgotten to make them and the meatballs just entered the oven. So she pretty much completely lied to us the first time she "checked". 5 minutes later, meatballs were finally on the table. Mind you, we'd already finished eating the rest of our meal. We also didn't receive a comp or anything for the inconvenience. =/
author: Helen L.

description: so good! I have never waiting in the super long line of peeps waiting to get in. Order ahead and take it home to enjoy in private!
author: Andrew M.

description: The Margherita Pizza and the one with Prosciutto, Arugula, and Egg! So delicious! Although not my #1 Pizza place in SF, it definitely ranks high up there. I think I prefer this place more than the Mission district location for parking, atmosphere, and space.
author: Sandy T.

description: Pricey, limited outdoor seating. Great for dogs. Nice seating on the street to wait for an outside table. Prices are a bit high. Food is great, but I'm not sure I will go back. I enjoyed my lunch but didn't feel it was worth the wait or price. Nice place to try. Give it a chance and see for yourselves.
author: David R.

description:
First time here the other day. First, I'll start off by saying that the pizza is some of the best that I've ever had. We got the Panna with sausage, the cheesy rice balls, Fava beans with aoili,  and ice cream with chocolate sauce.
Pizza: best pizza sauce I've ever had, shredded parm on top was a great touch, and the added sausage tied it all together. 5/5
Rice balls: very tasty little fried balls of cheesiness but a bit overpriced. 4.5/5
Fava beans: very very not good honestly. It was fried Fava beans, which by themselves were okay, but a bit bland. We also had to ask what the sauce was, because we were convinced it was straight up mayo. Not a good combo at all. 1/5
Ice cream: delicious ice cream, with even better chocolate sauce on top. A must have here! 5/5
Service: the service wasn't great at first. We didn't really know what to order or what to do because we are not familiar with Italian dishes and they just kind of stared at us like we were dumb. They came around a bit, but still, it was a little uncomfortable and the waitress did upsell us into 2 apps. 3/5
Overall: Food is what matters and the food was delicious. One of the best pizzas I've had! Try it! 4.5/5
author: Nick K.

description:
I love everything about Pizzeria Delfina - 
You never have to worry about anything you order here as everything is great. Favorite  sit-in thin crust pizza spot in the city, for sure.
author: Ha V.

description: Love this pizzeria, especially the margherita and fennel sausage pies. It's got a cute decor and the service is solid. It's a great spot to catch up with some friends over some carb-y goodness. It's family-friendly as well. It gets pretty packed after 6:30 pm on most nights so go early or be prepared for a wait.
author: Jess L.

description:
Came here for a Sunday late lunch.  Years and years ago when I lived in SF for school I went to the Mission location, but I dont remember getting pizza..  

We ordered their capricciola (sp?) pizza that had prosciutto and artichokes and a cream sauce.  I love that their pizza is thin crust but it still has a great big bready butt to hold on to/eat.  I heart carbs.

We had a salad of arugula and roasted peppers to start, it was tasty but a bit salty.  The pizza came fresh out of the oven .. suuuper tasty.  One was enough for my friend and I to split, though on a good day I prob could've eaten the whole thing myself.. 

The menu changes from day to day, tho there are a few items that are standard and always available.  Salad and pizza came to $30 for two.
author: Alison T.

description:
FOOD:
sausage - mm tasted like maghareta. the melted mazerella so yummy
cheese meatballs - yummy


SERVICE:
good

ATMOSPHERE:
Cute small joint, some outdoor seating if weather permits. Has heat lamps.

7.13
author: Angela L.

description:
DELICIOUS pizza in a trendy small restaurant! 

Came here last weekend (~2pm) and was seated within 10 minutes. The music had a beat and was a little loud for my taste, a little distracting. It was all made up for by the AMAZING pizza! 

Had the tricolor arugla and endive salad (with a really nice subtle lemony dressing) to start. The star was the pizza marhgarita -- flavorful mozzarella, piping hot but didn't burn my mouth, and crust was crispy - you can hold the slice up and everything doesn't slide off. SO tasty. For dessert had passionfruit and TCHO chocolate gelato, the flavor of the chocolate was rich and perfectly done. 

Great service as well. Come in the afternoon if you don't want to wait!
author: Gary S.

description:
Pizzeria Delfina, located in the heart of Pacific Heights, is arguably the best place for a slice I have ever experienced. From the Funghi Misti appetizer on, each meal is amazing. This dish is probably one of the finest starting courses I have ever consumed. Delicately fried Chanterelle, King's, and Oyster mushrooms from local farms are plated and served with a Meyer Lemon Aioli on the side. This is truly a wonderful dish; the perfect opening round. It shows off Pizzeria Delfina's mastery of even the seemingly simple dishes.

But, the pizza has to be the star here. Fresh, traditional ingredients and a perfectly cooked crust highlight each pie. One of the best is the Salsiccia, topped with house made fennel sausage, and mild peppers and onions. The crushed tomato sauce and beautiful Mozzarella cheese does wonders to bring out the other ingredients. Then, there's the crust, a perfectly made boundary within which the other ingredients await your sampling.

Going away from the delicious offerings for a minute, Pizzeria Delfina also has an excellent service staff and a price tag that matches the food being given out. When all is said and done, it is, hands down, the best Italian/Californian pizzeria in the Bay Area.
author: Garrett P.

description:
You MUST try their lightly battered, fried fava beans! They're amazing. And they're seasonal, so if you show up and they have them, order two.

The pizza here is good: it's that crunchy, thin-crust variety that all the cool kids are eating these days. Any of the saussage/meat toppings are delicious. Other than that, it's nothing terribly special. The service is fast and friendly, the restaurant is loud, and there are a lot of hipsters. Last time I was there, I paid about $55 for lunch for two. It's a bit much for me, but I would still go there again.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
3.5 3.5 3.5, why can't we give 3.5 stars?!

I can already feel my hair being ripped off for giving Delfina 3.5 stars..
but truth is, I loved everything about this restaurant except the pizza.
I think the hype was partially to blame, after countless friends asking me
"have you been to Delfina yet???"
And I have a feeling they will be giving me grief for not going to the Mission one.

Pizzas were good quality thin-crust, but not crispy enough
Tomato sauce tasted fresh, but there wasn't enough of it
Prosciutto di Parma was nice, but only 3 slices
Overall they just came a little below expectations :/

On the upside..
Service was excellent! (awesome staff!)
Ambience was hi-casual 
Breadsticks are a cute touch (makes me homesick)

As someone else said.. will come by again if I'm in the area,
but not if I'm sitting home craving pizza.
author: Jade T.

description:
Sorry - I am used to Brooklyn pizza, and while this is a cut above the usual inedible frisbees served up around here, it is no Grimaldi's

I very much object to 10% (MORE THAN THE STATE SALES TAX) being added for health insurance. I do not have coverage myself so if I can go without, so can they. There should be an opt-out for the uninsured not to have to pay this.

However, this did inspire me. Beginning tomorrow I am rolling out Healthy George. This will feature my taking 10% off my rent, taxes, food etc... to keep me well.  I'm sure I won't run into any problems with this seeing that we are so generous these days.
author: George S.

description:
It's about time I write a review for my favorite SF pizza place! I've frequented Pizzeria Delfina since it first opened and I have yet to be disappointed. This place gets 5 stars in my book for the attentive waitstaff, hip vibe, and consistently good thin-crust pizza. Throughout the years, I've tried many pizza joints in the area, yet I still come back for more fresh Delfina-made pizza. The broccoli raab and napoletana pizzas are my two favorites. The ingredients are incredibly fresh and the thin crust is simultaneously crunchy and fluffy. Very similar to the pizza I've had in Naples. 

Bottom line: Be sure to give Pizzeria Delfina a try if you haven't yet. You won't be disappointed by the thin-crust pizza at this hip joint!
author: Angela C.

description: The server was sweet, the patio was nice and heated, but most everything was under seasoned and underwhelming. Pizza is not correct size for price point either. Will probably keep going to paxti's.
author: Kevin J.

description: Long wait, but the food is well worth it!! Great pizza and a good range of entertaining music.
author: Shewit A.

description:
We (my husband and I) came here a couple weeks ago on our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks. 

Honestly- I'm going to give this five stars because I can't think of anything to ding this place on.

After seeing a movie at the Kabuki theatre we walked up Fillmore and came here, maybe around 9pm on a Friday. We didn't wait at all as we chose to sit at the bar. We each got a glass of red wine and shared a pizza. The wine was rather inexpensive, but really good! You could tell the pizza had all fresh ingredients. The waitstaff was great and come to think of it, really nice.
author: Melissa N.

description:
CROWDED! Get there early to put your name on...even early probably won't be early enough. We were quoted 35-45 minutes when we got there at around 530pm. Ok, not a problem because there are tons of bars nearby.

I SWEAR we had ONE drink, but missed our call. We didn't know this but you can order drinks from inside and drink while you wait.  Fortunately, if you re-check in, you can get your place back in line.

I have to preface this by saying I'm not "yay i'm a fan" to all the pizzas we had. 

We ordered the prosciutto pie, margherita , and one that was on special. The prosciutto pie was nothing special. It was some slices of meat thrown on the pizza. In fact, if you took a slice, the meat would be attached and it would leave other slices bare naked. Wasn't too much of a fan.

The special, the one name I can't remember, I am a fan of! It was a red sauce pizza that didn't really have any toppings on it. But the red sauce was soooooooooo tasty and with the thin crust everything was in such balance. so good.
author: Wendy M.

description:
Parked right in front -  SCORE! Walked into Pizzeria Delfina and got a table right away - SCORE!

I don't know why I haven't been back to Pizzeria Delfina for years. I've walked by making mental notes to eat here again, and I always forget about it when I'm thinking about places to go. 

I had the margherita and it was flavored so well. You can totally tell that they use fresh tomato sauce and mozzarella. I love how their pizzas are thin, chewy but also crunchy where it needs to be. They also have chili oil, and if you like spicy pizzas, this is the way to go. 

I won't forget about you next time Pizzeria Delfina!
author: Natalie S.

description:
Somehow have not reviewed yet, but ate here again last just now, so I will finally review.

As the five stars above indicate, great!  In the past there may have been some service issues, etc that would have caused me to drop them from five, but this time was spot-on.  We dined on a salsiccia pizza, tricolor salad, and whole fried sardines, and beer.  

Everything camed out timed right, the waters were full, plates cleared, and the food was perfect.  My GF even let me eat her "burned" bits of crust, which I love.

Nice treat on a nice sunny SF afternoon.
author: Rob B.

description: I find myself here every 2 weeks now, (since July 2013) and I have no regrets or intention to stop coming even though its a 50 minute drive to get some fresh, hot pizza. If this is the closest I'll get to Naples, then its absolutely worth it. Although my wallet says otherwise ;p
author: Angela S.

description:
The last time I was in San Francisco, this place was closed. :(

This time around, I was glad I had the chance to taste the pizza that they served at Pizzeria Delfina.

I must say, this establishment serves some tasty pizza.  My friend and I ordered their "Magic" pizza (which is essentially their Panna pizza with sausage) and their Clam pie.  The Magic was of course.. magical.  The Clam pie was of course.. clammy.. but in a good way.  It was like tasting the goodness of the ocean with every bite.  The crust was thin with a thick doughy edge.  The staff was very helpful and attentive.

Overall wallet damage for 1 coke, 3 beers, small salad, and 2 pizzas came out to roughly $64 (or $32 for each person).  Kinda hefty for lunch, but heck.. I'm on vacation! :)
author: Norm D.

description:
The first time I went to Pizzeria Delfina in the Mission was the first time I ever fell in love with the pizza and a cracked egg on it combo.  

So when I visited their Pac Heights location, I was delighted to see another pizza/egg combo!  Their carbonara pizza with a farm fresh egg is such a treat.  It's salty ... maybe bordering on a little too salty for my taste.  But the dough is always perfect, the toppings carefully picked, and overall a great high quality meal.  Service is nothing to rave about and neither is the ambiance.  This place is really more like an upscale diner.  That's not why you're eating here anyway though!

You can definitely go halvsies on these pizzas if you're not a big eater.  But if you're like me and you love indulging in good food, definitely get your own.  You'll probably end up eating a whole pie by yourself!
author: Jean A.

description:
I had been dying to try this place and its where I ended up on my 30th birthday! Since it fell on a weekday, the revelry was postponed to the weekend. That doesn't mean I can't have some deliciousness to fill the gap tho! 
We started off with house made lemonade that was perfectly refreshing and noshed on the thin crunchy bread sticks. 
When our appetizer came it was a thing of beauty! The beef cheek arancini was bliss in my mouth. Creamy risotto with super tender braised beef cheeks fried to a golden perfection created a decadent morsel that was totally worth the caloric content and $3/ball price tag. 
The Marg pizza was the freshest tastiest pizza I've experienced in a long time. The sauce, crust, basil and cheese was in perfect proportion and brilliantly executed. 
I believe the hype and was glad I could finally check the box!
author: Stacy T.

description:
Hmm... maybe I'm just not into pizza as much as I thought I was. Perhaps Little Star has spoiled me. Pizzeria Delfina is just okay to me. Not buzz-worthy. And DEFINITELY not 1.5 hour wait worthy.

Proscuitto Pie = Meh. Proscuitto was way too salty here. The rest of the pie was boring and tasteless.

Salsiccia = Good taste, but the pizza gets soggy after about 5 minutes. Depends on what you like I guess, but soggy pizza isn't what I'd consider delicious.

Meatballs = Good, but you can't really mess up meatballs.

Fried Pig's Ear = A little too salty, but it was okay.

Pizzeria Delfina is okay -- nothing special whatsoever. I'd prefer Little Star over this any day.
author: Roy C.

description: LEGIT.  The wait can be long here, but once you get seated, the service and food are fantastic.  I have had three different types of pizza here so far over a multiple number of visits, and everything I've had has been great.  You really can't go wrong here no matter what you order.
author: Lindsey O.

description: Four stars, if only because it IS pretty overpriced. Then again, it IS also found in Pac Heights. The wait at 6:45 on a Sunday night for 3 people was almost an hour!!! But we got a nice booth in the back. Ultimately, I think the food made up for it. We got two pizzas: the Proscuitto and the Salsicca. Both were excellent, but I was partial to the Proscuitto with its generous sprinkling of fresh arugula on top. We also got a side of the grilled asparagus, which didn't disappoint. It was generously covered in lardo butter and topped with crispy breadcrumbs and more proscuitto. Yum. I could eat this alone...maybe they can turn it into a pizza? :) We ended with some of their homemade gelato: hazelnut and pistachio hit the spot. I liked the fact that they include whole pistachios and hazelnuts in their ice creams. I would return, but probably with only one other dining companion in order to speed up the wait. Or, maybe I'll just get takeout, which half of the diners seemed to do. I'll definitely keep this place in mind the next time I'm in Pac Heights. The service was friendly and efficient and unobtrusive, just the way I like it. And they didn't pressure us to get out, which I also appreciated.
author: Leslie H.

description: This is one legit pizzeria and restaurant. Some of the best Italian food prepared in the Bay Area. Simple, delicious. Reminded me of some of the better restaurants in Italy. It is hard to imagine that you will be disappointed--but I think they sometimes have an "off" day and the food and/or service can be less than stellar. This place is worth the risk, though. Just good food with quality ingredients.
author: R S.

description: It was good, although it didn't impress.  I belong to pizza club in Washington DC and have spent three adult years living in New York.  I know pizza.  We ordered two pizzas, a salad, and the blood orange soda.  Pizzas were the Napoletana and the Broccoli Raab.  The Napoletana was a little boring... no cheese does that sometimes.. I guess not enough ingredients.  The Broc Raab was great with copious amounts of broccoli on it.  It wasn't over salted, which is often a mistake made in Neapolitan pizzerias.  The blood orange soda was good too, although not as much of a fancy concoction as I might have anticipated from the establishment.
author: Oliver J.

description:
Before we delve into the bounty of Delfina, let me be very clear on one point: You're gonna wait. And it's going to be interminable. The wafting smells of hot bread and garlic and moans of happiness are absolute torture. So grab a book or take some work with you because it's worth stickin' around.

Courtney was the nicest person EVAR and noticed our famished glazed stares. As a total protip, grab a bottle of wine and some bread stick thingies -- they'll stave off the tummy grumbles in a great way. Then just gape at the menu because it's covered in goodness that's nigh impossible to decide between. 

We were seated (finally) at a table and ordered the burrata. It was like someone went to God, asked for a piece of heaven, and then put it on the plate. Creamy, rich, calorie heavy soft cheese. Hell. Yeah.  Then came the pizza pies. And god forbid we should share. Four steaming artisan pizzas found their way onto our tables and our butts. It's all a blur now but the broccoli rab was spicy and a little bitter and like nothing I've had before. You're not going to go wrong with the pepperoni or the cheese or the other hand tossed, perfectly made concoctions. All that and two bottles of wine brought the bill to a $130 tab... but it was money well spent on some of the best pie to grace my lips. 

Dear SF: Someone come up with an app to help avoid line waiting. Puhleeeeeeze.
author: Kelly S.

description: The margarita pizza was perfect - crispy, chewy, tasty crust with a great sauce and cheese.  We also had the special lasagne, and it was excellent. We asked for the kale with no salt (special request), and they were so accommodating... It was fantastic.
author: Jon H.

description: The pizza here is good, and the service is excellent. I am just not so sure that it's good enough to wait in line for. The margherita pizza, the ultimate litmus test, is as good and in my opinion about as good as any other restaurant's version.  One caveat, I didn't get a chance to try their homemade gelato...there's always next time.
author: Taz M.

description:
Yes, believe the hype!

We strolled in here after the Jazz Festival and were happily satisfied! We had the tri-colored salad to start off. So simple yet fresh with vibrant flavors.

The broccoli raab pizza and that thing tasted like it was sent from the heavens. A crisp crust with oozing sauce and cheese.  The flavors were popping aplenty. 

Great service and surprisingly, we didn't have to wait that long. I'll be waiting patiently for them to set one up in the East Bay.

I rank this place on par with Pizzetta 211 which is in my top 3 Bay Area restaurants.
author: Art O.

description:
I found this place on a list entitled "40 Places to Eat in SF before you die", do I assume it cane highly recommended. It was ok, I wasn't wowed. I'm an east coast foodie where the "farm to table" movement is very strong. So I commend Delfina for its efforts. But the food sort of missed the mark: insalata tricolore was too salty. The meatballs were tastey I do admit. And the broccoli rabe pizza was good (though O found the spicey olives far too tangy). 

I wouldn't strongly recommend but I also wouldn't discourage anyone from going.
author: Christina A.

description:
This review is actually for the service at Pizzeria Delfina rather than the food. I have to say the food is consistently very delicious and well executed BUT, and this is a big but, we had a terrible service experience when my boyfriend and I took our two friends for dinner there last night. 

We ordered two pizzas, a salad and a pitcher of beer a few minutes after sitting down. We got our beer about 10 minutes in, and then continued to sit there drinking beer... waiting... waiting. A neighboring table who ordered after us recieves their food. Our waitress comes backs, asks us if we would like another beer and a couple of us say yes. At this point, we are getting very confused about what is taking so long to make a salad.

Also, it's a Monday.

Then, about 30 minutes in, she returns and apologetically tells us she has forgotten to put in our order at all. We are slightly annoyed but figure she is going to put it in "on the fly" and it should be out in a few. About 15 minutes after her update, we receive just our salad. 20 minutes after that, one pizza. ANOTHER, 10-15 minutes, the last pizza. Seriously, you didn't even put a rush on it after forgetting about our food for 30 minutes? It became obvious she didn't talk to a manager about her mistake.

We had originally wanted to get one of Delfina's awesome-looking desserts but decided against it after the outrageous tenure of our dinner and the thought of waiting another 30 minutes for that.
Obviously frustrated when she returned to ask us about the meal, she continued to make small talk and said "thanks for being understanding". We are like OK and continued to be polite, figuring she might take care of something to make up for the 50 minutes it took waiting before we got a pizza. But when we get the check NOTHING, not even a beer is comp'ed. Sorry for your 10% tip but that is not the kind of service I expect at a nice place.
author: Cayla W.

description:
Whenever one of my closest friends and I meet up for dinner to catch up and chat, it can take us a bit to figure out where to eat.  You'd think we'd have a system figured out by now, but after all these years, we still go back and forth quite a bit with suggestions.  So, when we quickly (for us) settled on checking out Delfina in the Mission, it's like it was meant to be.  Well, sorta.  It certainly was meant to be...just not the one in the Mission!

After calling ahead to find out how long the walk-in wait would be, we were glad to find out that it hadn't really changed by the time we had showed up.  A wait time of 20 minutes?  No problem compared to the 90 minutes or so we were told for the Delfina in the Mission.  Plus, it gave us time to browse through the menu and scope what other tables were having for their dinner.  And boy did the food look good!  When it came time to order, we went with the the Salsiccia pizza (housemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions, and mozzarella) and the P.E.I. Mussels.

The pizza is pretty solid - similar to a combination type of pizza with a nice crust.  I wouldn't call it thin since it wasn't exactly brittle and crisp, but it wasn't thick either.  Somewhere between pan and thin, but it was great.  The fennel sausage was the best part of the pizza though, and not just because I love sausage on my pizza.  Delicious flavor with just a touch of kick form the spices.  Not always a fan of bell peppers, but these were okay, which says something for me.  The mussels were pretty solid, but a couple of pieces weren't as flavorful as others.  Not bad overall, but I wish they gave more of that buttery toast for that great wine sauce.  The breadsticks on the table are not bad, but can only hold so much sauce!

One thing that's pretty cool about Delfina is that they offer Dublin Dr. Peppers, which is sorta like saying a Mexican Coke.  Except in this case, it actually tastes better than its famous cousin (I don't get the appeal of Mexican Coke).  Our server was a pretty friendly guy and was nice enough to tell my friend and I to hold off on ordering more than we did.  The ambiance is pretty chill, though it can get pretty loud for conversations...especially if you happen to be sitting near the front by the crowd waiting.  Considering my previous failed attempts to check out Delfina, I'm glad to finally check it off of my "to eat" list.  I thought the food was good overall and that the service was great, though the volume level at times was what made me round it down instead of up.  The best part though is that my friend seemed to enjoy her meal as well, so maybe it'll be easier for us to choose where to eat next time!
author: Mike L.

description: I've been wanting to try this place for quite a while and I was so impressed. We had the wild boar sausage, the salsiccia and the prosciutto pizzas, and the gelato and brioche dessert. Everything was phenomenal and extremely delicious. The sparkling lemonade that they brought was great too. I can't wait to come back again.
author: Sheeva G.

description:
Pretty long wait, even at 3:30pm.  I took that as a good sign.  

Ordered the panna and a special that had green onion, prosciutto, and an egg (what?).  But I gotta say, the egg was a pretty nice touch.

not a whole lot of parking in this area, so be prepared to circle... and circle... and circle... and get really angry.  but, this is the mission, what do you expect? 

service was really great and genuinely nice - i appreciated that.  pizza was delicious.  i also appreciated that.  i appreciated it by taking pictures of the pizza, and also by eating 5 slices.
author: Jessie H.

description:
Breathlessly, I ran up the Lyon Street Steps and, in the process, discovered true poetry. I reached the top and was exhausted in such a way that all my thoughts came out in childlike observations...

Sky. Green grass. Puppy.

It's saying something meaningful in as few words as possible. If you choose the right ones and use them well, you've created art. If you've managed to do this in such a way that steals all logical thought, you've created an experience...

Sound of birds. Eucalyptus. Boats in the distance.

There aren't a lot of ingredients in pizza but so few places manage to make it perfectly. Fortunately, Pizzeria Delfina is one of those places. Here, they expertly create a flavorful thin crust that's all Naples with a bit of NYC. It's rare to eat at a place that's so good you're already thinking about what to order on your next visit. Pizza is their art and they are fine poets for palates...

Basil. Mozzarella di Bufala. Spice.

I had the best time here, in large part due to the company and that it was the start of an incredibly epic night. But, epic night aside, Pizzeria Delfina ranks as one of my new favorite restaurants in the city and I'm really glad it's in my 'hood now. Getting served great pizza by friendly hipsters in a fun environment is win.

Friday evening. Tall glass of Peroni. A close friend.

And I am breathless again...
author: Keane L.

description:
3.5
I had expectations for out of this world....didn't measure up to par.
The fennel pizza was my favorite. I think that the pizza crust was a bit too chewy and burnt for my tastes. I loved the limeade and the breadsticks. Overall, it is a speciality pizza place and the portions are nothing like a regular pizzeria. I would come back again and try the Proscuitto Pie. 
Yes, it is good, don't get me wrong, but its not a place I will come back to for a while.
author: Angela D.

description: I came in thin and left hefty. Courtesy of the four formaggi...if you like cheese and more cheese, then this 'za is for you. It's a blend that no chain can match hehe. Good and filling, but shake shake shake with the pepper flakes makes it better.
author: Derek N.

description:
Sometimes knocks my socks off, sometimes doesn't. This is the perfect place to order several things and share!

The Panna and the Prosciutto Pie are two personal favorites & are always good. The place is busy during your average busy times for lunch & dinner so expect to wait. Ordering for pickup is reliable and the pizzas are always ready reasonably fast.

One of the specials featured right now is the "Capricciosa" (prosciutto cotto, artichoke, mozzarella, panna, nepitella)--It tasted alright, but was sitting in watery sauce. Needless to say, with such thin crust, the pizza got soggy quickly. Not a good way to finish off that super delicious, thin, fresh crust!

Service varies. Sometimes perfect, patient, non-disruptive, and on point; sometimes overly enthusiastic and borderline pushy. Nice (but limited) outside seating.

Still, my favorite pizza place.
author: Briana F.

description:
Pizza with a celebrity sighting 

Let me just get this out of the way right now. The best thin crust pizza in the country is made by Paul Bianco at Pizzeria Bianco in Phoenix, Arizona. Don't even get into an argument with me and tell me that the pizza in NYC is better because it isn't. Bianco is by far, hands down the clear winner. 

Ok, so what's the best thin crust pizza in San Francisco? The jury is still out, but Pizzeria Delfina is making a strong case that they could be the one. 

Three of us walked in right at 6:15 and were immediately seated next to the window. What a score because just a few minutes later there was a wait out the door. Our waitress waled right over and took our drink orders and even made an excellent wine suggestion. She sure knew her Italian wine! 

There were three of us, so of course we had to order three pies. Which here as follows. 

Margherita 
Tomato, fior di latte mozzarella, basil 1 w/ Bubalis Mozzarella di Bufala 

Prosciutto Pie 
Prosciutto di Parma, mozzarella di bufala, panna, arugula 

Salsiccia 
Housemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions and mozzarella 

All three were excellent and were enjoyed by all at the table. I did have a ranking in what I preferred. The Salsiccia in my opinion was the most exciting, but may be a little too spicy for some. The Margherita was my second choice, but probably needed a little more fresh basil. The Prosciutto Pie provided a nice change up as the sauce was more of a cream and not tomato based. 

As I mentioned before, the service was excellent and never once did we feel neglected. As for the star sighting, I am not 100 percent certain but I believe I saw Rex Walters sitting outside. Bonus points if you know who that is.

1 solid 3 3/4 stars.
author: Rene C.

description:
I've been here several times, and while it can be so crowded that a seat outside is the only way to peacefully enjoy the pizza, I go back for the italian sodas and delectable apps from time to time. I thought that I had come up with the perfect solution - ordering it to go - so my husband and I called, ordered our favorite pies and specifically asked for them to not be burnt. This place has a weird habit of ALWAYS BURNING THE CRUSTS. REALLY BADLY. Since I really don't care for my pizza crust to be black and crispy in spots, I was excited to go pick up the pizzas until we got there, opened the boxes to check, and they were totally burnt!! My husband pointed it out, and the cashier informed us that was their METHOD! HUH?? Then, she said she'd be happy to do them over without burnt crusts...as if that wasn't what we had very clearly asked for in the first place. 

News flash guys: BURNED CRUSTS ARE CARCINOGENIC AND TASTE REALLY BAD. Not a good way to bake pizza by any means.

Oh, and WTF is up with having ONE bottle of olive oil to use? 

I won't be back. And recommend you don't order pizza here unless YOU REALLY LOVE BURNED CRUSTS.
author: Katie D.

description: Delicious pizza! Ordered the sausage pizza and meatball dish to share. The marinara sauce might be the best I've ever had. Would drink it if I could! Friendly staff too :) cute neighborhood.
author: Robin S.

description: Just moved into this neighborhood and wanted to check what the hype was all about.  Or at least see why folks would stand in line FOREVER for.  After a bit of a wait, the boyfriend and I got in.  The Margherita pizza was divine.  I feel like you can never go wrong with this anywhere.  Service seemed a bit rushed, as folks wanted to turn their tables around to accommodate the growing line outside.  A bit on the pricier side for pizza.  We would come back, pending the lines.....
author: Tracy C.

description:
It was ok... We ordered the 4 Formaggi.  Nothing outstanding.  Thin crust with 4 cheeses that really didn't have much flavor.  Sorry.

We also got the Prosciutto Pie.  Also nothing special.  Thin crust with mozzarella, Prosciutto and arugula.

I know people love this place, but it just wasn't our cup of tea.  

The restaurant next door was packed.  Maybe we'll try that next time.
author: Denise M.

description:
