Some of the best restaurants I have eaten at did not take reservations, so I wasn't bent out of shape. thought the idea of writing your name on the chockboard was really cute. We ordered wine, salad, meatballs and the 4 cheese pizza (shared).. Plenty of food for two people! 

The service was also spectacular- waitress brushed up against my date with a plate of food, she immediately and personally cleaned it off. I thought it was great. haha. but in all honestly the service was wonderful. everyone there was very friendly.
author: Denniz M.

description:
We went here for lunch on a Saturday. Be prepared to wait a bit. There isn't a ton of seating so it gets crowded.

We got the Napoletana and the Panna pies. Yum and yum! They also had a special appetizer of fried spring onions and it was great.

Our server was so friendly and checked on us to make sure we were ok.

For dessert, we had the zeppole, which wasn't what I expected. It was more like funnel cake. I don't know if I would recommend it (it depends on your preconceived notions of a zeppole). We also had the affogato, which was a great pick-me-up at the end of the meal.

This place is great!
author: Julia L.

description: This place is in my sons neighborhood and the pizza was so good, I'd want to stop and enjoy its pies every time I visit.
author: Rick S.

description:
First time to ever had warm olives! Little salty but definitely uniquely delicious!
Small, quaint place and great friendly service! Chef was nice enough to make arugula only salad - he added shaved cheese (forgot the name of the cheese), which was elegantly tasty in it's simplicity.
Definitely a worthwhile.
author: MeeSun B.

description: I really love this place for a thin crust pizza.  The 4-Formaggi is my fav :) and they are always nice :)
author: Jason S.

description:
Pizzeria Delfina is yet another restaurant that shows that, contrary to popular understanding, SF is a good-pizza city. 

The specialty here is thin crust pizza, and they do an excellent job. The crust is light and airy and the toppings are fresh and tasty. For instance, the Hand-Stretched Mozzarella is extremely fresh. The server explained that the cheese is made in-house, and you can definitely taste this in the quality. I enjoyed this appetizer, but I wish it was served with more crostini. 

The pizzas are small, but large enough for two moderately hungry people if you eat the crust and order an appetizer. I went last night with a bunch of friends. I think there were 12 of us total and I saw a lot of leftover crust. I ate my crust, but the majority of my friends opted out of crust eating. I think this happens often. Perhaps Delfina should consider extending the toppings to the very edge of the pizza. This would prevent future generations of crust waste. Just a suggestion. 

Delfina's pizzas are on the gourmet end of the pizza spectrum. It's not greasy-lets-have-a-few-pitchers-and-some-meaty-saucy-pizza pizza. It's more delicate than that. I will go back to Delfina, but I will need to be in the mood for that kind of pizza.
author: Tash T.

description: One of the best margherita pizzas I have ever eaten! ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! (Word of caution to any out-of-towners like me: If you find yourself parking on a hill, make sure you remember how to position those wheels when parking!)
author: Jeff M.

description:
PROs:
+Delicious pizza!
+Good potions.
+Stone IPA... Mmmmm.

CONs:
-Tiny restaurant.
-Waiting for a table.
-Loud.
author: Dalton C.

description: Wow! We were very happy with our experience at Pizzeria Delfina. Early seating on a Friday evening with my wife and son. Ordered warm olives, burrata and a margherita pizza. Everything was excellent. Ended up ordering a prosciutto pie to go. Service was outstanding, ambiance was very nice, couldn't have asked for more.
author: Sean C.

description: Can't believe I haven't written a review just yet. Pizzeria Delfina is my backup pizza joint. There is almost always a wait but you can drink while you wait. :) What makes this place so special you ask? The menu! Where else can you order pig ears with chili lime oil? You're probably asking why the hell would anyone wanna eat their dog's treat? This is not that nasty treat your dog has been gumming to death. It's a deliciously crispy piece of pork served with kick ass oil. Just try it, I promise it won't disappoint. Alright, enough about the pig ears - the pizza here is also some of the best in the city in my humble opinion.
author: Leanne S.

description: I would give a zero if that were an option. I had my sister and my best friend in town and wanted them to share my first delfina experience with me. We waited for about 40 minutes when others ahead of us and below our names got seated. We were giving up on being seated when one of the staff came to us and said that there are a couple of tables that'll be opening up soon. I asked him how long roughly and he kindly responded "well one table just paid, and ummm there are 4 chairs at the bar." I responded that we wanted a table and he said it would be a wait. Since we were starving we decided to leave and I smiled and said thank you "we are going to leave." He then responded with hella attitude saying he is giving us options and trying to help...blah blah I looked at him and said thank you fine we will stay but I was thrown off by his attitude and tone of voice. Didn't want spit or anything in my food so we decided to leave. It was mostly his stank attitude and tone of voice accompanied with my hunger that caused us to leave. I will honestly never come to eat here but I will probably continue to order to-go or just not do that at all. It's honestly a great place with okay food but customer service by this dude tonight...stank! Customer service is everything.
author: leba g.

description:
What could I say that hasn't already been said? The pizza here is delicious -- very fresh tasting, with quality ingredients. The wait staff is very efficient and I do appreciate that the hosts try to make waiting as painless as possible (although be prepared for an extremely long wait). 

Incredible pizza. In my top five in the Bay Area.
author: Jovi C.

description:
Spartan. That's the word that comes to mind when I think of the pizza at Pizzeria Delfina. I really liked the thin crust but there just wasn't enough cheese or sauce on the pie. 

Nice staff, great service but the pizza left me wanting, especially since I'd heard so many good things about it prior to going.
author: Dylan S.

description: The waitresses were not dressed appropriately at all. If I would be the owner I would ask them to at least wear a shirt instead of a tank top. It felt extremly unhygienic. The prosciutto pizza was good but a little oily. It's a good place if you want to grab a pizza during the day. The wine was pretty expensive for a place like this. The atmosphere is not that inviting during the evening. Tables and place in general rather small. Friendly staff.
author: Chris S.

description:
I've been to Pizzeria Delfina three times now. I live a few blocks away and its delicious. Great place to bring friends, your significant other, a casual date, dinner with a parent or relative, its just awesome for so many occasions. Price-wise its pretty average. You can get a great meal for under $40 including a couple glasses of wine or beers. It's a bit loud but a fun vibe and I love that they make their own ice cream!! What a treat. 

My suggestions for dinner are the Pizza Napoletana, the Meatballs, the Collard Greens, Fried Asparagus or Fried Mozzerella, and the Ice Cream. 

There is always a wait (up to an hour) but you can drink while you wait ad it can be cramped inside but they have heaters on the outside and it's sortof nice to work up an appetite. Don't come here if you're starving because it'll be a while until you eat. It's for a more social occasion. 

I've never ordered take-out but thats something I have seen people do often. Great pizzas and salads and better quality than Dinos or Amicis, etc that deliver in the area. 

Parking on California Street at night isn't too bad and there is a small, inexpensive outdoor garage across the street from Mollie Stone's that really close to the restaurant. 

I've been to Delfiina, the more upscale restaurant managed by the same people in the Mission. Pizzeria Delfina is MUCH better and less expensive. It's great if you're craving some gourmet pizzas or if you just want some casual Italian fare. I prefer this place to A16 or other similar Italian locations. Next time I am going to try a pasta dish!
author: Pilar P.

description:
On my search for best pizzas in SF this goes on my top list.  Slightly bigger location than its mission version, they have great thin crust pizza with fresh ingredients and interesting topping choices. My favorite? The pizza with egg on it.... purgatorio, usually available upon request if its not on the menu.  

There's typically a long wait at the door but always a fun choice for when you're shopping or walking around the neighborhood.  The tripe appetizer with lemon, chives, and oil is a fresh twist on the otherwise unappealing and chewy piece of whatever part it comes out of a cow. They also have a great ginger ale to washdown the pizza. The portions are not huge, so sometimes worth getting more than one to share. 

Worth the visit, but if you're in the mission also more fun to go to the original.  Only annoying thing can be waiting for seats. Service is good.
author: SF Diner A.

description:
Takeout has taken on a whole new meaning in my new 'hood.  So excited that I can walk to Pizzeria Delfina and get some delicious pizza!  To start, I had the insalata tricolore, which was pretty refreshing.  A couple of slices of the 4 Formaggio hit the spot.  I think the pizza was hot and fresh when I picked it up, but since my long lost roommate and I had to do some major catching up on the phone, by the time I was ready to eat the pizza, it had cooled off; putting it in the oven didn't fully revive it, but I could tell that it was still better than the crappy places I had gotten pizza from in the rest of the city.

One added bonus---I get to pass by Pets Unlimited on my way there, and was lucky enough to make friends with a cute little dog!
author: Danielle B.

description:
The good news: it's open to the public, as of tonight!  And, I can't be sure, but I think I saw an application for outdoor seating on the window.

The great news: it's amazingly tasty.  We arrived around 6:15, apparently just ahead of the rush.  After a short wait, we were seated at the counter.  That was an experience -- the entire kitchen is open, so it was interesting and educational to watch the workings of every order that came through.  (It also gave us the opportunity to ogle the assorted desserts being prepped in front of our hungry maws.  Yow.)

Service was a bit crazy, as I'm sure you'd expect on a busy opening night, but we didn't have to wait long.  Our drink order was taken immediately and service was attentive, if not doting, throughout the 3-course meal.  

All I can say is that the pizza is authentic and mouth-watering, with a thin yet crispy crust, succulent sauce and a mouth-warming smattering of fresh mozarella.  We were so convinced that, following the meal, we immediately order a salciccia (homemade sausage) pizza to go.

A nightly special was the roasted brick-flattened half chicken.  The brick helps essentially form a crust of crispy skin on the bird, which retains a very juicy, soft interior.  It was perfect.  My only demand would be to accompany it with a starch.

Breaking down the order:

TO START:
Insalata Tricolore
Numerous breadsticks
Beer (x2 or 3)
Lemonade (freshly squeezed)

THE MAIN DISH:
Pizza Margherita
Roasted Brick-Flattened 1/2 Chicken

DESSERT:
Affogato
PIzza Salsiccia (to go!)

Get out there and do it.  You won't be sorry.
author: Rob W.

description: This place is always crazy packed and for good reason.. the pizza here is something you would get straight out of a good pizzeria in Italy. The crust is always perfect.. thin and slightly burnt. I had the funghi special and it had such a great earthy mushroomy taste that I almost jizzed my pants. We also got the margherita and I have to say that I didn't like the way they made it. It barely had any basil on it and the tomato sauce tasted like chef boyardee. The funghi pizza made up for that misstep though!
author: Henry W.

description: Absolutely love this place! Everything is delicious, and I really enjoy the ambiance of the Pac Heights location. It would be very difficult to be disappointed by Delfina.
author: Bridget B.

description:
I got a message from a student of UCB Grad School of Journalism wanted interview me because my Yelp reviews.
She wanted to know my opinion of the health cord number and the Government try to get rid of the whole inspections because the budget cuts.

So, we met-up at Pizzeria Delfina for lunch.

My GF and I got there early to get a table for 3.
It was busy as usual, about 20 minutes for waiting.
The girl came.
Introduced my GF and I because she is the person who check my spelling in my reviews.

We ordered,
Tricolore, $8.50
Meatballs, $13.25
Chicken Diavolo, $15 

The girl was a cute, polite came with a digital recorder with headphones and a microphone.
And she started to record surrounding noises in the place.
So, I asked, " Why are you doing?"
She said, "Oh, I think it's good idea to do it because people can tell where we were."
My GF and I were like, " ?".
She said, " You know, radio show needs sound of location."
My GF and I were like, " !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! ".

She is a reporter of 91.7 FM radio.
Interviewing me and my GF, Live. Our voice will be on the radio show.

In the interview, she asked why I like the place and do we know the health cord number.
The number here is 96.
Very clean place.
But I stressed more about that the people who work here. 
They seem always happy.
I told her that I really like sitting by the counter watching chefs making food and waitresses here are all really nice.
I call people here are all professionals.

The TV add of California Cheese is true though, 
"A good cheese come from a happy cow."
"A good food come from a happy people"

People, listen to 91.7 FM, on September 10.
My voice might be on air.

SORRY FOR CONFUSION!!!
It won't be September 10.

yota L. messaged me and said,
"Hi, Nobusan,

http://www.publicbroad...

Which one did the interview with you? 
I'd really love to listen, but I can't pay attention to the radio all day. Will you give me a hint? thanks ".

I just talk to the interviewer and she told me that today is her dead line and they edited for next week.
I didn't know that.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Quite possibly one of the best margherita pizzas I've had. The cheese is fresh, the tomato sauce has a robust, sweet flavor, and the dough is just the right texture.

Their other pizzas (I've also had the speck pie and the salsiccia) aren't bad, either.  But, to get the best pizza in the house, definitely get the margherita.  The other ones I tried were delicious, but just not as awesome as the classic combo of cheese, sauce, and basil that they serve up.

Service is ok, but it's definitely a busy place with a little bit of a wait, especially on the weekends.  It's better for smaller groups than larger ones.

My only gripe is the cost of their non-alcoholic beverages.  Delfina, do you REALLY need to charge 3+ bucks for a soda???

They also serve salads, side dishes, and gelato.  I have yet to have their ice cream, as I always stuff myself full of pizza.  'Nuff said?
author: Nina B.

description: Poor service. They won't let us get seated first when tables were available but nut everyone here. Knowing we have a kid and we could order for the group, why not let people sit first and let the kids eat? I already hate it here and won't ever come back.
author: Alan T.

description:
This is one of thoes places I'd give six stars if I could.

I love to sit at the counter and watch the chefs cut, chop, peel, prepare, and create.  Going with a group is preferable, because I like to try as many different kinds of pizza as possible, but I have no problem fying solo and eating a pizza all to myself.

The crust here is absolutely divine.  Normally I throw crust away, either because it's awful or not good enough to justify the calories.  Not here, my friends!  The outside of the crust has the perfect amount of light crispiness and the inside is soft, flavorful (yes, the *crust*), and the perfect texture of chewiness.  I don't even feel like I need to address the toppings: fresh ingredients, perfect sauce, and original combinations.  However, I strongly encourage you to try the seasonal salads and antipasti.

I rarely walk through Pac Heights without making a pilgriamage to Pizzeria Delfina.  If you haven't already, please please go.
author: Mark J.

description: This place is very busy, even on a Sunday night! We were able to get in at the bar. I got a glass of red wine (I can't remember the exact one, but my waiter recommended it as being the most like a pinot noir) and my friend got a prickly pear drink that was delicious. We ordered the marinated beets and a salad to start. The beets were delicious and the salad was yummy too. We ordered the pizza that was on special and it was great. That amount of food was the perfect amount for both of us. Although, we saw the zeppole de san guiseppi dessert go out to another table and were drooling just looking at it, we were completely full and satisfied with our meal.
author: Alycia N.

description: A great neighborhood pizza spot with a bright fresh interior and tempting menu items. Today's special pizza "Purgatorio" was one of the best pizzas I've ever had: spicy chilli oil tomato sauce, parm. remano and two eggs. Wow. I can only hope this becomes a permanent fixture on the menu. The tricolore salad is a great way to start your meal. The fried pigs ears are also suprisingly better than just an experience to say that you've eaten, well, a pig's ear. The lime and salt, the chewy yet crunchy texture, and the chili oil's subtle heat make this dish a unique one you shouldn't pass up.
author: Jacqueline S.

description:
I was all set to try out spqr, which I of course pronounce as a two syllable word, not a series of letters. However, they were closed for renovations. Luckily enough, Pizzeria Delfina was right around the corner.

We put our names down and were second or third in line for a table. It came as a shock when about 5 other names were called before us - the hostess flubbed, which didn't impress me one bit. But, in the end it's OK. We were seated soon enough and that experience made up for the unfortunate front of house experience.

Deciding on wine would have been tricky, were it not for the Illuminati Montepulciano d'Abruzzo on the menu, which called out to me - and turned out to be rather tasty. 

Once the wine was decided on, we ordered a fritte  and a salad. The arancini - saffron flavored balls of cheese and risotto were fried deliciousness. And a tasty heirloom tomato salad - it's tomato season, and these tomatoes lived it up.

I wish I remembered more details on the pizza we ordered - it was a special and it was good, and that's about all I can say. The crust was warm, slightly crispy, slightly chewy, and tasty dipped in a bit of extra olive oil (do ask for this!). 

For dessert we had the fried dough, which was light and crispy, and served with a marscapone pastry cream sauce which was a nice cooil counterpoint to the hot dough.

So, despite the rather unhappy start to the night, I was pleased with the overall experience and will go back (or order to go!)
author: neil c.

description:
The pizza here is most excellent....

If you don't like it, blame your malfunctioning taste buds.
author: Dennis A.

description:
i've always like the food here... to the point that i invite friends, co worker, and clients here..

yesterday... i sent my assistant in the morning to buy $300 worth of gift cards... she comes back kind of nervous telling me that she walked in.... there were people there... she stood at the counter for quite some time finally someone says to her:

"you shouldn't be here, you need to get out," my assistant says... "but all i need is to buy some gift cards," person says... "you need to come back later,,,"

from my assistant experience, the person talking to her was rude... i feel like they could've been more accommodating... too bad... guess i wont be buying gift cards here...
author: Cisco M.

description:
It's hard to commit to which place is my favorite place for artisan pizza in SF- Delfina's or Pizetta 211.  They are both outstanding and, in my opinion, in a league of their own, making a serious case to the timeless debate of what makes the perfect pizza.

The pizza here gets high marks on everything- super-fresh ingredients, mostly everything made from scratched, cooked perfectly in the right ovens, perfectly crisped crust, and a delicate balance between sauce, cheese, and toppings.  They've honored the classics, but also offer some bold, creative choices as well that are constantly in flux.  Try to Carbonarra if it's available.  You really though can't go wrong with any of your choices, though.  Pair these pizzas with a glass of vino from a deep wine list or a craft beer and you have the perfect meal!
author: Mike B.

description: The staff is cool-friendly and hip. I ordered take-out, so I can't comment on the actual wait staff. My pizza was really good -(minus) the olives. I ordered the broccoli raab (sp?) pizza and the olives were so damn overwhelming that I couldn't taste anything else. Sooooo, I picked them off and scarfed them down on their own and then gobbled down the absolutely scrumptious pizza; the cheese, fresh peppers, fresh parmagian and crust were all terrific.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Meh.  I don't know if it because I phoned in my order for take out, or if we ordered the wrong thing, but I was not impressed at all.  The insalata tricolore was bland, the pizza Napoletana (anchovies, capers and black olives) was burnt and tasted like charcoal, and you could hardly taste the anchovies.  Lastly, the meatballs in sugo were tasty but definitely too salty.  I am left pretty unsatisfied after dropping almost $40 on takeout! I'm willing to give Delfina another chance, but will have to eat in next time to see if my first impression was wrong.

Oh, but plus one star for the super nice gal who took my order and rang me up.
author: Kira K.

description: the burrata alone deserves 6+ stars, the best in town..... you must try it
author: Beth P.

description: Just went here last night. We got take out, called about 20 minutes before to get our food. It was packed when I got in there around 7 at night. Got the margarita and the sausage, and I must say I liked the sausage better which normally I don't.  Both really good tho! Also got the side of Brussels sprouts -Delish, they have red pepper flakes and lemon oil on them.
author: Jess O.

description:
The BEST pizza ever!!!!!  Love the fresh ingredients!  Love the dough!  Love the cheese!!  And, LOVE the salad!  Extremely friendly staff!  A MUST stop when in Pacific Heights!!
Thank you Delfina for another wonderful lunch!!
author: CINDY T.

description:
- Super noisy with horrible loud music
- Service can be random, good to horrible
- Decent pizza
-over priced
- pathetic crowd
author: Nick S.

description:
I love this place!  It is obvious to me that those that work there know what the heck they are doing.  They have a great attitude and an outstanding foodie & wine knowledge.  And despite how busy it always is, they give you their full attention and are very snappy with the service.  I love their style.

The primary reason I come back again and again is that it is always just so consistent not only with service but with the food.  The tricolore salad is a must every time and the pizza is worth falling off the diet bandwagon.  My only suggestion is to up the ante when it comes to the desserts.  I found myself a bit non plussed when it came to the sweets.  However, let's not fool ourselves.  The reason you go to Pizzeria Delfina is for the pizza, not the desserts.  In fact, just writing this makes me want to go over there right this minute...
author: Miranda O.

description:
I went here for lunch on a Saturday and was seated near the window.  I thought the place was cute though very cramped especially where we sat.  We were so close to the tables next to us it was difficult to get through and we could hear each others' conversations.  

We ordered the tuna salad with cannellini beans, the fennel sausage pizza, and a side of toasted and buttered bread with a tomato based sauce over it.  I thought the tuna salad was just okay, nothing special.  The watercress on the side of the salad was probably better than the tuna and beans.  The pizza however, was very good.  I liked how thin it was but still doughy at the crust.  I also liked how they didn't overdo it with the cheese.  As for the bread w/tomato sauce, I wasn't a huge fan at all.  I don't like my bread soggy and it was just like soggy bread. 

Overall, I think the place could work on its other dishes and also make more space for diners...oh and the waitress seemed a little slow and inattentive...but the pizza was so delicious.  I would like to try some of their other pizzas but that's probably all I'll be having there going forward.  Wish I could give it a four but because of everything else, I think a three is a bit generous! :P
author: Jessica T.

description:
Wife and I went to Pizzeria Delfina for a New Year's Eve lunch, and we were very happy with the quality of the food, the service, and the general personality of the place.  

Pizza - wife had the Panna, which is a great alternative to the Margherita.  It is a great tasting pie and easily worth the ten bucks.  I had the Broccoli Raab, which was tasty.  Thin crust but the outer ring is pleasantly doughy and charred nicely.  A decent size to eat all by yourself or share with someone.  

Other menu items - Didn't try appetizers, salads or dessert, but will do so next time.  Mozzarella in Carozza looked amazing and gelato list was also intriguing.

Service - fast and friendly; the dining room is very small, but tables turned quickly, even on a holiday weekend.  Waited about ten minutes after putting our name on the board.  Our server recommended some off-menu special items, but if we hadn't asked, I'm not sure we would have learned about them.  Not an unusual practice, but one to be advised about.

Price - not bad; the simple pizzas start at 10 bucks; specialty pizzas are close to 20 bucks apiece, which seems bit pricey to me for a personal pie.  Worth it for a pizza splurge, though.  2 pizzas, 1 draft beer, 1 coffee was ~50 bucks which included 20% tip.  

Bottom line - This place gives me hope in my neverending quest for Bay Area pizza that doesn't suck.  My east-coast pizza bias is the one thing that hasn't mellowed after a dozen years here, so good on ya, Delfina for encouraging my return to your place.  Oh, and thanks for having Sudwerk Marzen on tap.
author: Aneesh B.

description:
Reminded me of European Pizza.
My family wend to have lunch in the city on Sunday, walk around Fillmore street , our daughter decided to have a pizza, and since Delfina was in the corner and packed with people when we passed by we figured it must be pretty good.
It was busy but not that bad, we waited a couple minutes and got a seat by the window, we order: margarita, Salsiccia, Panna; I have to say it meet my/our expectations, very comparable to the pizza I have had in Europe, both Italy and Switzerland/Geneva both were my residence for very a couple of years. True the pizza are suppose to be one person serving size, so if you are looking a large size pizza like at Pizza my heart, you are not going to find that here, you may need to order two pizza for one person, however, one pizza is enough for one person, we had one pizza left over in total.
I love every bit of it, you don't feel  stuffed at all like most of the time after you eat pizza, its very light, its just perfect for my family and we all enjoyed the taste and the atmosphere, the servers are great, very friendly, they seems be very good at what they are doing and well trained.
If you are in the area and want to try different kind of pizza from the one we usually found in America, this place will give you little taste of Europe, its reminded me of Pizza Paolo in Geneva, how tasty they are.
author: Jolie T.

description:
I'm not too much of a pizza fan but my friend and I really couldn't think of anything else to eat so we decided the try out Pizzeria Delfina.

Luckily for me, there was more than just pizza.  

We got the pulled mozzarella to start, which was really good.  It came with rustic bread and arugula in a salty olive oil dressing.  Sooo good. It was definitely the best part of the meal.

Then we got the meatballs in sugo.  They were a little undercooked but they were really moist and tasty.  The sugo was a little oily but good, especially with the rustic bread that was soaked in it.  

For pizza we got the porcini pie.  It was good. Oddly, it was on the sweeter side but the crust was really good. Crisp yet moist.  

I would definitely come back to this restaurant.  I heard it gets busy here but if you go around 2:30-3:00 (when we did) you'll get sat right away!

Service was okay.  A little slow but our waitress was really sweet and friendly.

60$ with tip.  A little expensive for what you get.
author: Marisa R.

description:
Pizza with flakey yummy crust.  Good wine selection for wine illiterates.  Nice place to sit and people watch.  Only downside is that with its cult status, it feels like a little too much effort to get some pizza!

Highlights:  clam pizza, meatballs
author: Wendy C.

description:
*Sausage on pizza and wine in my belly 
Bright kitchens gleaming and nights with Paul and Kelly 
Burrata mozzarella and bread sticks galore, 
These are a few of my favorite things 

When the waiter snaps 
When the food is cold 
When A16 makes me mad 
I simply remember my favorite pizza place 
And then I don't feel so bad 

* To the tune of ''My Favorite Things" from The Sound of Music

oh, and ps- go early to avoid wait!
author: Megan M.

description:
Great place. I actually ordered pizza for pick up and didn't know much about this place. It was the only pizza join open around noon that wasn't your run of the mill Pizza Hut type place. Not knocking, just saying.

It was a chance that paid out. I should have read more reviews here. The pizza is well balanced and the crust is great, not heavy, crisp and a bit chewy, and a good base for strong toppings on the Prosciutto Pie and the Salsiccia. I thought, the prosciutto would be over powering on a pizza, but they did it right. Same with the familiar tomato sauce topping on the Salsiccia. We also tried the Margherita. Not bad, but I would have liked more basil leaves. That's just me. I'm a big fan.

Anyways. Definitely worth the money. I'll come back to dine here one day, but thanks to you fellow yelpers, it'll be at a not-so busy hour.
author: Khanh N.

description:
This is my favorite casual place to eat. I used to eat here once a week (until I realized my clothes seemed tighter). 

It's the best pizza around. I love the margarita, prosciutto pie, and other pizza specials. I never eat my pizza crust and this is the only place I eat it. The pizza dough reminds me of a fluffy naan. 

The salads are very simple but taste fresh and light. Most of their pastas are delicious too. The last time I was there, they had fried risotto balls. They were sooo delicious. My boyfriend was on a diet because he was training for a marathon. I ate the entire plate by myself. 

Typically, there is always a long wait since this place is popular. I recommend getting there early if you don't want to wait. Or, just grab a glass of wine while you wait. Everyone that I have brought here loves this place.
author: Shelly W.

description: My favorite pizza, not only in the city, but perhaps ever. Pizzeria Delfina crusts are deliciously crispy and thin, and even the "plain" pizza is great. I enjoy all types of pizza, from chains to gourmet mom n pops, but this place takes it.
author: Mark A.

description:
I ate here recently with a friend after hearing such great things about Pizzeria Delfina.  I went in skeptical, because I've yet to find great pizza in San Francisco, and unfortunately Delfina did not disprove my expectations.

We split a beet salad, which I think may have been a special that day, and a Margherita pizza.  The salad was actually quite good, but I came here for the pizza, which was just OK.  It had decent flavor, seemed like it was made from fresh ingredients, and the crust was fine, but nothing about it blew me away.

I've definitely had better.  For the price, I doubt I'd come here again.
author: Jamie T.

description:
Definitely a great Thursday night with the bf getting tipsy on some Italian wine I can't pronounce and chowing down on some decent pizza. I will disclose up front that I am slightly more of a fan of Zero Zero, for a few reasons: the margherita pizza was better there, they had a great caesar salad (Delfina doesn't offer one), and the environment was more conducive to conversation. We came here based on the 7x7 recommendation for the margherita pizza so it was a little disappointing that it was somewhat flavorless and the cheese was a little chewy, not melt-in-your-mouth. But overall way better than average with great crust. I definitely recommend the sausage pizza. Our tri-color salad was pretty bad though. There was some sort of shaved bitter vegetable on top that was unedible. 

Definitely very loud with the open kitchen and tables 6 inches apart. We would sometimes just sit there and listen in on the first date going on beside us. A little pricey, as we spent over $100 for a bottle of wine, 2 pizzas and a salad. Overall great place to venture to - be aware of no reservations, so put your name on the chalkboard and wait awkwardly in the entryway.
author: Natalie H.

description:
Margeroni rocks.  Magic rocks too, but I prefer the Margeroni!  Yeah, you try to find these names on the menu.  I'm kidding.  I've only been here once, but it seems like I've been there several times now.  We started with the stretched cheese, which was amazing.  The bread was the right crunch.  The crust was chewable, but the middle was absolutely AWESOME!  And this is just the appetizer.  

I like how the crust is barely even crust.  There was like that perfect amount of sauce and cheese and oh so goodness.  I must say, thin crust is much more appetizing then the thick crust that is used more as handles than something you would want to eat.  But hey, that's my opinion.  As Scott Pilgrim says in shock, "Bread makes you fat!?"
author: Joey H.

description:
Wow, this pizza looks and tastes amazing. It is simlar to place in DC that serves neopolitan pizza. 

Every part of this pizza is very good, the sauce and cheese are top notch. The sauce has the right level of thickness to it and a rich tomato flavor. The cheese is excellent, it tastes how good mozz is supposed to taste like. Harder to explain that in words, something you should just know. The crust is the weakest part of the pizza, not as good as others I've had.

Excellent place.
author: Nishad J.

description:
Went here with the BF and my parents last night..it was good. We waited for probly 30 minutes, but as my parents are visiting, we just walked around Fillmore for a bit, lookin at stuff. 

We were seated, and I must say, the staff is great-friendly, knowledgable and prompt. Ambiance is nothing to write home about. Ordered some wine-very pleased with our selections and the size of the glasses poured..Yea! For food, we ordered the fresh stretched mozzarella, which came with a piece of crostini and a small amount of arugula. This was definitely tasty, but not necessarily something I couldnt have gotten at the market. 

We shared 2 salsiccia pizzas (my parents really cant think outside of the box when it comes to food) and the stuffed shells with escarole and sardines. The food was good; it was nothing particulary spectacular. 

All in all I would say that i enjoyed my meal here, but there was simply nothing about it that gives me cause to want to go back again, especially to go back and wait for 30 minutes to eat on a Tuesday night.
author: Afton T.

description:
This place is great.  Really nice service, good relaxed ambiance, and quality food.  The crazy melon salad is my favorite, made with yellow watermelon, feta, chili flakes, mint and oil.  Trust me, its to die for! Wildly flavorful!!
As for pizzas, they are all great, although I really prefer the Panna which is a very simple pizza with creme, sauce, basil, and light cheese.  At this spot, a little goes a long way. Ah...transports your to Italy in the first scrumptious bite.
author: Brittany T.

description: What a disappointment! I've been looking forward to trying Delfina for months but was let down by my margherita pie. We came by for lunch on Sunday and I was pretty happy to get a table right away. We ordered the margherita, a good way to define a great pizza place. The crust was spot on and my absolute favorite part about the pizza. Crispy bottom, chewy crust. The sauce, however, was entirely too sweet and mixed with the bland fresh mozzarella made for an overall meh pizza. There was also little to no basil- maybe 2 pieces. I felt like it needed salt or more seasoning and definitely less sugar in the sauce. For $12.50 it was a big let down. Perhaps the pizzas with toppings are better, but if you can't get a margherita right, I just don't know.
author: Cori W.

description: The best pizza in SF? Quite possibly. Combine that with a great selection of appetizers and a thorough but budget friendly wine list and you've got a solid go-to place that doesn't get tiresome. The ambience is a bit loud and crowded, so it works better for small groups (like 4-6 people max) rather than an intimate date. And even though the wait can be a bit tough at peak times, I've never been let down by the food even after an hour of sitting around watching the queue on the chalkboard.
author: Mark A.

description:
Oh my gosh...YUM! Delicioso!

I ordered the Pizza Margherita.  My date ordered the pizza with the leafy greens exploding off the pizza (forgot the name).  

We both loved our pizzas, loved the wine that was blindly recommended by our waiter, loved the staff, loved sitting at the bar watching desserts being prepared.  This was a really fantastic dining experience!

One of the waitresses and I were joking that they put crack in their tomato sauce.  But seriously, that sauce is crackalicious! I had to order an extra bowl of the sauce just to get a quick fix.
author: Jessie H.

description:
Really yummy pizza, really yummy meatballs.  Good service.  

I came here to sober up after watching a baseball game down the street and we got a seat at the bar right away.  The food was quick and the people making the food were fun to talk with.  One of the servers wasn't cheering our team on (World Series, Giants, baby!  Come on, why not?) and he was a bit of a downer but still full of sass and spunk.  

Overall I had a really good time and the pizza was great.  I'll have to try it again to really get a feel for if I want to give it 5 stars.  For now, 4.
author: Natalie W.

description:
I like to keep my reviews simple.  I'm not gonna go on and on, so here it..

Yummy fried cheese ball appetizer.  Delicious.  Order a side of red sauce to dip them in, it takes them from good to amazing.

For the main course, my husband and I shared a pizza and meatballs.  Both were outstanding.  The meatball were probably the best I've ever had.

I could continue to go crazy about the food, but the best thing and what will really keep me coming back, was the service.  When our meatballs didnt make it to the table in a timely manner, the manager not only apologized, he casually took over as our server to ensure the rest of our experience was flawless.

Our initial server, a very sweet and attentive young girl was great and I never would need a manager to guide us through the rest of our meal, however, this manager was so sincere and genuine, it didnt seem odd that all of a sudden, we were his focus.

I really appreciated the hospitality and to put a cherry on my sundae, he bought our meatballs and even filled our wine glasses.

Delfina pizzeria A+++ especially for the hospitality.
author: Krissy P.

description: At first I was weary due to the pretentiousness of the Mission branch, and the long waiting list to get a table made our order change to "to go." But I have to say the guy working the register was super nice and friendly. They take you name down for the order which makes it seem more personalized. Prosciutto pizza was a bit salty, but just the right touch. I like the thin crispy crust and the balance of cheese and fresh spinach leaves. The local organic apple juice from Mendocino was delicious too.  The pizza was ready in about 10 minutes and the lines for seating seemed to be moving pretty fast too. This place a better vibe then the delfina in the mission.
author: Naomi K.

description:
Very good Neapolitan style (thin, crispy crust) pizza. We ordered a pizza Margherita and a clam pizza and both were great. I preferred the clam one, but the clincher wasn't the clams, it was the high quality Parmesan cheese liberally sprinkled on top. They also give each table a small plate of red pepper flakes, basil, and parmesan for us to season our dishes.

We also ordered the fresh-stretched mozzarella appetizer, but that was a bit excessive. Not only was it yet more cheese, bit it was also coated in olive oil. It was tasty but I'll stick to pizza next time. Two pizzas for the two of us was more than enough, we had most of a pizza left to take home.

Thanks to other Yelp reviews, I went to the Pacific Heights location on a week night, and pretty much avoided the line. We only wait for about 5 minutes.
author: Adam B.

description:
From reading all the reviews, I'm not sure if my co-workers and I just went on a off day in regards to the pizza. 

We ordered the Prosciutto Pie (which was my favorite) and the Salsiccia. It was plenty to feed 5 hungry ladies before our happy hour escapades. While taste wise of both pies were perfectly balanced, especially the blending of the bitterness of the arugula and saltiness of the Prosciutto in the Proscuitto Pie, the crust on both pizzas were very burnt and I had to cut off a tumor-sized burnt bubble in one of the crusts. It was my first time eating at Delfina, so I'm not sure if that's normal but I feel crusts should never have multiple black burnt spots larger than a Sacagawea coin. 

Although I was disappointed by the crust, I was impressed with the little details that Delfina has to offer. They have these breadsticks that look like table decorations and a little plate of spices to sprinkle on your pizzas. The waitress also leaves the water in a tall narrow-neck clear bottle which was very cute.

Service-wise our waitress was immensely helpful in recommending wines even going as far as letting us sample some to make sure we are satisfied with our selection! That was definitely going above and beyond! 

When I go back (and I am certain I will be), I'll do a review update on the crust. Maybe it just wasn't a crust happy day.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Pizzeria Delfina you have pleasantly surprised me!  

I had never heard of the place and been more used to the likes of Golden Boy rather than this, dare I say, somewhat trendy pizzeria.  Don't get me wrong I will always be in love with Golden Boy, but Pizzeria Delfina is amazing!  Thin Crust Pizza with a perfect crust.  I am a crust person and have never fully understood the people who don't like crust...its just seems so unnatural to me.  Light, delicate pieces that will fill you up, nothing really heavy and doughy.  Went there with a bunch of friends, there was 6 of us and we ordered 4 pizzas, each got a slice of each which worked out perfectly.  We got the Clam Pie (not a huge fan), The Four Formaggi, the Prosciutto, and the Salisiccia.  Also got 2 pitchers of beer on draft and we each paid $23.00 so it was a really great price for the group.  

I highly recommend this place, just get there early and put your name in because apparently its the, "place to be," in Pacific Heights!
author: Natalie L.

description:
My man and I got take out from here tonight. The pizza was good, but unfortunately I've now been spoiled by a much better, yet similar pizza place in DC called 2Amys. I can imagine that if I'd never tried 2Amy's, I would think Delfina was really good.

The largest problem about their pizza was a lack of cheese. And the cheese that was on the pizza was a little plastic-y and hard. But seriously, it's like complaining about a cloudy diamond; it's still a diamond. Delfina's definitely not bad.

Were I eating in the restaurant, I'd probably have more to complain about. Just looking at the crowd outside gives me hives. Hipsters... ugh. It must be tough to be a young WASP-y couple in SF; they all seem to be at Delfina, sucking down glasses of red wine and talking about their fabulous selves. You drive a BMW? I drive a BMW! You work at Facebook? I work at Facebook! You rent in Pac Heights? I rent in Pac Heights! You met in college? We met in college! Barf.

I'm reading Revolutionary Road, so when I drive by here at night all I can think about are the Wheelers or Campbells of a more civilized, modern world. 

I'm totally moving to Paris :). Or maybe Italy, where I can get better pizza.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Pizzeria Delfina is one of those places I take out of town guests to make them jealous of where I live  :)

Love the atmosphere - energetic, casual, neighborhood vibe.  I love sitting at the counter and watching all the action.  The pizza is FANTASTIC!  Wood fired crust with a nice chew, flavorful and robust sauce (I always get some extra on the side for dipping), market driven menu...just great, really.  

Great, now I'm hungry.
author: Aisha W.

description:
My girlfriend and I went to see the latest "potter" movie... On the way back from the movie it was pouring rain. So we stopped in here for our first Pizza here. We had  ordered two pizza's thinking we would take some home for later on. No way no how! We eneded up eating everything!
Great vibe here. Great service and kind staff! We will be going back...

Thanks guys!
author: Kirk M.

description:
Five stars for service and three stars for food. 

The pizza here was just not impressive. The bottom crust was thin but soggy and the toppings were sparse. I've had much much better for all the hype that this place gets. The squash appetizer was pretty good. I'm not a huge fan of the yellow veggie but they poured some spices and sauce on it that perked it right up 

The service was fantastic. Our server was so helpful when it came to ordering a second glass of wine. She brought out taste after taste and then even after we had chosen something she still brought out more for us to try. She was having so much fun with it and so were we! If it weren't for that, though, I'd probably have given it a 3 star rating. It's a great and fun experience to eat here, but you can get better food elsewhere.
author: Julia N.

description:
Considering all the hype at Pizzeria Delfina, I ate here twice before writing a review.  Both times were disappointing.

The crust at Gialina's definitely beats Delfina.  At Delfina, it's too thin and soggy toward the middle of the pizza, while the outside portion of the crust has too many of those blisters and gets too messy.  

The first time I went to Delfina, my roomies and I ordered the Salsiccia, the second time I got the broccoli rabe.  The toppings were both better than Gialina's Atomica pizza for the most part, but it was pretty oily, which probably contributed to the soggy crust.

Other than the fact that Delfina is literally 2 blocks from my house, I've definitely had better thin crust pizza than this.

My hunt for really good (crust + toppings) thin crust pizza continues!
author: Naoko M.

description:
Always a line out the door.  Only gone once so, I can't really say it's a fair review but, I thoroughly enjoyed their thin crust pizza and fruit soda.
The service was great!
author: Mina B.

description: Lemonciata, warmed olives, and the 4 Formaggio pizza...yummy.  This place was really cute.  Love the simplicity.  Love the friendly service.
author: M E.

description: Had prosciutto pizza, calzone, salad and water. The long bread sticks were a nice treat awaiting for the main stays. Thin crisp pizza and the calzone  tasted like they used same crust flour (yum). Staff was friendly, service was efficient, and food was great (calzone esp. and the arugula was fresh).  Seated outside at about 7pm and the fog was slightly coming in but their heat lamps took care of any discomfort. Place had a reputation that I heard and that they lived up to.  I got value (service, food, comfort) for my money.
author: Andrea K.

description: Fresh mozzarella was awesome. Prosciutto was not aged enough but was tasty. Long wait if your party is more than 2 people but worth it.
author: Michael D.

description:
Thumbs down for Broccoli Raab.

Otherwise, very good pizza. Salsiccia was awesome, and margherita was good once the girl got back with the "extra" basil... (there were only 3 basil pieces on the pizza to start with - we demanded more.)

Mmm.
author: Catherine H.

description:
After living in Italy for 2 years we've been on a quest for solid authentic pizza.  This comes pretty damn close.  Good crust and fresh, flavorful ingredients.  The Napoletana pizza is awesome, super flavorful!  Definitely our go to pizza spot.

Also, I am not much of a soup person, but the soups here are amazing.  The Pasta e Fagioli is a must try if they have it on the menu, the flavor is super authentic, and the Brodo is very simple but extremely flavorful.
author: Mia L.

description:
yum yum yum yum yum!!

thin crust, wood oven pizza with fresh yummy toppings.  our table had the broccoli rabe pizza, sausage pizza, and clam pizza.  plus the fried mozz to start.  i would honestly skip the fried mozz next time, and get another pizza. they were SO good.  YOU MUST TRY THE CHERRY SUNDAE for dessert!!  it has candied pistachios on it!!  CANDIED!!!  :)  Can't wait to go back.  Noticed a really big crowd here sunday evening - we went on a friday afternoon and it was almost empty.
author: Laura K.

description: Highly disappointed. Getting a table, no problem. Getting your food, that's another story. After an hour wait, no pizza to be seen. By that time the pizza came, I asked to get it boxed up because I simply wanted gtfo. Lesson learned, should have went to Pizza Hut..same quality nothing special and not worth the wait.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
obviously i dont need to write ANOTHER review describing how deeeelicious Defina is, not only because there are near 400 positive reviews and it is already well-established as one of the best pizza joints in town, but because as an eater of SF its just a given....

the only thing i want ADD to this page is that the Broccoli Raab pizza is top notch as far as creativity and flavor!! 
{i could use way more olives (see pic) but thats just me}.  
this thin crust pie is also proportioned perfectly to fulfill a solid dinner and be cold leftovers for breakfast the next morning. 

Delfina i loooove youuuu!
author: Kaylan S.

description: Three words:  cherry pie pizza. Thrilling. (That's four.)
author: Robert M.

description:
Went here with two gal pals as part of the 7x7 magazine's 100 things to eat in SF.

We got:
- Blue Star beer (tasty and light...almost like a Blue Moon but not as orangy)
- Appetizer made of zucchini (very good, came out as strips of zucchini in this spicy-ish dressing, like a small salad but warm...veryyy tasty and full of flavor)
- Margherita pizza (listed in the 7x7, it was ok, nothing absolutely amazing. the middle of the pizza was not cooked all the way and very droopy, yet the crusts were burnt)
- salsiccia pizza (def. favored this pizza over the margherita; has Housemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions and mozzarella making it spicier and more flavorful)

I would say overall, i like the feel of the place apart from the music blasting. Given the mix playing was nice and I would love to have it for myself but maybe at the volume they were playing at. 

We went on a Friday evening, and it was pretty crowded and we waited about 30 min before being seated (pretty small location). Price-wise I would say it was so-so, a bit pricey for what it is but since it is considered one of the better pizza parlors, I guess they can do so.

They have that quirky mix of elegant yet still warehouse/low-key.
author: Jung-Ah Y.

description: I was going to regal all of you with a long-winded post about how I've been a workaholic for the last several months and somehow tie that into something maybe useful, but then got really bored and just decided to say that Pizzeria Delfina is awesome. And if you don't think so, then you're obviously a communist. Why do you hate freedom?
author: Jaime L.

description:
Definitely the best Italian place in Pac Heights.  The pizza is great and they always have simple, fresh vegetables (broccoli raab, marinated cucumbers, brussel sprouts mmm) and other yummy small plates.

The wait staff is extremely knowledgeable and attentive and the restaurant has a relaxed vibe.

It is always crowded and there isn't tons of room to wait around, so make sure you put your name on the chalkboard as soon as you get there.
author: Kathy D.

description: Delfina is my go-to when people come to visit. It's a great intro to San Francisco between the delicious pizza and the people (and dog) watching. If you go, expect a wait, but you can order wine at the desk to sip on while you wait. The wait is part of the fun because that's where the best people watching happens. The restaurant typically plays great music and the staff is very accommodating, kind and knowledgeable. I like to order the tricolor salad to start, and choose my pizza based on guests. It's hard to go wrong. If the meatballs are on the menu, try those, too! They have take out too, so you can take Delfina home without dealing with the scene.
author: Katie M.

description:
I have been so excited to go here for weeks and am thoroughly disappointed.  My boyfriend and I ordered two pizzas for pickup because it is always extremely crowded. You would think that would be a good sign.  We ordered:
Margherita pizza: the crust was thin, chewy, tough and lacked flavor.  The sauce was good but did not make up for the crust.  The cheese was very fresh and tasty.  It saddens me that so much amazing cheese is wasted daily on this pizza.
Daily special: basically the Margherita pizza with an an egg on it. So... great cheese, chewy, flavorless crust, good sauce, and an egg. (it's hard to screw up an egg)
Fried chili lime pig ears: I was very excited about these after reading the reviews. Since I love pork rinds, I thought this would be a winner. They had a really nice flavor however, the texture was repulsive.  Yes, there were some yummy crispy pieces in there, but then, the chewy mouthfuls of soft fat in the shape of sliced pig ears really turned me off. I guess I should have seen that coming.
Overall, this place invests in high quality food, but does not know how to cook it. This explains the high prices.  I am assuming the trendiness explains the crowds. If you want to be trendy, you should say you like pizza delfina.  If you want good flat crust pizza, you should try pizza antica...or anywhere other than here.
author: Laura M.

description:
Fantastic pizzas, great service, fun atmosphere, but of course, LONG waits.

My favorites are the sausage and marguerita pizza. We also tried the calzone ($9) but it was just so-so (no meat thus not as much flavor...just lots of spinach and cheese). 

I love this location in Pac Heights though. It's more cozy and probably a bit less crowded than the Mission location. 

And yes, those skinny breadsticks are for you to eat! Haha. We weren't sure if it was table decoration or complimentary appetizers :)
author: Yee-Shing W.

description: I love the mission delfina too but had a pretty amazing experience here a while ago with a couple of friends.  It seems the waitstaff was privy to my weaknesses and made me feel really good about ordering (more or less) one of everything - which everyone always laughs at. And it's delicious, all of it.
author: Melba T.

description:
Solid pizza - but if you're a Mozza Virgin (West Hollywood, SoCal), you might think this place is the best that it could ever get.

The margherita is decent, the Pac Heights location is easier to get into than the Mission, and they offer Warheads as after dinner mints. That gave it one whole extra star. 

Their gelato though - divine. Try the olive oil one.
author: Tian L.

description:
A lot of people seem to get really emotional when discussing pizza places.  Maybe because it's the ultimate American comfort food?  Not sure, but I'll be honest, I don't have a sophisticated enough palette to tell you the pizza crust I had in New York (by the way, big fan of Forninos in Bk) is just SOOOO much better than the pizza crust I had in San Francisco, etc.  In fact, when you add lots of alcohol into the equation, extreme statements will come out of my mouth like "oh my god, this slice of Papa John's cheese pizza is the best pizza EVER."

Basically, my point is, the pizza at Pizzeria Delfina is great.  Is it THAT much better or worse than the pizza elsewhere in the city?  My taste buds have no idea.  But when I bite into a slice of Delfina's pizza, it tastes delicious and I leave a satisfied customer.  

My favorite pie is probably the Salsiccia, though the Margherita pizza is also good for something with less toppings.  It's fresh, it's hot, comes right out of an oven.  I've had the calamari appetizer, which was also good, though of course you come here for the pizza. 

The downside of this place is the wait where your name goes up on a chalkboard behind 1489590 other people on a Friday or Saturday evening.  Some people stand outside with a glass of wine to wait (yes, it's a yuppie thing to do, but quit hating).  They are also kind enough to call you if you want to wait somewhere else.  In general, the service is good.  

The menu is a little more expensive, but I think worth it.  For cheaper pizza and drinks, you could always check out Dino's which is down the way.
author: Mitchell L.

description: Consistently good service. However, stick with the pizza and avoid the other main dishes. The Chicken Diavolo sounded intriguing but it was just meh..
author: Mimi T.

description: A cozy pizza place down the street from where I used to live.
author: Suz L.

description: The pizza is always worth the wait.  Very creative combinations they make.  Also the beer list here is great.  Much better than most pizza places.  If you don't like lines go early, but they built a nice place to wait outside on the curb.   You'll enjoy your time here.
author: Matt C.

description: Let's keep it short, sexy and sweet!  Yum!  On a whim a dear friend of mine and I went here for dinner last night.  I loooved the pizza which was ulllltra sexy delicious.   Plus the set up of the place is so darling - it's like I'm in a beachy town on vacay.  I loved it.  Their iced tea was delish.  So will be back and will bring my sexy other half next time!
author: Christine P.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for quite sometime.  I know I'm a bit late to the game on this one...the only problem is that it is always sooooo crowded around dinnertime!  Damn Pac Heights.  Anyway, I had a docs appointment at Cal Pacific so it was a perfect opportunity to stop on in.

It was everything I hoped it would be!  Great atmosphere, delicious menu, sorta in my hood.  I ordered the brocolini pizza, and man was it tasty...light, thin airy crust, smoking hot toppings and cheese.  I will definitely be back if I'm up for braving the lines....my only question is, "do they change out those plates of condiments on the tables".  I sure hope so...
author: Vince B.

description: I've eaten pizzeria delfina a few times-- mostly because its convenient. There is much better pizza to be has in San Francisco and I find the meatballs to be lacking in flavor and a bit greasy. I'm writing this review now because of service issues-- I just tried placing a takeout order. The first time I called- I was hung up on. The second time, I was put on hold not once but twice. It takes less than 3 minutes to take a phone order if the person knows what they want (and I did)-- there is no reason to put someone on hold twice. Ended up going to Ragazza instead- better pizza and much better service
author: Kristin R.

description:
Best pizza in the city, period!  The pie is paper thin and crisp when its fresh from the oven.  I usually go with the Margherita (purist) but the special Purgatorio pizza comes around once in awhile and it is worth your while to try it - Its spicy tomato with two farm fresh runny eggs.  The meatballs are also very good here (very large portions).

This location is definitely easier to get a table versus the one in the Mission.  If you go during off-peak hours a table will open up very quickly.
author: Peyton D.

description: I've been here a few times and only now am reviewing this. I've tried all pizzas and I've loved all of them. I'd love them even more if they were not priced like they were made in Europe! Go early, way early.
author: Paolo D.

description:
Good pizza- definitely believe most can die happy prior to trying...

There's something about the ambiance that kind of gets to me...bright lights make it feel like your'e eating in a cafeteria.

I prefer taking this pizza out and eating it in the ambiance of my pad :)
author: Gabrielle J.

description: Great thin-crust pizza. Prepare to wait if you go during regular dinner hours.
author: N B.

description:
Get the meatballs - they are amazing. Nuff said.
Pizza is thin crust - you know, that new fangled pizza that is fired up. It's all the new rage because it's yummy!
Wish I had room for dessert and would love to go back just to have some with those meatballs. Did I mention how good they were?!
author: Wendy B.

description:
5 stars for the prosciutto pizza.
Try to get there early -- before rush-hour dinnertime.
author: Rebecca L.

description: I love the pizza, and the good Italian wine selection. However, I find the booming, weapons-grade "music" so offensively loud that I can't eat there. There is also generally a really long wait unless you go at off hours.
author: Nancy G.

description:
I went here for the first time last night with my roommate and my family.
Six people.
We got a lot of glares.
But they accomodated us willingly. But I think they could get a better system than just a chalkboard, I mean really. 
The wine was yummy and sweet. 
My roommate and I split the panna pizza with fennel sausage on it. 
More like the grease with cheese pizza. 

I drank that shit up!

For dessert I got the coconut gelato with chocolate. I should have done shots of pure chocolate, cause that stuff was sinful...

I was oddly full after two pieces of pizza and overpriced gelato. I came home and ate a box of Girl Scout cookies. Not filling enough!!!!

Sigh.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Great thin crust pizza!  My sister and I split the arugula & prosciutto pizza and a tricolore salad.  Great dressing on the salad.  The homemade lemon and limeades were delicious!   

Nice spot for lunch, especially on a sunny day when you can eat outside.  As a plus, there are some cute little shops on Filmore Street close by.
author: Lori S.

description:
Ate here for the first time yesterday, and wow very happy.  To start with the wine list is very good - mostly good wines from southern Italy.  

The arancini (fried risotto balls) were excellent and we ended up ordering a second portion.  Our chard antipasti was very yummy. 

The highlight was the Napoletana pizza - thin and perfectly burnt crust.  Very tasty and balanced sauce.  I could live on this stuff.  

The affagado's were decent but not great.  All in all and excellent dining experiencing at a reasonable price.
author: Namit M.

description:
PIzza: Off the hook!

Service: Could use some tweaking. I am even reluctant to give this place a whole notch lower, but i just had half assed rude service. I get it, this place is trendy and cute and all the hype, but not even a signal of warmth? I hate that corporate forced to learn lines and never stop smiling but not one nice thing from a server? beh.

I will be back and just expect bitches serving me.

Got the tricolores salad and panna pizza. Both to die for and the pizza OH so delicious with the cream on top and the fresh basil. Maybe I'll resort to take out.....
author: Susanna B.

description:
Delfina continues to deliver quality food out of their second location. We got seated at the counter within 5 minutes of putting our name on the board. 
They always have a few specials featuring seasonal delights. Today just happened to be a nettles calzone...alway superb. This location vs. The mission location is a little more family friendly with a little less well, "mission flair."

There is a metered parking lot only a 1/2 a block down too! The food is still the same great delfina fare.
author: Michael M.

description: Am a big fan of Delfina but am a bigger fan of Pizzerina Delfina.  As with any popular SF restaurant, this place has a long wait and doesn't take reservations for small parties.  However, come for a later dinner and the wait isn't so bad.  If you love thin crust pizza with fresh ingredients, PIzzeria Delfina is THE place to go.  Hubby and I usually start with the insalata tricolore and end with two pizzas.  You can't go wrong with the margherita, but we've had the broccoli rabe and the prosciutto and arugula -  all amazing in their own ways, and the wine selection and cocktails compliment the food beautifully.  Save some room for dessert because the amarena cherry sundae is to die for!  Trust me, you don't want to miss it!
author: Julie P.

description:
Pizzeria Delfina was a pleasant surprise. It was better than expected. I must admit I was originally weary of Delfina because of the hype (I've been disappointed enough by the suggestions on the 7x7 list) but the pictures on yelp made me salivate.

I was starving when I arrived to Delfina's. Luckily Ellie C. and I grabbed the last bar seats. I love watching the cooks work their magic. While munching on the breadsticks, Ellie and I perused the menu, watched other patron's enjoy your meal and drooled at the wonders being created before our eyes. 

Their special the Capricciosa was not ready and of course we desperately wanted that but we decided on the warmed olives, Margherita and Salsiccia. The food came hot and fresh. Oozing mozzarella, thin crusts and simple fresh ingredients. Ah-mazing! (Just pick off the burnt bits on your crust...) 

Oh by the way, the service was amazing. Great staff! Incredibly friendly!
author: Tina Y.

description:
When I think about Pizzeria Delfina, I think about the story of Goldilocks and the 3 Bears.  Their pizza is just like the baby's porridge...JUST RIGHT!  Not too much sauce, the crust is not too thing, the toppings aren't over powering - it's pure perfection!! 

I love coming here and getting my regular order - 1 cheese pizza and a salad with a glass..or 2..or 3 of wine!  The service here is impeccable and everyone is friendly.  I love that you can see the kitchen and see the chefs in action.  

This a restaurant that is worth visiting over and over again!
author: Cherlyn M.

description: I'm adding a star.  Went back and split the broccoli raab pizza with a friend.  It was spectacular.  The tricolor salad was unimpressive, and the latte was more milk than expresso.  But the pizza deserves another star.
author: Robin W.

description:
So here's the deal: Delfina is awesome. 

I realized this before the food came, before we even ordered. I was in the bathroom washing my hands when "Never Ending Math Equation" by Modest Mouse came bursting through the speaker...had to do a little obligatory dancing before rejoining my party. Turns out, they played the entire "Building Nothing Out Of Something" album--you know, from back when Modest Mouse was good. 

We chomped on those long, slender breadsticks--so distinctively Delfina--and enjoyed some Sudwerk pints whilst awaiting our food. 

While I'm not normally a fan of appetizers, I am a sucker for their fresh stretched mozzarella...it's basically a cold ball of mozzarella served with crostini. Simple but incredibly delicious. 

In terms of pizza, I go for the margherita every time. I should probably try something new, but there's something to be said about a safe bet. Especially when that safe bet is as scrumptious and tangy as this one. 

Rather than get dessert here, go a block down Fillmore and visit Tango Gelato...as good, if not better, than Delfina's gelato, but much bigger variety of flavors. 

Yes, overall Delfina is awesome. Good groovin' tunes, great food, friendly service...still need convincing? On top of all that, you just might have the pleasure of running into me here!
author: Eric E.

description:
ive heard the wait here is ridiculous.  our friend came here early to put her name down so we didnt have to wait much.  but i could understand how frustrating it would be to wait a long long time to eat.

i thought the thin breadsticks on the table were decoration.  the bar forgot our wine.  we got it after a reminder.

we started with a cauliflower special.  it was pretty good.  spicy.  also the tricolor salad.  we all shared the meatballs, the spicy egg pizza and also the pasta of the day.  all were very good.

the only thing was the pizza had a slight chemical taste to it.  im sure it was just a fluke and im willing to come back and give it another try.  the crusts texture was great.  but it tasted like someone wiped the counter down, forgot to wash their hands, and proceeded to roll out the pizza with their cleanser chemical covered hands.

on another note, service was pretty good.  the music selection was really interesting with 80's and 90's slow and hip hop jams playing the entire time we were there.  reminescent of an 8th grade dance.
author: claudia y.

description:
I have previously tried their other location close to Dolores park which I love (best thin crust pizza in SF), so I had high expectations walking in. I was not disappointed, the restaurant has a cool vibe and was packed when we walked in but we got seated at the counter pretty quickly. 

We enjoyed watching the chefs in action and the service was great. We had the capriciosa pizza with artichoke (Never had that on pizza but it was delicious). We also had a beet salad, I would give the pizza a strong 5 and the salad a straight 4. Will definitely be back!
author: Johan S.

description:
Came here for the first time tonight and thought it was some of the best pizza I've had in a long time.  We waited for about 30 minutes or so to be seated and yes, the place is cramped and loud but it doesn't pretend to be a romantic, candle lit restaurant so you shouldn't expect that.  

We had the tricolore salad to start which was a mix of spinach, endive, and radicchio dressed in a lemon vinaigrette and topped with grano podano (like a parmesan but nuttier).  It was a nice combination of bitter, lemon, saltiness.  

For pizza, we went with the fennel sausage pizza with red onion and red peppers.  It was simple - not a ton of sauce, perfectly seasoned and a thin, tasty crust that is slightly burnt and chewy at the ends.  I'm usually one who eats the good stuff on the pizza and leaves the crusts behind but I happily ate all my crusts as this place -- really good crust!  

Service was good as well...busy, friendly waitstaff who all help each other out and try to get people in and out as efficiently as possible.
author: Carrie L.

description:
Finally made it out to Delfina for their famous pizza. Love the fact that it's in my neighborhood, where the vibe is casual and unpretentious, but people still look like they took a little care before stepping out. In fact, I found it to be a cute date place (and would recommend it as such). There's a lot of energy in this smallish restaurant, activity from the wait staff (who were very friendly and efficient) and the chefs behind the open kitchen.

We were seated at the counter facing the wine so had privy to special views. Lots of wine from smaller name vineyards (at least lesser known to me) and I liked that. You could see sous chefs dipping bread in olive oil and grilling them, or plating pasta and salads.

Since we came to the pizzeria, we had to have pizza of course. The Salsiccia ($15) called to me because of the sausage toppings. Served fresh and hot, the crust was on the thinner side with a nice crisp bottom, and some nice dough at the edges. Cheese was the right amount but the toppings of sausage and peppers were a little haphazard in placement so that slices didn't have fair distribution (making you vie for the loaded ones). 

Also tried the Baked Ziti ($13) which is just long penne pasta with meat sauce, topped with cheese and sauce, then baked. It's a simple dish, and was tasty. I liked it but could see that the portion could be a little small if you were a bigger eater.

So overall, liked the ambience, the homey food, and the pleasant staff. But it wasn't what it was hyped up to be. It's homey and that's good too.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Prosciutto on pizza is definitely one of my favorite things and Pizzeria Delfina definitely delivered. Prosciutto and some sort of creamy cheese, was yum. We also shared a Margherita pizza, tricolore salad and had a few glasses of wine. I was inticed by the pizza's with hot peppers but not excited about the topping combinations, so passed on getting one of these. The pizza's were light, not too heavy, so I felt full but not too stuffed at the end of the meal...always a good thing. 

Overall it was a good experience. I wanted to give this place 3 1/2 stars, but will upgrade to four. Service was super friendly and the waitress was helpful picking out a glass of wine.  The place was pretty packed, even when we were leaving around 10pm on a Wednesday night there was a wait. So definitely show up early or be prepared for a wait. I plan on being back to try some of the other pizzas, as well as possibly the meatballs, which we heard were good.
author: Carolyn K.

description:
Honestly I don't know what all the excitement is about this place. I've dined in and taken dinner out, and both times the restaurant was too busy, too crowded, and the food was good but not great. Tonight my pizza (for take out) was cold by the time I got it home (5 blocks away). When I arrived to the Delfina counter they said it was "still in the oven" so I expected piping hot 'za when I got home...mmmmnot so much. Cold is more like it. Had to put it in my broiler to heat it up.

Also, the staff is nice but not over the top friendly. When you wait in the cold for a table inside, or wait inside with the crowd for a cold pizza to go, you just hope for it to be offset by a little friendlier service.
author: T Z.

description:
I'm not especially familiar with SF - but we were here on Halloween evening, which is particularly interesting in SF! Just saying. No, I don't think that has anything to do with my review. 

Anyway, we got 4 different pizzas between 5 of us and it was delicious. Really thin, crispy crust with minimal toppings, awesome tomato sauce. The capers+olives one was really salty but DELICIOUS. I love capers. 

We waited an hour to get a table for the 5 of us. Should have gone with take-out. Or come when you have only 2 people.
author: Kolina T.

description:
I forget where I read this (best pizza in the US) article about Delfina. (GQ perhaps?). So I had to stop by and give it a try. Despite high expectations, I was disappointed. I've given up trying to find a quality slice in TO, which, I will admit is difficult for me because I really did enjoy my trip through Italy.

But......Delfina's pizza is thin, crispy, sauced beautifully with a fresh tomato, basil and mozzarella. Almost perfection and quite perfect for an easy lunch or mid-day snack. Took a few slices home and even the reheat didn't take away from the great flavors.

Some will complain about the burnt bubbles along the crust but I can appreciate the process of making a pie that involves just the right temp to crisp without charring. They did it well. The meatballs dusted with basil and parmesan, heated in a clay bowl looked delicious too.

I'd stop here anytime for a slice.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Thin crust, wood oven and a wait that is too long.  I use to go by and glance at the chalkboard just to get a sense of the wait.  It was usually about an hour.  A couple months ago, I was wandering around with the family and went by.  Two names on the board!  Gotta go now.  Signed up and got an outside table for 5 in fifteen minutes.  We ordered everything and all was good, but nothing stands out.  Sad is all I remember is we did not have to wait forever.
author: Michael N.

description:
Listen Yelpers, honestly, this place is ALL HYPE! 
We live right up the street and sadly, this is another shitty Fillmore/California area restaurant...we have nothing good in our hood!

The food is mediocre at best at inflated prices for the half-assed food they serve you.  The dining room is cramped and loud.  You have to wait forEVER to be rushed through dinner because there is a caravan of hungry idiots waiting for your table...aghhh...this place sucks.

The beer selection is small and the wine that was suggested to me was pure vinegar. 

We shared the brick cooked chicken which is just a pre-grilled smashed chicken thigh served on a thin bed of oily greens (thats it!) for $15 bucks!

We also shared the sausage pizza, which was mostly doughy crust with all the toppings in the soggy center.  You could have made another pizza with the doughy crust that was left over.  Sure it tasted ok but it was melted cheese and sausage...that would taste good any way...

The whole dinner with drinks and tip cost us $60 and we had to go home and snack afterward.  I felt violated!

NOT impressed, not coming back.
author: Nilu r.

description:
I was secretly excited to meet J here for dinner the other night. I finally, finally, made it to Pizzeria Delfina.

Despite there being loads of parking spots (crazy, I know), we had a bit of wait for 2 seats at the bar.

Service was good, atmosphere loud, food really, really good. Actually, I'm still thinking about the broccoli rabe pizza we shared last night and am making it a request for when I'm postpartum in the hospital in a couple months (hint, hint). The broccoli was so cooked down, it looked like spinach, probably to remove the bite of the rabe and the provolone was just oh-so creamy. The crust was soft, chewy, a little buttery. Yes, the crust was a tad bit burnt, but it's not gonna hurt you to just remove the burnt spots - really.
