Order the Tricolore Insalata and Salcissia for antipasti, and the Prosciutto Pie, Panna, and Cherry Pie for primo. You can't go wrong with those, only sometimes the consistency changes, but still awesome!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Very over rated place. There was a ridiculous wait, definitely not worth waiting for like an hour and a half, pizza was average. I would not recommend going. Some of the food was bland and tasteless
author: David D.

description: Pretty good service and the pizza was good with reasonable price; however, the wait is way too long.  Their appetizers were just okay though.  Will be back for the pizza.  Maybe I should try the take-out next time.
author: Elena L.

description:
Great pizza.  Great wine.  Very friendly service.

In terms of atmosphere and service, I prefer Delfina over Little Star. 

In terms of food, definitely Little Star

I would say their pizza is thin crust.

Go for the one with broccoli!!
author: Peter G.

description: Sausage pizza was delicious, everything about this restaurant met our expectations. The gelato looked really good but since we ate the whole pizza, we were too full. Definitely will be back for more.
author: Liz C.

description:
what we ordered...mozzarelli carozza, salsiccia(neoplitan pizza)

pizza was ok with crunchy chewy crust, great sausage topping, ok sauce and few slices of cheese (as a norm for this kind of pie). mozzarella in carozza was good but pricy, it was  fried mozzarella cheese in an airy batter just like an english fish and chips then dazzled with oil and herbs.


ambiance... bad(kindda hip but with tiny unisex restroom and that darn real loud music was so irritating seems like am in the club in the middle of the day and waitresses with dirty dirty aprons)
service... bad(busser was great though, our server started great and it went haywire until we were about to leave that she finally remembered us again)
cost... $$
author: Gors P.

description:
Our date night at PD was highly anticipated. And once we got there (early), we didn't have to wait too long to be seated. So far, so good.

But... I can't say I was overly impressed with my experience. Yes, the food was delicious. I especially enoyed the soup - it had a little drizzle of olive oil on top - authentic Tuscan style. The pizza was good too. But it was just good. Not life-changing (as I had been led to believe it would be by all the hype). And since I'm kind of partial to Chicago-style pizza, I knew I was setting myself up for disappointment with the, how shall we say, dainty pies at Delfina. (My husband actually counted how many little sausage crumbles were on the pizza - 14, if you're interested.)

And, the restaurant was incredibly loud. I had to shout to carry on a conversation. Blech. One star off just for the atmosphere.

I will say that the service was excellent, though. Super-quick, friendly and efficient.

Bottom line: the food was good enough for me to want more of it, but next time I will be better prepared for the portions/style, and it will definitely be take-out.
author: Krissy D.

description:
Very disappointing.
We ordered to-go to avoid waiting.
The pizza didn't have much in the way of toppings and it was expensive.
author: JaM W.

description: Ate at the one on Mission a few months ago. Visited the one on Fillmore today. Good service and great pizza! We got there at a good time and only had to wait for about 5 minutes to sit down. They use good ingredients and cheese. We ordered the Broccoli Raab pizza and the marinated beets.  Definitely a great place to eat!
author: Shad B.

description:
It's pretty much right around the corner from our house so it is inevitable that we will be coming here frequently, and that's A-OK with me.

I am not quite as smitten with their pizza as most others (I prefer the A16 pizza crust and flavor), however this is sure a second best! As Alex D. said, though their pizza is good, it is the starters that blow me away every time. Always fresh, always simple, and always stellar. The other day we had the fried young fava and some incredible mussels, and another time was the grilled escarole. Definitely get a starter.

Love how easy it is to grab a pint of Sudwerk while we wait for a table. Great atmosphere, very lively.

Yes, please!
author: Abby Z.

description:
Study up on your Italian wines, California wines are banned from the menu.  The wait is ridiculous but entertaining.  Here's a game we invented while waiting.... customers enter and immediately look at the chalkboard waiting list, first timers wonder if they have to ask of if it's ok to write their own name on it.  Watch the door and guess if the person will know to pick up the chalk or stare awkwardly at it before picking it up. 

Advice: Order two glasses of wine when you sit down because trying to get a second  may take half an hour (their system for getting wine to the table is very bizarre.)  Cheers!
author: Sue K.

description:
Although the food is consistently great, I had to knock off one star for seating.  I think the place is just too damn small, and they should not seat parties larger than 4.  I waited an hour to be seated.  What a pain!  Bottom line--don't bother coming after 6:30pm or you will starve while waiting for a table.

On to the food review...

The Insalata Tricolore is really tasty.  The lettuces go well with the zesty lemon dressing, but the dessing is not overpowering.  The pizza is very good.  I like the fact that I can eat the entire crust.  Usually I toss the top of the crust aside because it's too hard and dry.  The marinara sauce is flavorful.  I have tried the Margharita and the Broccoli Raab, and both are recommended.
author: Kandi K.

description: The Panna pizza is RIDICULOUS. Best pizza on the west coast by a longshot. If you have any respect for your mouth, put some pizza from Delfina in it.
author: Mark C.

description: Went out for dinner..A very pretentious place, they firmly believe in overcharging and underperforming. One little scoop of vanilla ice-cream is $5. Mussels were very small and overpriced as well. The staff was loud, the waitress was not paying attention and had to come back to ask again what we had ordered. They also generously allow customers to pay a fee for their employee benefits currently at 1.50 per/person. So you can pay for their employee benefits instead of the owners taking responsibility for it. Not coming back here again..
author: Mary E.

description: I tried the cherry tomato pizza, mushroom and salsiccia all of which were pretty good. I do have to say however that I enjoyed the mushroom pizza from Tony's Pizza far more than that from Delfina's as well as the salsiccia from Caffe BaoNecci. The cherry tomato pizza was also a tad bit watery on top, but overall it's really splitting hairs as there is no doubt that I would eat each and every one of Delfina's pizzas in a heartbeat. Still a place that I would return to without a doubt.
author: Procter F.

description:
5 stars - Mozzarella en Carrozza - one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten. It's a breaded and deep-fried skewer of mozzarrella and bread topped with anchovy sauce. There's some kind of seasoning and in the breading that just makes it divine.

4 stars - Sausage pizza - very good sausage, and the rest of the pizza wasn't shabby.

1 star - crushed red pepper - they give you a sprinkle of crushed red pepper on the plate next to a small mound of parmesan. if you're like me, the amount of crushed red pepper that they give is used on one slice. If you ask for more, they return with a tiny dish of a similar amount of pepper. And if you ask again, they again return with the same amount of pepper. And so on. Is their crushed red pepper expensive or something? And who thought it'd be a good idea to put a sprinkle crushed red pepper in a plate? Vastly inferior technology to the shaker.
author: Nuveen D.

description: Love this place! Great wine, awesome pizza that even my Italian relatives enjoy, friendly and knowledgeable waitstaff, yummy soup, fun music, and delicious gelato. My go-to neighborhood spot when I'm hungry, don't want to cook, and want to smile during my whole meal.
author: Nicole B.

description: One of the best pizzas I have ever had.  So delicious.  The tomato sauce was light and flavorful.  I got the fried mozzarella sticks and those were yum!!!  Prices are very reasonable.  I went on a Sunday around 3pm and didn't have to wait.  It was still a full restaurant.
author: Tara K.

description: We ate here for lunch with our two young children. Breadsticks were crunchy and delicious. Prosciutto pie with arugula was very good, and different from anything I had ever seen before on a pizza. I had the sausage which was as greasy as I expected, but also delicious. Our waitress was very friendly and came back to check on us often. We tried the Dublin Dr. Peppers. Fabulous.
author: Robert M.

description:
My friend and I arrived right before the dinner rush on Monday evening around 6:30pm.  We were greeted by a friendly waitress and ordered the insalada tricolore, the margherita pizza and if that weren't enough we also got the Neopolitan Meatballs in Sugo.  We both had to try the blood orange mimosas too!

The salad was a good choice to balance out the heaviness of the other two dishes but all in all, I don't think it was worth $8.50.  The margherita pizza was also a little disappointing personally because the whole pizza had maybe 4 pieces of basil in it.  I loooove basil and I loooove it when they pile it on.  Maybe it isn't authentic and that's why they don't add more but maybe it's they're own thing.  There's a little dish on each table where you can add some dried basil (plus the stick pieces), pepper flakes and I think parm.  Dried basil to me just isn't the same but I threw it on anyways.  Now, on to the star dish of the night.  The dun dun dun, MEATBALLS!  These balls were delicious!  haha!  They came in a small casserole like dish swimming in some tomato sauce and two pieces of butter soaked toast.  We polished that off!  The blood orange mimosas were also pretty tasty and perfect for a warm SF evening.

I'd come back to try their other pies but probably would not order the margherita pizza again.
author: Rosalind S.

description: Lucky to live right down the street from this delicious pizza! Downside, lunch on Sunday was an hour wait. Still, I'll go back and wait again!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Ehhhhh,,,.. Not worth the price nor the wait. Nothing special at all. It was 4 of us and we spent nearly 200 bucks for 2 sodas 4 beers 2 apps and 4 personal pizzas...
author: R C.

description:
Whether we like to admit it or not, where we eat defines who we are, especially in the food-centric town that is San Francisco.  

That said, I liked eating at the OG PD in la Mission because it made me feel like I was artsy and hip.  Although, the Pac Heights PD is pretty much the same restaurant, it doesn't give me the necessary street cred.  

If PD were to open up the Bayview or HP, that would be dope.  Yes, you heard it here first.  I'm bringing back "dope".
author: Monica L.

description:
To be clear, I don't think PD is a full 4 stars. But 3 stars doesn't reflect the experience I had. So there you go.

First off, I have been away from San Francisco for 2 months, so I'm a little rusty on the restaurant scene and didn't have any idea what all the people crowded on California St. were doing on a Thursday night. That was one week ago. This past Thursday night, my husband and I decided to check it out on a whim - to be clear, I STILL didn't know what I was waiting for until we actually sat down. I'm serious. I knew we were at a pizza place and there were a lot of people who looked very "Thursday night ready" (quite a contrast to my "Post-Yoga Sleepy"). But not until I saw the branded pizza boxes on the wall when we sat down did I exclaim, "OH! Pizzeria Delfina finally opened here - this is huge! Oh, wow!" Random.

My Margherita was good - not the best (especially after 6 weeks in New York) - but solid for a thin-crust. My husband did not enjoy his prosciutto as much, but that just seemed like an inferior order to me anyway...

Love the bottomless breadsticks, the friendly waitstaff, the casual chic space, and the nice wine list. Don't love the crowded "waiting area" that makes you feel like a caged chickens a-la Prop 2.

I will definitely come back here a lot. This area of Fillmore St. is bizarrely lacking in good restaurant choices, and this is a good first step towards solving that issue.
author: Kiesha R.

description:
Me and my homie are always talking about a really good thin crust pizzeria in SF that's comparable to the one's in Connecticut (that's where he's originally from). He's always talking about how good they are and I always ask him if he's found one. So he finally takes me to this joint on California Street. We go there on a Friday in the early evening around 6p. Folks are already getting their dinner on by then so we were asked if we would like to sit at the counter. We want a booth so we waited for about 15 minutes as the chalkboard sign-up was getting longer and longer after our name. As soon we're seated we order a Salsiccia (housemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions and mozarella) and a Margherita (tomato, fior di latte mozarella, and basi). Since the joint was a bit busy the pizzas took about 20 minutes and they got to our table separately.

Overall, it was okay. A bit on the bougie side for me. A bit pricey but the service was good. Everything was fresh. 

Which leaves me on my continued quest for that good thin-crust pizzeria that isn't on the shi-shi tip. I'll come back though coz they got some good tomato sauce.
author: Ivan F.

description: Ordered Carbonara pizza, best ever!! I almost finished the entire one... omg... 1 hour wait on a Friday afternoon is nothing. Totally worth it! And it's only $16... Awesome taste and price.
author: Flora F.

description:
i hadn't been to delfina yet, despite its proximity to my place.  i'll usually opt for pizza that isn't as fancy just so that i can get more for my money.  though, since it was a sunny afternoon, and i was feeling slightly generous w/my wallet, i decided to pay them a visit.

had a seat at the counter, looked over the menu, and decided to go w/one of the specials of the day ($15):  grilled chicories, pancetta, mozzarella, caciocavallo, chili, and rosemary.  sounded delicious, and i only had to wait about 15 minutes for my pizza.  

at first glance, i noticed that there were way too many grilled chicories and only a slight sprinkling of pancetta.  when i took a bite, i noticed that the crust was nice and crispy, but my praise unfortunately ends there.  my mouth was full of an overly grilled, oily, rosemary taste.  if i wasn't the leftover queen, i would've ditched the pizza.  however, i took what was left and had another go at it later that day.  nope.  still bad.  

thank god for sriracha.

i really hope that the other pizzas that they have to offer are better, as i'd be willing to give delfina another shot.
author: Ting A.

description:
Wow, I was underwhelmed.  Everything was fresh but I would rather go to Pizzaiolo, which is much closer to me, for this type of pizza.

First warning - this place is better suite for groups of 2 -4 people.  Ideally 4 so you can order a couple of pizzas to share...we had a group of 5 and had to wait nearly 2 hours.  That being said, the 2 top tables (put 2 together for the 4 top) are so small it makes getting any more than 1 pizza with water glasses and 1 wine glass on the table.  If you want to minimize the wait (at least on a Sunday evening) go around 8 pm - the wait was very short at that point.

Now on to the experience/food - after being seated, we ordered the insalata tricolore (radicchio, endive and one other bitter green w/ lemon vinaigrette), meatballs in sugo, sausage pizza, funghi pizza and  prosciutto pizza.  The meatball dish was an appetizer so we assumed the salad would come, followed by the meatballs, then by the pizzas.

Well the salads came (we ordered 2) and we split them up.  The 3 bitter greens together were very fresh but too bitter.  Even the acid and citrus from the vinaigrette couldn't offset the overly bitter quality.  We did finish the greens and just as we finished...the meatballs arrived and all 3 pizzas.  No room for all 3 - we all had 1 wine glass apiece.  Fortunately (or unfortunately) the prosciutto pizza was not pre sliced so we had to send it back which gave us a couple of minutes to wolf down a slice and consolidate the remaining funghi and sausage slices on one pie tin.  

As for the pizzas - the housemade fennel sausage/red onion pizza was the favorite on the table.  Best balance of ingredients, the sausage was tasty, the pie could have been cooked just a minute longer but a nice crispness nonetheless.

The prosciutto pie, interestingly enough had large pieces of prosciutto and large arugula (not baby arugula) which made it difficult to take a bite without all of the arugula and prosciutto coming off...also the prosciutto was not very crispy on the pizza and extremely salty - and I am a salt aholic.  The last was the funghi - mushroom/white sauce - pizza.  I loved it but was in the minority at the table.  Most found it just too rich.

The star of the show was the meatball appetizer - rich sugo, tasty meatballs...we should have ordered 2.

The wine list was found and had many interesting regional Italian wines.  We ordered 2 under $50, both were very tasty and went well with the food.  interestingly, one of the bottles came out room temperature (read too warm), while the other came out cool to the touch as if it had actually been stored in a wine cabinet (read mid 60's).

Service was personable, knowledgeable and professional despite the rush to get food on the table - although I suspect that is more the kitchen's fault than our servers.  

Probably won't go back unless we order to go...much prefer Pizziaolo, Pizzeria Picco and Dopo for this type of pizza.
author: Tony V.

description:
So many mixed emotions - enthusiastic, underwhelmed, hopeful and surprised.

People raved to me, "Pizzeria Delfina!  Pizzeria Delfina!" as though it was the best thing to happen to pizza since the invention of thin crust.  Perhaps my expectations were set too high.  I did appreciate being able to dive right in and put our name up on a chalk board rather than push through people to find a hostess.  I knew that we'd be facing a wait, though time flew as we sipped our wine on the sidewalk.  Our wine steward with the oversized white glasses was very funny and friendly, and for that, I wish I could award another half a star.

The insalata tricolore was delish and I'm glad it was recommended to us by the waiter.  But, eating it at a cramped counter made the experience less than fine dining and more fine tuning to get my elbows out of the way of my neighbor.

When I saw Proscuitto Pie on the list of pizzas, my eyes lit up.  Salt and cheese is this girl's dream meal.  The proscuitto was fresh and soft, the cheese was good if not lacking, and the whole pizza was...eh.  OK.  Sure.  Whatever.  I came in enthusiastic and hopeful.  I left underwhelmed and confused, since the buzz had been so loud about this pizza.  

3 and a 1/2 stars is more accurate, but Yelp restricts me from going halfsies.
author: Teal C.

description: i have to write about this place and get it out of my system. the pizzas are great. all of them. but i can't stop thinking about the crispy pig ears with chili oil. they're a special, so if you see them get them. they are the best crispy pig ears i have ever had. so light, thin, crispy with just the right amount of fatty/gaminess. if you're into that stuff... who ever threw that slice of lime in there is a genius. my mouth is watering just thinking about it.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
A "Foodie" friend took me here and it was great!  Their fresh mozzarella appetizer was to die for, the pizza had my taste buds dancing and the desert was incredible (I have no idea what it was, but something with fried pizza dough and raspberry syrup)!  Just writing this is making me crave Delfina!

After finishing our main course my foodie friend was watching someone else eat some cheesy pasta dish and had to have it.  I think i gained like five pounds that night from overeating, but it was all worth it.

Oh and love the wine on tap- nice touch!
author: Heather S.

description:
So.... I hate to do this, I live in the neighborhood and I'm all about good restaurants doing well. I have been here twice... the first time.. AWESOME. Had a great heirloom tomato salad..and the pizza was to die for.

When my Father-in-law came into town to visit, I raved about Delfina and told him we HAD to go. Except this time...my Father-in-law ordered the clam pizza and asked for extra garlic on top. He takes a lot of meds and lost some of his sense of taste. He pretty much throws garlic on top of everything. However I was shocked when we were told it was "not possible."  I then offered to pay for a "side," also then to be rebuffed saying they "can't."  They offered no rationale, just that they won't do it.  We were shocked. We spoke to the manager really sweetly, explaining our situation with my 70 year old guest just wanting some garlic. They would not budge, or even offer a valid reason. Needless to say, left a very bad taste in our mouth... the pizza didn't taste as good after that. I don't think we will be back....
author: A D.

description:
Cruised in here on a sunny Saturday afternoon and somehow managed to grab a table without having to wait - yay!

Overall - good pizzas, extra fresh ingredients, the olives deserve a special mention and the gourmet gelato-es are a must. Highlight of our meal must have been the stellar mint stracciatella gelato .... made with fresh mint .....(yeah, from the stuff that sprouts up from the ground rather than some chemical lab concoction).

Service was attentive, but it took at least half an hour after our appetizer for the piping hot pizza to arrive....
author: Melissa S.

description:
Ill keep it short cos im on my iphone waiting for night at the museum to come on. 

Good, light pizza. We got the prosciuto pizza (if thats how its spelled). And we got this ball looking thing w rissotto anf cheese in it. Long line so come early.

Would like to come more often but the line is way too long.
author: Brian P.

description:
I live nearby but have been avoiding this place because every time I pass it on the bus there are 20 people waiting outside and only about 20 seats in the whole restaurant! (okay, so this might be a slight exaggeration).  I finally had good timing yesterday and only had to wait about 10 minutes.  I would recommend going to delfina only on a day when you're feeling flexible and willing to try some place else on fillmore if the wait is too long.

That being said, I was really impressed with the pizza.  It's light and the crust is quite yummy.  We had the sausage fennel pizza, and it was very well-seasoned.  We were less impressed with the fried and battered squash and watercress appetizer... the batter is nice (interestingly, they use sparkling water in the batter) but we only got two slices of squash and the rest was watercress... this seemed a little stingy.

Overall, very impressed by the pizza!  It will be a fun neighborhood place if the lines ever calm down.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Best...Pizza...In...San...Francisco...period.

A16: pffft, it's in the Marina, need I say more?
flour + water: you came close.
Zero Zero: you came even closer!
Arizmendi: the closest yet!

But nothing beats Delfina becase of the...wait for it...CRUST: light, fluffy, chewy, not too salty.  I eat all of my crust...and my wife's crust...wait, that sounded weird.  

Anyway, what other place has deep fried sliced pig ears?!  None!  And gelato on a bun...yum.

Homemade sausage, fresh veggies and sauces, some of the best MFing mozzarella and burrata I've ever had...damn.

So that's it.  I'm done.  I'm hungry.  I hate writing reviews.
author: Stan C.

description:
Went here last night.  Wait staff was professional, food was great but the music was way too loud and we spoke(or rather shouted)  to other diners who also thought so.  When the man I was with spoke with the very nice manager about it, the manager said that that was the type of music they play in restaurants in Naples (it was some kind of post punk).  Well, I don't know how long the owners spent in Italy but I can state as someone who has eaten my way around Italy (I'm from Europe) that they are, in a word, wrong.  

So long Delfina! I won't be coming back.
author: Poppy P.

description:
Now this isn't hear say...just call them up and they will tell you it is true...
In the Tao Noodle location it is coming!
Early summer 2008!
Just like the pizza that we ALL adore in the Mission!
They are going to have a bigger kitchen that will be able to offer more as well as a whole draught beer selection as well!
It should hold 40 seats (as per the April SF Magazine) and they might even try to have delivery (be still my heart!!!)
Can't wait for this!!!
author: Presidio H.

description: Very good, but the wait can be long.  If you order beyond just a pizza it starts to get pricey.  Worth trying at least once.  They have a bread app sometimes that is fried and finished with browned butter.  It's excellent.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Stepping into this location of the Mission-born Delfina is like stepping into some weird irony machine: handlebar-mustache-black-framed-glasses-wearing-hipster meets hair-gelled-pink-lipsticked-khaki-clad-yuppie.  Actually, the only reason I even found it (no sign besides a lit up "Pizzeria" glowy sign) was due to 2 bikes chained to a street light outside -- the first time I've ever seen a bike in Pac. Heights.

Clientele aside, the food is equally as delicious as their mission location.  They have the same cute condiment sets as well.  I love taking my time to carefully crumble the dried oregano leaves on my pizza.  It's one of those (almost OCD) tasks that I truly delight in accomplishing.

Of course, anyone who's ever dined in Pacific Heights knows, the shelf life of any business is less about quality and more about.... Location, location location!  With a great space, delcious food, and a lot of spunk, maybe Delfina can inject a little bit of sass into the neighborhood!
author: Abby M.

description:
Good but not great.

We ordered the Napoletana and Salsiccia pizzas. Both were tasty with fresh ingredients and good crust. However, it felt a bit pricey and the portions were small. Ambiance was nice though it got crowded.

It's easy to become a pizza snob with so many options in the Bay Area (Cheeseboard, Pauline's, Little Star, etc). I love pizza, and enjoy trying new places. Delfina was good, but probably not worth another trip.
author: Mike L.

description:
A beautiful Sunday afternoon in Pac Heights is made even better by a meal consumed at Pizzeria Delfina.

Our party shared the Insalata Tricolore, a nice light, bright, peppery and slightly sweet way to start off lunch.  It was a nice palate cleanser.  I thought the little tray of pizza condiments was novel; a small white platter on which were heaped tiny mounds of dried oregano herbs, finely grated parmesan and flakes of red bell pepper.

The broccoli raab and panna pizzas were set on our tables, and we dug in, uttering muffled approval sounds with each bite.  The thin, crispy, chewy crust was a nice carrier for all that flavor.  The fresh ricotta cheese providing a nice foil to the slightly bitter, stalky broccoli raab and deeply flavored oven-dried tomatoes.  The other pizza, panna, was equally rich and palate pleasing.  The liquid cream glistening and rolling across the top of the thin pizza, pairing nicely with the simple tomato sauce and parmesan.  I wanted more when I was there.

Thank goodness I don't live too far from there, so I can indulge myself as often as I want!
author: Janet L.

description:
100% YESSSS YELPERS! 

Now... a few things to remember. It's time to accept the fact, that I don't live in the tri-state anymore. This is THE BEST pizza I'm going to find out here in the land of nuts and fruits. 

The Pizza! I got the margarita... basically if you cant make the basic margarita... then why bother trying anything else?  The right amount of saltiness, delicious sauce, great dough!!! Got my pie with Buffalo moz... MMMMM!!!! Washed it down with a Peroni. Hit the spot on Saturday Afternoon. 

And when you finish the whole damn pie, you can't refuse desert! This place has HOME MADE Gelato... the Vanilla and Choc are the BEST!!! PERIOD! 

SO, To sum it up for the flakes in SF, The Best Pizza, and The Best Gelato... NOW JUMP ON THIS!
author: Matthew Z.

description: It was just a quick bite before a late meeting, fried anchovies and a margertia pie. They were both good, not mind blowing or world changing but solid. The only thing that was a minus was the music. Yeah I know I sound old, but it was horrific. Not only was it horrific but it was definitely played at 11. I sat in the front window by the door so I was directly beneath 3 speakers so that contributed. But really it was so bad (like Italian Devo cover band..actually that makes it sound too good) it affected my enjoyment of the meal.
author: Steve B.

description:
We went here for a very late lunch on Easter Sunday.  Pizzeria Delfina's second location is disappointing in the abstract, and particularly when compared to the spectacular original.  

The food was just ok (but not the "wow" that I've come to expect), and kind of thrown together.  I was lucky enough to stand by the open kitchen while waiting in line for the restroom (at least that is consistent with the original restaurant) and got to watch the meals being hastily prepared.  Not impressive.  

The service was sub par.  Our server (Laura J according to the check), only made infrequent appearances as the table and seemed annoyed at the fact that she had to show up at all.   She was only condescending to us, but  seemed openly hostile to some of the other patrons. Not what you would expect by way of customer treatment in a down economy.   

All in all, I felt like we were at a diner, or an Applebee's, and not getting the type of quality restaurant that you would expect from the people that brought you one of the SF Chronicle's Top 100 restaurants.
author: Brian M.

description:
Had dinner here on Friday night... 

a-mazing. Started with the meatballs and fava beans= the best i've had of each.. so delicious

then the 3 of us shared 2 bottles of wine and

the egg pizza and prosciutto pizza.. so yummy.. i will def be back!!! gialina&delfina= best pizzerias in town!!

yum.
author: Art A.

description: This place gets packed so be prepared to wait but it is so worth it.  Fresh amazing food.  My favorite is the Burratta but you cant go wrong with anything you order.
author: KAREN C.

description: I love this place! You really can't beat their pizza.  Having grown up on the East Coast, I've wondered ever since I moved here why there weren't more places that knew how to make a solid pizza.  Delfina is that and then some.  They always have daily specials that are interesting and really good, and their calzones are also amazing (and also another great food item that's hard to come by in these parts).  Can't complain about the wine menu either! If you haven't tried it, go now!
author: Tammy R.

description:
We decided to have lunch here yesterday with no prior knowledge of the Pizzeria. We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of service and food. 

If you are looking for a great pizza and a friendly staff this is definitely the place to go. 

Highly recommend finishing off your meal with their Zeppole di San Giuseppe (fried pizza dough with a pastry cream). Great way to end your meal. 

Will be going back very soon.
author: Juliana M.

description:
The new location of one of my favorite pizza joints in town does not disappoint. The food is sublime, from the melt-in-your-mouth tender salad greens and zesty lemon dressing of the tricolore salad, to the chewy, crispy, "I swear I can fit another slice into my bloated stomach" pizza crust, to the inexpensive, extremely drinkable Italian wines. 

The decor is pretty generic at the new location, definitely not the no-frills "anti-decor" you get at the Mission one. It's comfortable and pleasant, but  clearly geared more toward the Volvo crowd than the Polvo crowd.  On the plus side, it's a lot bigger, so the wait is merely long, as opposed to excruciating. On the down side, the people watching is not as good while you wait. 

Being the total pizza whore that I am, I would go to either location in a heartbeat.
author: Angie R.

description: Like the vibe, but a tad loud.  The tuna, watercress, beans salad was good.  Pizza was good, but the salt wasn't evenly distributed so in every slice, there was one salty bite.
author: Irene C.

description: The wait can be grueling, but it's just because the food is great and everyone knows it.  We had the sardines as a starter (they are big and served chilled) and they were amazing and memorable.  The pizzas are tasty but small, order one per person if you are really hungry.  I've never been impressed with the salads.  The service is consistently good, and we appreciate the complimentary skinny bread sticks.  You may feel guilty camping out at your table because there is always a line of drooling people waiting.   Yummy and Goooood- but a long and pricy pizza experience.
author: Liz Y.

description:
First visit to the Fillmore Delfina and it was great.  I found parking quickly and less than half a block away and the wait was only five minutes on a Sunday night at 6pm.  The menu here is a little more extensive than the pizzeria in the Mission.  We started off with the small Affettati (charcuteries) plate and the Hearts of Romaine with Green Goddess Dressing and Hazelnuts salad.  The Affettati plate (despite the cool name) was just a selection of cured meats, good, but nothing you can't get at a good grocery store.  The salad though was delicious.  I never thought avocado dressing could be so good and the use of hazelnuts is so perfect.  I'd order it again without hesitation.  

We had our standard Margherita pizza with Bubalis Mozzarella di Bufala.  Perfectly salty and olive oil drenched as usual.  For something new we tried the Neapolitan Meatballs in Sugo which arrived bubbling hot!  The meatballs were delicious nearly melted in the mouth.  The sauce was also perfect to dip the crust of the pizza in.

To finish we had a scoop of the Strawberry and Chocolate Gelato and coffee.  Hoi was extra happy about the lattee served in a tall glass cup instead of a mug or bowl.  Good simple stuff to end the meal with.
author: Edgar C.

description: I have yet to have a bad experience here. Everything from the vibe to the food to the wine on tap is excellent! I love the Tricolore Salad--endive, arugula and radish (I think) with shaved parm and a simple lemon vinegarette. And the sausage and pepper pizza is wonderful! The crust is the right blend of crunchy and chewy. This is definitely a favorite spot!
author: Judy K.

description:
It's solid pizza, but not the best I've ever had. Coming from NYC with a plethora of amazing pizza joints, I had my hopes set high on Delfina.

It was probably the particular pizza I ordered that was "good," but not stellar. Next time I'll order something else.

Come here before the rush around 6pm, otherwise it gets crowded like crazy with tons of people outside.

Oh yeah, and the meatballs were yummy.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Friendly, attentive service, pleasing atmosphere and a good wine selection. The breadsticks are served in a creative manner. The catfish entree can be improved upon by using a pesto that is less salty.
author: Sargeant T.

description: This place is perfect for every occasion. My favorite experience here was with a friend when we sat at the bar. We were watching the chef's make the Burrata. I've never seen it made before so I thought they were making the pizza dough. I was just having fun watching them make it, and when they were done making the ball of very warm soft cheese, they gave us one on the house!! I actually pushed the envelope a little bit and asked if we can have bread with it. Not only did they give the bread to me, they toasted and poured some olive oil on it!
author: Michelle A.

description: Good Pizza! My favorite was the margarita, but truth be told I'm a margarita/cheese pizza kind of person, so its no surprise! I also recommend trying the olive and mozzarella for apps!
author: Andria N.

description:
Plenty of other reviews already, so I can only add a couple of worthwhile tidbits:

-On a cool night, bring a warm jacket and eat outside under the heat lamps.  If you don't mind folks drooling over your pizza as they wait, you will be in and out before most others are even seated.
-Margherita can't compete with A-16, Tony's, or even Pizzetta 211 so don't bother (not enough sauce/mozzarella IMHO).  Get the salsiccia!
-Order a side of warm pizza sauce and dip your crusts.
author: Brett T.

description:
Nice simple decor, large window seating & crunchy thin bread sticks on every table.

The Margherita pizza with its extra thin and bubbly crust was also delicious.

A nice place to stop by for leisurely lunch on a sunny weekday (to avoid lines) afternoon.
author: Flaneur C.

description:
Delfina is consistently delicious and I am so happy to have stumbled upon their Pac Heights location whilst surrounded by the disgusting fair food of The Fillmore Festival. 

My boyfriend and I sat down for lunch and it seemed that within minutes we had plates of fresh and tasty italian delights in front of us. We ordered the pig ears, which were not my choice, but perfectly fried and seasoned as well as the insalata tricolore to start. Personally, I thought the salad was excellent. The ingredients were simple, yet crisp and flavorful. For an entree we split the salsiccia pizza. The crust was thin and crispy and the toppings were little pieces of perfection. 

Overall the meal was delicious and the service was superb. Despite it being a busier than normal day, our friendly waitress was eager to please and made our dining experience a pleasure.
author: Mandi A.

description: I cannot stop thinking about how amazing their pizzas are! I love love love this place. Everyone is very nice and it was worth the 30 minute wait. i cannot wait to go back when im in SF.
author: angelina Y.

description:
At any time of the day, I had always noticed that Pizzaria Delfina had patrons lining up outside the door!  Everywhere you walk around Filmore, you see people walking around with these yellow pizza boxes!  Our curiosity was obviously peaked one Saturday  night and we joined the crowds.  

Instead of waiting for a table we decided to do take out and avoid the hustle and bustle.  We got the veggie calzone appetizer and ordered both the Panna and Margherita pizzas.  

Loved it!  Very tasty pizzas and full of flavor.  I'm so excited that we found such a great place to get specialty personal gourmet pizzas right here in Pac Heights! 

Try it!  You'll love it!
author: Candice M.

description:
Big fan of this place. The pizza is delicious. I love the sausage pizza. If you are a fan of pizza places that dont focus on the cheese as much as the tomato sauce and ingredients on top you will love this place. The tomato sauce is tangy, just the way i like it. I also tried the margharita pizza which was good as well (i still liked sausage pizza more). 

For dessert, they have homemade gelato. Really really good. Get the mint if they have it!

The waiters and waitresses are all very nice and friendly, and cool to talk to actually. Like I asked my waitress what was her favorite and she gave me good responses. Fun atmosphere - they play new music and its a young crowd that typically goes.

Be prepared for a wait. You have to go and put your name on a chalkboard; the wait can be around 20-30 minutes.
author: Steve S.

description:
One of the best pizza in San Francisco, if not THE best one.
Restaurant is sharp looking. Staff is always very nice.
Music is way TOO loud!
author: Elle H.

description:
Love love love that they opened this closer to my hood. Although I do not love that it makes me want to like 20 pizzas everytime I walk by. We went here a few weeks after it opened and sat at the bar. Yes you will have to wait and stand outside, if you are not cool with that than go to dinos on the corner, seriously some things are worth the wait.

I love our pizza and this amazing baked pasta that was the most delicious canelloni I have ever had. I will def be coming back here again and again and don't mind sitting on the sidewalk drinking a glass of wine if it means I can eat their yummy pizza goodness.
author: Katie M.

description:
DEL-ish.

I am seriously thankful that Pizzeria Delfina opened AFTER I moved away from SF. Had this been around when I lived in Pac Heights, I surely would have had to open a house account. 

I was skeptical about PD, having walked by the Mission location on several occasions, I always thought the crust looked a little to doughy, not Neopolitan enough. But, appearances can be deceiving. This is a GOOD pie and the sauce and bufala mozz are perfetto. 

I ended up eating here three out of four days...this is partly out of convenience, ie. walking distance, carry out and outdoor seating for the pup...but it's also because the food is damn good and the menu has enough variety for repeat visits.

Standouts: Margherita Pizza, Bufala ricotta salad, MEATBALLS (with the naughtiest toast you will ever dredge in sauce), Affogato (perfect portion), ARANCINI (ridiculous, really) and the pasta specials. 
 
YES, it is expensive, a little much so. I think the "house" wine pour should probably be less than $9.00 a glass, particularly in these times!
author: Lee T.

description: The pizza was delicious! Margarita and prosciutto with arugula. Yum...
author: Lisa C.

description:
Awesome prosciutto pizza.  Not too oily not too filling.   Just right.

Swordfish was good as was it's mozzarella cheese puffs.
author: Alan T.

description:
Food was excellent!!!  Service was friendly and kept a watchful eye on us, thanks Mel!!  The wait went quickly and the reward of sitting outside made the trip even better, I cannot wait to go back!

Mozzarella "in Carozza"

Grilled Asparagus (w/lardo butter and breadcrumbs)

Broccoli di Ciccio

Broccoli Raab Pizza (broccoli raab, mozzarella di bufala, olives, hot peppers)

Amarena Cherry Sundae (vanilla gelato, chocolate sauce, pistachio, whipped cream) and served in the most delightful little silver dish!

They also have a wonderful wine list to choose from.
author: Steven K.

description:
I was very excited when I found out a Pizzeria Delfina was to open in the space that formerly housed crappy Zao Noodle Bar. I've had Pizza Inferno, Dino, and Extreme Pizza, but none have wowed me enough to become my go-to neighborhood pizzeria. 

Then we ordered take-out from Pizzeria Delfina. I am so grateful that I live two blocks away! We called in our order and 30 minutes later, it was ready for pick up. 

We enjoyed the tricolore salad (good) and the roasted cauliflower (great). But it's all about the delicious, thin crust pizza. We tried the quattro formaggio and the panna with sausage. The four cheese was SO delicious. The combination of the cheeses were delightful and I loved the fresh mozzarella. The sauce was flavorful and tasted very fresh and was pleasantly light. The panna is the pizza with tomato sauce, cream, and basil and the very friendly person who took my order recommended it with sausage. Excellent suggestion: the flavor of the fennel sausage went perfectly with the pizza. 

I don't know if I'll ever have the patience to handle the cramped space and long waits (and therefore miss the nice wine selection), but the pizza was awesome and we will surely order from here many times again in the future!
author: Jenny K.

description:
Had the Napoletana and I have to say, LOVED IT. just the perfect amount of tomato sauce, no cheese (but didn't really need it) and a super thin and crispy crust. YUM!

the baked ziti was moderate. 

would definitely come back and wait in line to get pizza!
author: tessie n.

description: I can't even begin to describe how great this place is. I'm a huge fan of Italian food and this place does it for me. It is by far the best Italian food I've ever had. I hate meat balls but their meat balls quickly became my favorite dish on the menu. And don't even start me on the pizza. Thin crust, tasty, and garlicky pizza that will get you addicted, not only to pizza, but to carbs altogether. We did have to wait for them to take our order but not because of lack of service but because they were way too busy. The food is authentic and everything smells like home made. I can't wait to go back. BRAVO!
author: Willie Y.

description: I could eat pizza for every meal, every day of the week and probably never tire of it. I not only heart P. Delfina for being so close to my house, but for the delicious quality of their ingredients. None of that wretched government cheese (think CyBelle's) flavor here -- the "4 Formaggi" is to die for; and be sure to inspect the special pie of the day, as they're crafty little artisans. The only drawback is the buzz has fostered ridiculous waits, but this is Pacific Heights, so most of these clowns (sorry, neighbors) are way too wimpy to sit outside, so if you're not up for a 50-minute loiter-fest, grab some wood under the space heaters. You'll be done eating before many are even seated.
author: Gregor G.

description:
Been there twice.  

Pros:  
-good beer selection
-good wine selection
-casual atmosphere
-good thin crust-style pizza

Cons:
-expensive for what it is
-menu is too esoteric for my simpleton tastes (besides a salad and pizza, there's not much compelling on the menu)
-some of the staff try too hard to look cool and alternative
author: Greg A.

description:
In contrast to one of the employee's shirt that had a Yelper's comment "this place sucks" in huge letters (he explained that they print only the funniest of them on t shirts for the staff to wear), I cannot agree with whoever wrote that about Pizzeria Delfina. "This place rocks!" would be more fitting and true.
We headed out to the newly opened Pizzeria Delfina in the Fillmore today for lunch. Lip smackin' good it was.

Soup = 4 stars. Nice and zesty with a great flavor.
Olives = 4 stars. They come out hot and soaking in great olive oil.
Mozarella = 4 stars. Good, but burratta would be better.
Tuna Conserva = 5 stars. Amazing, the best I've ever had. The tuna was in the most delicate olive oil I have ever had. To die for.
Clam pie = 4 stars. Not a shabby pie by any measure and genuinely authentic Italian pie (think light on sauce and even lighter on cheese). Clams could have been a little more even spread (most were concentrated on a few slices). 
Service = 5 stars. Very friendly staff, very attentive, with multiple wait persons taking care of you so that you aren't stuck with one who can't keep up.

As one other Yelper mentioned it is very loud in there. I don't think there is much blame you can place on a restaurant for being full of patrons, but it would be nice if some restaurants like this one that can afford to do so planned for better acoustics when they built it. Hardwood floors and empty walls and high ceilings create the worse possible combination for acoustics - the noise just bounces all of the walls. Anything to absorb sound would help, so if you don't like loud places this place may not be for you. If you can handle it though the food makes up for it.
author: Matt H.

description:
We got the Tuna Conserva appetizer and the Salsiccia pizza, both to go. The Tuna Conserva wasn't worth the $10 (too little quantity) but was tasty. The pizza was nice, and flavorful, but not mind blowing.

The 1-teaspoon of red pepper and cheese given in the plastic containers wasn't enough for the 2 of us eating.

Just a reminder, don't even think about eating inside (crazy wait times), unless you like drinking wine for an hour or more on the road! Just take to-go (but then why wouldn't you go to Little Star Pizza instead?)
author: Sumit C.

description: Our first dinner in San Fran (this visit, anyway) was at Pizzeria Delfina, and we enjoyed it a lot.  I really liked the crust on this pizza.  My favorite pie was the special of the day, with lardo, cippolini onions, arugula, and a light tomato sauce.  The margherita was also good, as was another special with chicories and over-easy egg.  The place is teeny tiny, so we had to wait a bit for a table, but the server kept us happy with drinks.  My husband and I don't eat thin-crust pizza a lot at home, so this was a nice treat.
author: Betty R.

description: What a pleasant surprise to come across Pizzeria Delfina in our new neighborhood!  It was a busy Tuesday night but we got seated quite fast.  The larger than 2 groups had a longer wait.  Tried the Napoletana - excellent sauce.  Crunchy blistered crust.  Loved it although it was a bit light on the anchovies.  The waitress said we could ask for extra the next time.  There will be many next times...
author: Ash A.

description:
Love the breadsticks! BUT I think this place is over-rated. I like the space. The tables are quite close together, but it didn't bother me too much. 

This might not interest anyone, but as a server I thought it was cool: The micros/aloha computer stations are built into the counters!

My bf and I were super hung over and starving. Came in here on  Monday around 3pm. The service was fast and polite, not really friendly though. 

We shared the Margarita Pizza was was just so-so. I've had better. No tomatoes on it. . .just sauce. Pretty stingy on the cheese that we paid extra for (upgraded to real mozzarella di buffala).

All in all, I wouldn't go back. I much rather give my business to Dino's around the corner-a Fillmore street staple since I was in preschool!
author: Annette M.

description: Delicious pizza and salad. If you want something different, or for an ap, I totally recommend the meatballs. They're probably a million calories but are awesome. Usually the wait is not too long (between 20-45 minutes) depending on the size of your party.
author: Emily K.

description:
Why 4 stars? Because there is room for improvement.

We put our name down at around 8:20, and was told to come back in 20 minutes. Came back after 25 minutes and were seated right away at the bar (which was actually cool, b/c you could watch the chefs make food).

The margharita pizza was delicious, the crust was soft and perfect. The tuna salad with white beans was very good as was the chicken soup. For dessert we ordered the Brioche with chocolate & stracciatella mint gelato , which was delicious. The white wine on tap was very good as well.

The service was definitely the downfall of the experience. We ordered two glasses of the white wine on tap, but our waitress forgot about them. After we received our appetizers, we reminded her & she brought them to us pretty quickly. We also didn't get any of the bread sticks, which we asked for later. Our waitress disappeared towards the end of our meal, but luckily another guy picked up her slack (we saw her at the end of the bar playing with her iPhone).

Overall the food was excellent, the service was not that great, the prices were very reasonable & I will definitely go back!
author: Elaine S.

description: Went here for a late night dinner (funny how that means 10pm in SF - I think that's at least 1am in NY...) & I was super impressed with the pizza and liked the appetizers (although I like my fava beans raw and the ones I had with pecorino were flash boiled, but how picky am I!!!). Delfina has somehow managed to stay true to Italian flavor but in a hip SF ambiance. Another picky gripe - what's with the tiny plate of crushed red pepper/grated parmesan/ herb branch taking up space on the miniscule table. May I suggest space saving "olio piccante" (spicy italian red peppers in olive oil)???
author: J T.

description:
The do make a great pie, but I am still partial to Pauline's, and think Tommasso's and Little star are on equal footing compared to this new Delfina location.   When in the neighborhood, I have to say this trumps Dino's (no knock on Dino's hospitality and loyalty to the area).  

The interior design is far superior to most pizzaria's.  They have a great aethetic to go with their brand.   Hip and clean look.  No mediterranean murals or glass bottles full of rotting pickled veggies, and thank GOD there is no typical North beach Neon.

It was not all it was cracked up to be.  A lardo/arugula/cippolini pizza, iced tea, + service AND health charge for 2 came out to $26.  That was a bit steep.  I love quality pizza, but at its most basic function, needs to be more filling.
author: Christian W.

description:
Had a lovely meal. The pizzas were delicious and the service was fantastic. The wait staff was very observant. I never had an empty water jug on my table for more than 15 seconds. 

The only potential downside is the unpredictable wait, but once you're digging into the gelato you will know it was totally worth it.
author: Cyrus S.

description: Underwhelmed by my meal here. After working up an appetite while shopping on Fillmore, I was in the mood for some pizza and was caught in a dilemma -- cheap eat Dino's or fancy, rave reviewed Pizzeria Delfina, two store fronts down. My friend and I opted for Delfina and overall didn't think it was that amazing -- maybe I missed something? Perhaps the hype killed it for me? Got the Saliccia pizza which was all right - the sausages were great, but overall the mozzarella was just okay. Our salad that we started with was overly bitter. We didn't finish either, and I'm typically licking the plate clean.
author: Michelle B.

description:
DON'T ASK FOR GARLIC!

Approximately three weeks ago, I had a friend visiting from New York and my husband and I took her to Delfina's Pizza on California Street. Pizza is her favorite food. Everything went well...we arrived before the hour wait and were seated immediately. The staff were very accommodating and gracious. The food and wine very good.

However, when we asked for garlic either on our marguerita pizza (or served on the side) , we were told by the waitress and manager that they were not allowed to serve it to us...against management policy and it would ruin the delicate flavors of the pizza (even though there were hot dried peppers, dried cheese and fresh basil on the table). Doesn't that change the taste of the delicate flavor?

What ever happened to the customer is always right and who is paying for the meal? We're not talking about a Michelin 3 Star Restaurant.
author: Arlene H.

description: This place is always really crowded, so I often opt for take out, but every appetizer, pizza, and dessert I've had has been delicious.  It might be a little pretentious for pizza, but it's definitely worth it.
author: Allison D.

description: Pizza was great as always (after a 50 min wait on a Thurs night) but the music was so loud my group of 4 could hardly talk and I left an hour later with my ears ringing. Also, the server forgot to box up our leftover pizza.
author: Michael B.

description:
Pizzeria Delfina makes a fine pizza, perhaps the dough is a little sweet for my liking but, I do appreciate having a good option for to-go pizza close to home. And sometimes making things easy makes up for a lot. I'm sure we will be back.

On a side note, I wish people in Pac Heights would figure out how to use the metered lot next to it. It's certainly not rocket science. I had to watch (painfully I might add) a group of ladies ahead of me trying to figure the machine out.
author: J B.

description: Pizzeria Delfina is one of my favorite restaurants to just end up at. The wait can be long but always worth it.
author: Angela K.

description: LOVE this place!  Not really for the food (though I have never had anything there that I haven't liked) but for the Gragnano.  THE best sparkling wine I have ever had.  Deep red, chilled and delicious, I would (and do) make the treck there solely for it.  I would also recommend their spicy cauliflower dish along with the stretched Mozzarella appetizer and the Salsiccia pizza.  Delicious!
author: Jessica H.

description: Great food, the cherry pie pizza was great.  Really friendly staff, good wine, and an all around fun lunch!  There was no wait for the two of us on monday late afternoon.
author: Rebecca W.

description: A great neighborhood spot that we found during our trip.  Loved it!  This little area is so cute.  Very calm, clean, and nice.  We tried several different pizzas.  Margherita (which the little one gobbled down), one with capers and anchovies (ask for the tomato sauce to be added!), and a funghi.  Whoa.  The mushroom pizza was awesome.  Perfect level of saltiness and meaty, delicious mushrooms!  What a great place!
author: Stephanie H.

description: Some of the best Pizza in this city.  Melts in your mouth for sure.  I crave this pizza in my sleep, makes my skinny butt feel like a fatass but it's worth it !
author: S G.

description:
My pizza search continues.  I've been on the search for 8 years for a fantastic pizza experience in the Bay Area.  It's been a long journey, and it's going to continue.

I picked up a four cheese pizza from Pizzeria Delfina to check it out.  I started with four cheese because I think a basic pizza is the best way to suss out good pizza. 

My pizza crust was a bit burnt and the edge was quite bubbled up.  I had to apply the cheese, oregano & pepper flakes that came with the pizza. Doing this made me feel like I was basically dressing up bread and cheese.

The pizza was satisfactory, but I know and I believe that there's better pizza out there somewhere in San Francisco that's waiting for me to discover it.
author: Jean C.

description:
Well, I am the first person to write a review who has actually been to the place.  What is with people on this site??!??

Anyway, went there tonight, opening night for the public.  Overall, I am pretty impressed.

I haven't been to Pizzaria Delfina in the Mission, so I can't compare.

For appetizers, we ordered the mixed olives, they were warm and delicious.  We also got the fresh pulled mozzarella which was good, but just good, not terribly exciting.  We also shared the salsiccia pizza which I thought was excellent, but my date thought had a crust that was too thick.  She got a nice glass of wine and I got the limeade, which was very good.

Overall, not bad, espeiclaly since it was opening night and the staff was raw and had opening night jitters.
.
author: John L.

description:
Living downtown I've been anxiously awaiting this one. (Don't always feel like risking my life walking down Mission. Its not the gangs- its the crazy drivers! Or maybe the crazy gang drivers). In any case, this place looks great, after signing in on the oversize chalkboard (a good idea judging by the crowds) you're greeted by this great mural of the City. felt right at home and was welcomed with a glass of wine and breadsticks while we waited.

The pizzas were superlative. Superior ingredients and a crisp blistered, flame-licked crust. We enjoyed the tuna-conserva, but the house-made Mozzarella was a bigger hit.

Our server was very pleasant and knowledgeable about the exclusively Italian winelist (not my forté). He actually suggested a sparkling red we both loved, a Bracchetto I think. 

Why no 4th star you ask? Gotta agree with the other reviews: the Noise is DEFEANING. like I would bring my rockshow earplugs. there's no sound-defeaning anything, except lots of happy people.
author: Todd B.

description:
I love the new space and beautiful mural-covered wall. It's double the size of the Mission restaurant but we still waited nearly 30 minutes for a table at 8 pm on the Saturday after it opened in Pacific Heights. We did notice that if you held off till 9 pm, people were seated wait free.

We scored a booth and started off with a delectable, lightly fried mozzarella  and anchovy sauce appetizer before devouring the broccoli raab pizza [broccoli raab, ricotta, oven-dried tomatoes and mozzarella] and the 4 Formaggi [Mozzarella, fontal, provolone and pecorino] both of which stayed true to the PD tradition of delicate, flavorful thin-crust pizza with plenty of leftovers for the next day.

The service was attentive and friendly, happy hipsters flooded all the tables, and the food was great. (Though I have to admit I think their bursting-with-flavor appetizers outrank the pizza.)

We're thrilled to have Pizzeria Delfina open three blocks from our apartment - this will be our regular pizza haunt from now on!
author: Sharand N.

description: $96 for pizza for 4 people seems excessive.  The pizza was good, two pizzas, 2 beers and 1 glass of wine.  I come from New Haven CT, home of great piazza, Frank Sinatra used to have his pizza flown to his shows from Sally's, so I am spoiled.
author: Mark W.

description:
can i just say i really get the hype of this pizza margherita.... NOT

in other words this crust is quite horrible

apparently they use san marzano tomatoes 4 the sauce which saves them haha

also here is the correct menu link 4 this location ok

http://www.pizzeriadelfina.com/pacificHeights_menu.html
author: Ruby S.

description: A favorite! Not a whole lot to say that no one else has already said. Great food, great atmosphere. The broccoli rabe pizza is my all time FAV! Love this place, we go all the time!
author: jennifer c.

description: This place rocks! It couldn't be better! I eat there 3 times a week, cuz its 2 blocks away from where I live. Pobably some of the best Meatballs I have ever eaten. The pizza is amazing! They definitely know what they are doing. The service is so friendly and upbeat, especially when they are all so busy. Write your name on the blackboard, get a glass of wine and enjoy chatting outside while you wait for your table.
author: lisa b.

description:
The food is not bad but not greater than other pizza spots.  This is one of those places that people reflexively line up for like Sears cafe or Dotties because they've drunk some wierd Kool-aid.  

It's like that quote from the movie the Hours answering the question about San Francisco 'people just tell you it's great' or something to that affect.

Anyway Delfina's Pizza is one of  those places people visiting the city for 5minutes might say is great but meh.  They make a maguerita pizza you can make at home - and with much less olive oil.  Served with busy diner pretense the food is nice as well as the rushed servers.  The crowds are a hassle and not worth the wait because there are several other really great spots in the city.  

(Check my other Pizza Reviews for the real skinny)

Delfina does get a couple style points for the chalk board but a big negatory for the horrible color sense in the cityscape mural.  This place thinks big but is like a well groomed yet pleasant cheesball.
author: Chango M.

description: Went on a Thurs night and was greeted with a line out the door but I must say this place is worth the wait. Put your name on the chalkboard just inside the door and see all the names waiting for a table ahead of you. Then order a drink at the counter and cozy up next to a tree or parking meter. They will bring it out to you. When you finally get seated enjoy any one of their pizzas.The sausage was my favorite. Can't wait to go again.
author: Jason R.

description: Everything was perfect, from the simple pizza to the wine to the heirloom salad to the chocolate sundae.  I wish I could have the chocolate sundae every evening before bed.
author: Christina S.

description:
I came into this place with about 5 people telling me it's the pizza they ever had. We waited about an hour for a table for two on a Friday night. 

The pizza was okay, just okay. It was definitely not the best pizza I ever had or even that particularly memorable. I'm from the East Coast so perhaps I'm just pickier and I also have no idea of what else is available in SF, but my opinion is that it's just alright. 

The best part of the meal was an appetizer of skewered mozzarella. It was really delicious!

Service was good and the prices were average.
author: Eva B.

description:
when did a small pie (with no sauce) cost $17??!!
Delfina's Pizza has definitely answered to the supply-and-demand method. The new, bigger location is packed most nights....but I think Tommasso's, A-16, and Gaspare's are better overall.
author: Yinnie Q.

description: It's good, but it's not the end-all be-all.  The hipster aesthetic is a little out of control here.  Not so cheap, long waits.  If the pizza wasn't so good I'd probably hate them.
author: Jessa C.

description: this pizza was definitely very good. i am a huge fan of new york style pizza so more fancy original italian style i tend to dislike. however, i converted temporarily after eating the pizza here. i had their salsiccia pizza with homemade sausage and it was amazing. the front service staff were very nice and helpful. highly recommend this place.
author: Anish P.

description:
So-so. The pizza didn't have enough cheese on it; there were entire areas without cheese, that sometimes had some other topping (sausage) but often did not. Cheese is the most important part! Disappointing for a pizza place. Also, they don't take reservations, and when we arrived they told us the wait would be around 15 minutes, but really we had to stand around (outside in the cold) for forty minutes. If we'd known, we could have gone somewhere else.

But the rum baba dessert was delicious, and by itself would get 5 stars.
author: J M.

description:
I don't have a huge amount to add to the other reviews - as said previously,  the food is quite tasty - especially the pizza - yum yum.  But it's a loud madhouse -  not remotely relaxing.  One thing I will mention is that I was extremely impressed with the staff's training and commitment to quality.  We sat at the bar watching preparations, and there were no shortcuts that I saw - extreme focus on having everything come out right.  I watched the drink preparer spend quite a few minutes to get a tiny seed out of a carafe of fresh lemonade - a teeny tiny seed in a hectic environment.  
But the noise, crowds and frenetic pace is quite a detractor - and we were there on a Saturday afternoon.  Good news is that it's popular, I guess.
author: Ellen H.

description:
I think this branch is experiencing some serious startup problems.  My girlfriend and I visited this restaurant recently for what should have been a quick dinner but ended up spending way longer than we had wanted to at this restaurant.  We didn't order much.  Just an appetizer, salad, and a pizza.  But the salad and pizza took almost 1 hr to arrive.  Other tables which had been seated after us got their meals and had already left by the time we started into our pizza.

I think we got everyone on a bad night.  It was disappointing since I had been eagerly anticipating this restaurant for a while and its unfortunate that my first experience was clouded by bad service.

Otherwise I thought the pizza was ok.  It didn't really blow my mind or anything.  But its a nice alternative to other places in the area.  I was pleasantly surprised by how relatively cheap it was.

We had

Cheese fried in a batter of risotto
Insalate Tricolore 
Broccolli Rabe Pizza
Bottle of Wine
Gelato on a Brioche
author: Peter C.

description: Perhaps the best crust I have ever had! Friendly service, fresh ingredients. Love that you can watch them make the pizzas and salads. The tricolore salad was an excellent way to start. You really can't go wrong with which pizza you order.
author: Anna G.

description: This is one of the greatest pizza I've ever had - truly i can say that delfina knows how to make great  pizza and also you can tell that they use the freshest ingrediets and organic. The pizza and their salads are truly delicious!!
author: Joiera C.

description: This pizza redefines what pizza can be. I'm not saying it reinvents pizza because I'm sure some one at some time in Italy made pizza like this. I'm just glad it's available in SF.
author: Jessica B.

description: I've been twice in recent months and enjoyed it both times. From the delightful house red (Unti Segromigno) to the simple yet delicious pizzas, I'd highly recommend Delfina. Just be prepared to wait for a table (but they do let you order drinks while you wait...).
author: Corey B.

description: Great 4-star restaurant! Love the Prosciutto Pie!!! Service is great, too. Don't forget to write your name on the chalk board to get seated!
author: Jerald B.

description: Enjoyed the Prosciutto Pie, Watermelon Salad, and Tangerine/Plum Gelato w/ Briochefor linner with a couple of girlfriends.  Everything was tasty, and service was fantabulous.  I've never had Gelato w/ Brioche, but it turned out to be a delish combo of tart frozen goodness with slightly sweet bread.  I'll be coming back to try more of the thin crusted pizzas fo sho.
author: Tina F.

description:
I went to delfina about a year ago and I have to say I was expecting it to be way better than I found it to be.... since so many people had told me it was the coolest restauraunt in the city, celebs have been spotted at it blah blah blah!
I found the food alright  I mean I'm not a tough critic when it comes to food.. but the only thing the pizza had going for it was the cheese and the little bit of basil they gave me mixed together..... which didn't cut it that night cause I was starving from walking around for over an hour trying to find a restraunt for my friends birthday cause our favorite restauraunt (suppenkuche) was closed..  anyway for dessert I waited 45 minutes for them to bring me 3 little spoonfuls of chocolate gelato which I wasn't impressed with at all.  Oh and the wait time was an 1 and a half hours which just sent me over the edge when I learned they didn't even bother to give you bread but 5 little BREADSTICKS. So anyway to feed 3 economic 
people= 66 dollars plus tip. NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN!
author: Sophia C.

description: The food is absolutely delicious but there is always a wait, its very expensive, and once you do wait and get seated they rush you. Next time, I'll probably take my order to go.
author: Liz H.

description:
Okay, I know everyone and their uncle has reviewed Pizzeria Delfina, but seeing as this is one of my very favorite places in the city, I have to add my two cents. 

I have been been to Pizzeria Delfina easily over 20 times, and only once have I had a pizza that didn't make me swoon (the dough was a bit too thick in certain parts of the pie). 

My two fav dishes here: tuna conserva (oh-my-god, briny heaven: chunks of tuna mixed into Tuscan beans and peppery arugula with a lemon dressing) and the four cheese pizza. I have had pizzas with toppings here as well, but always come back to the four cheese - the blend of salty, stringy gooey cheese is perfection. 

Two cheers for the service as well - the staff is always cheery and handles the massive crowds pooling around the front with grace. 

To wrap it up: one of my favorite ways to spend a warm evening is to walk down to Pizzeria Delfina, grab a glass of wine and people watch while I wait for a table. Oh - and sitting at the counter is fun as well- I am in love with their tiered pizza oven.
author: traci p.

description:
Amanda says: 
We come here so often the guy with the awesome glasses recognizes my signature. (Which I guess is saying something about my signature, and my face? I dunno, but one of them is SUPER memorable). We get the Panna (pah-nah) and the Broccoli Rabe every time. Basically, we are creatures of habit with snobby taste buds. Case closed. 

relationship status: 
hot and heavy
author: AmanDave H.

description:
Its New Years Eve and I saved my 100th review for Delfina.   It was the perfect way to end/start a new year.  Unfortunately when my BFF and I arrived, there was a 30 minute wait and several patrons seated were not even served yet.  We were both straving and really didn't want to be eating at the bare minimum an hour away, so we meandered around the corner for some yummy pasta at Vivande.   Was not the same, I was so looking forward to bringing in the new year with Pizzeria Delfina.  Oh well, there always next week. . . 
and ps. . . I can give this 4 stars because I have been a long long time customer of  Delfina and have followed Craig Stolls career.  So there.
author: Kea C.

description: Woulda and coulda been a 4+ star review, but the pizzas came out sporadically.  We ordered 3 salads and 2 pizzas.  The first pizza came out, and the server said the next one was on it's way.  15 minutes later we asked when that second pizza would arrive.  When asked about the 2nd pizza, instead of just being accountable and saying they messed up and it's coming out, they just said it's "coming soon".  Soon was at least 10-15  more minutes after we asked, and I could see from the arguing in the kitchen that they just forgot it.  The 2nd pizza came out around 30 minutes after the first pizza.  Mind you, the first one was for the meat eaters, the second for the vegetarians.  So we had basically ended up watching each other eat.
author: M T.

description: One of the best pizzas to be had in town. If you like thin crust pizza, especially like they do in Italy (vs NYC), then this is the place for you. Like unusual combinations of toppings? Then this place is icing for your cake. Wait can be very long though, when they're busy.
author: Walter W.

description: Great pizza--price can really add up if up if you're not careful though.  Wait goes pretty quick unless the line is out the door.  You can get takeout too, which always seems to surprise some people.
author: T H.

description:
THE CLOSEST I HAVE GOTTEN TO TRUE ITALIAN IN SF... yess i said it, delfina you have hit the nail on the head! everything here is authentic and delicious, and you can tell they use great quality ingredients. I have been here a few times each time being someone new along with me and each time have each of my guests fall in love the the restaurant as much as me. 
service is exceptional, the food is delcious and authentic.
The pizza crust is perfectly thin and stretchy and tasty. Every pizza i ahve tried is original and delcious with the freshest toppings. And to add to the amazingness they have the chicken dish, chicken alla diavolo... almost like my moms rosemary chicken. It is so tender and juicy perfectly seasoned with pepper and rosemary and garlic it is a spicy, rosemary chicken that melts in your mouth. My suggestion, get the chicken and a pizzza and share with someone its the perfect combo.
author: Shadi N.

description: The service was impeccable. I was seated almost immediately for a party of 2 on a Saturday night around 8pm.  The food was delicious a little on the greasy side, but probably my fault since I order fried pig ears and sardines.
author: Skye W.

description:
It's been a while since I've written a review. Delfina Pizzeria most certainly has awakened my senses in so many yummy ways. 

Table of 3, arrived 8PM, wrote name on board, waited for 15-20 minutes to be seated b/c obviously, dinner time. The music could be quite loud... didn't appreciate it much, but hey, it's to keep the employees happy and the momentum going. Okay, food.

I apologize, I don't remember what the dishes were called b/c my friend did the ordering. We ordered 1. a pizza w/ tomato sauce, sausage, cheese, red bell peppers 2. dish of the mussels 3. meatballs 4. escarole salad (tuna flakes and lemon squeeze) 5. wine 6. canelones, 2 glasses of red, 1 beer, scoop of strawberry and vanilla bean gelato(tiny!) EVERYTHING was uber delicious! I just love their red sauce in the meatballs.. the meatballs were super tender, moist, flavorful, pizza was just yummm! I wanted more! The mussels were yummy, but I was expecting more of a garlic flavor, however, the broth had sliced jalepenos! yum! the broth isn't spicy/hot unless u take in a jalepeno. The escarole salad was tasty however, it was lacking something... it was dressed in lightly but a little to salty, definitely not bland. I wasn't ever a big fan of canelones, don't know why, but I did enjoy Defina's canelones, the cheese was stringy, cheesy, and the pasta was delicate yet still had a bite to it. 

I wasn't fabbed by the waitress only b/c my friends and I did most of the work there. Us 3 sat in a tiny table and definitely had to make room on the small space we had, but she just stood there with food in her hands, but luckily, my friend and I have been and are in the restaurant business so we know how to maneuver plates around... shame shame. But that's a pesky little problem that I have and not theirs. Delfina, I shall return.  Oh right, Our bill was right over $113. (4% health tax)
author: Margherita S.

description: Loved Pizzeria Delfina!  The two pizzas I tried, the Panna and the Salsiccia, were even better than I thought they would be, despite my high expectations.  It was great to have a crispy thin crust and creative ingredients as a change of pace from regular pizza places. I'm a big fan of sparkling wine, so also tried a glass of their delicious sparkling red, which I think was Aglianico Blend "Gragnano" - Grotta del Sole, Campania - http://www.klwines.com/detail.asp?sku=1044698
author: Laura B.

description:
It's just too loud. Really. NOT a pleasant experience. And it's hard to digest when you're cringing. The pumped up music just makes the people at the next table scream at one another, which adds to more noise. 

Food was good. I can't say great, but good. I'd consider take out from here, but would not wait 40 minutes again to be assaulted by noise.
author: Louise L.

description: I love delfina..I have been trying to find better pizza places...but its been soo hard...enough said.
author: N B.

description: This place has the best pizza in Pac heights hands down!! maybe even in the entire city. thier antipasto is always amazing, the staff is very friendly and the pizza to die for......a must have !
author: Ruca R.

description:
I have eaten here before, back in February, LOVED the Marghertia pizza but hadn't been back until last night. Now, I am sure I won't be back for even a longer period of time. 
So I was ranting and raving to my "date" about how good this pizza is. And ughhhh...Delfina....you let me down! 
We ordered these mozzarella/risotto ball's which were quite tasty and cheesy. And then the pizza came. The presentation was not nice as the pizza had big black (burnt) bubbles on the crust. I can do dark brown but not charcoal black. But whatever, I don't usually eat the end of the crust anyways, unless I am still starving. 
The reason I usually order a Margherita pizza is because I am a HUGE basil fan. The pizza had 2 pieces on it. And I am not exaggerating (usually I do exaggerate, but not this time). And the basil tasted a little weird, In fact we don't think it was basil at all. It kinda tasted like what one would smell walking through hippy hill in the park. Hmmmmm.....It was very strange. Is the pizza made in a smoke fired oven?
The also was not much cheese on it and the mozzarella that was on it, was not really melted. But overall, it was not bad. Just lackluster.
