Needless to say, we should have said something to the server about the "basil" but we were having to good of a time....laughing.
author: Kelley D.

description: I love the location and space. The atmosphere is really laid back andhas a  very fillmore/pac heights modern feel to it. I am in love with the Pizza Margherita. I can't remember if they take reservations or not, but when you walk in you put your name down on the giant chalk board and wait for your name to be called. A great place to have a glass of wine after work or share a pizza and chat with a friend.
author: Sarah T.

description: Solid pizza, we had the Raab Broccoli, wine on tap, Barbara was fantastic for the price, olives were nice, service was not bad. I have to say though for a pizza joint that is famous, although the pizza was good, the dough was under salted and it was clearly too greasy. Also if you sponsor a local cycling team, your staff should know and not look at you blankly when you ask.
author: Hippocamp W.

description: I'm a die hard chicago pizza fan but this place is amazing! Sangiovese while I wait, tricolore salad to start and a margarita pizza all the way. Definitely a long wait for a table, but then the food comes out at a good pace.
author: Jessica H.

description:
600 reviews think the emperor has clothes on. Well, well.

I eat out all the time for various reasons.  I am mature
and levelheaded and I cook!  I have been to more restaurants in this town for 30 years than there even  are in this town.

And I must say, this place

IS OVERRATED!!!

There are so many fresh off the bus from Iowa or Orange County  bumpkin yuppies in this town with
no taste whatsoever, yammering on and glomming onto
whatever they're told is hip or whatever, and I think it is
they who have created the ridiculous hype around this
rather unpleasant place.

It is insanely noisy. Horribly uncomfortable. Crowded to the point of "how do I find the way out without breaking something?   Pretentious "edgy"  canned music. Bellowing (skinny white guy geek-hipster) line cooks.  Busily self-important staff who seem more like  acolytes of a cult than waitresses. 

Every time I come here (3 total) I find 2 or 3 things on the menu that look vaguely palatable after 15 minutes of scrutiny.
Then I think about leaving.  I give in, and I regret it. Again.
I have been to Italy.   I cook.  The food here just is NOT that special.  The breadsticks, made by poster child Mission
Mexican immigrant ladies, are the best thing here.

There are three places here in Sf that make pizza to 
swoon over.  This is not one of them.  And there's too much salt in the soup, for lack of other flavors.

BAH!
author: harmonia b.

description:
Summary: Burnt, oily pizza and annoying server.

Detail: Knowing about the Delfina in the Mission, my wife and I decided to try the place out.  We ordered a salad and a pizza.  

We got the salad (which was very small, but pretty good) quickly and then we waited...  and waited... and waited for 25 minutes.  

We flag our waitress down and ask her about our pizza. She says 'Our pizzas take 4 minutes to bake and your pizza is in the oven'  BUT, we've been waiting for 25 minutes!  Does it take 20 minutes to put together a pizza?  The place wasn't even busy. 

5 minutes later we get our pizza.  The edges were burnt and it was loaded with olive oil.  Our waitress comes by and tells us, 'By the way, our pizzas normally take 25-30 minutes to make.  So, your pizza was well within that time limit.'  The tone in her voice made it seem like it was a privilege to have pizza at the place.

$30 for a salad, burnt pizza and an annoying server?  Go two doors down and eat at Dino's.
author: Steve L.

description: Interesting thin style pizza very tasty with unique texture. Service was good. Very fresh ingredients and attention to detail.
author: Kent P.

description:
Love the mission location, but this one is closer to home, so I stopped in with a friend this past weekend.  There was a huge line outside, but most parties were 3 or more, so being only two, as always, has its advantages!
We were seated after only waiting about 10 minutes.  I had the tuna salad and my friend had the sun-choke soup.  The food came rather slow, and the waitress never brought my friends soda.  She even acknowledged that she forgot it and funny enough, never returned with it.  She was also slow to  bring us the bill even after we asked.  She also never came to get it off the table, so I searched in my wallet to get the exact change and we just left it on the table.  I think our waitress was doing too many jobs:(  I would have given it another star, but the service was really bad!  I thought the food was good not stellar.
author: Lisa S.

description:
i instantly became a fan of pizzeria delfina as soon as i was seated.  since the place is quite popular (you need to get there early), my friend and i lucked out when we were able to get in by opting to sit at the bar, which i found more entertaining since you're able to watch the action.

my friend and i each got a pizza...i know...cra-z-z-z-ay!  i ordered the salciccia, which they make their own fennel sausage...highly recommend it!  we shared an appetizer...the mozzarella burratta...yuumm!  though, their mozzarella isn't as creamy as i have had at A16, they provide more pieces of crostini, as well as a side of arugula in vinaigrette.

i had no room for dessert, though some items sounded very, very good.  however, my eyes are on the meatballs for next time...i was staring at them all night...they look beyond delicious!
author: Kelly T.

description:
i didn't make any new years resolution... but if i were to stick to one this year it would to eat as much food as possible. pizzeria delfina would definitely make that happen!! 

so i come here on my lunch break and ask "what pizza are you guys known for?" to which the cashier replied "our panna have received a ton of awards." i mean, come on? who am i to turn down an award winning pizza?!? so i ordered a panna pizza and spicy cauliflower antipasti to go. 

20+ minutes later i am walking back to work and cant wait to DIVE into my food!! i take a bite of the spicy cauliflower... is this supposed to be cold?! hmmm, maybe not my favorite thing and kinda disappointing cause i LOVE cauliflower. so I take a bite into my pizza. OMG!! it sang me a lullaby cause next thing I knew I FINISHED THE WHOLE THING!! HOW DID THIS HAPPEN? my taste buds and belly want more!!!! then I think...great... now what the hell am I supposed to do with the box?! i mean, my name is on it so i cant just act like its not mine!! oh wth, I'm a damn proud heffer!! 

with that i ordered 2 more pizzas before i went home. thats right you heard me 2 more ON THE SAME DAY!!! so i get whats fresh (did you know they put out a new menu for the freshest things everyday?!) the FUNGI and the clam pie. 

sadly it does not come close to the tasty morsel that is the panna pizza. but EVEN with the disappointments comes my love and loyalty to the great PANNA PIE!! its not your fault nothing compares to you. i love you and i cant wait to sink my teeth into you again!!
author: Christine L.

description: Best pizza ever. Excellent service & all is delicious. The review said it's not good for groups but we had 10 in our party & they sat us outside with the heat lamps. Awesome place - looking forward to going back.
author: Ellen C.

description:
We've been to both many times, but I think the reason we come to this location more is because seating and parking are slightly better here.  

If it's just my husband and I, we always get the Salsiccia pizza and one of the specials.  One of our fav special is the Baked Lumachine with Sunday Supper Sauce.  If the arancini are on the menu, those are a nice add on and if we are really hungry, the second on the pizza list is the Prosciutto Pie. 

Service is friendly and prompt.  Always a safe go-to option if you have friends in town.
author: Nessa W.

description:
lots better when you eat this pizza in the restaurant, but who wants to wait in line....sigh.  the line gets super long and i get annoyed when im hungry.  sausage pizza and tricolore salad to go!  

btw, the fried pig ears are tasty!  i usually don't eat this kinda stuff, (i'm a bad asian, not into the internal organs and mystery parts that most asians LOVE), but this fried treat was really tasty!  def limonize these, adds a bit of zing to the flavor.  they used to have this as a special, but they've made it onto the regular menu.  give it a try, if you dare!
author: Wendy S.

description: I wish I had more time to talk about Pizzeria Delfina. I live in Washington, DC and happened upon a website talking about hidden menu items and noticed that Pizzeria Delfina had such a few hidden menu items. I decided the next time I was San Francisco I would stop by and order one. Man-o-man am I glad I did! The pizza was fantastic -- ate the entire pie! Service and staff were both great! I can't say enough good things about this place!
author: Michael Q.

description:
Everything about this restaurant was superb. However, we went early so there were parents with kids, people picking up take-out, people waiting for tables; all of this was tolerable and okay. What was unbelievable was that they have speakers on LOUD belting out heavy rock and roll. Love rock and roll but this on top of everything else was just TOO MUCH!!!!! Ruined my meal which was sooooo good.

Would love to go back but it would have to be alone or with someone I don't want to talk to as I'd have to wear ear plugs. Why they do this is a mystery to me????
author: Sandra B.

description:
I've gone here with friends quite a number of times and I love it! I can't recall all the various pizzas that we've had, but here's a few of the highlights:

purgatorio (with eggs) - if you like eggs, you'll love this pizza

gricia - so i've never had a pizza here that i didn't like, but this remains my absolute favorite! there's no cheese or sauce though they pour cream on it, the guanciale is melted in and looks nearly transparent and onions are sprinkled throughout.

meatballs - the best i've ever had, simple and hearty. they're pretty heavy though and when you come right down to it, i'd still rather get another pie over the meatballs.
author: Tammy L.

description: We came here around 5pm for dinner and no wait, but it quickly got packed. We had a salad ($8.50), the salsiccia pizza ($15), and the calzone ($13)! The pizza was 12" and has 6 slices. The calzone was just okay; not sure if it's my cup of tea since it had ham in it and I'm not a huge fan of ham! I guess I am bias. Would I come here again? Probably! For the pizza and the salad.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
i like this location more than the one in the mission.  it's bigger, so not only do you get a table faster, but you actually get a few inches of elbow room.  

the pizza is delicious.  really, really delicious crust (and this coming from a thick crust/deep dish lovin' maniac!).  i always order the panna pizza, except when there is a pizza with an egg on it.  seriously, egg on pizza = to die for.

the tricolore salad is one of my all time favorites.  super fresh with an amazing made from scratch lemon vinegarette.  and of course it helps that they cover the salad with shreds of delicious cheese.
author: Melissa C.

description: Finally, a restaurant I've wanted to try for a long time that actually lives up to the hype. We got there early and had no problems getting a table, but I was shocked to see the huge wait that accumulated at 6 p.m. - on a Tuesday! As for food, the spicy cauliflower was fantastic, as was the tri colore salad. We ordered two pizzas - the margherita and the sausage with peppers - and both were delicious, though the marg could have used twice the amount of basil. I love Delfina's pizza because they don't char the crust into oblivion; it has that wood fired taste without going overboard. I can't wait to go back and try their other pies.
author: Beth T.

description: just had full brunch 30 minutes ago so decided to get in line for some ice cream. A friend said there's a pizza join next block I'm gonna get us some while u wait for da cream. We met up at delfina with friend, holding three pizzas. We devoured them (clam, egg, n fresh mozz). I love nyc ones but these were pretty damn good. Next time we'll sit down n definitely give this a five.
author: Diesel M.

description:
My boyfriend and I enter and waited to be seated and then we noticed that there was a blackboard on the wall for the wait list (duh!). Anyways, it didn't take long for us to be seated and it looked like we got there right before the evening rush, lucky us =).

We got seated and the waitress asked if we needed any help on deciding on what to get and seeing as it was our first time being there, she recommended meatballs and the panna pizza. We were trying to decide on what to split so we did go with the meatballs but I was looking to see how their clam pie was, so clam it was.

The meatballs and the pizza came to our table at the same time! Meh, I don't really mind, but it would have been nice to eat the meatballs first before the pizza got cold. The meatballs were heavenly! Like OMG, gimme moar! If you can't decide on what to get, get the meatballs. It comes with about 5 meatballs and slice of toasted bread with tomato sauce. They are, without a doubt, the best meatballs I've had in my life.

The clam pie was good, but the clams were a bit overwhelming. I think it was because they used fresh clams and perhaps used some of the clam juice? I couldn't quite tell, but the clam taste was overpowering everything. I would definitely recommend something else unless you really like clams.

All in all, I definitely see myself coming back here again.
author: Richard C.

description: Yes, I do love pizza. As much as everyone else, maybe not, but I do enjoy a fancy pie on occasion. Though I had trouble understanding the wine and cheese here, (I guess they specialize in Southern Italian wines?) I got some help from our kindly server without feeling unrefined. Broccoli rabe pizza, yes. Marinated Eggplant, word. Nice atmosphere as well. Everyone was nice.
author: Isabel L.

description: Friend tried to have a birthday here. Called beforehand and even had a champagne bottle pre-paid for. Waitstaff was extremely rude and didn't care at all. People eating here equally rude and snobby. Ruined my friend's birthday. If you're looking for a restaurant that cares, go somewhere else. Would give it zero if I could! Also, who the **** uses a whiteboard as a wait list? DUMB
author: Kevin P.

description: Went in early because I thought it would be easy to get fed. Hmmm I guess I was wrong. I ordered first then went to use the ladies room. Came back to my seat and got a cappuccino which was extremely bitter, not at all good. Then after about 20 minutes someone else took my order again, because apparently the first person didn't put my order in. Okay, finally got the rabe pizza. I thought it was very good. It did not blow my mind like the first time I had it at Pizzaria Delfina in the Mission. No love in this, too much cheese, the center was soggy and so much mozz makes for a soggy wet center. Who likes that? No one, twenty-five dollars later I think that's too much unless everything is PERFECT sorry, won't be going back anytime soon.
author: Lisa C.

description:
The food was good. The service was garbage. 

Check it out, my bud and I go on sunday afternoon, we arrive sit down and the waitress was really nice, 20 minutes after we order the waitress comes over and apoligizes for the food taking so long, we understand no big deal she says "I'm sorry is there anything I can do for you?" I say "sure how about a couple more beers" she says "I like your style" smiles and thats that. 

It was my understanding that the beers were on the house because well; thats what it sounded like to us and that is the way any real fine dining restaurant that wants repeat business operates. Have you ever heard of anyone waiting forever at Gary Danko and not enjoying a glass of wine on the house or a comped dessert? What about an experience I had at Peter Luger in NY where my meal took forever and they offered me a selection of bourbon after dinner on the house. Anyways....

Of course when the bill comes the beers are on it. We must have sat down in the middle of a shift change because another waitress brought our bill, and when I requested to speak to our original waitress she was "off the floor" not off for the night just "off the floor"  this new waitress also said "is it about the beers?" I say yes it is, she takes the bill and says "let me see about that". Two minutes later who I will assume is the manager comes out and explains that there was a mis-understanding Delfina (pfft) doesnt comp food or drinks ever and that we should have assumed that the beers were not free and that our food was taking a while, translation: "Go Fuck Yourself, Youre Paying for all of it Jack" This "manager" than proceeds to take our bill and our credit cards and run them, with the "sorry guys but youre going to have to pay" well we payed and we tipped too, a whole penny. Dont spend it all in one place kids...
author: Ryan P.

description: Great thin crust pizza, its still doughy but not too chewy. Margarita pizza is something we always get here and the proscuitto pizza is delicious as well. The mascarpone dessert is light and airy and crispy all at once, I also got to try some cheerwine for the first time, yummy dr. pepper and cherry coke hybrid drink. Oh, and the tomato cheese toasts for apps were super satisfying and garlicy.
author: Sydel S.

description:
finally...after all the hype from the opening...i don't have to wait an ungodly 1.5 hours for some thin crust piece of heaven.

on a monday night after superbowl sunday, parking was a piece of cake on fillmore.

the pizza margherita was thin and airy.
the meatball order was heavy and filling.
a perfect combo balance.

2 glasses of the wine and a dollop of the chocolate and amaretti gelato squished between a brioche was just a perfect way to end the evening.

the outside tables with heat lamps was almost warmer than the tables by the open door.  my friend and i were pretty chilly indoors - hence the lack of a star.

the service was friendly and helpful.  given the no wait...a surefire three stars!
otherwise, a solid and casual place for some tasty slices.
author: Anh V.

description: Good and friendly staff. Food is average and ambient is warm. One strange thing is that they charge coperto!!! $1.5 per person!! I know it is not much but i think it is very low move..That is common in Italy but we are not that cheap here...the prices are high for the quality anyways so this is just extra charge...and you need to tip on top of that..I will not go there again because that cheap trick..there are plenty of better options nearby.
author: Zz S.

description: Best pizza in SF. The crust is amazing!!! Sometimes the tomato sauce is a little watery on the sausage pizza...but that's ok because everything else is awesome. Have been to both locations and was impressed both times.
author: serena l.

description:
came here on a wednesday evening & it was packed & had a line.   since we got rock star parking, we tried it  anyways..... fortunately there were 2 open seats @ the bar that no one wanted in line, so we took 'em....score...

- started off w/ 2 glasses of red (forgot the names) -- perfect for the cold evening & dinner
- squash soup w/ pasta bits -- also perfect for the the cold evening
- panna pizza -- rich & creamy, just the way i like it
-fennel sausage pizza -- sausage was super flavorful 


a serendipitous evening............
author: Cindi N.

description:
I went there with 3 girls and we split two pizzas and the meatballs -- it was just the perfect amount of food for us but if you're starving definitely get more pizza!

Yuuummmy margartia pizza! Comparable to Tony's in Nortbeach, but slightly better. Thin slightly doughy crust and not a lot of cheese, which I personally like, but if you're a cheese loved I'd go with something else. 

We also tried the broccoli rabe pizza -- I didn't love it because it had that bitter broccoli rabe taste (and I'm a huge broccoli rabe fan, but it needs to be cooked properly to bring out the taste/slight sweetness) and it was sauceless pizza, but if you like white pizza you may like it a lot more than I did.

The meatballs were good, but I wasn't a huge fan of the tomatoe sauce they were in -- good dish for sharing though. 

I went there on a Monday night at 7pm with a group of 4 and we waited about 45min to be seated. That being said, not quite the place for a relaxing, long dinner since there's a long line and the restaurant is small and sort of rushed. But definitely worth a try at least once :-)
author: Katherine R.

description: I actually give it 3.5 starts. It's a great place and has great food and especially loved their dessert, but the two drawbacks for me were that you CANNOT make your own pizza and need to get whatever they have on the menu and that they take a long time to get you your food, but they pressure you to order quickly!
author: A M.

description: Unreal... And the wait's long enough to get at least a bottle of vino in you before you sit. But so worth it. We came on a Saturday night with 9 people so I can't complain too much about the wait. If you're lucky enough to get Lindsay as your server, you will be well taken care of. Other than the smile and cheer (which are enough as is), she knows how to put a dozen pies in front of 9 people and follow it up with apps, and plenty of desert without a single up sell. DO NOT leave the table without having at least one ice cream sandwich (or as they call it, two gelato balls in a brioche, add chocolate sauce). You will think you were delivered a half pound burger with cheese but don't be fooled. The sweetness will blow your mind. Perfect way to sooth the lingering taste of the broccoli rabe pizza (which also cannot be missed). Enjoy!
author: Scott D.

description: I wasn't really thaaaaat impressed with this place. Pizza was good but quite average when it comes down to it. If I gotta wait in line your shiz better be smokin' good. I mean like Mama's on Washington Square good mmkay? I honestly feel like this sort of place... in this sort of neighborhood... is popular because the people that go there think it looks cool to wait in line... like it's some sort of status thing. anybody knowwhatimean?
author: Derek B.

description: Gotta love the new standard Delfina has set for pizza.  Finally!
author: Kurt F.

description:
i came here with my family a few weeks ago. they wanted to go because they had read that it was one of the best pizza places in the city... and i think it is. it is so good. the crust is delicious! i got the 4 cheese and all the flavors together were great. my aunt got the spicy one (with either asparagus or broccoli) which is supposed to be their best... but it was too spicy for my taste. not bad, just too spicy. for dessert we had some gelato... i think we had one of each flavor (if i remember right there were only 3 or 4) and it was delicious! smooth and sweet. 
it is pretty casual but definately trendy. the inside design is great, really nice. the only think i really didnt like about it was that the music was too loud! 
if you are in pac heights (or not haha) i would recommend trying this place! it got voted best pizza in the bay for a reason.
author: Amelia R.

description: There's no doubt Pizzeria Delfina has excellent wood fire pizza.  Its tasty thin crust and fresh ingredients burst out of the pizza as you eat it.  We had the Salsiccia which includes house made fennel sausage, bell peppers and onions along with a cucumber salad with basil. Don't let the size of the pizza mislead you to order a pizza for each person.  With one pizza and a salad for two people, we were full!
author: Jeannine L.

description: Not sure why, but I think the pizza here is better than at the Mission location.  I picked up an order to go (which is soooo convenient since you can park in the lot next door) of the cauliflower appetizer (which was delicious), the four cheese and the panna pizza with sausage (yum!).  The crust was thin, but chewy and the flavors were great.  It's definitely pricey for pizza, but then I guess it is fancy pizza...
author: Mitzi C.

description: I was NOT impressed despite the large number of good reviews.  True, our 1 hr+ wait was due to our silliness for coming here on a Saturday for dinner, but it was really not worth the so-so pizza.  I had a margherita pizza while my bf had the sausage.  My pizza had 3 tiny little pieces of basil and the huge dough-y crust was not tasty.  If you want tasty pizza, drive down to San Jose for Pizza Antica.... MUCH MUCH better pizza than this place.
author: Grace M.

description: I've dined at Delfina the restaurant, and had takeout from this pizzeria they opened a year or two ago on California St. I'm a big fan of their ultra thin-crust pies with interesting and oh-so-fresh toppings. This pizza satisfies your hunger but doesn't leave you feeling stuffed to the gills with bread and cheese.
author: Andrew K.

description: This is continually my go-to spot in SF. I live only about 4 blocks from here, so it's at a very convenient location. The pizza is literally the best I've ever had, and not only that but the rest of their food is just as appetizing! Their salads and chicken are fantastic. Great service and atmosphere- the people working there truly love being there, and I think it shows. Sometimes there are long waits, but I attribute that to the outstanding quality of their food and service! They always try their hardest to get tables bussed and people in them as quickly as possible, which is great. Definitely a must go to spot in SF!
author: Emily P.

description: Maybe I just went on an off night, but the pizza I had here was no better than frozen pizza. I think this place is overhyped.
author: Jolie S.

description:
i have seen the lines outside the mission location of PD, and have never been.  needless to say i was intrigued and excited when the new pac heights location opened up.  the wait is still true - we waited about 45 min on a week night.  BUT it was definitely worth the wait!  as efficient diners, we decided what we wanted outside so that we could eat asap once we were seated at our cute little table.  
we started with the spicy cauliflower - amazing!!  then we shared 2 pizzas (which is WAY too much food for 2 people but it was more fun to get 2 types of pizza and then take home leftovers).  we shared the broccoli raab and the salsiccia.  both were good but i liked the broccoli one the best.
author: Carolyn B.

description: Not much different than the Mission location, however we did snag a table outside when the sun was shining. The food was obviously made with high quality ingredients, starting from the appetizers to the pizza. We started with the sardines which were perfectly fried and tasted extremely fresh (so fresh that i was tempted to eat the heads, but thought otherwise). Next up were what our waiter described as hot pockets, but tasted more like mini calzones. I can't remember the name, but they were packed with cheese and pepperoni and a delicious red sauce. For the pizza we chose the fennel sausage which was some of the better sausage I've had in a while. The crust was nice and crispy even though the middle of the pie was a little soggy due to all of the ingredients. Overall an enjoyable experience...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Solid food, fun atmosphere, and knowledgeable servers. 

I went on a weeknight around 7:30 pm and there was a long wait for a table for 2. Luckily we weren't in a rush, but they don't take reservations and the service was a little slow, so this isn't a good place to go if you are starving!

The food was traditional and great. We didn't get to try the meatballs, since they ran out, but our server told us that they were a must-have next time. He also gave us some help with our wine selection.

The pizza was great- I love thin crust pizza, and my friend and I went crazy over the sauce. We also had a tricolore salad, which was unique and very fresh and tasty.

Overall, worth checking this place out.
author: Nicole V.

description: This place gets a lot of hype for its pizza.  I just thought it was okay.  If you take the price that you pay for okay pizza, it becomes a little disappointing.  I've had the Margarita and the Salsiccia pizza.  The Salsiccia was definitely my favorite of the too.  the Margarita was just so so.  I've just had much better Margarita pizza's else where for the same price, but they were also bigger.  Ambiance was nice and cozy.  Service was excellent with attentive waitresses.
author: Sam C.

description: Now that things have settled in a little bit at the Pac Heights location, Pizzeria Delfina is the real deal. The pizzas are still awesome and, while not exactly cheap, they won't break the bank. They've got some fantastic wines on tap here, the service is efficient and quick, and weeknights you don't have to wait in line anymore either (though I'm not sure I'd recommend Friday or Saturday nights.) I've been won over!
author: Colin T.

description: Came here to celebrate our friend's birthday and we ordered 3 pizzas and their meatballs.  Meatballs were hot and juicy but a little bit on the salty side. My favorite was actually the toasted bread it came with- crispy, warm and buttery! The meatball sauce was really good, too.  We had Margherita pizza which was soooooo delicious. I love meat but this meatless pizza was the best ive had here.  The mozzarella and the tomato sauce tasted so fresh. We actually added more basil leaves on top of the pizza for a more fragrant taste. Next, we had Salsiccia pizza and it was really good. The onions worked really well with the sausages and the red bell peppers added a little sweetness to the pizza.  Last but not least, we had Capricciosa pizza and we thought it'll be more rich with the cream sauce but it was a little bland. The prosciutto didn't bring out the taste of the pizza and neither did the artichoke :( but overall, we were  all stuffed and ready to dig into that complimentary ice cream for our birthday girl! The staff were amazing and brought us everything we asked for. The downside about dining here is that you can't make reservations!! But the 1hour wait was definitely worth it.
author: Irene L.

description:
Had dinner here over the weekend and it was delish!! They don't take reservations and the place is popular so be prepared to WAIT. We waited about half an hour on a Sunday night at six.
Once seated though, things went swimmingly. Service is super, attentive staff without being intrusive, really knowledgeable recommendations on wine and appetizers. Eric was a bombass server who explained all our dishes to us and was super friendly. Love him!
We had the fuyu persimmon salad with buffalo mozzarella. It was amazing. My favorite dish of the night. Extremely well balanced, the persimmons were sweet and firm, the mozzarella fresh, the arugula gave a nice peppery contrast. Love this dish and this is the perfect season to get it. 
We also had the panzerotti which are basically pepperoni hot pockets. So delicious! Little fried balls of dough with cheese and pepperoni inside. Topped with a yummy tomato sauce. Get this dish.
We also had the grilled fennel with bottarga which was a very interesting and tasty dish. I've never had fennel with bottarga before and it was definitely unique flavor combination. This dish is a good choice if you are looking for something a little lighter on the appetizer menu.
Finally we had the prosciutto pie which was also delicious. Crispy crust, salty prosciutto, peppery arugula, cheese and cream. Amazing. I would definitely come back.
author: Cathy T.

description: Blech!  Just plain awful.  Prices border on gouging.  Who are those people lined up to pay for this food?
author: Phil C.

description: I am happy to write that this place lived up to the hype.  The pizza was very good.  We had something with sausage and onions that was delish!! Good wine list.  Fun vibe to the whole place.  Service was good although they did seem rather flakey at times.  If you are a large group prepare to wait awhile for a table.
author: Amanda P.

description: OK. I can die happy after eating the mussels appetizer and my friend's pizza at Delfina. As someone who loves to eat, but is very particular, I give Delfina my top props; my happiest-Buddha-Belly joyful Thanks for this amazing Chow. And I recommend eating your friend's food to- doubles the variety you get to try. Just make sure to ask so as not to lose a finger...One more point- the California St. location beats 18th ST because there's pay parking 100 yards away and more space in the restaurant, making for a calmer vibe.
author: Charlotte M.

description: Excellent thin crust pizza with bubbly, slightly burnt edges. I had the clam pizza, which had the most amazing sauce on it. The margerita was also delish. We left wanting to come back the next night. As the others said, the wait is ridiculous but there is a reason for it (especially when you looked around at the surrounding restaurants swatting flies). You leave feeling satisfied and NEVER "i'm so full i'm going to blow." Perhaps they should have a reservation system of some sort? The chalk boards cute for like 5 minutes, until you realize you're ready to chew your arm off after waiting for an hour. Either way, on my next trip to San Fran, I will go again.
author: Angela K.

description: SO I went here to day for lunch and it was cool.  The bread sticks standing were tasty!  The pizza was the salsiccia with extra pepperoni and it was cool, slighty burnt at the edges.  I kind of wish there was more cheese.  Anyhow, we also ordered the olives which were awesome and the mozzarella plate which was great too.  Anyways, having eaten a lot of pizza from NY, I am giving this place an OK.  Patsy's and Grimaldi's takes this place ten-fold.  Cheers!  The service here is superb by the way.
author: Limzer L.

description: This is my favorite pizza in the city.  Delicious food, amazing service and a great price for a wonderful meal....PLUS they have some good vino by the bottle that is very cost effective for these tough times!
author: Colleen C.

description:
I guess we would give this 2.5 stars but I'm going to round-down in this case.

Pros:
* Fast service - they only seat you if the party is all there, which worked to our advantage. Immediate seating for 2 on a weeknight.
* Very helpful order taker guy. I didn't study Italian, I had no idea what the fried things were. he listened to what we didn't know, and educated us, vs those waiters that assume we have 0 idea about everything and start launching into a canned speech about "this Italian wine comes from the blah blah blah region"
* Fresh ingredients (which better be a default)
* Bright, clean surroundings
* Crisy bottom crust

Cons:
* LOUD music, which when combined with the clean colors gave the atmosphere a college dining hall aspect. Very hard to talk to my date.
* Too much edge crust! I know this is very subjective but it was almost like an extra set of breadsticks. I should've asked for some balsamic vinegar & olive oil for dipping those chubby edges.
* PUSHY WAITRESS. At first we just thought she was eager & perky (ahhh, youth). But when the following 3 things happened (and there were no other parties waiting for a table), she passed over to the pushy side. (Note, she was not our original order taker, who somehow vanished.)
a) We were not done eating, had some slices on the main serving plate, and she asked if we wanted it boxed up. (Nope, thanks, still eating.)
b) Another 'how's everything?" check in while we were eating said slices.
c) I was still eating my last slice (my date had finished), and she literally took my plate out from under me and cleared the table. WTF?
d) No mention of dessert, and then the bill. Again, no one was in line. (Is she working on some sort of "# of turns per hour" commission???)

Hell, I don't mind getting pushed out of my table at a divey Chinese restaurant...but I'm not paying to be treated well and a waitress at a dive isn't trying to be perky, either. 

But here, I paid a lot more than a cheap Asian dive (and they add $1.75 per person for the SF employee cost), and in other cases it'd be comical. Except it happened to me and I -paid- to be pushed out!
author: Liz K.

description:
Tease me!  I am starving and I've been waiting for at least 30 minutes.  Walk by me with one of your delicious pizzas one more time I might go postal on you or I might lie and say my name is Bob, who happens to be at the top of the list.  "Bob party of two" "Yup that's me! (sorry bob wink wink).  Good thing I've always had the company of good friends and reasonably priced wine to keep me entertained.

The food here is delicious.  They are known for their authentic italian style pizzas (obviously) but be adventurous and try some of the other items on the menu.  Might I recommend the meatballs or the Insalata Tricolore?  Back to the pizzas.  My fave? The Salsiccia.  Their daily specials are always a great surprise of delicate flavors that sing in your mouth.

Not down with the wait?  Get it to go, you'll be the envy of all the patrons waiting outside.
The staff here is hipstered out in a good way.  Dining late night?  They'll hook you up with a musical treat.  Got me dancing in my seat.  Ciao ciao!
author: Ashley Q.

description: Stopped by after reading about it from Serious Eats and the pizza is good stuff.  Being a New York native, I can be picky about pizza.  But, Delfina does hold up.  Simple menu with great Californian ingredients.  Quick service and pleasant staff.  Very family friendly and cozy.
author: Carolyn N.

description:
Decent service, terrible pizza.

The service was better than some of the reviews make it out to be, but the pizza margherita was terrible, no flavor at all.  In addition, the pizza was overpriced.
author: Axay U.

description: I've cracked the code here. It reads, TO GO! Especially if you live nearby. Stopped in today for a pizza. Speedy order, no wait, noise levels no longer problematic. And a tasty napoletana.
author: Purnima M.

description: 3.5.  I like the pizza. Been here several times:iIt is a tight ship - everyone works hard, ingredients are high quality, it is clean. It is completely programmed.  The target demographic is probably 25 - 30 with some moola (I guess that dates me).  For the rest of us, there are some barriers to a great meal: long wait, loud music, bad chairs.  Nonetheless, the pizza is hard to beat and I will go back for it.   As will the throngs that pay the rent.
author: Glenn S.

description: The meatballs. Oh, the meatballs. YUM. The pizzas (we got the margherita and prosciutto pie) and insalata tricolore were also very good, but I still dream about those meatballs.
author: D E.

description: I love the crunchy thin style pizza. Been to the new Tony's in North Beach and this is way, way better.
author: Tom E.

description: I've made at least 10 visits to PD.  Always begin with the tuna (amazing) and segue to the pizzas, all of which are great.  Favorites are broccoli raabe or margherita.  Service is fun and funky, very cordial, and the alla spina beers are terrific too - Sudwerk in particular.  Worth even a short wait, which gives you a chance to try the various and very affordable wines (Aglianico is my favorite.)
author: Brian L.

description: For a restaurant group which prides itself in its customer service, was pretty disappointed at my recent experience. Went to eat with my 2 year old on a Friday afternoon - 3 empty tables outside. Guy running the chalk board refused to seat us until my wife who was just next door came despite telling him we were ready to order immediately and that a 2 year old running low on fuel is a combustible agent. Instead went down the street to Dinos - not as good pizza, but easy as could be. Having eaten at Delfina before, enjoy the pizza but in a very family oriented neighborhood a little less attitude, a little more smile would be appropriate.
author: Andy C.

description: I hit up Pizzeria Delfina on Sunday, waited about 20 minutes, and snagged a primo patio table for two right around 7PM. The waiter was attentive and friendly, pointing me to a spicy, well rounded red wine (Trini? I really don't remember...). My date and I shared two pizzas: the broccoli raab and the panna. Both were heavenly. Thin, light crusts with flavorful sauce and just the right toppings. Next time, I'd like to try one of the veggie specials or the margherita. Oh, and don't miss the gelato, especially the caramel. It's pure buttery sugary goodness.
author: Bee H.

description:
Fun for lunch during the week-- if you can get a table!  We were lucky and slipped in right before the lunch rush.  I understand others' frustration with the sign-up board wait list: a little confusing, no direction from wait staff, and some customers bypass altogether in favor of hovering next to a table waiting to pounce!

We had the broccoli rabe and margherita; both were delish.  Fresh ingredients, great flavor-- and the crust is thin but delicate, not "crunchy".

Minus 1/2 star for loud background soundtrack:: (I felt like I was in a bar), and 1/2 star for the table next to us getting their broccoli rabe before us, despite sitting down 10 minutes after.
author: Marie F.

description: I'm so happy they open another one in my neighborhood.  I can't be vegetarian until they stop serving salsiccia and Gragnano Frizzante... This combination is excellent!!! Mmm, yummy!
author: Sachiko M.

description: Mmm. Fortunately for me, one of my best friends lives 2 blocks away. I picked up 2 pizzas to go last night. They were delicious as ever; the Salsiccia and 4 Cheese. They are huge! And I love how they give you the fresh oregano, cheese, and pepper flakes in little to-go containers. The guy that took my order was super friendly to both me and the hostess he was training (which means a lot to all of us past and present hostesses!). She did a great job of balancing the craziness (on a wednesday night!) of the phones ringing non-stop, taking to-go orders, warmly greeting customers, and communicating with the kitchen. I love good service.
author: Laura D.

description: I had the prosciutto and basil pizza, and a salad. Very good, worth trying.
author: Joshua S.

description: Food is good. But it is way overpriced and small portions. The wait to get in is usually pretty long. The pizzas don't travel well for take out. So we end up at Dino's next door 9 times out of 10.
author: Melissa B.

description: Broccoli Rabe is bitter, little cheese and inedible. The other pizza we tried was better but the toppings just slid off the crust. We make pizzas at home and do a better job than these overpriced mediocre pizzas. Soup and appetizer was OK - nothing special. Not worth the long wait.
author: Nicki M.

description: As an east coaster, the only thing I miss living in CA is PIZZA! That is, until I had pizza from Delfina! Thin, crunchy crust, yummy burnt bubbles in the dough, fresh sauce and just the minimal cheese. When I crave pizza, only this place will do. My only negative comments are for timing. For takeout I usually wait 35 minutes. I've never sat down to eat there since it always seems so crowded; so much so that I often don't have room to stand to wait for my takeout order. My advice: just order 30-40 minutes ahead and have someone else drive you so you don't have to look for parking at the busy Fillmore St location.
author: Liz A.

description: Not much more can be written about Delfina's pizzas - even if those in Pac Heights seem to lack some of the magic of the original Mission location. It's a great addition to the neighborhood. For desert, try ordering both the fried pizza dough drizzled with marscaponé and some chocolate covered vanilla gelato. We combined them and it made for a great, serendipitous desert.
author: Kent G.

description: Came by on weekday afternoon - not crowded at all.  No wait.  Service was friendly, but she forgot our drink order.  The pizzas were good.  I thought the clam was a bit too salty, but the mushroom was tasty.  Unfortunately, the prices are very high.  For me, pizza is comfort food.  I don't need a high-end pizza to hit the spot.  I'd rather have two good pizzas rather than one very good one.
author: Boomer D.

description: I used to love Pizzeria Delfina, but the quality -- particularly for the price -- has definitely gone down (maybe just at the California location??).  Pizzetta 211 smokes Pizzeria Delfina.
author: amanda g.

description: mmm.. soo good! We sat at the counter right by the pizza ovens and LOVED it, we were having so much fun watching the pizza made and watch everyone rush around making the food.. We ordered the pizza Margherita and the Salsiccia which were both amazing, great combo to share. The dough was light and perfectly fluffy with just the right toppings! I ordered the lemonade which tasted so fresh and refreshing. Our only regret was that our stomachs were not big enough to fit in the meat balls which looked AMAZING!! Next time i think i would like to sit outside under the heaters to people watch while we eat. Great pizza, great location and really great service from hostess to server.
author: Barbara C.

description: The panna pizza is the best thing I've eaten in San Francisco, hands down.  This place never fails.
author: Nick M.

description: The worst restaurant experience. It was a very noisy place. We ordered 2 different dishes. Macaroni shelves and pizza. Those didn't taste especial and too small for one. It was brought well before the pizza was ready. We didn't receive services and it cost 50$ for 2.
author: Mah A.

description: this place is one of my favorite pizza joints... i absolutely love their margherita pizza!!!  i've gone here several times and there's always a wait... but well worth the time =)
author: Kae B.

description: I had the pizza with cream. It was incredible. The wait to be seated was a little long & it was a little hectic inside, but the food is so, so worth it. Thin crust, slightly burnty in some spots (just how I like it!), cream, fresh parm. It's like a dream.
author: Anna O.

description: For pizza in the city, it doesn't get much better than this. Their specials are always amazing, the wine selection is affordable and perfectly sized for the occasion and the cherry sunday is basically the best thing in the universe. Don't forget to try their selection! Wait, why are you reading this!? GO HERE NOW :)
author: B L.

description:
Best Pizza in SF!

Honestly I have not found a better place for Pizza in SF.

Thin-Crust pizza with emphasis in simple pizza's with maximum flavor. 

It is tough to get in since the place is so small, so I recommend not going on a weekend night... but this is a destination pizza place worth travelling for.

Every Pizza we tried (ordered 4 for a group of 4 since they are on the smaller side) was exceptional.
Crack open a bottle of wine, have some fresh mozzerella for an appetizer and get ready for some good simple pizza. Its the best I have found in SF so far...
author: Matt D.

description: 2 thumbs up for this place.  High quality ingredients.  They ensure your wine is good before serving it.  Home made iced tea and lemonades!  It's fun sitting at the bar because you can see what's going on in the kitchen.  The place was packed today because it was father's day. Appetizers came right away but we waited a very long time for our pizza but it was worth it.
author: Don J.

description: likely the best margherita in the city. worth the wait-15 minutes for 2 on new years day. nice location, friendly staff, and interesting crowd.
author: J L.

description: I love love love their Napoletana pizza!! Nice light thin pizza crust, just the right amount of tomatoes, anchovies, and capers on the pizza.   The bursing of yummy pizza delicious melding together as you are eating it.  The just right amount of fullness.  Believe or not, I never been in their to eat at the restaurant because I live so close to it that I can order the pizza and bring it back to home in about 10 mins.  I never want to deal with the crowd over there, so if you live nearby, just order it and they will have it ready by the time they quoted you on.   (Although I might go dine in one of these days for their breadsticks.)
author: Chris C.

description:
we go often for lunch, it is a busy place, might have to wait on any given lunch, but the food is always good, i have tried many pizzas and my favorite is pizza bianca with broccoli rabes, the arancini appetizer are to die for (when they are on the menu) and the salad tricolore (arugola, endives and radicchio) is always fresh .
enjoy lunch but remember it is not always a quick one and parking is not easy
author: Giu G.

description: One of my favorite pizza places in SF so far. Coming from NY, I think it's the closest to Lombardi's or Grimaldi's I've had since moving. If it isn't coal-oven pizza, it sure tastes like it. They pull off a good prosciutto pie (which isn't as easy as it sounds). But if you're looking for something along the lines of Ray's pizza, this isn't it. Worth a visit, for sure. One thing I'd like to note is that my group had to wait quite a while for a table but the staff was so friendly, I don't think any of us minded.
author: Micah M.

description:
had to wait for quite a while... even at an early dinner hour (615?).  this you can take as a sign of excellence.  

a clam pie and a prosciutto pie.  tasted pretty darn good, but this may have been because they serve Stone IPA.  affogato is choice.  although for the appetizer we made the mistake of doing the "what the hell is that? ok, sure... ".  i forget what it is, basically a cheese stuffed veggie, but i was unimpressed.

basically, you can't beat stone and pretty good pizza.
author: Steven C.

description:
great takeout
I'm addicted to the meatballs sugo - outstanding. That and an order of the Burrata perfect meal! :)
author: once u.

description: what a cute pizza place!  i'm in love! :)  had the tricolor salad, mozarella infused with cream, and 3 cheese pizza with arugula.  i recommend sitting outside when the weather is nice ... like in rome ;)
author: Janice M.

description: I love the food, particularly the pizza at Delfina but am angry about their $1.50 per person surcharge for "healthy SF".  I went there with 3 children last night and the surcharge added 10% to the bill.  That seems excessive since 1 of the children was 3 years old.  I think the general rate for the tax, which I agree with, is about 4% so, until Delfina changes the $1.50 charge we'll, sadly, be eating somewhere else.
author: Juliet K.

description:
Pizza = Delish in Ma Bewwy

This was a great place for that new kind of snobby pizza.
author: Rebecca F.

description: As far as I am concerned the only way I rate a place with 5 stars is a combination of food and service.  The pizza was fantastic, thin in the middle, not very doughy and not covered in sauce.  We had 4 pizzas and each one was unique and very tasty.  My favorite was the Panna which was the "GQ 3rd Best Pizza in the US".  Simple but it tasted sooo good I almost ordered another to take home.  Our server was very friendly and helpful not to mention fun.  We had an excellent experience and I will definitely return soon.  The only con was the wait, which turned out to be about 45min but it was a nice weekend night so it is not to be expected as they let us order drinks while we waited.  This place is reasonably priced, has excellent service with great pizza, what more do you need?
author: Eli Z.

description: I went to the Pac Heights location and yes there was a wait. As a New Yorker i have a pretty high standard for Pizza but not an inflexible one. There are many great pizzeria''s in the bay area - Pizzaiolo, Little Star, etc.....Pizzeria Delfina is not one of them. To me the sauce is the biggest culprit - it taste's like a budget brand of canned tomato sauce (think from the dented can aisle) and just ends up making the crust soggy. The pizza's are also a little too spartan lacking any kind of visual presentation or flair. The best part of going there to me is the solid Italian sourced wine list which is reasonably priced with many choices. Pizzeria Delfina isn't bad but it's not worth paying the premium to go there and depending on time of day the wait.
author: Paul O.

description: I love the pizza here. I think it's up there with A16 with more choices. I loved the broccolini. Other items were good as well, just stick with the pizza. Wait can be a little long during the weekend dinner hours. My friends weren't impressed with the pizza here, we're no longer friends.
author: Mike C.

description: I love this place... The food is great and so is the amazing staff. My favorite is the mozzarella ball, so yummy! I could eat that everyday! Now not only is the food GREAT!! but the atmosphere is another thumbs up, the last 3 times I have gone in to eat with friends, the music that is playing completes the package. If you love pizza and want a fun and energetic place to dine at, you have to check out this place!!
author: Dulce R.

description:
no reservations...first in = first seated.  no phone orders tonite (24sep), but they said they're gonna fix it in the coming week(s).

food is impeccable, but can be expected because of this place's big siblings (deflina and pizzeria delfina).  broccoli raabe pizza is outstanding, as was the house-cured lardo.  margherita is also excellent.  lots of fresh-cracked pepper makes the pizza zing.

the salads are pretty good (tomato and tuna)...the olive oil in the dressing is light and fruity.

the ice cream and brioche dessert is phenomenal.  house-made brioche just melts.  the ice cream has a gelato consistency, so don't get your hopes too up, but with the brioche, it's all good.

wine list is well-stocked, either by the glass or the bottle.  staff is knowledgeable about the wines, too.

service is attentive.  food cranks out as fast as possible and turnover is about as can be expected.  it's definitely just like the original pizzeria delfina.
author: JM Y.

description:
Napoletana Pizza
Tomato, anchovies, capers, hot peppers, olives and oregano:
Super tasty if you like anchovies and some spice which I do do do.  The crust tempered the strong flavors nicely--I should have ordered wine with this one...

Collard Greens w/ guanciale & chili:
I like salt when I expect it, but this was just too salty--even the guanciale was overpowered and damn, that's some pretty salty bacon already.  It was plated nicely though.

-Place was clean.

-Service was good.

-4 tables squeezed into the the window area is questionable...I'm small but my ass almost knocked over the table next to us as I was getting to the bench side.  If anyone was at that table they would have had my ass on their pizza (as opposed to pizza on my ass, which is common).  OK, maybe I'm not so small, but is 10 inches any real clearance for anybody?

-Fun, long, skinny breadsticks to gesticulate with!

-Would go if I were in the neighborhood and if I had money for $8 collard greens again.
author: Donut Cak e.

description: Excellent Italian-style pizza in a friendly neighborhood cafe. We had the fennel sausage pizza and it was so good, I could eaten a whole by myself.
author: Rick V.

description: The pizza here is absolutely spectacular!  Try the four cheese pizza, add sausage, if you really feel like spoiling yourself.  Yummy-  They also have brilliant veggie side dishes to go along with your pizza.  Try either the cauliflower or the broccoli when they have it.  It makes you feel a little less guilty about the fact that you just finished a whole pizza by yourself.
author: Darcy P.

description: i have been here twice in the last week. it is just a great, comfortable place near where i live. the staff are really friendly and helpful. the food is excellent. i think that it can get crowded, however i have found that if you time it right and go later, it is less crowded.
author: Partyhat X.

description:
pizzaria delfina is basically a must-try if you are a fan of thin-crust neopolitan style pizza.  on any given evening there is usually a wait, anything less than say 15-20 minutes and i would say it's worth it.  otherwise there are plenty of other places up fillmore to get your grub on.  

i've sampled most of their pizzas, but prefer trying the daily special which i've had twice.  the first time it was this carbonara inspired pizza with guanciale, pecorino, and black pepper (think the spaghetti carbonara at SPQR on top of a pizza), and the second had pancetta, green onions, and pecorino.  both were off the charts great.  

i've eaten at the mission location as well, and can't seem to figure out why the pac heights spot isn't ranked as high.  i found the quality of the food and the wait to be about equal.  at least it's easier to find parking in pac heights.
author: Scott K.

description: Unfortuately, there's always a wait here, but it's good food.  I like the apps and the pizza.  There's always some thing new on the menu which is nice;  We had some pizza with egg and some salty meat, it was delicious.  Nice thin crust.
author: Jenny M.

description: always good! worth the wait.  customer service is excellent!  while waiting for tables employees give out water and breadsticks.
author: robbie l.

description: Yummy! Real pizza - awesome staff very organized...dog friendly sidewalk seating....outdoors heaters....order some vino while you wait...
author: Liz D.

description:
Yum! After hearing rave reviews from several folks, we decided to try Pizzaria Delfina. And I am so glad we did! 

We had the tricolore salad (mmmm!), the sand dabs (perfect!), the special corn on the cob (put lardo an anything and it's delicious), pigs ears (what?! yes, tasty! pigs ears fried and then topped with lime juice and chili oil = super good), three pizzas that were all amazing (the cherry tomato pie, the napoletana, and the salsicca), and brioce with chocolate and strawberry gelato. All in all a decadent and ridiculously good meal. 

In short, go there -- you will be happy you did!  Be prepared to leave stuffed and happy.
author: Alison B.

description: Open late, nice. Food appears to be consistent, fresh and tasty. Price is reasonable at about $15 per person without drinks.
author: joolia f.

description: saffron risotto balls. like heaven for your mouth, trust me.
author: Marcelle R.

description: Finally we do not have to drive across town and can have a great meal on our California Street. Pizzas were great. We also tried pig ears, yam. Service excellent.
author: Lana B.

description: Outside of the wait and the issue with who was in charge of the chalk board I really enjoyed my meal here. We had the special app of lightly fried broccoli and pecirino cheese - SO good!! And then we split the prosciutto pizza which was delicious. Not sure I would wait that long again but if I could walk right in I would go back in a heartbeat.
author: Jenifer B.

description: This is my favourite place in San Francisco. So far it makes me the feel the best when I walk in and out! The food is delicious no matter what I've eaten including the pizza which normally I don't eat. Peroni on tap rounds out the equation for me, including some good Italian reds. It's worth the price for whatever the bill is and the affogato is special because they know how to make proper espresso. The best part is that the staff are switched on and never miss a beat! Friendly, happy and they know what they are doing, what else can you want? Go early to avoid the crowds or be patient and enjoy whenever!
author: Peter H.

description:
Never been disappointed eating at Delfina's. 

Pizza's are solid. Tri-color salad is a light and refreshing starter. My new favorite and a must-try has to be their deep-friend calzone. It's fresh dough stuffed with meatballs, ricotta, mozzarella and tomato sauce. It's moneeeeeey! 

Be sure to get there early as the wait can get really long. It's also pretty cool to sit at the bar and get a first-hand view of the food being prepared. You can tell the chef's at Delfina's take a lot of pride in the food.
author: Charles M.

description: Amazing pizza, best in the city that we have found so far.  Better than A16.  Everything tastes great, customer service is good, but lacks value on first courses.  Need to be a little bigger or cost less.  Obviously they are doing well because they are always busy!  Monday nights seemed to be easy to get in but plan on at least an hour and a half wait any other night.  The pizza is worth the wait!
author: Runner G.

description: Don't understand the hype. Yeah, it's a nice, 'in' place with quaint atmosphere, but not impressed by the pizza selection, and there are other crispy thin crust brick oven pizzerias elsewhere.  Had the Monterey Bay sardines Fritti, which was very over priced @$10 for 2 sardines that I was still tasting the fishy taste 4 hours afterwards (may be they should clean the innards better) .   The Brodo w/Chard leg, chicken, mozzarella & chili was nice on a cold day but $7 was kinda expensive for a small paper cup.  This place is hype probably because the "IN" crowd wants to be at the "IN" place, and you've got to say it's good to justify willing to wait in the long line... LOL.
author: Karen Y.

description:
Came here for dinner last night and ordered the Napoletana and the Salsiccia pizzas.  Both had great flavor and was quite tasty.  I thought that the Napoletana had anchioves but I didn't see them but it could have been the black little things on top.  I wanted to order the 4 cheese pizza but my dinner mate veteod it.

Staff was nice and friendly and the place was packed when we left.

We also ordered the meatballs and they were really good.

there was a cute little baby sitting besides us and she smiled and giggled at me the whole time.  edither she thought I was the best looking guy she every saw or the funniest guy she ever saw but I like to think it was the former.
author: kenny l.

description:
Simple good food. The staff are very friendly. It is a very easy going atmosphere and it's in my neighborhood. 

Try the meatballs and affettati.
author: Joe R.

description:
As far as pizza goes - this is the best I've had in the city.  Kills A16.

Their eggplant caponata was a bit overdressed in oil, but tastey none-the less.  (Buretta's equivalent was both better and healthier).  

Their pizza was flavorful - and the crust was perfectly crisp with a chewiness to the thicker edges.  I had my own, and then ate my husband's crust.... (Carbs are not the enemy!)

I wasn't wild about the tricolor salad - although the heirloom salad was really very good. 

Casual Friday night before a kabuki movie showing?  Done and done.  

(Tip :  don't complain about the wait.  Just go early and figure it's really good if ppl are willing to wait.)
author: Casey M.

description: Food is great, just turn down the music. I'm convinced that they are trained to flip as many tables as possible b/c there's always such a wait. Thus, they crank up the music (in this case, classic 80's hair rock: Whitesnake, GnR and Aerosmith) to force you to eat and get out- i.e. no lingering. We kindly asked the waitress to turn it down a bit, she did, but another staff member promptly turned the volume back up.
author: Linda Y.

description: Pizzeria Delfina is now a "regular" spot for me now that I've moved much closer.  Great pizzas.  I've learned that a salad, an appetizer, and a pizza is enough to share between two people.  For three people, order two pizzas and a salad to share.  Service is always quick and friendly.  I prefer their pizzas to some of the other places I've tried (Flour & Water, Beretta, etc.). I would come here more often if they had a better selection of appetizers or other foods.  Still a fan.
author: Trinh N.

description:
Went here on a Sunday night for dinner hoping to escape the wait.  No such luck.  Got seated and ordered a pitcher of beer ($15).  Waitress brings us a pitcher of the wrong type of beer.  Then my boyfriend finds a piece of glass in his beer (due to stacking the beer glasses inside each other when they bring them to your table.)  Needless to say there were many apologies by the staff and our beer was free.

pizza was good, but a little pricey for what you get.  the fennel sausage was amazing.  even though dinos pizza next door isn't as hip- its still my favorite pizza in pac heights.
author: Krystal D.

description:
yeah, so check it out...i'm on this pizza odyssey, so to speak...i want to learn to make awesome pizzas, and i am going around trying to find what characteristics of pizza i like....and will try to incorporate it into my own pizzalicious creations.  i will continue to do this, until i start gaining weight, in which case i will abort said mission....

delfina had a 45 min wait on a tuesday evening...geez, can't even reap the benefits of less people eating out in our lean economic times, i guess.  the meatballs....FREAKING fantastic!  the salad was good, though....blood orange, arugula, goat cheese (i think, unless that was some other dinner), and either fennel or onions.  i kinda think they were onions, in which case there were too many of them.  i got their pizza special of the day....cured ham with some cream sauce and cracked peppercorns.  it was a bit strange at first, since i was thinking thick cream sauce, and they were thinking, pouring heavy cream over a pizza.  but somehow, it worked!  nice crust, although a bit soggy b/c of the cream, i suppose....it's got a chill atmosphere though, and i would definitely return....
author: Miss P.

description: Well I gave Delcina another chance. Only because my sis in law had a gift certificate.  Wowza on the food and the service rocked too. Broccoli rabe pizza and zucchini "pasta", little gem salad all were perfect. Great wine by the glass selection. I'm still not ready to commit to 5 stars just yet.
author: Lisa P.

description: Their pizza was delicious and their gelato was also pretty good!  I will definitely go back again!  The service was also good.
author: Erin S.

description: Yes, the lines are long (it's SF folks, and this ain't Dominoes).  Yes, the wait can be long (refer to last snarky remark).  I have some dear friends who live near P.D. in PH and we've fortunately been able to partake in the delightful take out from P.D. and it was WONDERFUL!  The pizza is always tasty, the crust is perfect, and P.D. doesn't skimp on quality on the take out orders at all.  In the words of the great Lidia, tutti e tavola a mangiare!
author: Ria D.

description: Pizza here is so good. Red pepper is HOT and crushed by hand right at the restaurant, according to the waitress.  Fried pizza dough desert is perfect, light and not too sweet. Yum. Tables are close together so it's a little tight inside.
author: Christa D.

description: Had the Margharita and the Proscuitto pizzas, very nice but they don't allow substitutions which annoyed me.  I went on a Wednesday eve around 5 pm and there was no wait, except for the very long wait for pizza.  The proscuitto pizza needed to not have the panna (cream) and have honey instead.  The staff was dressed like they worked at a vintage clothing store.  I hate focusing on a fat guy's rolled up jeans when I'm eating.  Staff was aloof but food was worth it.  Yeah, take out seems to be the best idea here.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Love the pizzas here.
Rather, i love the crusts here!
One point though... when you're sharing a few pizzas with a bunch of friends, you could end up not getting a piece of the Prosciutto, or whatever 'cos there's barely enough... Can you please put more topping!?!?

Apart from the pizzas, the sides are brilliant too.
author: A T.

description: Delfina can really do no wrong in my book.  The pizza here is yummy.  The only thing I would change is to make the tricolore salad bigger!  Otherwise, perfect.  And I love love love how they transformed the old Zao into an airy, yet cozy space.
author: Amme P.

description:
waited only 20 min on a Sat evening (arrived at 8:45pm).  it can get rather loud inside.

the pizza was so-so. had the basic magharite, which was a bit burned and also a bit soggy on the bottom.  but, the meatball dish made up for it.
the tri color salad was simple, crisp, and delicious.  if i go again, i'd get the meatballs over the pizza.
author: Caroline I.

description:
I placed an order for pickup, and it wasn't ready when I arrived, so I waited there for 15 minutes in the crowd.

I've also sat down to eat there once.  

You can't complain about the crowd, the pizza is delicious.  However, the staff doesn't go out of their way to make a great experience, and because the pizzas are small, there is no real value.  Good thing Pac Heights people can afford it.
author: John M.

description: Very yummy pizza, but not worth the 2 HOUR wait...next time we will be ordering take out.  Our waiter tried to make up for it with free dessert, which was awesome, but I just don't understand the idea of  "no reservations".  If Delfina took reservations, I would have given them 5 stars.
author: Jessica T.

description: Heavenly pizza. And the sand dabs? Yum! Broccoli appetizer? Yummier still! There is no pizza place more indulgent and delicious than Delfina. I strongly recommend the salt cod pizza but you couldn't possibly go wrong with anything. We had a bottle of wine, three pizzas and two apps for $35pp with tip. We left satisfied and happy. i think its a great value!
author: Margaret G.

description: Went back to Delfina at lunch time. I've got to say it was a way better experience. I went with my chef friend, on his request, and he's right - there pizza is pretty damn good. I tried the panna this time too...its actually better than the margherita, if that's possible.
author: Jenica M.

description: The best pizza in the city is now within walking distance.  I've been a big fan of Delfina, the restaurant in the Mission, for the last 6 years and now it's not a 20 dollar cab ride away...
author: Louisa P.

description: This was the most delicious Pizza I have had for a long time. We took it to go and had it in the park. Sooo tasty. The thin crispy crust and then the deliciousness on top... We also had some sides and the tri colore salad. Everything was just really good there. I'd go there more often if it was closer to where I live.
author: Alexandra D.

description: Hands down my favorite Neopolitan pizza joint in California, and believe me, I've been to them all because I LOVE pizza.  I limit it to California since NY is its own category and let's be honest, no one cares about the states in between.  Meatballs are second to the ones at Tony's, but still pretty spectacular, tricolore salad here is the best rendition I've had, and you can't go wrong with any of the pizzas.  My personal favorite is the one off-the-menu they call "magic pie."  Ask for it.  It's amazing.  The only annoying thing is that just like any other great restaurant in the city, wait is long and they take no reservations, but the wait time at this location is usually shorter than the mission location, parking's easier, and food's just as tasty.  If you live close by, you could get take-out, but I think these pies are best consumed fresh for the perfect balance of crispy crust and fluffy top.
author: n k.

description: Wow, this place is quite a find.  Terrific food at really reasonable prices.  I went here on a Thursday night around 9pm and it was still packed and had a line.  Great, fun atmosphere and the food blew me away.  We shared the meatballs, a margherita pizza and each had the blood-orange soda.  The meatballs were the best I've ever had (so tender and full of flavor) and we were both fighting over who could lick the bowl.  Outstanding!  We opted for  plain margherita pizza b/c it's a great base, if they can do this well, I have confidence they can do a more jazzed up pizza to perfection.  They nailed it.  Perfect thin and tender crust, fresh home-made mozzarella (stretched on site).  Delish!  Even the soda was fabulous.  Home-made and freshly squeezed juice with sparkling water in a carafe for only $3!  Bargain.  I think we both made it out of there for ~$20 each and had a fabulous meal.  I love SF!  The service was extremely friendly and attentive as well.  We will certainly be going back.
author: Alison E.

description: I'm a huge fan of thin crust pizza and this is one of my favorites in San Francisco.  Everything I have tried here has been good if not great (get a side of the meatballs).  Service is excellent, good selection of wine and beer, definitely a neighborhood favorite.
author: Ashley E.

description: Great pizza margarita, great mussles and exceptional burrata!!! Love their outdoor seating!!!
author: Bettina O.

description: The pizza here is consistently excellent, but so are the salads (insalata tricolore) and other dishes.  Would definitely be great if they broadened the menu to include more of these.
author: D L.

description: The pizza is great and our service was too.  One of the many bottles of wine we ordered was corked.  The manager took it back and replaced it with a good one.  I was glad to see the manager teaching the staff what a corked bottle of wine was/is.  It's too often you get bad looks for sending back a bad bottle of wine.  She was all over it and took good care of Big Daddy....
author: Who D.

description:
Enjoyed the food here immensely.  Split 5 ways, we had meatballs and three pizza's which was a perfect amount.  The waitstaff was very friendly and made very good recommendations.  Definitely don't miss the meatballs if you go here! 

The only reason to knock off a star was the wait time.  It took us over an hour to be seated.  But in the meantime, we were able to have wine while we waited, which was very nice ... everyone was very knowledgeable of their large wine list too.
author: Tim S.

description: The food is excellent (5/5 stars). The wait was an hour and a half. Oh yeah, Delfina.... You can put that on one of your tshirts.
author: Chris G.

description: hands down the best pizza i have ever eaten has come from delfina (both locations but i am favoring this one because it is closer to my place of residence). the crust is thin, chewy, and has just the right amount of salt. they preserve an excellent sauce to cheese to crust to toppings ratio. and the arancini are to die for. um,  fried rice and cheese balls? yes, please. they also have an excellent wine selection. LOVE this place.
author: Rachael S.

description: Super tasty pizzas, but I would classify this more like a thin-crusted sandwich since some of the combinations taste more like savory sandwiches.
author: Ryan C.

description: I will miss Zao, but SO EXCITED for pizzeria delfina!
author: Danielle R.

description: Well it was my birthday and my SO wanted to know what kind of cake I wanted.  I immediately said I want pie...pizza pie at Delfinas...it didn't disappoint and I did have a happy BD
author: Evie F.

description: 5 stars simply for the meatballs, and pigs ears.  damn those chili lime pigs ears fried to perfection.  and the pizza....sends that guy from una pizza napoletana packing back to NY.
author: matt d.

description: I come here 2x a month and love there margherita pizza. The pizza has the perfect blend of crust, sauce, and toppings. Food is 5 star, but sometimes the wait...errrr not so and the customer service varies as once in a while they can be a bit snooty. Come on, you guys are a pizza joint here!
author: Lisa S.

description: Best pizza I've had in SF by far.  I love real Italian-style thin crust pizza.  This place would easily earn 5 stars were it not for the lack of reservations and the long line.  I had prosciutto/arugula and my wife had salcicia - both were excellent.  It's all about the crust and Delfina knows how to do a thin, crunchy one.
author: Graham M.

description: i've been to both this delfina and the one in the mission and enjoy both.  the pizzas are great and service was friendly.  if i had to pick, i'd go for the pizzeria delfina in the mission.  it's a bit smaller and cozier but if i'm in pac heights and looking for some rockin' thin slice pizza, i'd hit up delfina (if the wait isn't too long).
author: Helen T.

description: Took a friend who lives in Pacific Heights there last night for dinner - our food was ordered and then THREE other tables got their food before us and they came in AFTER us.  Each time we would question why - the Manager was extremely RUDE and kept making all these excuses.  She needs a lesson in customer service.
author: jerry f.

description: Delicious!  I think we sampled like one of everything on the menu and I was super pleased with our meal!  We started with the insalata tricolore and the burrata mozzarella and yum--so good!  We also got a surprise order of the mozzarella frita and it was to die for.  For a main course we got the margherita (because my friend is a vegetarian) and I got an order of prosciutto on the side to add to the pizza.  The order of prosciutto was enormous!  I would have like more cheese and more basil on the pizza, but it was cooked perfectly (not burnt at all) and the crust was chewy and delicious!  To end it all we got the cookie & cream gelato and a scoop of their mint gelato.  The mint was super duper minty, like I just ate a handful of mint leaves minty, but it went perfectly with the cookies & cream.  Oh, and our waitress Allison was adorable and super sweet and she took excellent care of us!  I'll for sure be back soon!
author: Ali L.

description: I must say that it is amazing!  But...Something has totally shocked me!  The kitchen staff coming by and taking a piece of food fresh out of oven!  Not WEARING GLOVES! YUCK! they have cuts and burns all over from being amazing cooks, but for me to watch them place a piece of meat in their mouth, than prepare my food!!! umm.. no thank you!  If you don't believe me, than you can just deny it and enjoy your food!
author: H S.

description: Outside of the wait, the food is amazing.  pizza as it should be...not the crap at A16.  fresh ingredients coupled with a perfect crust is the perfect marriage for pie.  The meatballs are fantastic, and the "house" wine (they make it) is too good for words.  YUM...so it's pricey and crowded.  It's a pizza joint.
author: Sonia C.

description:
Absolutely delicious.

First restaurant I've been to in the Bay Area in the near two years I've lived here that hasn't left me disgustingly full.

Their antipasti Anchovies are incredible.
author: Isabel d.

description: Seriously overrated. My pizza was over salty and under-exciting. Go to Dino's on the corner. WAY better!!
author: Jaime R.

description: super busy. i went on a tuesday night around 6:30 and they told me it be a 30 min to 45 min wait. u write ur name on a chalk board. luckily i didn't have to wait that long, only 15 min and we got a nice cozy booth. service is a lil slow, but really friendly. started off with the meatballs. delicious! i got the prosuitto pizza. it was good, but way too much argula and the crust was way too thin for me. i love thin crust pizzas, but i like it to be crispy, not soggy. my boyfriend ordered the sausage pizza, but it wasn't anything special. i'm glad i tried this place, but i don't think i would come back.
