author: Karen H.

description:
delfina was all I wanted when i first moved to the neighborhood, straight up addicted. But... they never change the menu, haven't in like 2 1/2 years, the lines are long, and after a while you just get tired of it.

Having said that.. the crust is great (can't believe its not a wood burning brick oven), and price and quality have always remained consistent.

Now instead of every week, I'll hit it up once every 3 months.
author: Nick H.

description: The pizza was great, but they were playing the worst loud music. It was 90's top 100 or something. Especially for a mellow Sunday night. They need to set some rules with the staff on what is appropriate for the ambiance.
author: Marissa T.

description:
Long wait overpriced OK food ripp off prices on wine
list 2 wines at bottom of chalk board menu 
ended up being charged 27 dollars when we thought it was the carafe price on board 9 $ for average crappy italian vino 
wont be back
author: didi c.

description: You HAVE got to try their roasted cauliflower appetizer that is not on the menu! It is to die for and I mean it! I don't think I've ever had a more delicious vegetable dish before and I consider myself pretty vegetarian!  Literally everyone around us ordered and everyone was raving about it. The cauliflower has a tangy/spicy zing to it that will perk you up but is not overbearing at all.  Hurry and try it while it's in season!
author: P G.

description: Get the brick chicken... I believe this is the only Delfina location that has it. If the lines are too long, get it to go and eat it at Lafayette Park... just as good and save on tips!
author: Lily C.

description:
Not sure what the fuss is all about.  For one I could not understand the wine list.  They could categorize them a little better as I am sure the waiters are probably sick of translating and describing.

Now for the pizza...I love crust and this place gives it to you...although it needs more sauce or something to dip it in as you don't get much for toppings.  The four cheese pizza had flavor but again you are left with a ton of plain crust.  Same with the margharita pizza.  

Overall I have had better and would not wait in line for this place.  Otherwise, could be a good place if you are a carb lover and want to pack on some extra pounds of the devil (white flour)!
author: K L.

description:
The Margherita pizza is simply magnificent and by far my favorite - bright, fresh tomato, creamy fior di latte mozzarella, and sweet basil, all perched atop PD's infamous thin, crispy - yet, soft & chewy - crust.  

The Salsiccia pizza is also quite delicious - homemade fennel sausage, tomatoes, bell peppers and thin slices of onion give this hearty pizza a nice spicy bite. 

When available on the menu, try the fritti risotto balls (proper Italian name escapes me) - a fantastic concoction of creamy risotto and cheese enveloped in crunchy, fried goodness.  What tasty little morsels they are!

I can't leave out the delightful limonciata, which is made to order. It's perfectly sweet and tart, and arrives in an individual carafe.  So refreshing!

Word of caution: Unless you visit during off hours (not sure when that is), don't come to Pizzeria Delfina if you're absolutely famished and must eat right away.  There's almost always a (long-ish) wait for a table. Fortunately, the wait is worth it the moment you sink your teeth into the pizza!
author: Marta T.

description: This is a fun place to have a nice meal. The pizza is spectacular and the mozzarella is delicious.
author: E J.

description:
The food is fabulous-- esp. the pizza with sausage and the 3-color salad and the iced tea-- actually everything tastes yummy. We have been there 3 times now, and tried to go a few others.  But we won't wait more than 20 minutes for anyplace.  Besides once when we couldn't get in, we went around the corner to Fresca, which was AMAZING.  But I digress... go in the midafternoon or really early for supper, like 5:00.  You'll find fab food and no waiting.  Why not 5 stars?  Hmm... I would say a limited selection of menu options.  And the pizza was very good but not over-the-rails indescribable.
Yes, I am a fan!
author: Joan O.

description: Excellent thin crust goodness with top notch toppings.  And Unti wine by the carafe!  They don't take reservations, but the wait is quick.  Especially with a glass of wine in your hand.
author: Alex M.

description: The pizza from Delfina is pretty good. I usually get the prosciutto pizza and maybe an appetizer from the place. I give this place 3-stars because I would never consider eating there unless it was like 3:30 on a Tuesday afternoon because the dining room is so small, loud and basically just uncomfortable. So this place to me is basically a good take-out place. The pizza's are a little bit expensive but a step up from the usual ordering places. Definitely not the best pizza around, but its okay and was nice to get something new. But if you want to eat there, don't go hungry or practice your buddha-like patience skills.
author: Matthew F.

description:
With better service, they'd get another star. It probably was just a random 'bad service' experience but...

we missed our name getting called after leaving for 40 minutes, that was our fault sure, then we waited another 40 minutes, where we were told we would be seated next, then another party just as big gets seated ahead of us woops

breadstick situation: did not receive breadsticks

waiter: no breadsticks? i'll get you a free appetizer
us: yay!
--'free appetizer' gets put on bill--
us: boo

We concur it would be could for take out. good pizza.
author: Karen J.

description: i'm tough on giving five stars so this was a tough one.  it was great pizza...and i'm ignoring the fact that this is california.  it was good with fresh ingredients.  something wasn't a five though.  go there...i'm just being cheap with my five stars.  great pizza, great wine.
author: Hammer Time H.

description: came here after being told we would have to wait over an hour(!) for tapas at fresca and so glad we did.  love the simplicity and the bright atmosphere.  enjoyed a glass of wine while we waited and inhaled the warm scent of fresh oven baked pizzas wafting through the air.  my favorite part of a pizza is the crust and delfina definitely did not disappoint.  their starter salad was tasty and the wine was delish.  the only downer was the dessert.  stay away from the brioche.  other than that it was a really great dining experience.  can't wait to go back!
author: Jane L.

description: It's been written that this was the best pizza in town and finally i tried it. YUM!  Headed out on a Tuesday night and there was a line and about a 45 minute wait.  Thankfully my friends and i were patient but we still didn't sit down to eat until 9pm.  Our waitress was extremely friendly and helpful.  All her recommendations we tried and were not dissapointed.  Salad with shaved tuna hearts, FANTASTIC!  I could have eaten the whole plate myself.  Deep fried sand dabs were moist and crisp and the crispy parsley was a nice treat.  The aioli that accompanied it was like butter, mmm.... :) I would have preferred larger portions for the prices we paid for those two items.  $10 for 4 small fish pieces?  8 would have been better considering they were the size of my finger.  Onto the pizza: Calzone special with Salami, ehhhh...not a fan.  too juicy and would have preferred the salami to have been seared or crisped instead of steam cooked inside.  Margarita pizza was our favorite.  Perfect balance of thin crust, sauce and cheese.  Sausage pizza was good as well but the Margarita was the best.  And the piece de resistance...the dessert...Zeppole di San Giuseppe...fried pizza dough.  It was described to us as an italian funnel cake, and did not dissapoint.  Save room for it, its TOTALLy worth it.  And this is coming from a non dessert eater.  Overall i really liked this place and will definitely come back, minus one star for the line (not really a bad thing) and the price to food ratio (give us a little more for that price, not much, but a little bit bigger portion please, lettuce is cheap).
author: Susan Z.

description: Always a good meal.  Pizzas are creative and delicious.  The tri-colour salad is my favorite with the Napalotona pizza.  Good service, yummy food...
author: Ali S.

description: it's really good food but last night I asked for breadsticks and i was told they were out of breadsticks. I was sitting at the counter looking at a bunch of breadsticks... i guess they weren't for ME!  it was weird
author: goevie d.

description:
We were SO lucky - walked up at 7pm on Saturday and, despite a large crowd outside, were seated within 5 minutes at the bar. Lesson: if you are just 2 people, don't be daunted by the crowd out front, at least check to see how many 2-tops are in front of you!

We had a terrific dinner, splitting a couple appetizers and a pizza. For appetizers we shared the large salumi plate and a special item - a lightly breaded and fried cod - amazing, light, flakey, and not at all fishy.  Pizza was white sauce with mushrooms and, as with the appetizers, was delicious. Overall, all was terrific! 

The only negative was the noise level - to the point that it was a challenge to carry on a conversation. But, it's a pizza joint so not a big deal.

We'll definitely be back - especially if we can walk up and sit at the bar!
author: Walter A.

description: Love the Food!!! OMG! Yummy!  Pizza is to die for!  Good beer too!  The place to go for your pizza fix!
author: Jane S.

description: Disappointing continual turn-over of staff and management.  Waited 1 hour for an outside table because the team would not ask a three top to share a table while another was doing the same.  Told that would be rude.  Hello?  You ask us to do that most times we are seated outside.   Paid the bill for a glass of wine and still had a server call out loudly accusing us of not paying.  Really?  Get a grip.  You serve pizza.
author: t h.

description: never thought i'd like eating gourmet pizza while listening to the roots and tupac...
author: Ethan L.

description: The wait for a table was worth it.  We sipped a glass of wine while we listened for our name to be called off the blackboard.  After about 20 minutes, we were seated and our waitress was there to welcome us.  We decided on a special veggie dish of the evening - a roasted cauliflower with capers, bread crumbs, and just a enough heat to spice up the blandness of cauliflower.  We also ordered a tricolor salad with raddichio, shaved cheese and greens topped with a light olive oil dressing.  The sausage pizza was plentiful with roasted red peppers, tomato sauce and spices plus the requisite cheese.  We didn't feel rushed even though the place was humming with business.   The selection of wines mostly were from Italy.  Our waitress recommended a great red and proseco.   The water bottle was refilled without asking.  The one challenge at Delfina's is the noise level can tax conversation and the house rock music that blasts out of a speaker over the entry grew annoying while we waited to be seated.  We asked the staff to dial it back a notch but to no avail.  Good eats, reasonable prices, and friendly, efficient, helpful staff.
author: K S.

description: it's the same delfina from the mission, but this branch is smaller than the other one, and it's more pizzas, i believe. i'll just saaayy..MOUTHGASMSSS! me and my sis-in-law were just having the best mouthgasms on their food!!!!!!!!!!!!! we got the broccoli raab (dont know why italians spell raab different! LOL)...and the torpedo onions, very interesting yet simple! can't say no more... total moutgasms all the waaaay! oh ya.. broccoli raab is the best for vegetarians like me and my sis-in-law! and the place is packed when we were there.. whaaaat? lol
author: Marc K.

description: Had the special of the day pizza with pork jowl, chile and caramelized onions. If the crust wasn't so burnt, I would've given it 5 stars. The flavors combined together was excellent. We got it to-go; ordered over the phone and it was ready in 20 minutes, just as quoted! Service was quick and friendly. We live 10 minutes away and by the time we got home, it was almost gone! Also, the spices and grated cheese they include were fresh and delicious! Definitely recommended.
author: Heather I.

description: Totally fun to sit at the bar and grab a salad, pizza, and dessert.  Long wait though.
author: Danielle B.

description: :). Walked down Cali for a wedge salad and ended up at delfina.  Wasn't in the mood for pizza... Or a wait but I figured I could gamble on the wait.  Put our names down for 2 and got a bottle of their extremely reasonable wine.  First bottle was a bit off... They graciously replaced it for another.  We were seated within 20 which was impressive seeing as we were about the 10th couple on their chalkboard waitlist.  Ordered the mildly sweet mozerella app.  Toasted baguette... Slightly bitter greens and milky creamy mozzarella with a bit of seasalt and grassy olive oil.  Yum!  Staff was funky and friendly.  Not one item on the menu was over $17!   I had the octopus. I wanted their "fries with eyes" app that ended up being tiny fried fish... Haven't had that since hong kong.  But my +1 wasn't feeling up for it.  I definitely hit the jackpot with the octopus entree... Lol and for a pizza joint!  It was soooooo tender.  Tomato stew with plump caperberries and bits of onion and celery. Then the waitress told me that the octopus is flown in from Spain on jet blue!  Talk about attention to the quality of ingredients.
author: Shannon S.

description: I had the Margherita pizza. As everyone else has pointed out the crust is great...thin and flaky. The place is limited on space which makes it amazing once you have a seat and a little torturous if you have to wait and smell the pizzas being made.
author: Matt R.

description:
I'm a big fan of Delfina and have heard how good the Mission Pizzeria Delfina is. I was so excited to check out the new Pac Heights location. I'm very sad to report that the food was not good. I ordered the funghi pizza (it was a special) and it was almost uneatable. The crust was so thin and completely undercooked. When I picked up a piece, it literally fell apart. The crust was doughy and there was barely any cheese on top. but the cheese that was on it, was almost a liquid and slid off. In addition, the pizza had 0 flavor. A Tostino's frozen pizza or even Domino's (which I think is gross) would have been 100X better. They need to fully cook the pizza, add enough cheese to actually cover the pizza, which will hopefully give it some flavor. 

I asked the waitress for wine suggestions. I requested something smoky and earthy, not sweet. She brought a sweet, fruit forward option 1st and then brought over 2 more tastes of wine either worse or the same as the first. I was going to go with the lesser of 2 evils, when the waitress finally asked someone who knew wines and she brought out a perfect red. Management definitely needs to have a wine tasting event for their staff to familiarize them with the wine menu. 

I'm going to give it another chance in a few months and hope this experience was just a start-up hiccup. I would definitely wait until the buzz wears off to try this place out bc it is definitely not worth the wait. I left the restaurant and went across the street to eat afterwards.
author: Sally F.

description:
This says it all...

http://www.thetechchef.com/2008/09/pizzeria-delfina-on-california-disappointing/
author: Scott H.

description:
Came by on opening day.  We ordered a good amount of the menu. So many i cant remember. We were happy with it all. Not one negative.

Tripe
Green Beans
Soup
Numerous Pizzas
Gel/Sor in Brioche

Oh and the limeade is so good that we didnt see the face of the person making them the whole HOUR we were there.

The most memorable tho are the servers. My god they know how to hire a beautiful wait staff. Id come for the food if those servers didnt distract me everytime i passed by.
author: John H.

description: It's not that it wasn't good at this spot.  I've never been to the location in the mission.  Having heard amazing things about Delfina's, my boyfriend and I went.  Well, it was alright.  But considering my all-time favorite pizza HAS to have pineapple and tomatoes, I was heart-broken.  I did get a Panna pizza, and it was pretty nice, but I've definitely experienced better, and I'll only go to those places with pineapple!
author: Olivia S.

description: Had a great dining experience here.  The staff was awesome, wine list to die for, and food (as expected) was spot on.  Went with a girlfriend and sat at the bar.  Every single pizza out of the oven looked phenomenal.  The tricolore salad was simple yet perfectly dressed in a lemon vinaigrette that really let the flavors shine.  This is a place I will certainly be back to again (and again, and again...)
author: Lauren M.

description: This is a model that other pizza establishments should study...  outstanding execution, creative as well as authentic combinations, and I think one of the best pizza's in SF.  Staff is energetic and helpful, and the take-out service is very efficient.  I personally prefer A-16's crust (despite lack of take-out), but this is a very close 2nd in my book.  Awesome take-out service for an amazing pizza (and salads!) earns them my frequent repeat business.
author: B M.

description: Another location, completely different specials each night. That is brilliant! The atmosphere at Pizzeria Delfina on California could not be more different than the 18th street location. It's louder, larger, a different crowd, but the same great food. Service was attentive, with excellent wine suggestions. My only complaint is that a host should be keeping an eye on the folks awaiting a table. We were seated at a cozy spot directly on the opposite side of the partition wall separating the waiting patronage, ending directly at the intersection where patrons enter and exit (in fact, sticking into it a bit even). With a table situation right there, it's pretty annoying to have wait list folks nearly leaning on your back while you attempt to enjoy your food. It's also hard when their elbows are leaning next to your temple, and their glass of wine is dangerously close to the edge of the partition, right above your lap. On the other hand, the guy who was on the other side of the partition who decided to lean over, staring as us and the rest of the dining crowd like the captain of a sea vessel, literally less than six inches directly next to me, was charming as all get out. Really.
author: Shannon F.

description: The pizza was delicious, verrry good. However, my experience eating at this restaraunt was RUINED by their HORRIFIC taste in music that was blaring so loud it gave me a headache, i had to scream across the small table in order for my father to hear me speak and vice versa and it gave us both headaches. its so disappointing cause the food was so great. but it was so bad(the music situation) that neither of us could ever go back fearing a similar experience. we asked the nice waitress to eitehr turn it down a little or change it and she nicely agreed to, turned it down for 5 minutes than starting blaring it again. it wasnt even really music so much as it was extremely loud, piercing noises, that perhaps was the creation of one of the young hipster wannabe waiters??? it was thaaaaat bad. sadly.
author: A M.

description: I have been a fan of Delfina in the Mission so when my friend sugggested we try Pizzeria Delfina at Califrornia and Fillmore I was very excited. After waiting for 45 minutes for our table ( write your name on a chalkboard and hope everyone leaves quickly ) we sat down and ordered a bottle of Aglianico. Someone brought the bottle already uncorked and put it in front of us without asking for a taste. It was unusual for an upscale place but it usually happens in Italy as waiters drop carafs of wine in front of  you and depart so I dismissed this fact in good spirit. When we poured the wine ourselves and tasted, it was iced cold. The very friendly waitress just came by an inquired about the wine. When I said it was too cold and offered her to feel the bottle, she dismissed me with a smile telling me that all wine is kept at perfect temperature in their cooler and if it s too cold it will warm up at our table.Nice...I did not bother to argue that you do not do it to a $40 bottle of wine and instead we ordered appetizersand pizza. Food came fairly quickly and Buratta was melting in my mouth; the Tuna salad was superb and the 4 cheeses pizza was delicious. We finished off our dinner with home made gelato ( get the chocolate) and espresso. By the end of the meal we forgot all about small  wine inidisgretions and agreed that we would be back in Delifna. Definitely!!!
author: Alex k.

description: What a nice experience!  Was visiting my best chef friend in SF who suggested we go to PD for an early dinner last week.   The staff couldn't have been friendlier, the antipasti selections delicious (don't miss the lightly fried pepper assortment or poached calamari salad), the lambrusco cold and fizzy, and the broccoli rabe pizza just perfect!   The manager (Aaron?) was also extremely engaging and personable.  It's on my "must repeat" list.
author: David M.

description: i love pizza.  i could eat it everyday.  pizzeria delfina, in my opinion,  is amazing.  i love the bustling atmosphere...helpful staff...and having a glass of wine while waiting for my table.  it has become our new friday night favorite!  the pizza is wonderful...light, crisp, flavorful and the salads are tasty.  try it...but be prepared to wait for a bit...it is a hot spot.
author: A E.

description: Pizzeria Delfina is a gem! In a neighborhood (city?) that has a decided dearth of good pizza, the pizza Margherita at Delfina stands out. Crispy, thin, non-soggy crust, and fresh tasting cheese and sauce, heaven! Espresso and gelato round out the Italian trifecta. Yum!
author: Elizabeth K.

description: 9/7/09: lunch part duex. i was already stuffed when we arrived, but our friends needed to chow down and we're always up for food and company. we arrived around 2pm labor day, not too bad of a wait and soon found ourselves inside with a pitcher of anchor steam in hand! its been a while since i've ordered a pitcher of beer, cold beer is very enjoyable on a seldom warm day in SF. we order a couple pizzas, both were done well, alittle burnt on the crust in some areas but much better than the crap we have in hawaii. will be back.
author: Jesse W.

description: There are a bunch of excellent pizza places in town and it is a close race but overall Delfina wins.  I usually have to go with the prosciutto pie but they are all good.  The wine list is small but well edited and reasonalbly priced.  Tip: if you go on the weekend, plan on arriving early and waiting for a while.
author: C M.

description: The best thin crusted Pizza in San Francisco.  the Panna pizza is very good.  the pizza is worth the wait.
author: Setf C.

description: Really good pizza. I moved to san Francisco a few months a go and, so far, Delfina is my #1 pick. The only down is the long waiting time, but it's totally worth it. Prosciutto pizza is your best bet.
author: Alessandro S.

description:
I'm yelping after my second time there which was just as good as the first! They are smart in the fact that they dont bring you huge chunks of bread to start, rather just some breadsticks. This is a great way to not fill yourself up before the amazing mouthwatering pizza arrives. The first time I went it was just my finacee and myself and we ordered the salad and the special of the day which was a cherry pie. When presented with the dessert menu we opted to order a second pizza instead because it was so good. The brocolli rabe pizza was AMAZING! The flavor is to die for. 
This time I was in a group and we got the margherita, the panna and the 4 cheese all which were great. The service was awesome. They don't take reservations and we had a large group so we just went over to Dino's for a drink while we waited and just kept checking in. Between A16, Delarosa and a few others, there is some tough pizza competition in this city and Delfina still manages to be at the top of my list! Also we ordered the $28 Aglianico and it was AMAZING!
author: Chelsea L.

description: great authentic pizza, very hip
author: Cass M.

description: Pizza is excellent.  Best I have had in a while.  Very crisp, thin crust, and stays crunchy throughout the whole experience.  The table next to us got a cheeseless pie, which was also excellent.  Other dishes were less exciting - fried squash was on the greasy side.  Gelato for dessert OK.  Basic tri-colore salad was the best non-pizza bet.  That cauliflower looked good. If I were to compare to Otto in New York, I would say the pizza is slightly better, but Otto is better on the sides and the rest of the experience.  Beware atrocious waits for tables, but cheery service once you gain entry.
author: Molly V.

description: The food here is Great! The specials are always on point, from the starters, pizza's or entrees. Service is fun and attentive. The music playing is always awesome. Do yourself a favor and go for the Arincini's!
author: nick m.

description: better food selection and EXCELLENT service. get there early or expect to wait.
author: lasok o.

description:
After not-so-patiently awaiting this opening of this location I was excited to learn that Pizzeria Delfina opened yesterday in Pac Heights. I've been to Delfina in the Mission, but never made the trek for their pizzeria so I went in blind and must say I was very pleased and impressed with my entire dining experience! 

I have to give the folks at Pizzeria Delfina mad props for making such a great impression especially since I went in wondering the following:

Q: No matter how good this spot may be, can it really live up to all the hype?  A: Yep.

Q: This is their opening night and I'll have to be understanding if there are kinks to be worked out...  A: The fact is, I was completely impressed with the food and all of the staff we interacted with. If I didn't know it was opening night (and mind you, we came towards the end of the night when the staff might otherwise be plum tuckered out) I would never know it- that is just how smooth everything was. 

I appreciate the range of wines made available by the glass. While waiting for our table, the hostess suggested a wine which (bonus points) was very reasonably priced at $6.50 per glass and was super tasty. My dining mate ordered some antipasti while I was trying to decide which of the tasty sounding pizza's to order. We ended up with a tomato salad and a roasted pepper with tuna dish. Both were yummy, the red peppers with tuna was very memorable. In fact, I would go back just for that antipasti dish! I finally settled on a broccoli rabe pizza. It was a white pizza (which, had I paid more attention to the description I might have realized) without tomato sauce. Just for kicks, we asked for a side of tomato sauce. Our cheerful waitress simply brought us some with zero questioning or explanation that our pizza was in fact meant to have no sauce. Turns out they were right and the pizza is much better without the sauce, but it was still great for dipping the thin-and-bubbly-crispy-on-the- outside-whilst-perfectly-chewy-inside crust. 

Finally, despite a full belly, we had to at least try the home made gellato. I liked that the stawberry tasted very much like fresh fruit, not just overpowered by creaminess and sweetness of the dessert. 

I will definitely be back here and often. Love the decor, friendly people, the food, the wine selection, and the price point. My only concern is that this spot will always be so busy that I will never be able to get a table for myself! 

PS: This is one of those restaurants which does not accept reservations, so just be prepared for that. I personally don't think this is too big a deal as long as you're prepared. Hopefully, you'll bring good company along to chat with while waiting and enjoying a glass of wine, but if not, I wouldn't be surprised if the rest of the folks waiting with wine make for some friendly conversation as well.
author: Jennifer E.

description: We had very high expectations for their pizza.  But were somewhat disappointed.  I think they tried to put too much vegetables on their pizza and it makes the crust soggy.  We had their cauliflower which was wonderful.  Overall, very expensive pizza and not worth it.
author: Paul C.

description: We tried three different pizzas.  The Salsiccia was a hit and it went in a hurry.  The Prosciutto Pie was pretty good and it was the next to go.  The Napoletana was only finished because I am essentially a bottomless pit.
author: Luke P.

description: I really like the pizza of Delfina and as italian I think it is the best in the bay area. But I do not think the ice cream is special as well as the wine list. They used to have better wine. And last night, I asked for a bottle of San Giovese and they took me another wine claimed that was similar. But it was bad and very far to be similar to a san giovese. Honestly the service in Delfina (in Mission) is much better and if they do not have another one but ask if you want try a different one. Anyway, if you want a good italian pizza, delfina is the the plave where to go.
author: Antonino S.

description: This place is VERY inconsistent. I've been here twice. The first time I got the basic margherita pizza which I've had at the Mission location and liked. i can't get much else bc I don't eat pork. Anyway, our pizza did not have enough cheese. The table next to us got the same pizza with twice as much cheese.  I feel like maybe there should be some standardization of this.The second time I got the tuna salad for a light lunch. It was swimming in oil...so much so that I couldn't finish it and I normally like greasy food (see not enough cheese comment above). I think the $1.25 charge per person really adds up (especially during lunch). I would prefer that they just raise their prices slightly on some stuff or make the charge a percentage of your bill but when I'm getting a $10 salad and then you add the 10%  health care cost plus 20% tip it just starts to get ridiculous. I will say that the service at this location is much better than the mission location with the rude and moody hipsters serving you. I hope that last phrase makes it on a t-shirt. I think Delfina can be really good but sometimes they just drop the ball.
author: mazzy s.

description:
Went here with a friend this past Wednesday night.  It was amazing to see a line out the door and at least a 40 minute wait by 6:30pm.  The bread sticks waiting for you are absolutely wonderful, and it's damn near impossible to stop eating them until your pizza arrives.  We sat at the counter, and it was fun to see the pizzas being made.  Although we didn't have salads, I noticed they top them with huge parmesan shavings.  The salsiccia pizza was great...light thin crust, a tangy yet sweet tomato sauce, and perfect dollops of mozzarella.  Oh yeah, and the swine, too.  My friend had the Margherita pizza, and that too, despite its simplicity, looked fantastic.  As if each of us inhaling our own pizza wasn't enough, we split a dessert consisting of fried pizza dough, dusted in powdered sugar, and then drizzled with sweet mascarpone...call it an expensive version of elephant ears at a county fair.

All in all, delicious.  The only thing I'm wondering is: when is Dino going to come over and punch out Delfina's owners for taking all of his business away?
author: Ilan K.

description:
Their pizza rocks! The charred crust is the way it's supposed to be...it's not burnt. It's true Italian pizza. You can eat a whole one and not feel sick and full like after a few slices of other pizzas. My favorite is the broccoli raab pizza. I am not usually a fan of white pizzas or pizza without red sauce, but this one has just a light layer of cream, and it is the perfect match for the broccoli and black olives. Very tasty. The margarita is also excellent, as is the prosciutto pie. My husband really likes the clam pizza as well. Sounds weird, but he says it's good. 
The salads are really good, but I think they are overpriced. I'm willing to pay the price for the pies, but I usually opt out on the salads unless I'm dining in. I do usually always go for the daily greens though. Always yummy.
In my opinion, go for lunch at an off time or order out. It's insane there during dinner hours, and it's so small, you can easily feel cramped.
author: Jaime S.

description: Eaten the thin crust here several times and was mildly pleased with quality. Looking at the bill would've made me feel ripped off, but the client was footing the bill, so I didn't mind. No, I wouldn't go there if I had to pay for it. But if someone else wants it and they're gonna pay for it, well sure I'll go. I'd eat lots of place's food with the word "Free" attached.
author: gary a.

description: i'm a huge fan of the pizza here!  italian style with the most amazing tomato sauce.  the variety on the menu is not huge but, i think that's a good thing - i'd much rather have perfection of a few items than being par at many.  the biggest downfall is that it is a bit pricey for essentially bread, sauce and cheese (and not that much of it) - definitely not economically the best go to spot for a weekly nosh of pizza.  none-the-less, i would recommend it for the occasional visit - they most definitely do justice to the dish.
author: Tanvi A.

description: I am on a quest to find the best pizza in San Francisco.  I have found Pizzeria Delfina to be close to the type of pizza that I enjoy.  Apparently, Little Star is fantastic for their deep dish pizza.  But here, at Delfina, I believe most of their pizzas are thin (or thinner) crust.  Pizzeria Delfina is popular for their Margherita pizza, but I usually like more toppings so I first tried their Salsiccia pizza (housemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions and mozzarella) - it was pretty good.  But on my second visit, I tried their Panna Pizza (tomato sauce, cream, basil, shaved parmigiano) with sausage.  The shaved parmigiano on this pizza makes a big difference - for cheese lovers, this is a great touch.  I recommend the Panna Pizza with your favorite topping(s).  I also tried their Grilled Asparagus (w/ lardo butter and breadcrumbs and bacon) and their Amarena Cherry Sundae (Vanilla gelato, chocolate sauce, pistachio, and whipped cream) - not a big sweets guy, but the cherry sundae was pretty awesome.  4 stars.
author: Mark K.

description: That Anniversario Pizza with white truffles was killer! I had it yesterday for lunch. Mmm...Tartufi Bianchi!  I love this place as much as the mission location.
author: Jeffrey M.

description:
Went there last night - We tried four pizzas, the sausage, margherita and napoletana and the prosciutto one.  All were excellent, not too saucy or cheesy and the crust was really good.
There was a wait when we got there, but the hostess was really friendly and accurate about how long the wait would be.
Only downside was our waiter who had a chip on his shoulder.  When he took our order, he didn't provide any explanations when we clearly were confused about certain things....when we asked if he thought we had ordered enough for four, he just said "no" and didnt offer any suggestions and became impatient while we tried to figure out what else to order....there were a few more instances of his crappy attitude and rudeness that night, but I want to keep this review short.
Despite the waiter, the food was excellent, which is the most important thing....so Id definitely be back, although i'd probably ask for a different waiter if i got the same dude.
author: Rachell K.

description: the pizza here is really good. this location is bigger than the other one but the pizza is the same. its thin and the bread sticks are yummy too. i think i like the pizza better cold  but regardless i always order two to go for the next day. the crust is salty and the sauce is tasty.
author: chloe w.

description: Love this place - the pizza is awesome and so is everything else on the menu.  I hate the wait time (sometimes up to an hour), but it's always well worth it.  You will not be disappointed by this place.
author: Lisa K.

description: Three stars because I'm glad this place is in the 'hood, it's got a nice vibe, and I love Italian-style, thin-crust pizza. But because I love Italian-style, thin-crust pizza and have had it everywhere from Rio to Rome, I have to say I'm not particularly impressed with this version. The crust lacks quality control -- sometimes blobby and sometimes burnt. The tomato sauce is kind of bland. Though there are some good flavor combos, I'd much rather go to Pizzetta for its pure yumminess or to South Beach Cafe for a basic margherita.
author: Midori S.

description: This place is not big enough to accommodate that many hungry diners. We got to the restaurant around 6pm and weren't seated until close to 7, while we waited outside. We didn't order anything terribly crazy, a 4 Formaggi, the Prosciutto w/ fresh arugula, and the fresh sausage one. Crust was alright but nothing to write home about. Also a a tricolore salad which was actually pretty good, albeit small. Service was efficient, but this isn't the best place to go on a date.
author: Reeny L.

description: Fillmore Pizzeria Delfina, you really need to get your s**t together.  I ordered a pizza for pickup on a recent Monday and showed up 5-10 minutes later than told just because I figured there'd be a rush.  I still had to wait another 10-15 minutes before the pizza was ready.  Seriously, the reason people order for pickup is so they don't have to wait.  Also, the pizza is just too inconsistent.  When it's good, it's really good.  The problem is, it's only really good about 65% of the time.  I'll give you guys a few months and see if you can't pull it together.
author: Gregorio S.

description: Great pizza, salad and starters.  I disagree, I think Delfina is great for kids. We had our 15 month old twins with us and there was room at the table for two high chairs. Staff was more than helpful as well.  Definitely recommend
author: Liz D.

description: I heard great things about this pizza, but when the box came home, and the lid was opened, I was in shock.  CRUST EVERYWHERE.  The 2 or 3 bites you get of the good stuff per-slice are okay, but man o man, most of the slice--most of the pizza---was crust.  My girlfriend, a fan (but admitted to the over-abundance of the outer pizza regions)  likes the sauce they use on the pizza...and she likes the salady-concept they have come up for a pizza (she defends this pie, it should be known).  But I much prefer when she makes her version of it, because you actually get to bite into something--there is more topping and hers has much more taste (yes, I am a lucky man).  The Delfina MIGHTY crust, by the way, is very good as a dog treat.  Let it stand for about a day, and then it is better then a bone for your furry friend.  It is actually the best feature of an otherwise underwhelming experience.  For thin slice pizza, Gaspares or Georgios might not be as trendy...but are their pies ever better.  Trend versus pie...you make the call.
author: David K.

description: its only ok not great..had tons of great ny style pizza in nyc n all over this fell short...had a better thin crust at amici's...ordered a couple of pizza to try..both arrived with very thick end crust so the pizza itself was small n uneven..we requested in the well done side so the crust will be in the crusty side..did not arrive as asked..oh well. can't have it all...very pricy for such a small pizza..
author: kat r.

description: Loved it. At home in DC we have a pizzeria with real whatever flour from Napoli. This pizza is just as good. Fun atmosphere, and enjoyed eating outside under the heat lamps. Great tricolor salad and nice wine selection, too. Big thumbs up.
author: Merideth M.

description: i could do without the hipster servers and the crowds.  but hell, it's delicious.  try the sparkling red wine.  it's a volcano of awesome.
author: K H.

description: The pizza was excellent.   Had the proscuitto and friend had a special pie.  Both were great.   The starters were fantastic.  Let the waiter recommend both the starters and the wine and he did a great job.  Food is a little pricey but is high quality.  Wine is a good value.   Can't wait to go back.
author: Larry W.

description: Pizzeria Delfina in Pacific Heights is a huge disappointment.  The location in the Mission is much better in terms of staff and quality.  One of the pizzas I ordered was not the right one.  In addition, the Broccoli Raab was not the same pizza as noted on http://www.pizzeriadelfina.com/menu.html which is Broccoli raab, ricotta, oven-dried tomatoes and mozzarella.  Half of my order was incorrect!  The Insalata Tricolore was boring and was a very small portion.
author: Marcie H.

description: Insanely noisy!  I went with two companions on opening night, and we could hardly hear ourselves think, much less talk.  On top of the din of patrons, service staff, and cooks, we were subjected to Rod Stewart shouting from of many little speakers.  The food was mostly good, but I'll never go back unless I happen to find the place half-empty.  One of my companions was an architect who told me that it doesn't cost much to control noise when building a restaurant.  Regarding the food, the Margherita pizza was not made with slices of tomato the way I prefer.  And the edges of the pizza dough are too thick & doughy.  Otherwise, the food was quite tasty and fresh, and the wine was good.  They offer takeout, fortunately.
author: Rico C.

description: love this place! their prosciutto pie is so damn good. love the stretched mozzarella.  can't wait to try this place again.  service is fantastic
author: Tomas V.

description: went there after the elections tuesday night.  they were out of a lot of items already.  the menu was weird. nothing called my name. i had the fried broccoli, essentially italian tempura. it was done well.  the margerita pizza was fine. the pepperoni pizza was strong and cheesy.  feel bad it's right around the corner from dinos but this is fancy creative italian and his is traditional so both should survive.
author: Yelper S.
